title: Decent Hotel But Won't Stay Again
text:
It's a decent hotel.  The door and front desk staff were all super nice.  Room was clean.  Didn't try the restaurant, coffee, or bar so can't really speak to those amenities.  A couple of issues which keep me from bumping this up a star:

1) The last night our room was cleaned and serviced but they left no towels, washcloths, or hand towels.  Quick call to housekeeping and we had those items within about 20 minutes so not anywhere near the end of the world, very minor inconvenience.

2) I had my AirPods with me which I took out of my backpack and sat on the nightstand next to the bed.  Never once did I open them or use them during our week here.  I get on the plane home and open my AirPods case to find one of my pods missing.  My "Find My" feature shows my missing pods last location at the hotel, so I know it was/is there.  We called the Front Desk to ask if it had somehow disappeared in the room (not wanting to be accusatory of a pod disappearing from a case which was never opened by us on property) and was under a bed, nightstand, etc.  They took the information and said they'd call us back.  It has been 6 days with no follow-up.  I've ordered a replacement pod and will write this off as a mystery disappearance and stay elsewhere next time.

title: Excellent Location
text:
My daughter and I have just returned from a 3 night stay at The Pearl. Lovely spacious room (702), really comfy queen size bed, well equipped room including L'Occitane toiletries. Hotel very clean throughout, excellent staff, very happy and helpful. The hotel is situated perfectly, a couple of minutes from Times Square left out of the front door and Hell's kitchen in the opposite direction.
We had a yellow cab from JFK to the hotel but the hotel arranged for a car for the return journey (only 10 dollars more)
My only criticism is the extremely poor breakfast. (not only the limited choice but the use of plastic plates,cutlery (this needs to be addressed).

title: The location is perfect near theaters, restaurants and public transportation
text:
The hotel is in the middle of the theater district. One theater across the street another, next door and others blocks away. The hotel is on W 49th Street between 7th & 8th avenues which puts you a block from Hells Kitchen which has an abundance of restaurants all in walking distance, as close as 5 minutes away. The restaurants on 8th & 9th avenues seem more focused on the local residents and are well priced vs the neon lights on 7th Ave and Broadway which are tourist traps.
The hotel is very clean and amazingly quiet. The bathroom has a large shower, big enough for 2 and has good water pressure. Our room faces 50th Street but is recessed from the street itself, room 1105. From 5:00-6:00 pm complimentary wine is available in the lobby. While a Continental breakfast is included, pass on it 
The staff is very nice

title: Brilliant.  Absolutely recommended!
text:
We pocked this hotel for its reviews, location and star rating.  We were not disappointed.  Staff were fantastic, so helpful.  We had a problem with the safe in our room which was fixed in 20 mins.  Staff knowledgeable about the area, happy to answer questions etc.  The room was perfect size, clean, beautiful bathroom.   Fab coffee machine in our room too.  All perfect.

Snacks and tea and coffee on ground floor can pick up on way back to room.  Free wine from 5pm til 6pm too.

Breakfast was only issue.  Small continental selection with limited seating and rooms were excessively hot. But fight to get to table too.  That was only thing to slightly mark it down as felt could be better.

Still 5* though for the room and really helpful Staff.  Thanks for making our stay so lovely.

title: Perfect stay
text:
Hotel very well located, very friendly and efficient staff, large rooms full of amenities, excellent breakfast. In the hotel lobby there is a corner where we can find machine coffee, snacks and mini chocolates, offered 24 hours a day. There is also happy wine hour, free, every day from 5:00
at 6:00 p.m. It was a super pleasant experience, we loved it and will be back.

title: Great place to stay!
text: A great hotel is in great location right next to Time Square, the rooms are nice and spacious and the breakfast and cafe with drinks and snacks all included in the price was a nice added touch. Would highly recommend this hotel if you are planning on visiting New York

title: Disappointment @ the Pearl
text:
My granddaughter my daughter and I stayed at the Pearl in November of 2023  It was highly recommended by a friend. The check- in staff were wonderful the rooms were large and  clean. Returning to the room after a long day of walking the city sightseeing and seeing a show.  We just wanted to take a shower and get in bed unfortunately there was no hot water.
 The front desk told us to run the water and it would probably get hot after way more than 45 minutes the water still was not even lukewarm We got assistance from somebody at the front desk who tried desperately to get it hot and then explained to us that because of the time of night most of the hot water was used on the upper floors because the water comes from the roof down.
We were told  nothing could be done until the next day. We were leaving the next day.
 There was no way I was getting into that clean bed after being out in the rain all day in New York.
 The man that was trying to help called to see if they could put us in another room.No luck. Finally after 11 o'clock at night the water did get hot.
 When we check out the next morning I brought it to the front desk's attention about the hot water issue. They gave us a 15% discount. I didn't think that was sufficient but my daughter did not want to make an issue out of it.
I'm writing this review because I did put a complaint in on the Pearl's website back in December. As  of March I still have not even heard a word from them

title: Super location, lovely hotel. Top marks from me!
text:
I rarely leave reviews but based on how good The Pearl Hotel was, I really felt the need to share. It's just the perfect base for a visit to New York City, and I couldn't recommend it highly enough. The staff are lovely and so helpful & pleasant. I was visiting with my two daughters, ages 15 & 17, and we shared a Deluxe Double Queen Room. It was very spacious, had really comfortable beds and a very nice bathroom (with a really nice deep bath & great shower).  Breakfast was self-service and had a very good selection of nice croissants, scones, cereal, toast etc. 
The location was superb. It'sa 1 minute walk to Time Square! We went to a Broadway show which was just around the corner - it was so handy. 
Another nice perk was the tea/coffee/hot chocolate facilities available all day long just off the reception and the wine served in the lobby (complimentary) between 5pm & 6pm.
If ever I visit New York again, and I sure hope I do, as it's a great city to visit, I will definitely stay here again.

title: Great hotel in a great location
text:
Great hotel just off Times Square...
The room was a great size, beds were comfortable,  very clean, towels were changed every day.... The complimentary breakfast was a great bonus .. Lots of tea, coffee, juice, fruit, bagels , pastries..
Staff were very helpful and friendly.. 
Would definitely stay here again and would recommend to anyone looking for central hotel ...

title: Exceed Expectations!
text: The Pearl Hotel exceeded my expectations! This was my first trip to NYC and the Pearl helped to make it the best trip! I chose the Pearl because it was in the Theater district and close to the attractions I had intended to check out. The location was awesome. Easy to walk to Time Square or an easy walk to a subway station. The front desk guys were awesome. A special shout out to Keegan! He was very helpful and kind. We mapped out our day each morning. He explained how to get to the subway we needed and gave us suggestions on reservations. The room was great. We didn’t have a view, but we were not there for a hotel view. The beds were comfy. The shower and tub were phenomenal after walking all day. It was nice to have a microwave and coffee pot in the room as well. The continental breakfast was delish. It was nice to fill the belly up before a day of sightseeing.  I will definitely recommend this hotel to friends that are planning on taking a trip to NYC! I will be back!

title: Good hotel
text:
I have to agree with every point left by reviewer Katie P.  ( I don’t know her) 

Great location
Rooms are very big 
We loved the free wine hour from 5-6pm 
We loved the free coffee and snacks 

We were on the 4th floor and it was very quiet. We didn’t enjoy the bathroom as it was too small. 

There is obviously no kitchen in this hotel as everything is served with disposable cups, cutlery, plates, bowls. This is really horrible for your guests and terrible for the environment!!!! I thought the selection of food was also very poor with the cheapest of the cheap items. Please reconsider this or just don’t offer breakfast.

title: Here's the facts!
text:
Great  location
Great size rooms 
Great donuts at breakfast
Wine hour a nice touch
Free snacks 24/7
Friendly and helpful staff

The BIGGEST downsid was all the disposable plastic and cups used at breakfast and in the rooms!! Please reconsider this as it leaves such a bad impression of your sustainability values as well as cheapening what is actually a plush city hotel.

title: You love NYC? You will love The Pearl!
text:
The rooms are large, clean and comfortable, and have everything you could possibly need, even a coffee/tea making station.  

There is a coffee station also down the hall from the check-in desk, and you can help yourself to coffee/ tea and cookies or snacks 24/7

At aroung 6.00 pm they serve wine, like a happy hour thing, for all guests, which I thought was neat even if I dont drink myself.

Although it is at a stone's throw away from Times Square, it is very quiet. There are lots of places to eat around, from bars to fancy restaurants.
Staff was amazing and check-in and out was a breeze. 
They provide you with an umbrella, which came in real handy when we stayed.

WIFI worked very well, too. 
A great experience from start to finish.

title: Fantastic hotel
text:
We stayed here as a family of 4 in October 2023. 
The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were spacious and clean. 
The hotel has complimentary wine for an hour everyday, which was great after a long day walking around. The breakfast was also included and was delicious. 
We were 3 minute walk into Times Square. Great location, central for everywhere. 
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and will definitely be returning.

title: No Snow NH, hit NYC
text: Spur of the moment trip to NYC.  No snow in NH, weather was warm.  Normally we stay at a chain hotel, but this time we took a chance. I can’t say how happy we were.  The staff, I can’t compliment enough. From the doorman greeting you outside to the desk personnel.  You feel welcome before you get out of your car.  You are close to everything too. Definitely going to come back here.

title: Fabulous hotel with friendly staff
text: Once we were past the sticker shock of hotels in NYC (espec on Marathon weekend), we were thrilled with our experience at The Pearl.  Front desk staff and bellmen could not have been friendlier or more helpful. My apologies if I don't get names correct, but Kelvin (?) stood out as interested and customer-focused. Just the person you'd want as the face of your hotel brand. Breakfast was included and truly outstanding.

title: Très confortable et chaleureux
text:
Hôtel très confortable au coeur de Time Square. 
Personnel (Mr Kagean) formidable. Chambres vastes et cosy. Literie excellente, 
Un seul bémol, le petit dejeuner ! Il n’est pas à la hauteur des prestations de cet hôtel. Exemple: nappes non repassees, pas de place assises pour tout le monde, assiettes et couverts en plastique 😡, pailles en plastique!!!!
Je recommande mais vraiment sans le petit dejeuner!

title: Great access to Broadway, Highly Recommended.
text:
The Pearl Hotel was a wonderful experience. Located directly across the street from a Broadway theatre, others are within three walking blocks. The room was spacious, especially for NYC, front desk and valet competent and welcoming, and the cleanliness was excellent. 

Highly recommended.

title: Exceptional NY Hotel
text:
Wonderful hotel in New York. In the middle of the theatre district. Unexpectedly handy and superb location.
Great service from check-in to departure. Very comfortable, spacious and clean rooms. 
Really handy for transport.

title: Great NYC Hotel Experience!
text: Visited NYC on a Christmas girls trip and stayed at The Pearl.  Everything was perfect, really.  The staff were so helpful and fun helping our group of fun loving girls.  The location and rooms were perfect.  I will always stay at The Pearl!

title: Excellent stay with friends!
text: We decided to stay at this hotel after multiple stays at the Millennium for our annual trip with friends. The rooms were good size and clean. The elevators were fast, the breakfast had a great selection with something for everyone’s taste. The wine hour at 5 PM was a nice touch to relax with friends before heading out for the evening. Keegan behind the front desk went above and beyond to help us secure a difficult dinner reservation.  Thank you Keegan!!

title: Great stay…
text: This hotel exceeded our expectations! Excellent hotel, clean facility and spacious rooms. Great location to all areas of town and subway stops with a friendly accommodating staff. Great little extras like tea/coffee/wine time too. Would highly recommend for a NYC stay

title: It was a “ fine” hotel.
text: I have mixed feelings about The Pearl.  Because of the word “ boutique” and the reviews I expected it to be a bit nicer. Don’t get me wrong the people are all so nice.  Friendly.  Really helpful. We found things clean. The two things that were disappointing were the towels/ linen. So worn and shabby.  And the breakfast. We just stayed at the American Inn and they had a better breakfast.  Also the rooms are generally dark.  They could use some lights for reading. On the other hand we were on the 8th floor and it sure was quiet.  So- idk.  For the money I might stay again. At least I’d know what to expect.

title: Comfort, Quiet and Old-Fashioned Charm
text: Affordable, comfortable digs near the Theatre District but a bit removed from the general chaos of the Times Square area.  Excellent place to stay for a theatre weekend in New York (we were right across the street from the Book of Mormom).  The hotel is old, built in the 1920s, and has retained its excellent architectural features - if you want modern, sleek glamour this is not for you, but if you want some SPACE, it's fabulous.  The rooms are large, well-appointed but not fancy, and maybe a bit - beige.  But I love it and its twin (same owners) the Belvedere, which is literally around the corner.  Near Hell's Kitchen, so lots and lots of diverse restaurants, corner stores and a glimpse of New York that doesn't seem nearly as touristy as the Times Square glare.

title: Great NYC hotel
text: This is a really well run boutique hotel. Excellent location near Times Square, but not crazy and crowded. Rooms were as pictured on the website. In very good condition; clean and well maintained. Not as cramped as other NYC hotel rooms. Very quiet. Staff was excellent- especially Keegan at the front desk, who went the extra mile to help. There were 2issues with lights in my room; both were handled quickly. Near drug store and food emporium, many theatres and restaurants. I will definitely be back on my next trip to New York.

title: Pas mal
text: La chambre famille comprends 2 lits en 140cm et nous avons eu du mal à dormir… le petit déjeuner est sommaire (pas d œufs ni bacon) et industriel. Assiettes tasses et couverts sont jetables au petit dej: pas écologique du tout! Très bien situé et pas trop bruyant

title: Superb Service!
text:
Our one night stay at the Pearl was fabulous-due primarily to the friendliness, attention to detail and extraordinary customer service provided by House Manager, Beata (sp?), and her staff. We were greeted curbside by Loraudo (sp?), who gave us details on the complicated process and rules of valet parking-which ended up saving us $. When checking in, Beata could see that we were two tired senior citizens, so she arranged an early check in for us. Francisco showed us to our room, which was nicely designed, clean and comfortable. All lights and appliances worked perfectly, and there were ample electrical outlets to handle our myriad of electronics. And after checking out, we realized we had left behind several clothing items in our room closet!!!
We called Beata, who gathered all the items herself, folded them nicely in a laundry bag, and had them waiting curbside when we drove up in our car.
I visit NYC alot, and rarely encounter such friendliness and service from an entire staff. I look forward to a return trip to The Pearl Hotel real soon.

Frank G.

title: Not really a boutique experience; bedding dirty on check-in.
text:
My spouse and I stayed at the Pearl during a romantic trip to NYC to celebrate our anniversary. We had stayed in the area previously and were really looking forward to being back and having a "boutique hotel" experience. Check-in is at 4pm, but Keegan at the front desk was great and held our bags so we could explore while waiting for our room to be ready at 4pm. He was by far the most enjoyable desk staff and was very friendly and engaging. The location was also great as the hotel was in walking distance of all the events we had planned for our trip.

While we wanted to enjoy our room experience, but did not. Despite the Pearl staff having five hours between check out and check in to clean our room between guests- we  discovered a large, smelly, yellow stain on our blanket when we turned down our bedding to climb in for bed. It smelled and appeared like a urine stain. It also appeared the blankets and sheets were not changed out from previous guests. The king bed we booked came with 3 old lumpy small pillows. When we called the front desk about the dirty bedding, the night desk attendant was rude and unhelpful and sounded annoyed we had disturbed him. The housekeeping staff was nice and came up with clean bedding and removed the dirty blankets after we informed them that our bedding was apparently dirty from the guests prior. They looked at the stain and then used gloves to touch the blanket and agreed it looked like urine.

After having dirty bedding on check in, we felt extremely uncomfortable having house keeping clean our room afterwards and we requested no housekeeping service for our 3 night stay (instead we sanitized the room ourselves and kept the room tidy). There was no do not disturb sign in our room to use so we had to make this request with the front desk staff each morning. On day 2, we were told we were not allowed to request no housekeeping for more than 2 days (which is utterly bizarre) and the hotel manager would need to immediately inspect our room. We explained we did not want or need housekeeping and that they didnt clean our room before we checked in. This manager stated we checked in too early (at 4pm, which is the check in time) for her to personally confirm housekeeping did a good job and that no one urinated on our bed before our room was occupied and implied that we must be committing a crime in our room because we had requested no housekeeping service. She inspected our room and obviously it was fine, but this was still was a huge inconvenience that disrupted our romantic stay. She also claimed no one told her about our bed having urine on it and implied it was somehow our fault for not reporting the incident to her directly (even though we literally reported it immediately to the desk attendant working and housekeeping). It was a truly bizarre interaction and experience.

Finally, the boutique experience overall was lacking. Breakfast was packaged grocery store pastries and bagels and a typical hotel coffee machine. The "cafe" advertised was a coffee machine with low fat Doritos and york peppermint patties despite it being advertised as a special amenity and us being charged extra for this "service". I would have enjoyed the offering of more local foods or coffees that exemplify NYC given the "boutique" title and extra fee charged for these amenities. I've had better breakfasts at chain hotels. 

We would not choose to stay at this hotel again since the other nearby hotels we have stayed at were much more enjoyable and cleaner for a similar price. And no other hotel in the area has interrupted our anniversary stay with a mandatory room inspection as if we were committing some sort of crime or left pee sheets for us at check in!

title: Excellent place to stay in NY
text: Excellent place to stay in NY. Well located just off 7th in the theatre district. Very well appointed room, 11th floor front, but sound-proofed so quiet (in New York?  Yes!) Comfy king bed, nice bathroom, good buffet selection for breakfast (included) and a reasonable price for NY.

title: Book without hesitation!
text:
If you're looking for a place to stay in NYC, don't hesitate to book this property. My mom (age 70 and in a mobility wheelchair) and I stayed 4 nights and would do it again. Here are just a few of property features that made The Pearl absolutely worth the stay: Kind and attentive staff, CLEAN and spacious rooms (we had a room w/2 queen beds), included breakfast (NY bagels, very good pastries, fresh fruit and yogurt, hard boiled eggs, coffee/tea/juice), luggage storage (no fee), car service to airport (reasonable price), QUIET rooms, evening happy/social hour with wine (no extra fee), and a great location (very close to restaurants and theaters).

From The Pearl, we were able to easily walk to the subway (<5 min), Times Square (<10 min), Central Park (~10 min), Radio City Hall (<10 min), and more. If you forgot anything, there is a CVS a couple doors down (even at night, this walk felt safe). For restaurants, there was the Carnegie Diner (around the corner), Ellen's Stardust Café (FUN! <5 min walk), Da Marino (practically across the street) and more to choose from, not to mention the Empire Steakhouse (on-site), which we didn't get to this time, but will next time!

I work in the travel/tourism industry and have already recommended The Pearl to my colleagues. I will 100% recommend it to any client wanting to spend time in the Big Apple. Thank you for a wonderful stay!

title: Location and Staff are A+
text: The staff at The Pearl are the best of the best! We were greeted warmly and they stored our luggage, as we arrived early. We had a lot of questions and Surf, Keegan,and Juan were more than helpful. The hotel was so busy yet they took the time to point us in the right direction with recommendations. The location is an A+. Times Square and so many shows are either a stones throw or short walk. You're right there! The rooms are dimmly lit, but spacious for NYC. The bathrooms are updated and nice. Breakfast is a nice array of pastry and breads (other things too but we only grabbed pastries....twice!). Coffee in the lobby along with snacks were a bonus. Our only complaint is valet is charged on a 24-hour cycle, not the number of nights you're staying. We were charged for a full 24 hours,  $75, for the additional two hours we were there. If we would have been told we would have pulled our vehicle before the next 24-hr cycle began. Otherwise, it was a great, comfortable stay and we would definitely return.

title: Great friendly hotel in superb location
text:
Good hotel in superb location. Next to major theatres and on doorstep of Hells Kitchen - vibrant area for restaurants and bars.
Very well placed for Metro lines and easy to find.
Staff were exceptionally friendly and efficient. Rooms were comfortable and serviced promptly. Bed was a dream after a long day in the city.

title: Location and Quief
text: Location, location, quiet, quiet!  We walked to sand from three Broadway shows.  Our room was 806. 2 elevators. Great bed, nice sized room with two TVs.  The fancy shower was hard to figure out and nailed each of us once with water coming from an unexpected direction. The room included a decent breakfast, wine from 5-6 each day, and a little cafe with hot coffee, tea, and chocolate and snacks 42/7.  It was easy to get a taxi or Uber. 35-45 minutes from LaGuardia.  The front desk was helpful when we needed questions answered. We’d come back.

title: Fabulous stay.
text:
What a fantastic time we had at the Pearl Hotel. The location was close to everything the room was very comfortable, but the staff were amazing their willingness to help us with transport on the subway to recommending a Broadway show and everything in between, Keegan you went above and beyond thank you, the Pearl are very lucky to have you working as part of their team. To have the breakfast as complementary WOW and also a Happy hour 5-6 pm every night, a glass of wine before we left for the evening. I would highly recommend the Pearl Hotel in New York and we will definitely be staying there again if we every come back. 
Thank you.

title: Ottima la posizione
text: Posizione comodissima a pochi metri da Times Square. La colazione è offerta. Si tratta di una colazione minimale con croissant, toast, marmellate, Yougurt, bevande e latte e caffè. Personale gentile. Camere un po’ datate ma pulite. Consigliato.

title: A Hidden Gem
text: Hidden gem in the Times Square area.   Rooms are larger than you typically find in NYC and our bathroom had both a tub and separate shower.   Staff was friendly and very helpful.  I will stay here again when I return to NYC.

title: Perfect small hotel in great central location.Highly recommended!
text: Excellent location just off Broadway.Room was clean and everything we needed was available.The hotel staff were first class, all very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful during our stay.Buffet breakfast was very good and hot drinks and snacks available all day. The wine hour was an added bonus with the timing just right for the shows nearby.We would highly recommend this hotel !

title: Great spacious hotel tucked off the main drag
text: We stayed here 2 nights and the hotel was wonderful.  The room was large by nyc standards and had both a bath and separate shower.  Our room also had a pull out sofa . Breakfast was good and each night they had a wine happy hour.  All the staff were very kind and housekeeping was great.  Can’t wait to return

title: Great Stay at The Pearl Hotel!
text:
We loved everything about The Pearl Hotel!
The location was perfect for theatre-goers like us.
The rooms were very well appointed and a good size for a NY hotel.
We loved that there were only 8 rooms on each floor.
The breakfast was great and we appreciated having a coffee maker in the room.
The waits for the elevators were always very short...a big deal in NYC!
The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful....especially Keegan and Shanelly!
The Pearl is now our go-to hotel in NYC!

title: Idéalement situé
text: Hôtel très propre et très bien situé proche Times Square, BigBus et lignes de métros au pied. Personnel professionnel. Petit déjeuner suffisant et très utile à New-York. Je recommande pour la situation et calme malgré la proximité du centre ville.

title: Nice hotel
text:
Very nice hotel . Perfect location. Near to subway, Times Square and theaters on broadway. Our room was a good size , clean and comfortable. The staff were very nice and friendly.
I really enjoyed my stay and I will stay there again in my future visits.

title: Unangemessens Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis  furchtbares Frühstück
text: Das ohnehin teure Hotel nimmt einem gleich beim Check-in nochmal eine Facility Fee von zusätzlich 30 Dollar/Tag ab, obwohl es gar keine besonderen Einrichtungen gibt, keine richtige Bar, kein Restaurant, keinen Pool. Die Zimmer haben nicht mal eine Minibar oder Kühlschrank. Schreckliches Frühstück für ein Hotel in dieses hoher Preisklasse.. Kein Rührei, kein Omelett (nur kalte geschälte Eier!), kein Käse, kein Schinken, keine Wurst, essen aus Plastikgeschirr wie beim Camping. Für einen Preis von über 300 Dollar die Nacht eigentlich ein Skandal. Wofür dieses Hotel 4 Sterne beansprucht ist mir ein Rätsel. Das Hotel ist aus mir unerklärlichen Gründen meiner Meinung nach völlig überbewertet.

title: Fabulous Times Square option!
text:
I really enjoyed my stay at The Pearl. It actually was a surprising spot with an outstanding location.  There are quite a few thoughtful perks that I was able to enjoy during my stay.

Check in was friendly and welcoming.  I got a room on the 8th floor, in the back of the building.  The room was truly massive.  I couldn't believe I had all that space, a giant bed (queen), a closet, and a desk area all to myself!!  The bathroom had L'Occitane products - my fav!  The windows in the room opened, and there was a bathrobe and slippers in the closet.  

Housekeeping was efficient and thorough.  Breakfast was basic, but I definitely found something I enjoyed (bagels and cream cheese - good bagels, too!). Other perks I liked were the complimentary candy, chips, and other goodies, as well as wine hour from 5 - 6.  It was the break I needed, before heading back out in the evening!

The staff is really friendly, and the care you get at The Pearl makes the big city seem just a bit smaller :-))

title: Volvería seguro
text:
Aunque las criticas eran buenas, me preocupaba que no comparecieran recientes. 
La puntuación en general es muy buena. La ubicación es buena, tiene al lado un supermercado que te permite comprarte una ensalada o fruta partida para almorzar o cenar, o incluso comida preparada! Esta cerca de varias estaciones de metro  y muchos sitios donde comer y su personal suele ser muy amable.  La nevera en la habitación esta genial, y el hecho de tener un fregadero fuera del baño es muy útil si se hospedan 4 personas. La limpieza es muy correcta, el desayuno incluido tiene fruta fresca, yogures, pan de molde... es un desayuno suficiente para aguantar hasta el almuerzo!
El el hall hay café o té gratis todo el día. Lo único regulín es la almohada, que tiene como bultos y el colchón va necesitando que lo cambien, aún así es cómodo ya que tiene hecho el hueco de la cadera sin ser desagradable.
En fin! volvería seguro.!!

title: Beautiful honeymoon experience
text:
Beautiful  hotel.
Perfect location. 
Very attentive staff.
Clean comfortable & Very spacious bedrooms. 
We stayed in the queen deluxe on the 11th floor.
Great breakfast choice in the morning continental. . 
 
Hotel transfer to & from airport.

title: Customer Service is excellent, location and room were perfect.
text: Was very pleased with our stay at The Pearl. The hotel was very clean and the rooms were large by NYC standards I believe. A microwave and mini fridge were nice during our stay as we frequently had leftovers. The location was great and the area felt very safe. Turned out we were right across the street from the musical we were seeing.  During our stay we had an urgent medical situation and this is where I think the hotel stood out. They were going through shift change though both Keegan and Ali were both active in assisting. The manager (didn't get his name) was also helpful in changing our stay so we could return home early. Customer service is something they highlight on their website and all the staff from the front doormen, housekeeping, front desk agents, and management were exceptional. I would highly recommend this hotel for those visiting NYC.

title: Pessimo
text: Camera poco spaziosa per essere una delux, richiesta di un pagamento di 68$ come tassa su i servizi ( inesistenti), colazione a buffet pessima, dove ti devi apparecchiare da solo e su divanetti con tavoli dove mangi curvo. Pulizia discutibile

title: An Oasis in the Heart of the Theater District
text: My mom and I enjoyed a wonderful weekend getaway at The Pearl! We were in town to see a Broadway show, so staying in the Theater District was ideal. The Pearl's location is unparalleled if you're seeking the center of the Big Apple. Yet you won't be sacrificing comfort when you're ready to call it a day—I didn't hear a thing all night. I was on the fifth floor, so I imagine the higher-up from the street you are, the quieter it gets, so request a room on one of the top floors if this is a concern. Everything was sparkling clean (even the floors of the lobby, which were somehow spotless and dry despite us arriving on a very rainy day). We had a little suite that had three TVs (three!), a kitchenette, ultra-comfortable beds, crisp sheets and towels, and a great view of 49th. I especially appreciated the L'Occitane products in the bathroom, as I forgot my body wash at home.   I can't imagine working in the heart of Times Square is easy, but all the staff members we interacted with were friendly, attentive, and polite. There was no detail overlooked during our stay. This hotel really is a pearl!

title: set your standards low
text:
when we first arrived we were told our room had to be moved to the back of the building and there were no other balcony rooms available. not a big deal. got to the room it was tiny and outdated.  nothing like the pictures online.  but my wife and I are smokers so we were happy to have the balcony. we noticed old cigarettes and burn marks on the furniture outside. safe to say they allow smoking ,right?  before I get to that however , the night continues on, my wife went to go get something out of the car, they tell her every time they have to go get the car its a one day charge added to the bill. (hidden fee #1) so she asks where the parking garage is and decides to walk , at 10pm . the gentleman at the front desk hands her an umbrella and says , "your going to need this" . WTF?!?!?!?!
at this point if it wasn't for the day shift workers i would have left. but were only here for a few nights ,so, why not jus finish our stay, were only here to sleep anyways.

the next day, were leaving for the day and the so claimed manager stops me in the front lobby and in front of everyone down there proceeds to talk to me like a criminal or a child , going on about, " we found evidence of smoking" and "this is your last warning" like i ever got a first??? slaps me with a $300 fee(#2) and when i told him that i made it verry clear to everyone during the booking process that my whole intention for the balcony was for smoking , he couldn't be bothered. 
all and all. the breakfast is not even up to par with a holiday inn. the rooms are old and outdated, i feel like im sleeping on my grandmothers couch. the bed is tiny, there's one sitting chair for a couples room, where's the other person going to sit???  and the vibe i get is that there just trying to rack up as many hidden fees as they can.  i don't recommend this place at all.

title: Like finding a hidden pearl
text:
I stayed here with my best friend for 4 nights at the end of April.
We could not fault the hotel and the staff were excellent, shout out to Keegan on the front desk. So helpful and reassuring an absolute asset to the hotel. Always there to help, with a smile and a great sense of humour too. (He needed it with us 2 ! ). 
Our room was lovely and spacious, 2 double beds, we had a bath and a walk in shower.
Plenty of storage space. Not much of a view but its not really a picturesque location, so that figures.
The only small gripe I have is the pillows, they are awful and very lumpy. We ended up using the large cushions that are on the bed for decoration.
Beds were comfortable and we did not experience any noise at all.
Breakfast is basic, but does the job, only thing is it can get crowded and some people are so rude (nothing to do with the hotel) pushing in and having no consideration for others. On the whole it was fine.
The wine hour is a lovely touch, we only got to use it twice as we were out and about most of the time.
Location is good. Easy to get to most places, subways near by and plenty of places easy to walk to.
This was a really special time for me and my best friend as we had not seen each other for 13 years. This hotel made it even more special and in my opinion an excellent choice.
I would not hesitate to return if I ever get to visit NYC again.

title: Decent hotel, annoying area
text:
This small hotel is in the middle of the Times Square theater district, so the area - though safe as anywhere else in Manhattan - is full of tacky stores and is super busy all the time, with wall to wall tourists and hucksters. That’s fine if it’s your thing, but it’s not the real New York, and it means every place to eat nearby is very touristy. The best thing about the area is it’s very close to many subway lines. 

Our top floor room was clean and decently sized, though the bathroom was small and there was a constant rumble from some kind of machinery above us - but at least we weren’t near the elevators or facing the street which would have been noisier. The mattress was comfy enough, but bedding was odd with undersized polyester sheets and small lumpy pillows. Climate control worked well and the windows can open. 

Staff were friendly and helpful, and the free WiFi was fast and reliable. The breakfast was basic but fine - a selection of small pastries bagels and toast, hard boiled eggs, fresh made fruit salad, coffee and tea. Only a limited number of tables to eat at so you may be sitting on a couch instead. Sometimes a long morning wait for the two elevators since they are shared with the cleaning staff. 

We didn’t try the daily afternoon wine, but they also always offered free small bags of one or two flavors of chips. 

It was all good enough, but unless you really want to be practically in Times Square, stay someplace else in midtown. You can pay the same, and still be close to everything, but you’ll avoid some annoyances and you’ll be in the real NYC.

title: Bon hotel à Broadway au centre de Manhattan dans le quartier des théatres
text:
Séjour d’une semaine à New York dans le quartier des théatres , idéalement situé au centre de Manhattan avec un accés aisé  au réseau metropolitain . Des  chambres spacieuses , un personnel cordial et un petit déjeuner continental simple mais correct . Le prix  est raisonnable pour NY . Je recommande  . 
Joel Paillot

title: Excellent choice for family stay
text: We loved this hotel for our family! First, the room was plenty of size and space. We had a double suite with 2 queen beds and a pullout loveseat for the 4 of us (kids age 10 and 13). This boutique hotel has 8 rooms per floor. Lovely size. I loved  Free Wine hour every night 5-6. And we loved free continental breakfast each morning. Perfect to get the day going quickly. We walked to the Rockefeller center, theater, 5th Avenue, Central Park, etc. great walking area. We were on the 5th floor. The street has low traffic. Some noise on the weekend from Times Square, but overall no problem. We really loved this boutique hotel and would definitely stay again.

title: The hotel was, ok.
text: My daughter and I had an extended weekend stay to celebrate her birthday at The Pearl. Our flight arrived super early so we decided to drop our bags at the hotel and do a little sightseeing. Upon arrival, we were pleasantly greeted by a young lady and told we would we reached once our room was available. We went to lunch (Ellen's Stardust diner which was on our itinerary and literally right across the street). After leaving, we walked a few blocks and decided to head back to the hotel for chargers since our phone was dying...roughly about 2 hours prior to "check-in" time. The lady at front desk politely greeted us again and told us she was actually about to text us, which was great news to hear. Upon arrival to the room, it wasn't the room we booked. I paid for a double room superior and received a single bed. We were both too tired to care so we showered so we could rest. The bathroom was a nice size but with a small tv on the wall which was a great surprise. The shower was huge but neither of us could shower longer than 5 minutes because they drain must've been clogged and didn't drain. Within 2 minutes there was gross water nearly above our ankles. Disgusting. The beds were comfortable and the room included a microwave, coffee maker and mini fridge. There was also an umbrella in the closet which came in handy and robes and slippers for us. The lighting in the room and bathroom is horrible though and one of the lamps kept flickering. On the last day, the main room light would not come on but it was the last  day so I didn't bother calling the front desk. Breakfast was just ok. Bagels, an assortment of sweets, rubbery boiled eggs, fresh fruit, yogurt and packs of oatmeal. There was also orange juice, water and coffee. The eating area is a little cramped, located on the second floor but we did have a nice view of outside. There were about 6 tables with 4 chairs each on one side and the other had sofa chairs and tables. Also during the day they offered complimentary bags of chips and a vending machine on another level. Also there was complimentary wine daily (red or white) from 5pm to 6pm I believe. One other thing I noticed was we were the only POC during our entire stay, but those things don't generally bother me. I only felt a bit slighted at check out with that when speaking to a couple guys at front desk regarding transportation to the airport and a few stares during breakfast but hey, that's their issue, not  mine. As far as location, it was good. Very close to everything we were in town for. Minskoff Theater, Times Square, Ellen's Stardust Diner. We took an Uber & Lyft at other times. Would I stay again? Probably not. But it wasn't the absolute worst I've stayed in.

title: Perfektes Hotel, um mit der Familie bei York zu entdecken.
text: Das Hotel ist perfekt, um mit der Familie New York zu entdecken. Die Lage am Timesquare ist super. Rund um das Hotel jede Menge U-Bahn Stationen. Die Zimmer sind sauber und von der Größe absolut ausreichend. Service ist sehr gut. Einzig, dass beim Frühstück sehr viel unnötiger Müll durch Plastikgeschirr anfällt, stört doch und kostet einen Punkt. Das Frühstück ist im übrigen für den Start in den Tag völlig ausreichend. Von Obst über Baguettes bis zu Orangensaft wird alles geboten.

title: Lovely hotel in a great location!
text:
The Pearl Hotel was an excellent choice for us as a family, the location a short distance from Times Square next to the Ambassador theatre.
Check in staff were kind and friendly and made us feel very welcome. Our room was of ample size and had 2 queen beds. Shower was powerful and we had nice toiletries which were replenished daily.
Breakfast was self service and there was always a good choice of bagels, toast, sweet treats and drinks and the staff were helpful if you needed anything else.
We also asked the hotel to store our bags on our last day which they were happy to do for us as we had a late flight.

title: una perla rara a New York
text:
Il nome del' hotel è veramente azzeccato, è una perla rara a New York. L' hotel ha camere insolitamente grandi, pulitissime e soprattutto silenziose. Considerato che siamo in una zona trafficatissima è un miracolo.
Noi eravamo in tre  in una double queen al settimo piano. i letti sono abbastanza grandi, anche dormendo in due in un queen si sta bene. c'è il micoroonde e il frigo. Bagno ben fornito di asciugamani, accappatoi e prodotti l' Occitaine
Non c'è mai attesa per gli ascensori, e la fermata della metro è praticamente attaccata, talmente comoda che al ritorno invece di andare in aeroporto in taxi siamo andati in metro. La posizione è impagabile, a un passo da Times Square , nel cuore del distretto dei teatri. 
La colazione è a buffet, piuttosto semplice, ci si serve in piatti di carta , ma la scelta di dolce è buona ( salato meno) e anche facendo colazione tardi non abbiamo mai avuto problemi. Té e caffè sono sempre a disposizione.
Il personale è molto gentile, disponibile e veloce.
Lo consiglio veramente a tutto, ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo.

title: The Pearl Hotel is a pearl!
text: I love this hotel.  For theater-goers, it has the best location.  I walked everywhere I wanted to go except the Met and Whitney.  The room was a good size, big enough to hang with friends in. The bathroom had a great shower and nice toiletries. Housekeeping and front desk staff were great.  My only two minor complaints are: the mattress seemed a little hard and the tv was a little small.  I will stay here on my next trip to NYC.

title: A positive stay in the city!
text: We had a very pleasant, comfortable stay at The Pearl Hotel. My husband and I stayed four nights in November 2022. The location is very convenient to theaters and other sights, but is on a pretty quiet street. The staff was friendly and helpful. The wine hour was nice. Breakfast was sufficient, with several food choices and good coffee. The room was clean and comfortable.

title: Very average hotel
text: What can I say, the stay wasn't great. Location of the hotel is perfect just on Times Square but hotel is a bit outdated. We stayed 3 nights on the last floor (14th) and on the 1st night the aircon was making a cracking noise so couldn't sleep, next day the caretaker had a look at it and said we need to change our room but the hotel management didn't change the room and when we came back in the evening they said they sold all their rooms so it was very disappointing. They manager did change our room for the last night to a bigger and better room which was much better. Breakfast is very basic and we opted to have breakfast outside. You will hear a lot of noise from outside as it's Times Square like police siren and construction work but I guess that would be the case for most hotels in the area. Overall 3 star hotel at best.

title: Nice place to unwind after busy NYC days/nights
text: Clean room that fit our family of 5. Staff all very friendly and helpful. Nice breakfast that was not at all crowded. Busy Thanksgiving week but we easily sat down together every day. Free wine hour 5-6 every night. Location was close to most things midtown. Would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great hotel, great location
text: Clean, updated room with comfortable bed. Room was larger than other area hotels we stayed at. Great location, close to Times Square, theaters, infinite number of restaurants. Very friendly and helpful staff. Will definitely stay here again

title: Ótima localização
text: Experiência agradável em um hotel muito bem localizado na Time Square e  com um atendimento adequado de funcionários muito solícitos e educados. Quarto e banheiro amplos e bem limpos. A decoração é  moderna, clean. O que poderia melhorar é o café da manhã.

title: Perfect hotel for our family
text: The hotel is lovely, clean and is in a great central location. It’s on Broadway but we were never disturbed with any noise from outside. We chose this hotel as the room had a separate area for us to sit at night once the children were asleep, and it served us well. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was great, we ate it every morning and whilst the area is small, we always got a table. The hotel stored our bags for us between checkout and taxi pick up, free of charge. The only negative is there was barely anything my husband could eat at breakfast as he was gluten free, so some more gluten free options would be appreciated by coeliacs.

title: Bang average
text:
This is a bang average hotel and while advertised as Boutique it’s not that either. While it is well located and the rooms are fine it’s just OK.

Breakfast is a very basic continental buffet with juices, tea and coffee, but you have to battle to find your own table that is crammed in to the space.

There is no restaurant or bar on site so don’t expect to be able to order room service or similar.

It’s not a dreadful place it’s just it’s not that good.
Wish I’d paid double and gone for one of the more recognised brand hotels where you know what you will get!

title: Great hotel, fabulous location.
text:
Fantastic location (5 minute walk to Times Square), friendly staff. Nice breakfast.
Clean well appointed rooms.
Wine at 5pm in the lobby very nice touch, also tea/coffee available free of charge all day.
Beds very comfortable, rooms spacious and  well equipped with coffee machine, microwave and fridge.

We did have an issue with the toilet which maintenance dealt with very quickly.

The one improvement that could be made would be to have proper cutlery and crockery rather than plastic cutlery.

Would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Not a honest company to deal with, could not therefore recommend it.
text: OK hotel, clean, don’t expect an American breakfast what you get is a continental with plastic cutlery, paper plates and cups. Sting in the tail on arriving for a four night prepaid stay they asked for my credit card to pay for local taxes, after signing out they emailed my receipt which included an additional $120.00 for something called a daily facility fee. Totally deceptive practice as we had not used anything extra in the hotel other than sleeping and breakfasting.

title: Magnifique hôtel
text:
Je n'ai pas pu attendre la fin de mon séjour pour vous donner mon avis sur cet hôtel. Il est magnifique, très propre, le personnel est très gentil surtout Mourad qui parle très bien français ( ouff on ne parle pas anglais)et nous a bien conseillez.
Le petit déjeuner est très copieux. Viennoiseries, café thé, jus d'orange, fruits, yaourt, produits Salé, sucré bref beaucoup de choix. La chambre est fait tous les jours. Non vraiment je ne trouve aucun point négatif, en plus on est à côté de Time Square et du métro.
Un grand merci à tous le personnel pour le bon travail que vous faites pour que l'on se sente bien chez vous.
Nathalie et Michael

title: Disappointed
text: The entire hotel could use a make over. Everything is tired from the beds that are lumpy to the broken door handle on the bathroom. The toilet paper holder was barely hanging on. The carpet is old and stained. All of this does not make the hotel feel clean. This ihotel is a great location and the staff are very friendly. It is just tired.

title: Good size rooms with no so good breakfast
text:
Pros: good size rooms, close to many attractions 
Cons: daily fee, tasteless breakfast, no water in the room, in very busy area 
I stayed here for one night with my brother during our trip to NewYork. The hotel rooms are reasonable but over all i will not stay here again. For the price you pay you could get much nicer places. The guy on reception who checked us in looked confused and took long time to checked us in!

title: Definitely a great hotel option in NYC!
text:
The hotel is well located and very clean.  Lobby is well equipped and the room included a free continental breakfast.  Room was good sized with a small sink and view of the theatre next door.  Perfect hotel to stay at for shows or to check out the city. 

Bonnie at the front desk was a delight and very helpful as well.

title: Great location overall pretty decent place
text:
Friendly check in and helpful staff. Nice roomy lobby. Restaurant was closed but not an issue as there are lots of places to eat in New York! Lol
Room itself was nicely appointed but some items were in need a replacement. Clean bathroom and room cleanliness overall was good. We rented a king suite with a balcony. A really large balcony but the outdoor furniture on that balcony was pretty rough. Needed paint or replacement. Didn’t really want to sit on the stuff.
Located in the heart of broadway so close to theatres. Walked to our shows.

title: Great location, great service from Joey, Ali and Keagan
text:
This hotel is a hidden gem. The boutique hotel is nestled on 48th Street and 8th Avenue, within the theatre district,  grocery shopping, the subway and numerous restaurants and retail shops. The staff was most courteous with extra points going to Joey, Ali and Keagan. 
It comes with "free" breakfast and a gym. Alas, what they do not tell you is that there is an extra charge of about 104 dollars. This was referred to as a facility fee. It would be prudent to inform guests about this or simply include it in the booking fee. The wine hour from 5:00 - 6:00 pm was a pleasant surprise. 
This was a last minute trip for me and my daughter. I had never stayed at The Pearl Hotel before, during my visits to the Big Apple.  I would stay here again.

title: Fantastic stay
text: We enjoyed a wonderful, week long stay at The Pearl from 05August.  Superb location, room was large, very well appointed and every member of staff pleasant and professional.  With WiFi, breakfast and snack bar included in the resort fee, this was great value for money.  You can pay a lot more and get a lot less in New York.  We will definitely return.

title: Great choice in the theatre district
text: We recently spent 3 nights here and were very pleased. Our room was spacious and well appointed.  The location is perfect if you're going to Broadway shows. We've stayed in many hotels in the area over the years and this one was really a gem in terms of price and quality.

title: I'd stay here again
text:
Amazing location and the corresponding price was fairly reasonable. The breakfast however is not edible - the same old pastries and ugly coffee each day.

The first room we got was quite small, especially considering it was a king. We asked to be moved and at a small upgrade fee, we were moved to a room with two massive beds. The room was much bigger too and overall was very nice and clean. We stayed for 10 days and were very comfortable.

title: Very nice Hotel
text: Stayed here for 3 nights in July with 3 adults.  Room was spacious and location was excellent.  Staff was very nice.  Decent breakfast buffet.  Rooms were very quiet.  We enjoyed our stay and would stay here again.

title: Wonderful hotel!
text:
This is our new favorite hotel in NYC!  We just spent four days there and absolutely loved this hotel.  The location could not have been better- just a few steps from theaters- close to the subway- close to restaurants!
    We had a king bed room, and it was large compared to NYC hotel rooms!  There was a refrigerator in the room for your convenience.  There was also a social noir with complimentary wine from 5-6.  Also, complimentary  chips and chocolate mints in an alcove off the lobby.  Continental breakfast in a large area with couches and tables- plenty of room to socially distance.
     Everyone who worked there was sooo nice.  They were great with directions and answered any questions we had.
    And the elevators were fast- we never had to wait!

title: Quiet & Convenient
text: My husband and I stayed at The Pearl for five nights in May.  Our room overlooked the street out front and theater. Rarely noticed noises.  Our room was very clean and comfortable.. The staff was friendly. The location was excellent for walking to shows.  Even though in the Times Square area, it felt tucked away.  We walked to the Met, MOMA, and Rockefeller Center areas with no problem.  Good rates for the location.

title: 5 Stars on a 4 Star budget
text: Beautiful hotel. Five star quality at four star prices. The room was absolutely perfect and very clean. All the staff were very helpful. The continental breakfast is a little disappointing because there’s so little choice. Location is very central to Times Square. Never too noisy or busy. We will stay here again.

title: Good choice in Time Square Area
text:
While the reviews for this hotel were very good, it was still better than I expected for s hotel in the middle of the tourist district.

Nice staff and very efficient. Large room with big bathroom and a nice sitting area. Updated with current decor. Three TV's in the room. 

They have an area on the second floor for free snacks, coffee and fruit.

Would recommend if you plsnd have you focused on the theater district.

title: Décevant !
text:
L'hôtel est tres bien placé, sur la 49ème à 80 metres de Times Square. Nous sommes 4 personnes (2 couples), la reservation à été faite en même temps, pour 2 chambres identiques de catégorie supérieure . Une chambre sera au 12ème étage,  l'autre au 2ème !  Celle du 2ème est beaucoup plus petite, très peu lumineuse (lumières obligatoires toute la journée) car une porte-fenêtre qui est condamnée et une fenêtre à côté donne dans u e cour intérieure entourée de murs des immeubles, il y a des sieges et un transat de salon de jardin impraticables car p,ein de dejections d'oiseaux. La climatisation fonctionne mais regule dans un bruit infernal, obligation de l'eteindre la nuit. 
Autre aspect tres moyen, le niveau du petit déjeuner : gobelets carton et toutes petites assiettes en plastique, couverts en plastique, pas de service, vous devez vous deplacer pour tout,  jusqu'à vider vos dechets dans la poubelle. Juste des bagels de plusieurs variétés,  pain de mie et muffins, des petites viennoiseries parfois pas tres fraiches,  uniquement jus d'orange et bananes ou fruits frais découpés en morceaux mais pas'tous les jours ! Hotel 4 *, prix de la'chambre aux alentours de 300 à 350$ .Pas au niveau du tout ! Le personnel est sympathique.

title: Bon emplacement
text:
Hôtel très bien situé dans les quartiers des théâtres.
Malgré la situation,très calme,aucun bruit de la rue dans la chambre.
Nous étions au 8 étages.
La chambre est très grande pour New York,une salle de bain assez petite par rapport à la chambre mais suffisante pour trois jours.
La douche….franchement c est incompréhensible ce pommeau de douche qui a été disposé.
Aucun mais aucun intérêt au niveau de l’utilisation.
Vraiment pas pratique pour se rincer le corps,les cheveux. 
En plus vous devez laisser couler assez longtemps pour avoir enfin de l eau chaude.
Cela reste une énigme ce pommeau.
Propreté impeccable partout dans l hôtel.
La chambre a été faite tous les jours,je dirais c est normal mais apparemment pas partout…et nous l avons prit à nos dépend à deux endroits différents ( hôtel de 4 et 5 étoiles) apparement depuis l’épisode Covid-19…c est secondaire!
Le mobilier est daté mais une chambre complète et un matelas assez bon.
Le petit déjeuner est très très à l Américaine mais complet.
Nous avons eu la chance que ce soit Madame Nereida qui a été présente chaque matin pour nous accompagner.
Quel plaisir de la voir être aussi prévenante avec chacun,toujours un mot gentil et avec le  sourire.
Cela a été un réel plaisir chaque matin. Bravo à elle et j espère que son manager  en tiendra compte.
Le drink de 17h00 a 18h00…. Je ne comprends pas très bien pourquoi il se fait dans le hall de l hôtel alors qu une belle salle à l étage pour le petit déjeuner s y prête mieux…. Certainement à revoir.
Par contre,à part le vin blanc et rouge rien n était offert avec .
Bien évidemment vous avez les chips ou popcorns salés ( 24h/) mais  pas de fromage ou légumes frais comme j avais vu en photos lors de la réservation. Encore est ce du au Covid-19 ?
Sinon le personnel tout entier est très arrangeant et agréable.
Il nous a été impossible de régler la température dans la chambre.
Il faisait étouffant…l air conditionné est assez bruyant.

title: Classic Hotel in Heart of Theater District
text: We just stayed 3 nights in May at this very nice hotel.  Our king room was spacious and immaculate, with quality amenities, great bath/shower, and comfy bed.  The resort fee was a surprise, so continental breakfast and happy hour aren't actually "free," but still appreciated.  Staff were super nice and helpful. One or two blocks to almost all Broadway theaters.  Overall a great location for many attractions, including MOMA, Rockefeller Center, close to Grand Central. We will make this our NYC headquarters from now on. Loved it!

title: Localização e quarto maravilhosos
text:
Hotel muito bom, excelente localização, quarto grande. Staff atencioso.
Mas café da manhã muito ruim, não compensa. Apenas alguns bagels, cream cheese e café. Raros muffins e donuts. E tem poucas mesas. 
Recomendo ficar no hotel e tomar café em algum dos vários locais em volta!

title: Hotel Bestens - Frühstück?
text:
Ich suche Hotels immer zuerst nach Lage und dann nach Preis/Leistungs/Verhältnis aus. In beiden Punkten hat The Pearl die Erwartungen voll erfüllt. Mehrere U-Bahn-Linien sind gleich um's Eck. Times Square / 5th Avenue / MoMA und vieles mehr in wenigen Minuten erreichbar. Mehr im Herzen der Broadway Theater kann man fast nicht sein. Das einzige was man am Zimmer beanstanden kann ist, dass es nur 6 Haken in einem riesigen Schrank gibt - und die haben alle nur einen Drahtbügel für Röcke?!! Bei Service sind auch nur Kleinigkeiten zu Beanstanden - das Duschgel wurde erst nach Aufforderung aufgefüllt. Wattestäbchen oder -Pads sind nicht vorhanden. 
Erschreckend war aber das was sich "Frühstück" nennt. Im Vergleich zu den hochgeladenen Bildern muss dies im Laufe der Jahre immer weiter abgenommen haben. Verblieben sind im Wasser schwimmende geschälte Eier, Butter und Philadelphia - an 3 (von 6) Tagen gab es Obst. Für Europäer (wo mittlerweile Plastik bei Wattestäbchen und Strohalmen verboten ist) ist eis ein Kulturschock,  auf Plastik-Einwegteller zu essen und mit Plastikmesser zu essen. Die Gabeln stecken mit den Zacken nach oben zur Entnahme in einen Korb - sehr (un!-)hygenisch.! Die Sitzmöglichkeiten sind ebenfalls für ein Frühstück nicht geeignet - man darf auch selbst aufräumen. Gereinigt wird zwischen den einzelnen Gästen nicht.

title: Excellent Location and Service
text: Stayed here 5 nights in early March. The location is very close to the theatres, Rockefeller Center, and Times Square. The room was large and surprisingly quiet. Complimentary breakfast included pastries, fruit, hard-boiled eggs, bagels, toast, English muffins, yogurt, coffee, and tea. The lobby staff were very helpful, and the housekeeping staff cleaned the room thoroughly. Happy to find robes, slippers, an iron, and an umbrella in the closet. Free wine from 5 to 6 was also nice. Room service also available.

title: Felt home
text: After enjoyed my lunch at Verso went up to have a smoke and a coffee SOUKAINA helped me with her iPhone charger since mine wasn’t functioning she was super helpful such a good advisor with proactivity and professional engaging meanwhile my shisha yet to be served dint fell alone she could assist properly and serve me my phone after only 10 min of charging smartly made me enjoying the outdoor seating area that at that time was not busy we engage and I could enjoy shisha as well as the drink. Thank you soukaina again keep it up

title: Hidden Gem
text: This was our 2nd visit here. I love the location and the rooms are a good size.  The beds are comfortable as were the pillows. Our room had an outside balcony with table and chairs. They offer a happy hour and breakfast on the 2nd floor. All the staff were very nice and helpful.

title: Charming and perfect for our family
text: My family (husband, two kids ages 12, 9) and I stayed here last week for two nights and had a wonderful experience. The staff was courteous and helpful, the room (double queen) was spotless, safe, and more spacious than I had anticipated. The only change I would make is that we did not feel there was enough blankets on the beds and I didn’t see any extras in the room. I should have asked for more at the front desk, because that was our only downside and probably was an easy fix, the beds were otherwise very comfortable and clean. The location was fantastic, we were able to walk to Times Square without being in the midst of chaos, we walked to/from the subway, restaurants, Central Park, etc - it was great. We visited from MA over our February vacation week, and did not know if we would be able to make this trip until a few days before we came due to covid and weather, so the cancellation policy was important. We also did not make it to a Broadway show but this location clearly would have been perfect for that… next time. The continental breakfast had surprisingly good bagels and a couple other items, juice, etc, it wasn’t much but it was fine for us to get started for the day, and included so no complaints. The coffee machine and tea off of the lobby was a very welcome feature, I love to go down and grab a hot cup of coffee while the rest of my family is getting ready in the morning, without having to leave the property, or even stand in line and pay for a basic cup of coffee. My husband and I also enjoyed the complimentary wine hour in the evening. We happened to come back to our room at that time both days; I wouldn’t make special arrangements for this but if you happen to be there, it was very welcome. We left the kids up in the room to relax before dinner and just had a nice hour to ourselves with a couple glasses of wine. It’s special touches like this that make The Pearl Hotel stand out from others and I will absolutely book again when we return to the city.

title: The Pearl Hotel is a Diamond!
text:
Lovely 'small' hotel in the heart of Manhatten.
The staff are all very friendly, polite and helpful.
Rooms are good size and very clean and quiet.
Breakfast being included is a big bonus, and it's very nice too, as is the 5pm to 6pm free wine hour in the lobby!
Would highly recommend this hotel and will be back.

title: Can't fault it
text:
We spent 4 nights here, and absolutely loved it!  Staff are super friendly and helpful, rooms are spacious, clean and include microwave, coffee/tea maker, fridge, safe, free wifi, and are quiet.  L'Occitane toiletries replenished every day.  Breakfast included at Friedmans, was fabulous too!  Fresh fruit, meat, cheeses, bagels, pastries, eggs.  Special shout out to the lovely man in Friedmans who couldn't do enough for you!
The 24 hour cafe with coffee/tea and snacks was well used!
Extra special is the wine reception every evening from 5 - 6pm.  Lovely chance to meet fellow guests, and both the red and white wine were lovely.  Been to NY several times and this was by far the best place we have stayed, and we will 100% book here again.  Location ideal too!

title: best hostel to book
text:
I stayed in the most amazing hostel I've ever been to.

The hostel was a great place to stay. It was clean and had a lot of amenities. The staff were always friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was delicious.

I would highly recommend staying at the hostel if you're in the area!

title: 3* At Best, Could Do Better
text:
Hotel = 3*

- Hotel is nice, well looked after and hallways kept clean and spotless but nothing overall nothing special. We have had past hotels leave little greeting cards etc, amything just to make it that bit more special. Expect nothing from this hotel.

Greetings/Concierge = 1*

- When we first arrived to the hotel there was a lack of conceirge (who seemed to stay more by the room lifts rather than remaining near the front of house) so we made out way in with multiple suitcases which was a bit of struggle.

- Receptionists provided no greeting, total lack of conversation and were more bothered about closing out the transaction and giving us our room key rather than building any rapour, total silence and very odd. This is the same each day, never a "hello" or "how is your day", just prepare yourself to be ignored.

Breakfast = 1*

- Terrible, not enough choice. The fruit is old and mouldy, the bagels hard and also food left out in the open (at least during covid cover these up!). No hand sanitisers aroud either, total lack of cleanliness. Glasses for drinks were unclean, overall your better eating out.

Room/Service = 2*

- Room is pretty standard, im not a serial complainer however.... bath tap handle came undone, table sides were not cleaned down and galsses in the room were used and unclean. A few days in, we returned to our room having found the cleaners empty packet of crisp on the side, and a cup of water near the window. Even cups we had used were not replaced daily, bit disgusting.

(P.s. If your going to eat whilst on the job, at least do it discreetly and clean up after yourself). 

The only plus points were that the bedding and towels were changed daily so we were happy with that and appreciate the effort even on christmas day.

Location = 5*

- Right next to Times Square, surrounded by restaurants and shops (both food and retail) so you will no doubt enjoy this part!

OVERALL RATING = 3* At Best

- Ideal location however I have stayed in much better hotels in New York so would recommend any future traveller to consider an alternative hotel for your stay! Would not stay again.

title: Give this one a look if you’re going to NYC for theater
text:
Starting w/the cons: no luggage rack, strange shower head.

The pros, however: great location in the theater district, reasonable price, helpful staff, good breakfast, clean & comfortable room w/good amenities.

I would stay here again.

title: Great staff at the Pearl Hotel!
text: My daughter and I had a lovely weekend at the Pearl Hotel NYC. It was my second time staying there and I was so happy I chose it again.  The location can't be beat, the rooms are a nice size and Jaime and all the staff were extremely helpful and accommodating. Definitely will be back!

title: We Love The Pearl Hotel
text: This was our second time staying at The Pearl Hotel.  We love it.  The location is great because it is close to Times Square, Broadway, Rockefeller Center and so many restaurants.  It is also an easy walking distance to Central Park and also The Empire State Building.  Our room was spacious, comfortable, and well appointed.  All of the staff was always very friendly.  We just love it and will stay again on our next trip.

title: Good sized rooms, great location and awesome staff members!
text: We were very pleased with our recent stay. The rooms are a nice size, nicely appointed and the hotel was perfectly located for everything we wanted to do. The absolute best part of our visit was the staff. Everyone we encountered was so pleasant and helpful, it was a pleasure interacting with all of them.

title: Great hotel
text:
I loved this hotel. We chose it because the location was great (3 blocks from times square) and at a great price.
The staff was always very kind and were quick to answer our doubts or solve any issue we might have.
The bedrooms are good, have a tv, desk, mini fridge, microwave and a sink. The beds were really comfortable and the shower pressure great.
We were always required to show our vaccine certificate if we wanted to have breakfast in the common space and all the hotel respectes Covid-19 requirements.

title: Friendly Place in a Great Location
text: Just spent 3 nights at the Pearl. Had an excellent time -- spacious well appointed room, incredibly friendly staff.   It's just off Times Square, but on a surprisingly quiet block.  Great value -- would definitely stay again!

title: Amazing hotel
text: The staff were all friendly and helpful with any situation.  The hotel is conveniently located near Broadway and Times Square with easy access to the subway.  This hotel was the quietest I have ever experienced in my travels with the exception of the noises from the street.  You can't get any better than not having to hear what is going on in the room next door.

title: Exceptional Hotel and Perfectly Located
text: The hotel could not be more ideal in terms of access to Times Square, Broadway, Rockefeller Center, Central Park. There are also several subway stations within short walking distance that provide easy access to the entire city. Hotel staff were very helpful, courteous and friendly. They were very good about checking proof of COVID vaccinations prior to entering the breakfast room and staff were always wearing masks. All in all it was wonder experience and we hope to return.

title: There's nothing about The Pearl that doesn't impress me
text: This being my first trip to New York City, I was really concerned about where I was going to stay. I happened upon this hotel and the price and overall location was great. I'm a very firm believer in, "You get what you pay for," so I was going for clean and safe, but not a whole lot more.  I'm on my 5th day here, and everyday, I'm more and more impressed.  The staff really cares. They've solved multiple little problems for me, especially when I realized I forgot my vaccination card at home, the gentleman at the front desk suggested where to go to get a digital confirmation on my phone. In 5 minutes catastrophe was averted!! The cleaning staff stopped by after I left the do not disturb sign on my room to make sure everything was ok. I've had multiple interactions with the staff daily and they have all been a pleasure. The continental breakfast is very good and high end. This ain't no crappy plastic wrapped danish/instant coffee breakfast. My room is SUPER NICE with everything I need. The bed and pillows are very high quality.  The thermostat in the room is flawless. It's been horribly hot and ridiculously humid so yes, I set the room to 65degrees and you could hang meat in here.  I can't tell you how much I appreciate the large mirror in the room, so many times I've had to stand on a toilet to check my whole look out. The lobby is so beautiful. And I'm 2 blocks from Times Square. I literally couldn't have found a better hotel. I'll never stay anywhere else when I come to New York city.  Period.

title: Exceptional NYC boutique hotel experience!
text: What an exceptional NYC boutique hotel experience! The staff was especially attentive, professional, and accommodating. Our seventh-floor room was exceptionally clean and quiet, and well appointed. Additionally, we had a coffee maker,  a mini fridge, and a microwave in the room as well. Finally, the continental breakfast the next morning exceeded expectations and was really special, with delicious croissants, muffins, bagels, juices, coffee, tea, hard-boiled eggs, fruit, charcuterie, etc. They also have complementary coffee and hot water for tea 24/7, including latte and cappuccino, on the first floor as well…the latte was fantastic! We will definitely be returning on our next trip to NYC. Most highly recommended!

title: Very comfortable place to stay
text: We stayed at the Pearl last weekend and had a thoroughly enjoyable visit.  What a great value for NYC!  A complimentary breakfast and wine hour were such a nice treat.  The hotel was well equipped with anything you would need. The staff was wonderful!

title: Delightful Hotel! Like you hope for.
text: Outstanding everything: the room, service, tasteful décor throughout, very clean, the breakfast, wine happy hour, COVID-19 protocol/practices and the location.  Great value, too.  Easy walking distance to many neighborhoods, restaurants and mass transit.  Super nice and major grocery store on the corner.  The hotel lived up to all the great reviews.

title: Awesome Hotel and Staff
text: We were visiting NYC and decided to try a different Hotel to offer our clients. The Pearl was on point. The staff starting with Jose,Ozzie,Vonni,Red,Joey and doormen Juan etc. Not only made us feel at home but like we were part of the Fam. The Hotel is at the center of everything.   The beds were so comfortable and the room very clean as well. The breakfast was also good better than a continental breakfast. Thanks for everything and will definitely give this option to our clients. We will be Back. 👋🏼

title: I will not stay anywhere else in NYC!!
text:
I cant say enough good things about this hotel. Not all amenities are available due to covid and that I think is understood by all.
On arrival, check in was smooth, the lobby so clean! The room smelled freshly cleaned and is so spacious and I mean its NORMAL standard for a hotel in any other city, but in NY it is HUGE. The bathroom is also not a shoebox, nice tile, nice countertops, shower had multiple spray features. They DO NOT SKIMP ON shampoo, soaps, all L'Occitane en Provence.  The linens were clean, the bed was comfortable. We especially loved their wine reception each day and the ability to GRAB SNACKS for 24 hours a day in a room we all have access too. WE LOVED the coffee in that room and went several times a day to get some. The TV is oddly small considering the space available for one, but  we quickly forgot how small the TV was.  The staff was also amazing, the same familiar faces each day, always smiling, always happy. Planning to go again in NOV and booking this in advance.

title: Bad & Breakfast
text: If you need to have a breakfast do not choose this hotel because they sended us to a cafe. You can get there a bagel and a drink and there is no space to sit. If you are happy with eating bagel while standing then you might consider staying in this hotel

title: Perfectly Amazing
text: We had an amazing time at this hotel. The front desk staff was great and so were the greeters/bell men. Francisco was so nice and funny. He helped us navigate the subway system. Room was very clean. House keeping did a fantastic job.  We were given a breakfast voucher to pick a bagel (food was good). The hotel is about 3 minutes from Times Square and Broadway. Overall, I would rate this 5/5.

title: Awesome location, great staff, spacious rooms
text: This hotel is a few steps from the best things NYC has to offer! We could walk to 5th Av for shopping, to central park for a nice walk, to the Museum of Natural History and even Times Square (if you are into it :) ). Fransisco, the bellman, made sure to book us a car with car seats (not easy in NYC). The airplane landed at 1 AM instead of 8 PM and the driver was waiting outside (a lifesaver). My family had a few rooms in the Hotel and the front desk helped coordinate between the family members and were very helpful when needed. Finally, for an NYC room, ours was VERY spacious. We have 2 kids and had plenty of space in the room to handle them.

title: Fabulous Stay!
text: We found this hotel purely by chance after looking on the internet.  We had originally booked in to another hotel (for 4 nights) but checked out after 1 night and moved to The Pearl.  On arrival at The Pearl we were met with someone opening the door and immediately taking our luggage and put on a luggage trolley.  We then went to reception desk and were welcomed warmly.  After explaining our situation (our disastrous first nights accommodation) and why we had booked The Pearl (full sized beds) the manager explained that we would be better in a different room with queen sized beds and a walk in shower.  He moved us to this room without any hesitation or additional costs.  Breakfasts were served by in small kitchen/diner restaurant next door (inter-connecting door from hotel) which were very lovely and fresh.  Good selection and the staff were lovely and friendly.  On checkout from the hotel, we stored our luggage and this was completely free of charge.  Location was great, rooms good size (if you want UK double bed, request queen size bed in NY) and actually had a microwave, coffee machine, small sink, iron & board, safe (all FOC).  Complimentary refreshment bar behind reception, where you can get free tea/coffee/water/cookies/crisps.  Highly recommend this hotel to any visitors to NYC.  Excellent hotel and fabulous, friendly staff.  Would definitely return.

title: Midtown Manhattan Boutique Hotel
