text: Great Location, good breakfast, spacious rooms, helpful staff, extremely clean and comfortable.  Reasonable price for what you get. There’s even a snack room with 24 hour access to coffee, tea, cookies, and chips.  This hotel thinks of everything.

title: Very pleased with this hotel
text: Had a great experience here with our family with two young children. Our room was way bigger than I was expecting for NYC and the bathroom was amazing. I don’t know if they offer any type of crib as we brought our own pack and play for the baby. The staff was super friendly and they had a little snack area open 24/7 with a coffee/hot cocoa machine, fruits, chips, etc at no extra cost. The free breakfast was a little limited and didn’t have a whole lot (especially for our children, one of whom is a super picky eater) but even the staff there tried to be as accommodating as possible. The hotel has free wine and cheese in the lobby around 5ish every day but somehow we missed it each time. Great location too, would 100% stay here again.

title: Amazing stay!
text:
After thoroughly searching and reading and investigating NYC hotels, we decided for The Pearl. Okay, where to start? Location!!! This hotel is basically two blocks away from Times Square (Book of Mormons theater across the street and Chicago right beside the hotel); and is so close to everything and everywhere. We even walked to the Brooklyn Bridge and Little Italy which is an hour away and had an amazing time enjoying the walk.
The amenities of the hotel are unbeatable. Their “Continental” buffet breakfast is included, but it's really a full breakfast with oatmeal, scrambled eggs, bacon, French toasts, croissants, pastries, juices and coffee, and it’s really good and all-you-can-eat; it is served from 7:00 a.m. to 10:00 a.m. (NOTE: every morning you have to ask for the breakfast vouchers at the hotel reception which you will deposit in a jar at Friedman’s where it is served right next door – entrance through the hotel). The hotel also has a daily Wine and Cheese hour from 5:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m. with crackers, cheeses, and very good wine. In addition, it has a 24/7 snack bar which was heaven sent upon our arrival at 1:30 in the morning; the bar has bananas, apples, cookies of all kinds, chips, coffee, variety of teas, and hot chocolate.
We were given Room 203 which was convenient, because, even though the elevators are fast, it was easier to take the two flights of stairs. The room was very clean and spacious; bathroom products are from L’Occitane; the bed was super comfortable; some improvement can be made to the pillows although we slept like babies; the closet has bathrobes, slippers, an umbrella, a The Pearl small bag, laundry bag, safe; the room also had a nice terrace with a lounge and chairs, but the door had a please do not open sign which we imagined was due to the cold weather. The only problem we confronted was that the shower water took long to come out hot, but this was not a big deal; in the end, it came out veeeryyyy hot. The room was also beautifully decorated. When we say we slept like babies; we truly did, no sound whatsoever from nowhere.
The staff was super friendly as well as the butlers; always greeting guests and being attentive. We made the reservation through Orbitz and did not have any issues with hidden costs or daily fee which is $28.50; not bad for the many amenities and food provided.
Overall, The Pearl is a keeper; we will definitely be back!!!!!

title: Customer service
text: The minute I walked in I was greeted by the bellman. My room was perfect, and the level of customer service that was displayed by hotel staff was beyond my expectations . I highly ecommend for someone that needs a great hotel in Times Square.

title: Perfect girl’s weekend
text: A great spot for myself and 2 daughters for a 3-night stay.  It was difficult to find a hotel that offered 2 queen beds, and this hotel was perfect for the 3 of us.  You can’t beat the location, and we were impressed with how quiet it was.  The room was a great size for NYC standards and the breakfast was a real plus.  Staff was very helpful as well.  I would stay here again!

title: Fantastic location
text: We truly enjoyed our stay at this hotel and certainly plan to make this our new first choice when visiting the city. It is perfectly located in the theater district making virtually everything an easy walk. We were in a Superior King room and were impressed with the spacious interior and the minimal street noise associated with the central location. Room darkening curtains made sleeping in a breeze. The restaurant attached to the hotel serves fabulous food as well, meeting all of our needs and ensuring a grand family trip.

title: Very Happy!
text: My husband and I stayed in a Deluxe King room (Room 1402) in mid-February. I spent a lot of time researching hotels in NYC as this was our first time visiting the city, and we felt that this was the perfect hotel for us. The room was immaculate and spacious, with a 6-drawer chest for clothing, plus a desk, small bench, chair, closet, and two bedside tables. There was also a little counter area with microwave, coffee table, and fridge. We really appreciated the convenience of the continental breakfast, and found the selection varied - hard-boiled eggs, oatmeal, yogurt, granola, fruit, avocado toast, bagels, and various pastries. The 24-hour snacks were great too, and we helped ourselves to a hot chocolate or tea plus snacks after a long day of sightseeing. For first time visitors to New York, the location was perfect. We went to several shows in the area, and all were within a 5-minute walk of the hotel. Subway stations were also convenient. The only downside is that the hotel is a little noisy. We could hear street traffic, which was to be expected. But we could also hear the whir of the elevator, creaks and knocks in the building, and on occasion, voices from other rooms. It really didn't bother us at all (we sleep with earplugs), and we would happily stay at this hotel again.

title: Muito bom
text: Muito bem situado, com teatros próximos, foi surpreendentemente positivo. Café da manhã ( modesto)incluso na diária mas com sala no lobby com café , frutas e outros alimentos nas 24 hrs. Ao entardecer happy hour, com vinhos, queijos e petiscos gratuitos. Bom dormitório com frigobar e microondas. Produtos de banho L Ocitane.

title: Absolutey love this hotel
text: My friend and I have stayed here twice in the past year and we are booked again for April.  Staff, rooms and location are fantastic!  Make sure to eat or have drinks at Lilly's Victorian Establishment a few door down and Book of Morman is playing right across the street.

title: Love this boutique hotel in NYC's theater district
text: Just finished my first stay at The Pearl which had been recommended to me several times in the past. I stayed because the rate was unusually low and a great value. The room was very comfortable, a bit larger than the average NYC hotel room. The bathroom, too, was roomy. The staff was consistently on point, friendly and able to answer any questions I had. As opposed to the bigger, corporate hotels, you walk into the stylish, cozy lobby with a desk manned by one or two employees which I liked. Also a plus - 24 hour coffee/tea/snacks available in the lobby.

title: Great location
text: Our room was clean, decent size.  It was nice having a coffee maker, small refrigerator and small microwave in the room.  Great location - we walked to theaters, Times Square, Central Park, 5th Avenue shopping.  Breakfast was included and the rate also included drinks and snacks that were available all the time in a room off of the lobby.  The staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Miss coupland
text: Absolutely loved our stay here, staff were fantastic, service brilliant. Our room we lovely and the bed was so comfortable. Location perfect. Would highly recommend and we would definitely return I’f we come back to New York. Thankyou

title: We have stayed for several years, probably won't return
text:
The hotel is nice, good staff. In years past, they had a nice wine and cheese reception in the second floor, which has now been moved to the lobby. Very impersonal; in years past we enjoyed talking with other guests, not possible in sterile lobby.
The pillows are TERRIBLE! Very large and hard. They have no alternative for people who don't want to sleep with head at uncomfortable angle. Seems like any hotel should have a variety of pillows.

title: Awesome Little Gem
text:
We had the pleasure of staying at The Pearl Hotel in NYC for a week and have to say this place is a fabulous little gem! 

Centrally located on West 49th St right near Broadway smack in the middle of the theatre district, it provided easy access to all modes of transport and made it easy for first time visitors to navigate this colourful and diverse city. 

The service was terrific and the amenities provided for guests were above and beyond other hotels - happy hour every day, fresh fruit and snacks available all day for guests and the breakfast at Friedman’s was great. We will definitely stay here again when back in this part of the world. 

Thank you The Pearl Hotel!

title: Pre-Birthday Celebration
text: From the moment you enterred the property, staff members were professional, and courteous. Rooms aesthetic is modern. Don't expect a view of the city if you stay on the 7th floor. Breakfast is very good especially the granola. Wine and cheese presented upon checking was delectable. Overall I had a great stay. And by the way, the hotel provided great heat, don't forget to adjust thermostat.

title: Excelente hospedagem
text: Localização hiper privilegiada, em ponto nobre da 49th street e ao lado de vários teatros. O quarto é bom e com bastante espaço. O atendimento não chega a ser maravilhoso mas é educado. Tem snacks a vontade o dia inteiro e queijo e vinhos à tarde. Único senão é o banheiro. Pequeno, a água demora a esquentar e depois fica difícil regular já que esquenta demais.

title: Actually disappointed....
text:
I had my eye on this hotel for a while, as I’ve read great reviews and the website has some fabulous pictures and attributes. I’m a discerning consumer, and we usually stay at the Michelangelo on W 51st as it caters to families and offers spacious rooms at a decent price. However, I took a chance and booked here for a night with my daughter just before Christmas. I booked a ‘deluxe’ double room for a few hundred dollars for one night. Here is the lowdown...

Positives:

Location....very important, and this fits the bill if you want to be in proximity to Rockefeller, Times Square or various Broadway shows. 

The breakfast next door was a little different and we liked the variety....pastries, french toast and even avocado toast. Definitely a step up from the usual continental offerings. 

Negatives:

The room was standard, blah, nothing ‘deluxe’ about it to justify the pricing. We’ve had better at the Holiday Inn. Sure, a mini fridge and microwave were included, but isn’t that generally the standard at any hotel anymore? A bottle of Voss on the counter will set you back $8, and the main TV was small. The bathroom was a disaster and ill-conceived. Small counter, large toilet with 2 TP holders (one of which was right next to the bathtub). A small TV was in the bathroom, although it faced the toilet and made no sense for watching it anywhere else as the bathtub faucet was on the wrong side to view the TV while taking a bath.  Detail obviously was overlooked when designing these rooms. 

The advertised ‘24-hr snack and drink’ counter on 2nd floor is false advertising, as this was not open or stocked in the morning during our stay. Seems to be open at various times only. Or perhaps their staff just weren’t attentive to this. 

The staff was polite, yet curt. For a hotel that seems to get such accolades, the interactions with the front desk and valet personnel came across as apathetic, bored and perhaps overwhelmed. Not impressed. 

For a night, we survived. Live and learn, I suppose.  Will be staying elsewhere next time. Just not enough here to warrant their star rating or have us as return customers.

title: Loved this hotel and staff
text: We loved this hotel! This was our first time staying here but we highly recommend it! It was super clean, staff was very helpful and friendly and our room was amazing! Each day there; I loved it even more. I felt like the staff wanted to help and wanted us to have a nice stay. We will define staying here again next time.

title: Fabulous Location
text:
What can I say.  The hotel was warm and welcoming.  Room looked out onto the street with the theatre that was showing Chicago.Spacious, fridge, coffee maker, plenty of towels , including face cloths,. Air con was good and changed very easily to heating the room.  One thing I was upset about they didn't have the christmas decorations up until the day we left which was the 1st December.   As most of the shops had their decorations in I would have expected the hotels to have them as well.

conveniently on the 2nd floor there was food and beverages available 24/7 and free.  Nice touch

Fantastic location, Times Square about 5 mins walk as was the Top of the Rock.  Subway was convenient too.  Met the coach for the Woodbury Outlet about 3 blocks down which was very convenient.

Unfortunately when we went up to the Top of the Rock the floor was closed as the weather was bad.  Snow, never mind they still took us up to one of the lower floors and although you could image the view it was a bit disappointing but thats not their fault.

Would I go again, most definately.  What has upset me more than anything is that I have tried to book this hotel for December 2020 and its FULL.  Oh No not fair.  Would most definately have booked again.

title: Overall, a Great Hotel with Huge Potential...but Needs to Step it Up
text:
My daughter and I stayed here from the 22nd to the 27th of December and overall we were happy, just a few things that make me question if I will stay here again and not check out other properties more closely in the area.

1. The hotel has a 'resort' fee of $25 per night, and I am still not sure what for? Sure, the breakfast is included and so is the wine and cheese and desserts - more on that below - but it doesn't feel included when you have to pay an additional fee per night - it feels we are paying for it. I don't know what else the money is used for since it's not a resort. Even the water in the room was 8 bucks...maybe they could include some water?

2. Wine and Cheese/Desserts and Breakfast: It was nice coming home after a really long day to wine and cheese. However, the cheese cubes, hummus, crackers, and possibly the wine were definitely from Costco or a club like this...although nice to have the snack before a later dinner, it never felt like it was really worth the fee we paid per night. The Desserts were a sham...there were never enough and of what was offered, was clearly from a big box place like Costco. I recognized the red velvet cupcakes and the key lime pie bites immediately. And they always put out a carafe of hot apple cider or hot chocolate, but really? It was so small that maybe 2 people could pour a drink from it. If you are going to offer a dessert hour, offer it so there is enough for everyone in your hotel and offer it for more than 1 hour? I mean everytime we got back from our day everything was gone. And breakfast...I loved that avocado toast was offered - I don't remember the last time avocado anything was offered with a free breakfast. They offer hard boiled eggs so if you are looking for an eggs and bacon breakfast, you won't find it here. They do offer french toast for the kiddos, but sugar free syrup? Nope. They offer a nice mixed fruit and oatmeal, but again never enough...and they were slow to bring out refreshed food. Also - offering the breakfast only until 10am? I have never had a breakfast included that was offered only until 10am - 10:30 is the standard..so again we felt cheated because we always seemed to wake up too late and couldn't partake.But, if you can wake up early enough and partake it was all we needed and seemed fresh and again, avocado toast is a rarity on free breakfast deals - but come on...let's offer it until 1030am at least.

3. Room: If anyone says the room was tight, sorry but you are in NYC - ALL rooms are tight. But honestly it was a much bigger room than I expected for NYC. It was clean and fairly updated. There was a Keurig machine and I liked that with a fridge in case you have medicine or leftovers, and although I didn't hear anything outside, the walls are VERY thin here...so I heard everything next door and you will have to keep your TV down because you can hear that too, so just note that if you need a room where you can make noise for whatever reason, don't stay here.

Other than that, the bed was very comfortable, but the pillows need an urgent update, they are small, lumpy and not at all at the level that the hotel professes it to be. I did like the HVAC, it was quiet and the rooms were very stuffy so even it was only 40 degrees on the 8th floor it was HOT, so we had the aircon on! But it worked well and wasn't that loud. But the bathroom...although a nice size for a NYC hotel, and very nicely appointed with L'Occitane products (rare again for most hotels in this category)...they MUST update their shower heads pronto...ours was old, too high, didn't let out much water and we had an issue trying to maneuver the hand held so the water didn't leak out. And for those of us who hate handhelds, it was annoying...and the tubs need to be resurfaced too, ours was really old and looked dirty even it was just age. And although the cleaning staff kept the rooms really clean, we used lots of extra towels and rather than learning from this they never left extra towels and I had to consistently ask - not sure why? If you see day after day we are using extra towels why not leave clean ones? The housekeeper we talked to was very nice and the room always felt very clean, but just leave more towels.

4. Staff: Very friendly all the time and very helpful. There is a young bellboy who works there, maybe Turkish? He gave us some great recommendations and was always very accommodating, as was the front desk staff. I never had an issue with any of the staff, they were all very good and I was impressed that it seemed to be the manager of the hotel who was at the wine and cheese hour pouring wine...

5. LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION - you know what they say, location is everything and if it wasn't for the things I have mentioned I would have given it an EXCELLENT rating as the location was absolutely PERFECT for Times Square, Broadway shows, getting to the subway...I could not have chosen a hotel in a better location i don't think...there was even a CVS on the corner where we got our water and other incidentals needed. 

Overall I would stay here again if I got a great rate.

title: Not such a great place
text:
We stayed at the Pearl on Saturday December 21 for a night as a family of five in a Superior Suite with two queen beds and one sofa bed.  We picked the Pearl for its location and in part based on its reviews here.  We weren’t impressed and would rather have spent more for two rooms in a nicer hotel. Here are the good and bad points. 

First the good:

- The bellman was very friendly and helpful

- It’s location is very good if you are staying to see a Broadway show. We were within a five minute walk. 

- The room had a refrigerator and microwave which some might like though we did not use them. 

- Street noise even in this area was minimal. We were on the 6th floor and the window soundproofing must be very good. 

Then the not so good:

- The room wasn’t ready until 4 pm. When we arrived they took our number and said they would call when it was ready.  The front desk never called. 

- The beds are small and the room is cramped.  The sofa bed is a love seat that folds out. 

- You could distinctly hear the voices of your neighbors in rooms next door. 

- The bathroom did not function well.  The shower floor in our room was at such an angle that the water didn’t drain properly. 

- In all it just was not a nice experience. The hotel didn’t at all live up to its ratings here and was not a good value for money. The hotel was not as bad as, say, the Marriott Marquis but not nearly as nice as many other options in the area. We would have much rather spent more and stayed in cleaner and more comfortable room than we had.

title: What an amazing stay at the Pearl Hotel
text: By all means one of the best places to stay in NYC.  We stayed in a King Bed room with an outdoor terrace.  It was fantastic.  The room was quiet and comfortable.  We loved sitting outside and enjoying the New York City lights.  We saw a show at the Gershwin Theatre that was 1 block away.  Fantastic food all within walking distance of the hotel.

title: Great location
text:
We spend three nights at the Pearl Hotel. First time staying at this hotel; pleasantly surprised with the little extras such as complimentary continental breakfast.  Snacks available during the day such as fruit, coffee and cookies. 
The location is great close enough to several theaters.  We like the energy and excitement of the district. 
The front desk was very helpful and offered impeccable service. They upgraded us to a bigger room.  The rooms are quite, clean and modern.  The bathroom was small but everything in NY is small.  Overall we had a great experience.

title: A real gem
text: After a terrible Airbnb experience, we had to quickly choose a suitable place to spend our honeymoon and I believe that we couldn't have chosen a better one. The location, the staff the room itself including its facilities and cleanliness, all were perfect. If we ever return to NYC we will surely book again a room at the Pearl.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: I spent quite a bit of time researching hotels online for our 4 day trip to NYC to see all the holiday decorations.  I focused on 4 star hotels with very good reviews.  After reading the reviews for The Pearl Hotel I felt very comfortable booking a reservation.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.  Every single person on the staff had a smile on their face. They were always friendly, courteous, and professional whether they happen to be in the elevator or we were just passing them in the hallway.  Our room was a good size for a NYC hotel.  The bed was king size and comfy.  The bathroom was modern with a big shower.  We enjoyed the complimentary snacks.  We had the light breakfast one morning and we came in from the cold during the afternoons to relax and have a cup of tea with a cookie. The location was perfect for us.  It is so close to Rockefeller center and to Times Square.  We walked  to Central Park and also to the Empire State Building and Macy's to see the windows decorated for the holidays.  Overall we had an excellent trip and we would definitely stay at The Pearl Hotel again.

title: Wonderful stay..
text:
This is my last night at the Pearl and my first ever trip advisor review as I don't usually do them... But I really feel this place has been so accommodating and made our stay so enjoyable.
I looked at so many hotels before I came and couldn't find much that didn't have negative reviews thrown in.. I booked the Pearl based on the great reviews and it didn't disappoint.
Hotel is tucked away just off times square and Broadway, so much on the doorstep.. can recommend da Marino for a perfect evening and Lillies 2 doors away is quite possibly the most beautiful, ambient restaurant and bar iv been in. 
Rooms are big, so clean, we were upgraded to a deluxe, given a bottle of prosecco on the house as we were celebrating and beds were huge and comfy, turn downed daily. They even give you an umbrella! Staff can't do enough to help, continental breakfast and complimentary happy hour are such a bonus, snacks on offer too, even late at night they leave out crisps and fruit to help yourself.
4 days in NYC and I would definitely come back here. We visited some "fancier" places to eat and drink and decided we loved our hotel even more for being small, quiet and tucked away.

title: Great location
text: I chose this 4-star hotel to accommodate 13 family members for proximity to 6th Ave Macy's parade, Broadway theatres, Rockefeller Center, MoMa, Central Park and metro stations.  Hotel rooms, especially bathrooms, are almost soundproof.  Loved the L'Occitane toiletries. Light continental breakfast and 24/7 snacks as well as 2nd floor gathering space was excellent fit for our blended family. We were so busy only enjoyed the 1 hr wine and cheese afternoon event once...was delicious! Staff was very friendly and helpful.  We will stay here our next NYC visit!!

title: Incredible service
text: Had to book an extra night in NYC because our flight was unexpectedly cancelled. Staff were very helpful and put us in a beautiful room with a king-sized bed. The hotel has a fitness centre, free coffee and a wine hour. Best hotel we stayed in in the USA.

title: Expected more original
text: I did expect to find a more original style inside and just something more special.  Looked just a little too much like any other hotel with, what I consider very high prices, unless you can organise your trip 6 months ahead or more. Some of the staff very relaxed, smiley and efficient, some not so pleasant..without being unpleasant however. I am surprised that for a 7 day stay they put us next to the elevator, which we heard start up every morning around 6am. I didn't even think about changing rooms till after about 2 nights...by then we were all settled in and I really didn't want to start complaining.  I didn't find really comphy the blanket style quilt  nor the  pillows on the bed. The kitchette with coffee maker and coffee was very helpful but poorly designed.  The frig didn't quite fit in the space.  Shame I had to go to the bar on the second floor to get non dairy milk. A grocery was just a few yards away...for my fresh milk. The restaurant was under renovation. There were lots little lights that were always on...like the microwave.  Everything was fine and clean. Our stay there just didn't leave us with any special feeling of anything.  We did however very much enjoy the smiles and friendliness of the door men.The neighborhood was great if you want to by Times Square, but for a nyc "neighborhood" you need to be a bit further one way or the other.

title: Perfect little hotel in NYC
text: I stayed on my own for 5 nights for a shopping trip in New York. The location is fantastic- a few blocks from The Rockefeller Centre, Times Square and Broadway. Two minutes from the Metro and easy to walk everywhere. Rooms are a really good size, especially for NYC. They are modern and clean. My room was really quiet despite the central location. The breakfast and all day snacks in the lounge is a really nice touch. Staff are friendly and helpful. I’d definitely stay here again a don wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this hotel.

title: Clean, comfortable, friendly service
text: Great location. Room was clean. Bed comfortable. Hot water plentiful, shower pressure fair. Microwave, refrigerator and Keurig. Friedmans restaurant attached to lobby. Staff is friendly and helpful. Bathrobes and umbrella in room. Complimentary wine and cheese at 4pm. Complimentary light continental breakfast. Water, fruit, and snacks available in lobby for no charge. Will stay here again

title: get away
text: I was overcharged by hotel according to my hotels.com agreement and they would not budge. The hotel fee of $25.00/day is a joke. The wine/cheese is awful and the breakfast (cheap danish) is bad as well. Don't charge the $25 and let me get a decent breakfast. The only upside to this hotel is the location to the theatre district when it's cold outside. I would not stay here again unless is was really cheap ~$100/night not $300/night.

title: Excellent  Thoroughly Recommend
text:
Once again, I am going to rave about The Pearl Hotel. It’s been four years since our last visit and this place is still special.
First of all was the front reception and the great service and treatment when we arrived. I’d booked the hotel on the Internet two days before our arrival. When I did the booking, I was unable to book the same room for our entire stay, just came up that there were no rooms available. Turns out that by fiddling around with the dates & rooms I was able to get accommodation for our 8 day stay. I’d booked the Deluxe Queen Suite for the first night and the Deluxe King Suite for the rest of the stay. When we arrived at the hotel, Reception were able to work their magic and give us the Deluxe King Suite for the entire stay, as opposed to having to switch rooms after one night. Fabulous service. Best of all – no extra charge.

Great location, close to Time Square, close to Subway stations, close to loads of restaurants. Our Deluxe King Suite was just the ticket; the extra room with the lounge area was much appreciated, especially when ours was an 8 day stay. Fabulously comfortable bed, great linen, very clean.               
All the staff are fabulous – they couldn’t be more helpful, nor do enough for us. Big shout out to Francesco (who definitely gets an Employee of the Month award from me) and Manuel and Juan. Always pleasant, always smiling.
Other friends of ours were staying at the Edison – which they didn’t like; and were envious that they weren’t staying at our hotel.
We’ll definitely be coming back to the Pearl next time we are in New York.

title: Quite the gem
text: Location was fantastic as well as service and cleanliness. Hotel stay was great they offered a wine and cheese hour, was great. Very accommodating hotel. Rooms were spacious, beds comfortable and well cleaned. Would highly recommend, we loved our stay.

title: Perfect Location. Great for families
text: Stayed here for 4 nights with my husband and 3 children. We had a Delux Suite with 2 Queen beds and a pullout sofabed in the sitting area, perfect for our family of 5. Room was a good size, plenty of space for us all. Hotel is only a couple of blocks away from Times Square, within walking distance to all the main attractions. Staff very friendly and our kids loved the snacks and fruit that were always available in reception along with the iced water. Complimentary wine in the evenings too whuch myself and my husband enjoyed. We would definitely stay here again if we were to return to New York.

title: Well Situated and Comfortable
text:
The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was very nice. There were slippers, bathrobes and a hairdryer. There is a fridge but no minibar. Close to Time Square.
The only poor experience was the restaurant attached to but not part of the hotel. The servers were very nice and so was the manager. There is a problem in the kitchen. The first breakfast they had trouble getting my wife's order correct (the manager comped her meal). The second breakfast we waited well over an hour to get our food (the manager comped the entire meal). On the bright side the food tasted good.

title: Great Customer Service - Good Location - No Surprises
text:
Let's look at the Pros first: 
Great Location - close to Times Square, 1 minute from Subway stop, 
Great Staff - pleasant, helpful, always available, asked for more towels, asked for help with TV, offered upgrade as room became available  
Snacks in the lobby available on check in/check out - chips, fruit, lemon water
Wine Reception at 5 - didn't partake, but second floor guest lounge has more snacks, fruit, tea & coffee and space to hang out and use WiFi / work 
Vending machine for snacks and water - so you don't have to pay $8 for the water in room
-you get 15% off at the restaurant next door (didn't go but it was busy during check in time)
Rooms- clean- hairdryer & iron/board available
L'Occitane shampoo & conditioner - but hopefully you don't use these small bottles  and bring your own
Good sized tv  (tv in washroom too - but didn't use it)
Black out curtains - but can't keep out all the noise 

a Few Cons
Room is small - as is the washroom- standard size regular tub
Not a fan of all those decor pillows on the bed  (for sanitary reasons)
- gym is very limited - didn't use it but there were only a small number of machines
-noise from street - typical NYC fire engines & stuff - so cannot confirm other reviews about rooms where you cannot hear the street noise 
-small bottles shampoo/conditioner -- switching to large bottles /pump stations would be preferred (although always a risk I guess)

title: Very Concerning Incident
text:
If not the incident I’m about to describe the hotel would probably get a score of 4 and above. 
So let’s begin with the positive. 
Location, location, location !
The hotel is 3 min walk from the Times Square, most of the subway lines are within a short walking distance. 
The rooms (we stayed in the Deluxe room) are good size with a relatively spacious bathroom. 
The bed was comfortable. 
The daily free happy hour at the 2nd floor lobby with wine and snacks is also fun before starting your evening activities. 
Now to the less positive part. 
My iPad disappeared from my room during the stay. Despite the cooperation of the management  and even involving the police it was not recovered. 
To be fair, The Pearl is a kind of a hotel where you would never expect something like this to happen yet it did. 
The duty managers where very polite and cooperative however did not offer any kind of compensation which might have reduced somehow the bitter taste.

title: What a find in NYC!
text: This place was a great find, and we will definitely return!  Around the corner from Broadway, and quiet as can be.  We could not hear a pin drop in our room, and that's unheard of in NYC, especially so close to Times Square and the hustle/bustle.  Our room was just right, and we chose valet parking, which was the best option.  Drop your car and go about your adventure on foot.  Everything is SO close!  The hotel offers a wine/cheese hour and coffee and breakfast snacks in the morning.  All you need.  Oh, and did I mention that the price is RIGHT!  Affordable!! You honestly can't beat staying at the Pearl.

title: Business Meeting
text: I came here for business meeting and needed some space and found their lobby area is massive and plenty of leg room with fast wi-fi. Big thanks to Gilbert who took care of us and we met Dee later for their wine and cheese which was nice touch to decompress after. Great service and decor!

title: Loved it!
text:
Excellent hotel that deserves its name, what a pearl! Great location, right in the middle of Times Square and the theaters. Very friendly and professional staff. The room was clean, quiet and comfortable. Also good sized with all the amenities you need, including an umbrella for rainy days and a large bathroom with L'Occitane products. 

Clean, modern and friendly environment. Coffee and snacks were available 24 hours per day, and we LOVED the free wine and cheese hour. 

Overall, we had a fantastic experience. Great service, great hotel! We will be back next time in NYC.

title: Bastante bien
text: estuvimos con mi familia varios dias. el hotel tiene unas hermosas habitaciones con un servicio regular de limpieza. tiene buena atención en recepción y buena predisposición del personal. ubicado a 500 m de Times Square y con todo Manhattan a unos pasos. No tiene servicio de desayuno ni restaurante. tiene habitaciones con un patio externo o terraza, que son muy agradables.

title: Wonderful Hotel with Excellent Customer Service!
text:
We had booked 2 rooms at another hotel, which ended up being a disaster. We frantically searched online for something close by, and found The Pearl; we called and spoke with Teresa who was absolutely amazing! She was able to accommodate us last minute with 2 rooms at a good rate, and once we arrived she greeted us and did everything she could to help us get settled. 
The rooms were actually spacious and very nice; clean, well lit and had a nice size bathroom with separate tub and shower. The beds were comfortable and there was a full length mirror, desk and even a mini fridge and coffee maker.
They also had a nice lounge area, with a happy hour Wine and Cheese tasting at 5PM. 
Every hotel employee we interacted with was friendly and helpful, and made our stay even better. The location is perfect too, just off Time Square with so many dining and shopping options all around. I cannot recommend highly enough!

title: Excellent Customer Service
text: Spent an overnight in the City at The Pearl Hotel.  Upon arrival, we were given an upgrade to a suite.  The room was beautiful and spacious as well as the bathroom.  Everything was spotless.  A big Thank You to Jaime Mendieta, who went above and beyond to assure us a most pleasant stay.

title: Great hotel
text:
Great hotel in a perfect location
Free wine and cheese in the afternoon
Friendly and helpfull staff
The included breakfast was ok. The coffe could have been better
Comfortable bed
Great room
Nice and clean
Big bathroom

title: Googloo
text: Way best and among one of the finest, luxurious, mind blowing places to discover. Once in life you may have to plan visiting this place and there would be no regrets. This place keeps lots of wonder in itself. Worthy to experince

title: Great hotel in theater district
text: This is my 2nd time at The Pearl.  It is walking distance to theaters, restaurants,  and Times Square.  Free snacks at entrance and 2nd floor after sightseeing.   Always friendly staff on duty. I felt safe and comfortable.

title: Perfect hotel for visiting New York City
text: We stayed at the Pearlmat the end of August for 4 nights and had a very enjoyable stay. We had quite a large room with two queen size beds which was ideal for us and our two teenage children. The bathroom was very well equipped uand quite modern and though we were on the roadside there was very little road noise. Azi and the team of reception staff  were extremely good and helpful with tips for restaurants and advice about getting about NY. The hotel is also very calm with a lounge area on the first floor which always has some fruit and tea and coffee. Between 5 and 6 every night there is also wine and snacks, though since a couple of months ago the hotel now charges an additional facility fee of 25 dollars a night. The location is perfect 1 minute walk from Times Square next to broadway and the Hell's Kitchen area of restaurants. Definitely to be recommended for a peaceful stay in a perfect location.

title: NYC Pearl
text: Hotel felt clean and newly renovated - refreshing for NYC!  Room furnished well and very comfortable.  Location is great for access to theater, Central Park and subways.  Morning coffee and evening wine and cheese are a plus - but there is no breakfast as was advertised on Tripadvisor; manager said it was an error since they do not have a restaurant open at this time.  Room was very quiet despite being in the heart of the city; staff was friendly and always helpful.

title: 굿!
text: 룸상태가 매우 좋았습니다. 생각보다 넓었기 때문에 답답함이 전혀 없고 불편함없이 머물 수 있었습니다. 먼지 알러지가 있어서 먼지가 있으면 기침이 많이 나는데 이곳에선 그렇지 않아서 다음에도 이곳에 머물 예정입니다. 청소상태가 아주 좋았습니다. 굿!

title: Anniversary trip
text: Hotel was convenient to restaurants and theaters. Never had an issue getting an uber or taxi. The thermostat was difficult to regulate.  Having a balcony was nice but you need to be on a higher floor to really appreciate this.  We were on the 10th floor.  The check in process was smooth and the room was ready on arrival.  All the staff was nice enough.  No one seemed annoyed with tourists and crowds. Bed was comfortable. Pillows were lumpy and need a good punching to get right. Shower had good pressure. Room was decent size. TV was small likely cause room was smaller. Overall good place to stay.

title: The only place to stay in New York
text:
2nd stay at this beautiful boutique hotel just off Times Square.

Great location- close to all the attractions. Very big rooms, friendly knowledgeable and helpful staff and nice touches, such as l’occtaine  products in the bathroom, a lounge with free soft drinks and snacks and free wine and cheese daily.

This hotel is a gem! Thanks for a fab stay.

title: Super hôtel et idéalement placé
text:
Hôtel très bien placé à 2 pas de Times Square et au calme de l'agitation new yorkaise
Le petit-déjeuner est inclus dans le prix de la chambre, ce qui est très rare à New York, en général c'est minimum 20/30$ par personne.
De plus, à l'accueil, sont proposés tous les jours des pommes, des petits paquets de chips et de l'eau.
Nous n'en avons profité qu'une fois car nous étions tous les jours dehors mais il y a également de 16h à 17h une collation (fruits, fromage, crackers, boissons)
Je recommande cet hôtel. Le seul point négatif serait peut-être la taille de la salle de petit-déjeuner. Nous n'avons pas eu de problème pour nous installer mais nous y sommes allés en hiver. Peut-être qu'en haute saison ça doit poser problème mais je ne peux pas en dire plus.

title: Ottima esperienza
text: Hotel sito sulla 49st in centro a Manhattan e a pochi passi da Time Square. Ho soggiornato con la mia famiglia in una camera con due letti King size. Ambiente elegante e ben curato, la camera molto spaziosa. Bagno grande con doccia e vasca. Pulizia impeccabile. Alle 17:00 servono un “aperitivo” nella sala al primo piano. Non c’è ristorante e colazione (lo sapevamo prima di prenotare) ma data la posizione a pochi passi ti puoi godere tutto ciò che New York può offrire in termini di ristorazione. Se dovessi tornare a NY sicuramente soggiornerò in questo hotel.

title: Great location
text: The Pearl was a great Hotel with helpful staff and a convenient location to the subway, restaurants and Time Square. The rooms were beautiful and spacious. My family of 5 had plenty of space in the queen suite.

title: Amazing find...
text:
Beautiful hotel!! We had booked another hotel stay but the hotel was awful and it was our 25th wedding anniversary so we had to find another one so booked the Pearl! Made our holiday and anniversary one to remember! 
Beautiful room and bathroom, so clean! Big bed, great pillows. Air con. Walk in closet for clothes, plenty of room to store suitcases, dressing gowns and slippers, also had a safe and an umbrella in case. 
We also had a little patio with table and chairs and a sun-bed. Coffee making facilities in room but as we were on floor two we had direct access to the coffee machines, crisps, fruit and cookies. Also on floor two was the cheese and wine evening each night at 5pm. The only downside would be being charged $25 for this at check in, it was great but would have been nice to be given a choice. The $25 also covered use of the gym and business room and free local calls from the telephone in the room. 
The hotel is situated on 49th street with easy access to the theatre district, Times Square and the subway.

title: Perfect for family vacation!
text: As we’re a family of 5, it’s not easy to find a good value hotel room in NYC in the summer. The Pearl isn’t exactly cheap but having stayed there now for 7 nights I’d say you get what you pay for, maybe even a little bit more in this case. Friendly staff - literally all of them were friendly and kind. Rooms are the best I’ve seen in NYC - large, up to date and - most importantly - clean!! The hotel also offers a complimentary snack and wine hour every day, so you can sit back and relax with a glass of wine and some cheese, chips, fresh veggies and dipping sauces after a long day in the city. The Wifi also worked great so the whole family can watch Netflix no problem. Oh one more thing - they have super high quality shampoo, conditioner etc so no need to bring your own high-end stuff :)

title: What a great find!
text: We were so excited that we discovered this little boutique hotel.  The staff was amazing, and the rooms were incredible!  Not just by NYC standards, but in general.  It was large, clean, newly renovated, and had a sitting area inside as well as an outside porch with chairs and loungers.  We were upgraded to this room from a standard room and were very pleased with the overall experience.  Bed was comfortable, too!

title: It would have been 5 Stars BUT...
text:
We loved the hotel, it’s location, the people who worked there, the size of the room, individual AC controls, cleanliness, the wine and cheese hour in the evening, and complimentary snacks and fresh fruit in the lobby was also nice.

It is in the thick of things just off Times Square, so location if you’re going to shows...it was awesome.  Very quiet surprisingly given its location!

But, the bed was WAY beyond its expiration date.  Super lumpy, VERY uncomfortable.  It might just have been our room, but, oh my goodness.

title: What a great find in NYC
text: I looked online and decided the boutique Pearl Hotel would suit my needs - close to the Port Authority Bus Terminal and the theater district.  I was correct.  The hotel front desk is very helpful  - my room wasn’t ready so they checked my overnight bag and they told me exactly how to get to the subway and which train to take to get to the 9/11 Memorial.  They offer a 5:00 Happy Hour every night, but I had dinner plans so I didn’t partake.  The rooms, especially for a boutique hotel, are large enough with a TV, queen bed and desk, and the furnishings are all new and modern.  Why are there never enough outlets that can be easily seen?  The bathroom has a TV, a black towel for makeup, L’Occitane toiletries and a hand bar in the shower.  There is a Keurig in the room and a lovely 2nd floor area with coffee, tea, cookies, apples and a TV.  Sadly, the gym wasn’t great, but it rarely is in hotels where I’ve stayed.  One of the 2 treadmills was “out of order” and there were no headsets.  Would I stay here again - absolutely.

title: Good choice for NYC hotel
text: Stayed here for a few days and so pleased to have made the right decision. Clean and spacious room. Good service. Great location with almost everything available around the corner - Broadway theatres, Times Square, Food Emporium, restaurants, Pick a Bagel, laundromat, Hop On/Hop Off buses. And their special extras: Wine & Cheese at 5pm, L’Occitane toiletries, help-yourself snacks and hot drinks counters. Makes your stay so much more comfortable. And the area is so busy you don’t have to feel too afraid of walking back in the evening after dinner.

title: Well located, has everything you need
text: Good location in theatre district, loved having iced water avail in the lobby as we returned from a hot day.  Room was spacious, well appointed, L'Occitaine bath products were great.  Would definately stay there again.

title: Excellent
text: We stayed for the 4th of July weekend, excellent location, clean, staff very nice,. Do not miss wine  and cheese for free at 5p.m, very good quality wines. Metro stations just a few steps away and all Broadway shows just by your side. I will definitely come back. And everything with a very reasonable price!!

title: Great Location and Excellent Service
text: We stated for 5 days at this wonderful boutique hotel conveniently situated in the Theater district. It was close to Time Square and the Museum of modern Art which we visited during our trip. The room was very stylish, comfortable and spacious with a variety of in-room amenities like sewing kits, ear plugs and shoe mitts. We enjoyed the impressive views of the Midtown Manhatan from the private balcony. The service was top-notch.

title: Uma peróla na Times Square
text: Excelente hotel! Quartos muito limpos, confortáveis. Atendimento impecável a VANIE do front desk é a gentileza pura. Possuem microondas, frigobar e máquina de café. Existem mais de um tipo de banheiro, nem todos têm box (único senão) Está a poucos passos da Broadway, mas sem o imcomodo de não conseguir sequer caminhar. Fica em frente à dois teatros. Tem um supermercado na esquina da 49 com 8a.. (supermercado mesmo, não é Deli - basta descer as escadas). Restaurantes bem próximos. Adoramos o hotel.

title: Just Meh
text:
Was very disappointed in this hotel. We stayed here because of the promise of breakfast offerings. When we arrived we learned that had been discontinued. Food at the deli next door was awful. Thank goodness for Postmates.

Location was decent, safe. It was several blocks from Times Square. Overall, just okay. We’re staying elsewhere on our return trip to NYC in a few weeks.

title: Perfect location
text: Mom and daughter  3 night trip. We had tickets to broadway shows all 3 nights  so stayed here so we could easily walk .  The  convenience was exactly what we wanted but the other perks were a plus. . Nice size rooms, clean and updated . Hourly wine and cheese hour was appreciated as were we’re dressing for the evening. The staff at desk and the door men were also kind and helpful. We will choose the Pearl Hotel on any future trips

title: Retirement treat
text: What a gem in the heart of Times Square and theatre land. Next to the Ambassador theatre and across from the Eugene O’Neil advertised as boutique hotel which we love made to feel very welcome from the gent opening the front door to the reception staff. Surprisingly quiet room overlooking west 49th modern room with Tv & tea coffee making facilities. Loverly breakfast continental with extras. Location is fantastic hope to stay again soon.

title: Tolles 4Sterne Hotel mit persönlicher Note
text:
Wir waren 6 Nächte hier und hatten ein extra geräumiges Zimmer gebucht. Dieses war komfortabel und obwohl zur Strasse gut schallisoliert. Äusserst zuvorkommendes und nettes Personal am Front Desk und am Eingang. Den ganzen Tag über kann man in der Lobby resp. im 2. Stock kostenlos Kaffee, Eiswasser, Chips, Früchte und Cookies beziehen. Im Zimmer hat es eine Kapsel-Kaffeemaschine, einen Kühlschrank und eine Mikrowelle.
Die Lage ist ausgezeichnet. Gleich um die Ecke liegt Times Square. Vieles ist zu Fuss erreichbar. Es sind nur wenige Schritte zu den vielen tollen Restaurants in Hell´s Kitchen oder 15 Minuten zum Columbus Circle und Central Park. Gleich gegenüber dem Hotel liegt das O‘Neill Musical Theater.
Wir werden dieses Hotel bestimmt wieder buchen.

Das einzige Störende für mich war, dass im Zimmer eine Flasche norwegisches Wasser zu $ 8 angeboten wurde. Warum nicht ein lokales Wasser zu einem vernünftigen Preis?

title: NOISY NIGHTS  !!
text:
It was difficult to have a great night's sleep because of the extremely noisy air conditioner. I mentioned that fact to the front desk and a repair man was sent up to the room. He said there was nothing that could be done to make it less noisy. When we were checking out, the front desk mentioned that they could have changed rooms for us....the trouble was, that option was never mentioned to us.
The staff was friendly and the hotel was somewhat centrally located. The pictures on their website was not an actual indication of what the hotel actually looks like.

title: Great Hotel in a Great Location
text: I stayed at the Pearl and had a great experience. The location was excellent, right in the heart of Manhattan but my room was quiet at night. The room was large and all the amenities in the room were nice, we had a microwave and wine fridge. The staff was superb, when I told them we were celebrating a birthday they arranged for a bottle of wine and a birthday card to be sent to our room. I plan to return to the Pearl next time I got back to NYC.

title: Great location and facilities
text:
We stayed in a twin queen room on the sixth floor with our two children (aged 11 and 12) and it was perfect. The location is fantastic being right around the corner from Times Square (but not so close as to be right in the middle) and only a short walk to everything else that’s in midtown. The room had more than enough space for us and was very clean and looked after. We stayed 4 nights and found it more than comfortable for us.

The hotel doesn’t have a bar or restaurant - there’s a linked ‘pastrami’ deli although we chose not to use it given so many other places to eat nearby. There is, however, a lounge just above reception with free coffee, water, cookies and fruit - and free wine and cheese between 5 and 6 every day.

The staff were very friendly and accommodating. So I’d have no hesitation recommending the Pearl Hotel.

title: Lovely Hotel...A GEM
text: We stayed at this hotel during our visit and I must say it's a Gem we wanted for nothing we got a lovely room great facilities staff so polite and friendly and a warm welcome when we arrived.  I would definitely recommend this hotel and its central to where you want to be.  Tea and coffee available at any time and a lovely treat in the evenings with wine and treats. We had a birthday in the family too and that's wasn't overlooked either they made it their business to wish a happy birthday and wine to the room... Thank you ❤️

title: Good location
text: The Pearl is in a brilliant location just off Times Square.  It’s surrounded by restaurants, theatres and well situated for the subways.  Our room was spacious with 2 queen size beds, fridge, microwave and coffee machine.  We bought breakfast as part of the deal.  This is taken at the deli directly next door.  It was good and worked for us but there are plenty of other options nearby.  The daily cheese and wine hour in the second floor lounge was an added bonus.  As indeed were the fresh fruit, biscuits and snacks available at all times.  The staff are welcoming and efficient, warm and friendly.  Highly recommended.

title: NYC trip in May
text: We really enjoyed staying at The Pearl Hotel. The location was perfect, central to almost everything (especially the Broadway shows) and we could easily walk everywhere. The hotel is small but the rooms are big, clean and updated. Staff were friendly and knowledgeable about restaurants, transportation, and entertainment. I'd definitely stay there again!

title: True to reviews on TP
text: Better than we expected. Goof location if you are focusing on the theater district. Large room with a big bathroom. The room are well maintained and decorated. The staff is friendly and efficient. Liked the free snacks, coffee and fruit on the second floor lounge.

title: Great location!
text:
The hotel is perfectly located near metro stations, a corner from Broadway St and 5-min from Times Square and at a walking distance from Central Park, grand central station, Rockefeller center, etc. 

Room was super clean and the bed comfortable. We did not have any view on the fourth flour. There is a valet parking at 55$/day for an oversized car (SUV and Caravan) so it is practical but there was also public parking in front and beside the hotel. 

There was snacks all day and wine vegetables, fruits and cheese at the end of the day (they forgot to tell us though).

title: Another great stay
text: Another great stay. Visited nyc with family to see a Broadway play and enjoy family time at the start of school vacation.  The Pearl was just perfect as usual. Last time in the city we went to see Billy Joel and stayed closer to the garden. Our same group agreed we will not make that mistake again.   The pearl is the only place for us.

title: Séjour d'une semaine The Pearl Hotel
text:
Petit hôtel très bien situé, proche des commerces, Times Square, transports publics.

Très belle chambre avec suffisamment de place pour 2 adultes, bien équipée.

Eau, fruits et chips à disposition à la réception et au Lobby.

Portier super sympa, toujours un mot gentil, serviable et donne beaucoup d'infos utiles pour le séjour merci William.

En bref, très bon établissement pour un séjour à New-York.

title: Lovely hotel
text: This hotel isn't very big and it feels like the staff can't do enough to help you.  It feels like a family run boutique hotel. So close to everything but not noisy.  The décor is beautiful.  We had a family room which slept 5 (we can never find a hotel that sleeps 5)  Loads of room in it.

title: To celebrate our 50th birthdays !
text: The perfect hotel to discover NYC ! The staff were so helpful and so nice, the rooms gorgeous and spotless ! It’s situated perfectly to reach Time Sq and 5th Ave and when I come back I will definitely stay here again !! Thankyou to all the team at The Pearl for making my first time in New York so much fun !

title: SITUATION AU TOP
text: Sur la 49ème avenue, à deux pas de Time Square. Idéalement situé, au pied du métro et central pour toutes visites. Prestations conformes, hôtel très propre et chambre spacieuse. Personnel accueillant et très agréable. A recommander sans problème.

title: Hard Uncomfortable Bed
text:
I stayed in the hotel last week for an average of $400 per night for four nights for a king size room.  The mattress was hard and uncomfortable.  I had four nights of restless sleep.  Upon leaving, I was hit with a resort fee of $114 plus $8 for a bottle of water, as explained by Theresa, for the cocktail hour which I attended once.  Also faxing, never faxed.  
I stayed in the Hilton Garden in West Palm Beach last night in a $140 room which had a comfy bed.  
Tell me what was the better bargain!

title: The Pearl, comme une perle !
text:
L hotel est très chaleureux, la chambre double deluxe est spacieuse , la salle de bains également avec des produits de douche Occitane. Le tout très propre. Les lits doubles sont par contre étroits.
A notre arrivée à la chambre, nous attendaient un petit mot et une bouteille de prosecco car lors de la réservation, j avais précisé que c était un voyage pour fêter notre anniversaire de mariage.
C est vraiment une délicate attention , merci !
Au 2e étage de l hotel, entre 17 et 19 h, il y a un en cas wine and cheese avec du jus d orange, crudités , crackers et vin rouge/ vin blanc.
Au même étage il y a du café chocolat et cookies disponibles 24/7. C est très appréciable. On peut aller acheter des gâteaux ou autres dans des magasins à côté et revenir faire le petit-déjeuner au 2e étage.
Le petit déjeuner au Pastrami Queen (le dîner juste à côté de l hotel) est hors de prix, même avec les 10% de réduction étant clients de l hotel.

L hotel est près de tout, 10 mn à pied de Bryant square, Times square, Empire, Top of the rocks, a 15 mn de Central Park.
Bref super hotel, très central et compte tenu de son confort, propreté et emplacement, est un vrai petit bijou, comme une perle ! 😀😉

title: Fantastico
text: Hotel in ottima posizione, ad un passo da tutto:  Broadway, Time Square, Rockfeller Center, Central Park. Oltre  questo offre un ottimo servizio, con personale gentile e premuroso, la colazione è servita nel locale "Pastrami" ed era scarsa ma metto lo stesso voto massimo perchè al 2° piano c'era sempre disponibile caffè, biscotti e frutta nonché piccolo aperitivo pomeridiano con vino, formaggio, frutta ecc. La nostra camera era bella e pulita dotata di tutti i comfort con angolo cottura. Se tornerò a New York cercherò di tornare qui.

title: Hotel centralissimo
text:
Dopo attente comparazioni tra hotel in centro abbiamo optato per questa struttura: non siamo rimasti delusi. La posizione è otttima, a due passi da Times Square  in piena Broadway.
Teatri davanti alla finestra.
Camere molto ampie e pulite, ben organizzate e confortevoli.
Arredo nuovo, servizi molto confortevoli.

Colazione non internazionale, un pò limitata e in un atrio di passaggio,  senza una vera e propria sala colazioni. Servizi tutti in plastica, usa e getta, ma credo tipico di alberghi in New York.
Prezzi leggermente .superiori ad altre strutture simili, ma l'hotel vale ie le 4 stelle.

title: Lovely hotel and staff
text: Recently returned after a 4 night stay with 2 lady friends. We were celebrating our 60th birthday and as previous review, the hotel gave us a bottle of prosecco to enjoy. Hotel is in a fantastic location, staff are all excellent, very friendly and professional, particular mention goes to Jullisa on Reception who was lovely, chatty and very approachable. Room facilities were very good and comfortable.  The facilities available on the 2nd floor lounge are excellent. Tea, coffee and snacks available 24/7. Complimentary cheese and wine hour from 5pm was very welcoming. No restaurant in the hotel, although buffet breakfast was available next door. Would definitely stay here again if I was visiting New York.

title: Great hotel
text: This was a great hotel minutes away from Times Square and located about five minutes from three subway stations.  It was my 50th birthday and the hotel provided a bigger room and a bottle of Prosecco on arrival which was really kind. I found the front desk staff very polite at all times. The room was kept clean on a daily basis.  When we booked breakfast was included but not now, however the hotel honoured this and gave us a voucher each day for the concession attached to their hotel.  On the second floor there is a lounge area where there is always free hot drinks, crisps and biscuits and there seemed to be daily cheese and wine at 5pm.  Would definitely look at staying at this hotel again if visiting NYC.

title: Wonderful Hotel and Location
text: This hotel is exceptional especially if you are in New York to go to broadway shows. Location cant be beat. Walk easily to most all theaters also Time Square, Rockfeller Center, Radio City Music Hall. Lillies Victorian Establishment just steps away. Great restaurant, bar and Afternoon tea. We ate there several times. Also Thalia right around the corner excellent restaurant. Our room was big, beautiful and very clean. Great view looking over to a theater. Staff wonderful. I will stay here next time I go to NYC.

title: Best Kept Hotel Secret in NYC
text: I have been putting off writing this review mainly because I would like to keep this hotel a secret.  Alas, I feel the need to finally review simply because The Pearl deserves it. Truly an outstanding boutique hotel. I have stayed here for work and with the family many, many times over the last five years. I really don’t even look anywhere else in NYC. For me, this hotel has it all.  Reasonably priced, great rooms and over the top service. Check-ins are a breeze and check-outs are the same. They are very accommodating on whatever your needs may be.

title: We’ll be back
text: Perfect for our needs. Helpful staff, clean and comfortable rooms, soaking tub and shower in our room with 2 queen beds, perfect for 3 ladies with plenty of room. Coffee and small refrigerator for leftover takeout. Appreciative staff delivered bottle of Preseco for my birthday and location was perfect for us—heart of theatre district and steps from Broadway. We normally stay at The Jewel, but this will be a real contender for a return visit. Good Italian restaurant across the street, but avoid their restaurant Pastrami Queen attached downstairs(worst meal while in NYC). Not faulting hotel for restaurant as it’s brand new and a separate matter. Stay here; eat elsewhere. Thankful we used The Pearl as our home away from home.

title: Good Hotel
text: Average hotel rooom. Queen size bed, shower with bathtub, desk. We were two people and it was spacious enough. Daily snacks (chips, granola bars, apples) and afternoon wine & cheese were included. Great location. Friendly staff. Good location to Sony Theatre (concert/purpose of trip).

title: Pleasant Stay at The Pearl
text:
Reviews of this hotel are spot on. We especially appreciated the welcoming and accommodating doormen. They were helpful in every way. Housekeeping is top notch. When we asked they promptly responded. Our room was on the third floor overlooking 49th street. Not once did we experience noise issues. The room was well equipped with a mini fridge, coffeemaker, and microwave as well as many other convenient extras. The bath products are very good quality and replenished daily. Continental breakfast was not offered during our stay but there is a deli which has great food. Let them know you are a guest and they will discount your meal. A big plus was the arrangement for transportation to the airport. The price is very reasonable and a better option than cab service. My only suggestion for improvement would be to upgrade the bedding. 

Thanks to all staff members for a very enjoyable stay! Your service was stellar!

title: Best in Class
text: For its class and location, a real winner.  Not many frills here, as the lobby is minimalist and the hallways are tight, but the rooms are nice.  Would strongly suggest the nicer rooms on the higher floors as the lower floors get the Broadway show noise as well as street noise.  But overall for the price and location (right off Times Square), can’t beat it.

title: Fun weekend
text: Everything was perfect for our Friday night stay.  We checked in to find we were given an upgraded room with a balcony.  You’d think that everything was being used for the first time.  Immaculately clean in every aspect.  The bonus for us is that it’s across the street from Da Marino, our favorite restaurant.  They even had a wine and cheese hour.  Give it a try.  You won’t be disappointed

title: Everything we needed!
text:
My wife and I stayed at The Pearl during a recent business/pleasure trip to NYC. It worked out excellently for what we needed!
For my wife, who had multiple business meetings across Manhattan, it was centrally located so that she could either walk or subway to where she needed to go with a minimum of fuss. For me, who just wanted to wander around and have fun, there was tons of stuff to check out within a few blocks, such as Times Square, Central Park, and Fifth Avenue. 
The staff were polite and friendly, although we didn't have cause to interact with them much beyond check-in and check-out. They were always saying hello or wishing us well as we came through the lobby to go to the elevators.
The rooms themselves were tidy and well kept. They aren't huge but considering the price point, I found them to be totally reasonable. We didn't spend much time in the room outside of sleeping, though, so it handled all of our needs quite easily.
We never had cause to visit the second floor lounge area, so can't really speak to that and whether it is worth it or not, but I think they serve continental breakfast there in the morning.
Whether you are visiting for business or pleasure, The Pearl has the location and amenities to cover it! We would definitely stay again.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: Great hotel. Always very good service, amenities such as: L'occitane products in the bathroom, espresso coffee maker in the room, coffee, fruit and snacks always available, daily happy hour with wines and cheeses. 100% cleanliness and exceptional location. I will definitely stay at this same hotel again.

title: New York short stay
text: Stayed here with my daughter for four nights recently. Fabulous place, great staff and excellent facilities. Great Complimentary Wine and cheese reception daily, 24 hour drinks and snacks and  superb continental breakfast. A super little gem in central Manhattan - will certainly be back.

title: Great stay at the Pearl
text: My girlfriend and I had a wonderful stay at The Pearl.  I was a bit disappointed that they stopped serving breakfast starting about a year ago.  Still, the amenities are wonderful.  Snacks, coffee, tea and fruit on level 2.   Complimentary bottle of wine for my friend’s birthday!  Small and good deli accessible from the hotel.   Rooms are lovely and bathrooms are large.  Very convenient location to Times Square, theater district, etc.  Mattresses are a bit lumpy and could some upgrading.   That’s why I’m giving it a four and not a five star.

title: Great hotel for Family Spring Break trip
text: We just spent 5 days in New York with our family of 6 and loved staying at the Pearl!  Great theater district location allows you to walk to all the broadway shows (there is one literally across the street and another next door), Time Square, Central Park, Rockefeller Plaza, and pick up busses to tour the city.  We even walked to the Circle Line Ferry Cruises.  They are a small "boutique" hotel that really makes you feel special.  I felt like the doorman recognized us from up the street and the door was opened as we got the hotel every time and would hail cabs for us as needed.  The front desk staff met all our needs and were very personable! The rooms were comfortable and accommodated us when my mom decided to join us a few weeks before the trip by moving us into a larger room.  If you want the big city experience with small town hospitality, I highly recommend the Pearl!!

title: Lovely stay
text: On moving hotels from one that was not up to scratch, I picked the Pearl, I had not stayed there before but was very pleased, was given a larger room as what was booked was not ready, lovely staff and room. Nice touch with a free wine and cheese at 4pm. Right beside theaters. Loved it.

title: Boutique Hotel..... what a gem
text:
2 minute walk from everywhere:
Time Square-Restaurants-Subway.
I was nervous booking because I thought it was miles away from Time Square and far away from 5th Avenue and the buzz. 
I was so wrong. 
It’s a gem of a boutique hotel right in the midst of a bustling world. 
Clean rooms, Friendly staff and guests, Quiet and unhurried atmosphere.
Excellent healthy breakfast. 
Wine served in the afternoon. 
This is the first hotel in NYC that I have found to be staffed by genuinely friendly people. 
I will certainly book this hotel again.

title: Perfect for business trips
text: Entrance is a bit underwhelming. However, the rooms have all the comforts of a 4.5 star hotel. Staff is friendly, and the rooms are beautiful. For the rate we picked this hotel at, it is truly a bargain. Perfect for business trips.

title: Consigliatissino
text: Posizione ottima, servizio e pulizia eccellenti, in dotazione buonissimi prodotti , compreso crema corpo, ciabatte e accappatoio. Noi avevamo una stanza al 5 piano, spaziosissima. Colazione povera di salato , ma nel dolce buona e soddisfacente. Tornerei sicuramente qui senza dubbi.

title: O melhor custo beneficio em Nova York
text:
Hotel pequeno, simpático , onde você não é mais um.
Pessoal simpático. Acomodações boas. Localização ótima
Ficarei de novo quando voltar
O café da manhã quebra o galho.
Um simpático queijos e vinhos diariamente às 16,00

title: Valentine's day
text: My fiancee surprised me & we stayed at The Pearl Hotel. The room was beautiful!! Very modern, its located in the heart of NYC. The staff was incredible. I totally recommend this hotel. Planning to go back in the spring.

title: Shingram
text: My friend & I travel to NY every February. This is the 1st time we have ever stayed at the Pearl Hotel. The staff was fantastic. Helpful, polite, caring, & top notch professional. I’d like to give a special shout out to Joey who told us the best plays to see, where to eat, & would even write down directions &/or circle places on an area map. William & Manuel who took care of our luggage, Uber, & a ride in style to the Newark airport the day we left. Free continental breakfast every morning, wine & cheese from 4-5 daily, & even a bottle of wine delivered to our room because it was my birthday. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to be with in walking distance to all the on and off broadway plays & when you leave NY to return home, you’ll feel like you you’re leaving behind some special friends that you look forward to seeing again next year. 😉

title: Pearl
text: I wasn’t sure what to expect from this hotel as this was our first visit to New York, but we could not have been happier with the hospitality and service provided by the staff at The Pearl. The location is fantastic, it’s right by Times Square and most of the Broadway shows that everyone is looking to see, bus tours, a ten minute walk away from Central Park, Rockefeller Square and just made the trip so much easier and more special for my daughter and I. Everyone who works here has been kind and accommodating, the complimentary breakfast, coffee and snacks were fantastic to have. The room is beautiful and clean. Made our stay here so much better, if we ever make it back to New York we know where we’ll be staying.

title: Still outstanding
text: This was our second stay to the hotel. Despite the fact that our venue was further away from the hotel, we opted of staying here again. We were so happy from our previous experience in this hotel. We weren't disappointed this time either. The staff is truly amazing, the location unbeatable. Definitely our "go to" hotel when in NYC.

title: Merry christmas to me.
text:
.I visited new york from 17th of Dec thru till the 22nd and i had the most amazing time.
Bit of a tricky one getting a taxi from jfk intl terminal to midtown...traffic was crazy!! However, get one we did !!
The reception staff were friendly informative and so kind.
Our room was fabulous, we picked a double queen room...for nyc it was huge.
The staff left me a card and a lovely bottle of merlot for my 60th b'day...a nice touch.
The doorman were exceptional,  always ready with directions, the lend of an umbrella if needed and sorting out a reason cab fare for our ride back to jfk.
The breakfast was fine, boiled eggs , toast, fruit , cereal etc...we always had enough to do us , in the breakfast room between        4 +6pm there was wine, cheese, fruit and nuts etc, nice to put your feet up after a lot of walking !!
Just on 49th and 7th , by the theatre district, the pearl was ,quiet at night , cleaned ferociously daily and was everything we would have wished for ourselves.
If you are lucky enough to stay at the pearl ..I can guarantee a warm fuzzy feeling when you have to leave.🙁
Amazing hotel and i would never pass it over....not even for " the plaza " !!
Thanks guys and girls who work.there, you made our stay majical.
Thanks so much , Jayne rooney.

title: Perfect location and service
text:
I cannot imagine a more perfect location if you are in NY for sightseeing. We quickly walked to Times Square, Central Park, the Intrepid (which I highly recommend!) and more. Close to a subway stop
If you are going to Battery Park area. 

The free breakfast was fine - bagels, pastries, and fruit. Good coffee and juice. But I admit I loved the free snacks from 4-5pm each day - cheese and crackers, fruits and veggies, decent wine...and very polite staff. 

The health club was tiny but I only saw two other people use it, so the size didn’t matter. 

I highly recommend this hotel! Wish I had pictures. Oh and the room was beautiful - great bedding, tv even in the bathroom, nice big shower. Not a huge room but plenty spacious for two people.

title: Great hotel, close to everything
text: All the staff is friendly and helpful! They offered umbrellas, when available, to guests when the rains came, snacks available 24 hrs. Wine testing from 4 to 5. Nice way to break up the day and chat with other visitors. Not a huge hotel but rooms are very nice and location is perfect for Broadway. Overall the helpfulness and friendliness of staff was more than expected. Thanks Pearl, for a nice weekend!

title: Great location by Times Square
text:
Perfectly located for Times Square, the hotel provided something of a sanctuary from the busyness outside. 

Reception staff were all attentive and friendly. The 24-hr access to tea, coffee and snacks on the second floor was welcome. Plus wine-tasting with cheese every afternoon. 

The bedroom was clean, modern, secure, and comfortable. 

A continental breakfast is provided. It’s so-so. A bit nothing-much. Breads, cereals, fruit, but rather basic. And I’ve no idea why it is served on plastic plates with plastic cutlery. Didn’t appear environmentally friendly as everything was chucked in the same bin. I was assured by a staff member that it is recycled. Still, isn’t there a better sustainable solution? 

Despite this, I would stay there again.

title: A real pearl in big Apple
text: Pretty happy for my short stay in this real beautiful pearl of big Apple, from the hotel design to accommodation just prefect, the cold water, snack & Apples in hotel lobby just heartwarming , from variety complimentary breakfast, to the microwave to coffee machine in room , truly hospitality, I misses the 4 pm free afternoon tea time in the second floor too, despite my room next to the elevator, I still could slept like a baby , truly appreciated! The only little problem was the shower head too small , no water power so they just dripping out separate in two side , kind of bother a good shower, other than that I will be more than happy to come back ! This hotel at one of best location in Broadway show area, two famous show just next door , awesome!

title: Excellent Hotel
text:
We stayed there for three nights in January 2019.  This hotel is a well managed operation.

Pros:

Reasonable prices
great location in the theater district
free continental type breakfast
free wine/cheese hour at 4 pm
Clean throughout
Free wifi
Workout room
Pleasant staff
Free in room safe
Free Keurig coffee in the room
Free bathrobes in rooms
Fast elevators
Free snacks/coffee throughout day
Free newspapers

Cons:
Bathrobes are too small.

title: Great location!
text: This location is great as it's centrally located right in mid-town in the theatre district.  The hotel is clean, with decent sized rooms and nice amenities.  The bathrooms are nicely done and have all of the normal supplies.  The breakfast is fine and the coffee is really good!  They also have water and snacks in the lobby.  We are a family of five and it was completely sufficient for us. We had two rooms which worked out well.

title: Super stay
text: Stayed at The Pearl as a family of five. The room was really good and comfortably had enough space for us all - the coffee maker was a bonus. The breakfast was just right to set you up for the day. It was the staff that set it apart, they couldn’t have been more helpful and pleasant - and this was everyone we interacted with - housekeeping, reception, at breakfast, the doormen - would definitely recommend

title: Perfect for larger families!
text: Great time at this hotel. We had the one bedroom suite. Fit our large family comfortably. Friendly staff. Easy check in. 2nd floor offers snacks 24hr/7. And complimentary breakfast 😋 and they had almond milk!!!!

title: Perfect Location!
text:
We booked here simply because they had two queen beds and a pullout  (most other double beds are fulls in the area), but there are many more reasons to stay at The Pearl. The location is perfect for a Christmas NYC trip - same street as Rockefeller Center (49th) juts a few blocks walk East and within walking to any Broadway show.
The 50th street subway station is right around the block and can take you to the museusm, etc. Not to be understated is the Food Emporium grocery store a couple doors down where you can get anything and everything you need if you want to avoid eating out for every meal and saving money. They don't have their own restaurant but apparently will have soon, but Lillie's Victorian next door is a very beautifully-decorated English restaurant and the grocery store is a quick enough trip you don't miss not having room service.

title: Beyond my expectations
text: We spent one night at the hotel. My son made the reservation so his family and my husband and I could enjoy a fun two days in NYC just before the Christmas holiday. I was skeptical about the hotel as I had never heard about it.
