However, although small, it provided a large welcome with courteous and intimate service by going above and beyond any level of service we have ever encountered. The rooms were immaculate, large, modern and very comfortable. There was even a TV in the bathroom!  Robes and slippers were provided as well as high quality toiletries. The breakfast was continental but very well presented and the items were delicious. We attended the wine and cheese buffet and it was lovely! We checked in Friday afternoon and checked out on Saturday morning but planned a day exploring the city's sights on Saturday. My husband and I were exhausted from all the walking so we returned to the hotel and they graciously allowed us to wait for our family in the buffet area. Remember we had already checked out! Parking by valet was easy and reasonably priced. I will definitely return to this hotel and urge any skeptics to disregard their skepticism and book at the Pearl Hotel! You will not regret it.

title: An amazing hotel !
text: My wife and I and our 2 sons (11 & 18) stayed 3 nights at The Pearl Hotel this week and had a fantastic time. This is a great small boutique type hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. It has spacious bedrooms, very comfortable beds and an excellent contintental breakfast with plenty of choices. Highly recommended. Great location, very close to Times Square but not noisy. Lots of attractions are in easy walking distance. We will most definitely return soon. Thank you Pearl Hotel for making our 1st visit to NYC so enjoyable.

title: Nice hotel - good location
text:
Good hotel with some nice touches. Dressing gowns, slippers, l'Occitane toiletries, tv in the bathroom.
Inconsistencies with rooms. We booked three of the exact same room types but they ranged from small, reasonable and generous in size! Some had fridge, microwave, usb ports - some were missing one item. 
Shame they didn't have a restaurant or even a decent sized area to take breakfast. Only 6 square tables in one area each with four chairs, and a lounging areà to seat a few more. Believe there is a restaurant on the way.
Breakfast was self serve buffet with good choice of cereals, bread, bagels, pastries, fruit, yoghurts etc and juices and a hot drinks. Some snacks and drinks available during the day also.
Overall nice clean hotel, friendly and obliging staff in a good location just off Times Square.

title: Good location, adequate hotel
text: Nice check in, altogether ok, nice and clean enough hotel. Terrible pillows (half size and hard). Nice bathroom. Good if you need two queen beds. But no real style. Bit dated. Will get the job done just like a mid level cruise ship.

title: Awesome Service
text: We stayed for two nights.  Thanks to Darren for making sure our room was perfect. The lobby was simple but the boutique hotel tries hard to compete. Great location. The bed was very comfortable. Room was clean.

title: An absolute Pearl
text: This hotel is as  it says a pearl of a hotel.Times square and the subway are less than 5 minutes away. All the theatres are within walking distance and there are plenty of decent eating places nearby The staff were all extremely friendly and very helpful.We especially loved the afternoon cheese and wine which was very welcome after a busy day sightseeing.Breakfast was also very good,no hot food but what was offered was fresh and tasty.The hotel also had snacks and drinks available all day,so we were never hungry.Our room was very comfortable and the occitaine toiletries were a very nice touch.If we visit New York again we shall definitely stay at The Pearl.

title: Pleasant Stay
text: My husband and I stayed here for four nights.  The location was perfect.   The room looked like the photos online, nice modern room with everything you need and plenty of space for two people.  We had a couple of minor issues with our room which were addressed by hotel staff immediately.  Our only complaints were that the mattress was not as firm/supportive as we would have liked and the wifi signal was poor on our floor.   The staff at this hotel work very hard to make sure that their guests leave happy.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: Disappointed at The Pearl
text:
Second time we’ve stayed there, this time not as good as the first one, some 3 yrs ago.
We had our room not serviced for one day and when I complained, the front desk said that was because I left the No Disturb sign on the door, which in fact was the opposite. Moreover, I reported about a serious shower drain clogging in our room (501) and nothing was taken care of, nor we have been informed by neither the front desk nor by the management on any feedback at all. And the clogging persisted. Not a good experience at The Pearl this time and I’d think twice about returning, if ever.

title: Great location, big rooms
text:
The location of the Hotel is amazing. It is so near to Times Square, yet not smack in the middle of it so that you are spared the crowds and noise and just everything. It was just about 2 blocks off Times Square, which is well within walking distance, and yet it was so much quieter that you wouldn't feel oppressed. If you're a theater fan, then it is also right smack in between Chicago and Book of Mormon's theaters. Two subway stations, 50 St and 49 St surround the Hotel. The best thing is these two stations are on different lines, so we would just choose the station we have to use for the day based on where we were going. Convenience also surround the Hotel, with plenty of restaurants, diners, drug stores and fast food. 

The rooms were of a very good size, and I dare say, much bigger than what I'd expected from a NYC hotel. We actually had more than enough space to put our luggage and walk around. Especially loved the separate sink/coffee making machine area, which made things very convenient as we didn't have to go to the bathroom every time we needed to make a drink. We got upgraded during our stay which we were grateful for. The small number of rooms (about 8) per floor also ensured maximum privacy. Also enjoyed the free flow snacks and water provided by the Hotel at the lobby. It is a very small gesture but very much appreciated.

There was free breakfast on the Hotel's 2nd floor as well, but I thought the variety of food left much to be desired. There was no hot food at all, and it was just pastries and cereal with drinks. While I understand the food was likely just purchased daily instead of having a chef prepare them, I would have appreciated at least some variety re the food options. Instead, the types of pastries and cereal remained the same everyday, and I was there for quite a number of days. 

Staff were very friendly, but there was one or two at the reception who were less helpful than the rest. This was a little minus for me.

title: Well located boutique hotel
text:
Hotel location was great.. very convenient.  Next door to Chicago, opposite Book of Mormon. A short walk to Times Square and a grocery store.

Staff were friendly 

Rooms were a good size, with fridge, microwave and coffee machine. 

The L’Occitane bathroom products were lovely

The complimentary cheese and wine hour in the afternoon, and the crisps & snacks all freely available, were a really nice touch.

Breakfast was a casual offering of delicious bagels, some pastries, fruit and yoghurts, which was perfectly adequate... but be warned if you are expecting a cooked breakfast or more elaborate offering.

The beds were comfy but I would definitely suggest avoiding Room 201 if offered. It was on its own, between the restroom, the gym and the breakfast area.  Although the gym was supposed to open at 6am, people were in there before then, and as soon as the treadmill started, any chance of sleep was over for me.  It was a pretty noisy Room location. I would recommend as high a floor as possible for peace & quiet.

Pretty expensive hotel, but if you can get a decent rate, I would recommend a high floor room there and you will have a pleasant place to stay.

title: Nice stay, good location, not cheap and nothing "wow
text: We stayed at this hotel for its central location and also because of valet parking.  BEWARE - its $45 24 hours which is not horrible for NYC.. BUT... they take your car 10 blocks away and it takes about 45 - 60 minutes to get it back.  If we knew this before booking, I would not book.  The hotel itself is okay..  2nd floor has some snacks which was nice.. room  was okay but very dark for some reason.  All lights were dim and it was hard getting ready for our event. This hotel is okay.. nothing special..  Since it was more expensive than others I was expecting a little more "wow"..  I'm not sure I would pay more to stay here next time because the parking situation was not ideal.  Everything else was just "okay".

title: Great midtown hotel
text:
What a great hotel! The location is very convenient as being midtown it is never more than a 10$ uber trip to the main landmarks we wanted to see. The room are of good size and very quiet. They also have a free breakfast in the morning with everything you need ( Bagels, muffins, yogurts, fuits, cereals etc) as well as a free wine and cheese hour in the afternoon, ideal after a long day of exploring the city
Last but not least, all the staff was extremely friendly and accommodating.

title: Wife's 50th Birthday trip away.
text:
Thought l would use this Hotel due to all the good reviews and glad we did.
Staff are so friendly and helpful and because they new this was a special holiday for us they gave us a free upgrade room to King size bed.
Once we had made ourselves comfortable in the room they brought us up 2 glasses and a bottle of wine to celebrate on the house.
Room was great with free Wi-fi and the breakfast in the morning was a good touch, so was the wine tasting in the afternoon again free.
So to close would highly recommended this hotel.

title: Perfect little gem
text:
Stayed at the pearl hotel for 4 nights. From entering the front doors to leaving the stay was faultless. The doorman/valet were always friendly and ready to assist you. The reception staff were polite, friendly and always attentive. The continental buffet breakfast was just perfect to set you up for the day, and the cheese and wine afternoon was a lovely touch. Rooms were spotless and quiet. Would definitely stay here again if back in New York as why try to fix what isn’t broken. 
Keep up the excellent job you are doing 
My hubby and I had the best stay 
Thank you pearl hotel and all its amazing staff

title: Bien
text:
Estuvimos una semana en octubre, la verdad que el hotel está bien , la limpieza es correcta , el tamaño de la habitación perfecto , los pequeños detalles se agradecen, como café y snack durante todo el día . 
Pero el desayuno es muy básico , y por más de 300$ la noche debería de ser mejor o no ponerlo , puesto que da lugar a confusión  , y bueno , el precio también es bastante alto. Me lo pensaría si volver.

title: Amazing hotel!!!
text: Fantástico hotel, he ido varias veces a NY pero sin duda alguna el mejor con diferencia. Llevábamos desayuno incluido y se agradecen los snacks y fruta k ponen a todas horas del día. El staff encantador y muchos hablan español para aquellos que no se maneje con el inglés. Localización perfecta ya que está en el mismo Times Square. Nuestro hotel a partir de ahora en NY!!! Gracias

title: Nice staff but room too small.....
text: Hotel staff were very nice! Location was great! Hotel room and bathroom very small....actually too small. Would not go back there due to size of room and bathroom! We had a king with balcony. The 3 stars were for the staff and location!!!

title: Fabulous!
text:
Very clean.
Friendly and unobtrusive staff.
Large comfortable room.
Bath robes and slippers.
Large shower.
L’occitaine toiletries.
Fresh towels everyday.
Microwave, fridge and coffee maker.
Good selection of breakfast items.
Complimentary drinks and snacks throughout the day.
Complimentary wine and cheese afternoon.
Close to Time Square but away from the madness.

Book this hotel, you won’t regret it. I will definitely be going back.

title: Great location, breakfast and rooms!
text:
This small hotel in a Big city was perfect for our family. We traveled with an 11 and 13 year old, my husband and myself. My MIL had another rooms, so we got to see 2 rooms. The location is FANTASTIC. In the middle of a somewhat quieter block of the theater district, but an EASY walk to Time Square, Rockefeller Center, and many Major show theaters (Wicked, Lion King, Hamilton, Radio City...) and so much more! We easily walked most places and even to the Empire State Bldg and most of Central Park/Natural History... although we did get a car back from those two locations. 
The staff at the hotel was very helpful. There was a small fitness room, and a business center where we were able to check in for our flights and print boarding passes. The breakfast that is included was the same everyday, but had options ranging from pastry, toast, bagels, to hard cooked eggs, fruit and cereal. Both coffee and tea as well as juice, yogurt and granola. There isn't a lot of seating for breakfast, but we were able to manage and it was so nice to be able to start our day without looking for a restaurant every time. The rooms are actually pretty spacious for NYC, the bathrooms are wonderful - rainfall shower (that is completely frosted for privacy if another person needs to be getting ready while someone is showering- a nice to have feature when 4 are trying to get ready in one room), l'occitane products, fluffy clean towels. There was a single cup coffee maker, a bar sized sink, a micro and mini fridge - even some storage cabinets that suited us nicely. We shopped for wine, bear, snacks and fruit/veggies to help make eating in NYC a little easier and more affordable. They even provide a few ceramic plates for microwaving - and paper coffee cups with lids for on the go! I highly recommend this hotel!

title: A little gem!
text: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The Pearl.  Perfectly located for getting out and about and the staff were wonderful.  The room was a great size and extremely clean. My only gripe was that I couldn't get the air conditioning to work properly. Although I didn't complain about this so can't moan about it! Breakfast is continental but there is plenty of choice to set you up for the day. Would certainly recommend this little gem ☺

title: Enjoyable Stay
text: My wife and I loved staying at The Pearl. The staff were great and our room was very comfortable. It's in a busy area two blocks from the north end of Times Square but you wouldn't know it once you're inside. It is very relaxing. The bed was very comfortable and the breakfasts were fine. I don't think 'Continental breakfast' does it justice. In France that can mean a cup of coffee and a bread roll with jam and butter but we enjoyed the buffet every day. The cheese and wine afternoons are a nice touch and an opportunity to relax before the evening. This was our first experience of New York and it was perfect. We hope to return.

title: Great Place to Stay!
text: We love The Pearl.  This was our second stay and we can't wait to return. It's a wonderful hotel with lots to see and do nearby.  Our room was clean and spacious. The hotel staff are friendly and very helpful.  We highly recommend this hotel.

title: Times Square a tus pies
text: Nada como pasar una navidad en New York, a pesar del frío y deseando ver caer la nieve el 25 de diciembre.  Para ello, estar en un hotel como The Pearl, en el corazón de Broadway, es lo mejor que nos puede suceder.  El hotel The Pearl cumplió por completo con nuestras expectativas, por la cordialidad de su equipo de recibimiento y el confort cálido de la habitación, con camas mullidas y edredones acogedores.  La calefacción tenía el toque indicado para no secar demasiado el ambiente.  Tenemos ganas de regresar y repetir la experiencia.

title: Excellent, Excellent, Excellent!
text:
Undoubtedly one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in.
The staff were exceptional, the room was large by New York standards and the location was perfect (only a few blocks from Times Square).
Having stayed in Times Square on a previous holiday, I found The Pearl was in a prime position as it was away from all the crazy yet not too far away.
Room was exceptionally clean and the shower was the best!!

title: Great location
text: Just spent an extended weekend at The Pearl with my sisters. It was perfect and right in the heart of the theater district. Room was lovely and it came with ok continental breakfast. The staff was kind and helpful.

title: Great place to stay
text:
Decent size room. Well appointed. VERY CLEAN. Close to everything.  Continental breakfast as very much appreciated- as everything in NYC is more expensive. Wine and cheese hour is a nice touch as well. Snacks, coffee, tea and water available all day.  Nice to be able to grab a quick snack after a day walking the city.  

Staff was all very friendly and were great to offer suggestions of places to eat.

title: Had a great stay!
text:
Booked this hotel last minute (the day before I flew!) as most of the other larger hotels in the area were already fully booked. I'm so glad they were because The Pearl was a great choice! 

The service was great, the reception staff and doormen were always smiling and ready to help you out. It's not a massive chain hotel like the others in the area so they get to know you pretty quickly which is nice! They also arranged a car to take me back to JFK on the sunday morning as cabs at that time would have been harder to come across. I'd definitely recommend taking advantage of that- cost the same as the cab journey would have but in a much nicer car!

The room was great, plenty of space and cleaned well every day. The amenities in the bathroom were also excellent. The shower was AMAZING- super powerful. 

Location wise its ideal, only a 5-10min walk from Central Park, surrounded by theatres and restuarants and although right by times square, it's not in the middle of it so you don't have to fight through the crowds to get in and out. Empire State/Macys etc is about a 15-20min walk and so is the Port Authority bus terminal if you're taking any day trips out. Also plenty of Subway stations around

The only 2 minor annoying things for me was the air con in the room was quite loud and switched on and off- I'm a heavy sleeper and it still woke me up a couple of times. Also (as far as I'm aware when I was there) there wasn't a bar, so I couldn't go down and grab a drink. But they were only minor inconveniences- I'd be more than happy to stay at the hotel again and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to people!

title: Gute Lage wenn man in dem Bezirk sein muss
text:
Immer ein Zimmer nach hinten verlangen, die Strassen sind ja Tag und Nacht sehr laut. 
Bett und Bad sauber und der Service sehr gut. Zum Glück bin ich kein Frühstücksmensch und es gab immer frisches Obst und Obstsalat, alles andere ist Plastikland...schade...
Die Lage ist top wenn man in der Gegend sein möchte, alles ist zu Fuß erreichbar.

title: Unsurpassed hospitality
text: We felt very fortunate to have stayed at the Pearl Hotel. The rooms are beautiful, spacious and thoughtfully appointed and furnished. The location is perfect to all of the Broadway theaters (as well as 5th Avenue stores), and the staff could not have been nicer or more accommodating. We were pleased with both the quality of the fitness room (equipped with high-quality gear) and the nice continental breakfast and afternoon wine reception. The hotel is amazingly quiet and a thorough night’s sleep can be guaranteed. When we return to Manhattan, we will definitely book The Pearl for our stay.

title: Still a NYC favourite
text:
Third time to visit. This hotel is a great spot.

Close to Times Square, yet on a quiet street away from the madness! Central Park is a ten minute walk away.

The restaurant next door was closed, but, there  are lots of places around for food.

The rooms here a really nice, quite spacious (although ours was the smallest one we’ve had since we’ve been staying here), the staff are really nice. Breakfast is fine, it’s included in the price which is quite a saving in NYC. Some nice fresh bagels, fruits, hard boiled eggs and a great display of pastries and yogurts.

The coffee is not so great! The snack bar is open 24 hours and is free and there is a wine and cheese reception everyday.

The rates can be quite expensive by comparison to other hotels, but, the Pearl is boutique and personal. It’s worth it.

That said in July we could have had a one room suite at Fitzpatrick’s on Lexington for the same price as our room in the Pearl. The fact we went for the Pearl again will tell you everything you need to know.

Superb hotel, great rooms, brilliant staff.

title: What a Gem!
text:
We picked the Pearl last minute after being let down by the Manhattan at Times Square. Before booking we spoke to the receptionist who showed us the room we’d be staying in and gave us a free upgrade. He was so helpful and very understanding. Unfortunately I didn’t catch his name. 

The location is fantastic, just off Times Square, within walking distance to everything. 

The hotel serves breakfast 7-10, it’s a basic selection of bagels/bread and pastries but it was nice enough. They also do a wine and cheese tasting from 4-5pm which is a nice added touch. 

The room was great. Good size for New York, and very contemporary. Air con worked a treat but was also nice and quiet. The bedding and towels had a nice feel to them. Everything about the room makes you not want to leave it! 

The hotels checkout time is 12pm which was really helpful. 

The staff were really friendly throughout the stay, everyone we passed would say hello. Rooms were cleaned daily to a good standard. 

I would 100% recommend the Pearl and I’d definitely stay here again.

title: Simply excellent
text:
Location - great.  But really quiet as well. 

Decor - nice.  Rooms clean and good size 

Breakfast buffet - good choice and quality

Staff - excellent. 

This definitely will be my go-to hotel choice in NYC now.

title: Great Base
text: Last minute booking and was a little nervous as never stayed here before.  A great surprise, The rooms we had were of a very high standard, bath, shower, coffee machine, microwave and lovely toiletries.  Was a little surprised to find there was no bar but the cheese and wine hour was great as a meeting point for our group.  Free tea and coffee throughout the day and breakfast offered everything we needed.  Would stay here again.

title: Amazing location
text: After reviewing so many hotels in Manhattan, we decided on the Pearl.  The staff is excellent. The rooms are very spacious and very clean. Happy hour @ 4pm, what a nice touch! Breakfast was plentiful. Overall a perfect stay!

title: Rien à dire
text:
L'hôtel est bien situé. Il y a un parking avec voiturier pour 45$ les 24 heures. Ce qui n'est finalement pas si cher vu le prix des parkings à New York...
L'accueil était très sympathique et agréable. Nous n'avons pas eu de mauvaises surprises. 
Notre chambre n'avait pas de vue (au 5ème étage) mais bon, vu qu'il faisait un temps horrible, cela ne nous a pas dérangé.
La chambre était grande, jolie et avec tout : produits d'accueil, peignoirs, chaussons, café, fer à repasser et même un parapluie à disposition ! Sans oublier la télévision dans la salle de bains !
Il y a des boissons chaudes à disposition toute la journée ainsi que des chips ou des pommes. Le petit déjeuner est très correct.
Nous avons libéré la chambre à 11h, mais nous avons pu laisser nos bagages jusqu'à 16h lorsque nous sommes venus récupérer notre voiture.

title: Ottimo Hotel
text: Centralissimo, pulito, personale cordiale e disponibile, camere abbastanza grandi e silenziose. Abbiamo soggiornato 11 notti per una vacanza a NY, siamo stati molto bene. Colazione buona, con scelta di dolci, pane tostato, formaggi, marmellate, yogurt, frutta; aperitivo pomeridiano offerto dalla struttura, possibilità di prenotare shuttle privato per andata o rientro dall'aeroporto, disponibili a tenerci i bagagli - gratuitamente - il giorno del check out per oltre 6 h. Ottima la gestione del cambio biancheria e dei prodotti da bagno, con particolare attenzione allo spreco e all'inquinamento. Comodo l'angolo cucina - microonde e frigo - nelle camere. Consigliato

title: a little something extra
text: We booked this hotel for a week and were not disappointed ( its always a bit risky if you have never stayed that long some place) . I believe the Pearl specializes in little extras the other hotels do not: We were celebrating a special occasion, the staff left wine and a card. One of our flights was delayed the manager contacted the airport driver and let him know. ( This service is arranged by the hotel for a fee) The staff was very attentive to any needs . We had a plugged sink-they sent somebody right up.  The room was very spacious my only complaint was we faced the theater across the street and the noise from the street could be very loud on occasion-bring ear plugs if you are noise sensitive. We were on the sixth floor I do not know if it was less an issue the higher you were. There is a Continental breakfast and a wine & cheese hour . The breakfast to me is a wallet saver.  There were plenty choices: bread, pastries, bagels, yogurt, fresh fruit, dry cereal, hard boiled eggs- you would not go hungry.  We only were at the hotel once to  utilize the wine and cheese hour but that too was lovely and a little something extra.  The towels were big and thick, the toiletries were by Octaine (?), there were robes and slippers and even an umbrella. Every night as we rolled in from the days adventures we were greeted with warmth and genuine-how was your day smiles . The beds were a bit noisy-very comfortable, but don't expect to sneak to the bathroom in the middle of the night with out waking your bed mate.  We enjoyed our stay very much and would book this hotel again as it is within walking distance to the theater action, central park, Carnegie hall, The Lincoln center, many great restaurants, Rockefeller center and the subway !

title: Nagyon szuper hotel
text:
A szálloda elhelyezkedése nagyon jó, a tömb sarkán van a Broadway, a Time Square pedig csak pár perc sétára van. Ha turrista vagy akkor innen a legtöbb látnivalót akár gyalog is megközelítheted! Mi is így tettünk, nagyon klassz nyaralásunk volt! 
A szoba nagy, jól felszerelt, a fürdő kiváló! Tisztaság van mindenhol. A személyzet nagyon kedves és segítőkész! 
A szálloda extra szolgáltatásai melyek ingyenesek, nagyon barátságos gesztusok a szállodától!: a reggeli, a délutáni borkóstolás, a délutáni gyümölcstál, a chipsek, a kávé.
Külön megemlíteni való extra, hogy a hotelben van magyarul beszélő manager is! Ez nagyon komoly extra olyanoknak mint mi, akik kevésbé jól beszélünk angolul. Köszönjük ez úton is!
Nagyon ajánljuk!

title: Idéalement situé !!
text:
Sur la 49ème a 2 pas de Time Square cet établissement offre des prestations de qualités.. Le personnel y est accueillant, la chambre est très sympa,grande et spacieuse et surtout très calme au vu de la localisation !!

La salle de Fitness est équipée et adaptée !! 

Le Breakfast est inclus et à l’américaine !!

title: انصح بالاقامه هنا
text: الموقع ممتاز .. النظافة وطاقم العمل من أفضل ما يكون .. الغرف وسيعة ودورة المياه حجمها مناسب .. نظام المصاعد سريع مناسب جدا للعائلات لافطار جدا متواضع الله يديم النعمه ولكن سوف اعيد الزيارة له مره ثانيه.

title: Great little gem in the heart of the theater district
text:
My husband and I spent a night here after a broadway show and dinner at Marea. 

The staff was welcoming and very capable. 
The room was large and nicely appointed.
Location excellent and terrific value!

Restaurant is coming soon if that is important to you. Short walk to most all major shows and shopping, what more could you want?

Also felt safe.

title: Amazing stay
text: Stayed here for our honeymoon. On arrival we were upgraded, and a complimentary bottle of champagne left in our room. Staff were very friendly, and welcoming. The room was a perfect size for us, and the hotel was in an ideal location to explore New York. The 4pm wine and cheese hour was a brilliant way to relax after a busy day exploring. The breakfast was plentiful too. I would not hesitate to stay here again

title: La mejor ubicación de Manhattan!
text:
El hotel tiene la mejor ubicación de Manhattan, está a sólo 2 cuadras del Times Square! (que, realmente, sorprende a cualquiera), a 7 de la Grand Terminal, y a sólo 8 cuadras del Central Park. 
Cuando salíamos a pasear, preferiamos hacerlo caminando. Además, tiene 2 estaciones de metro muy cerca, lo que permite moverse por toda la ciudad sin problemas. En general el hotel es muy bueno. 
El Lobby tiene un espacio para sentarse tranquilamente, y disfrutar de alguna de las amenidades que tienen sobre una mesa: agua fresca, fruta y algunos snacks. El personal es muy amable, siempre dispuesto a ayudar si uno tiene dudas o problemas. El hotel cuenta además con un comedor para el desayuno (no muy variado, pero con buenos productos) y un pequeño GYM con máquinas y agua fría para refrescarse.
Las habitaciones me parece uno de los puntos altos: siempre las mantienen limpias y tienen buen espacio. El baño, ídem. Las cortesías del shower eran productos franceses finos, un detalle de calidad superior. En suma: lo recomiendo a ojos cerrados.
Lo mejor: la ubicación y la cortesía del personal a cargo.
Lo peor: la baja variedad en el desayuno.

PD: Con mi familia pedimos late check-out, puesto que debíamos tomar el avión de vuelta muy tarde (a las 00.00 hrs.) y no hubo problemas, y a pesar de que sí pagamos un extra, el manager del hotel, de manera muy amable, nos hizo finalmente una rebaja.
Excelente hotel! 
Sobretodo si quieren una buena ubicación!

title: מלון שעונה על הציפיות
text:
שהינו במלון שישה לילות, שבעה ימים
המלון במקום מאוד מרכזי, לא גדול ורועש שזה מאוד טוב כאשר נמצאים בעיר הגדולה
ארוחת הבוקר מעט דלה אבל בהחלט אפשר למצוא מה לאכול
חגגנו לאימי יום הולדת 60 והודענו על כך למלון הם הפתיעו אותנו בברכה ובבקבוק יין שחיכה לנו בחדר, הצוות מאוד נחמד וידידותי.
היינו 4 בחדר עם שתי מיטות גדולות שהיו מעט לא נוחות אבל בסופו של דבר התרגלנו והן לא היו עבורנו בעיה.
אנחנו מאוד ממליצים על המלון שכן הוא נותן ארוחת בוקר וקשה למצוא מלון כזה באזור שמציע גם כן ובלי תוספת תשלום.
אם נחזור לניו יורק בהחלט נשמח להתארח שוב :)

title: Return trip to the Pearl, Very Pleased
text:
Returned to the Pearl for a repeat engagement and was as pleased as ever.   

Boutique hotel in a good location, especially for theater.  Will stay again the next time I'm in town.  

Nice place for afternoon tea on the same block.

title: 非常一般
text: 我被网上的点评吸引，预订了这里，结果大失所望。酒店挺旧挺小，电梯缓慢，乏善可陈。除了地理位置还好，其它一无是处。

title: Great hotel in a great location
text:
Everything about our stay at the Pearl was pleasing. 

The staff was excellent, the room was surprisingly large, the wine at the reception was good (which I find rare), breakfast was typical (toast, bagels, cereal, yogurt—the usuals, no cooked-to-order), and the location was perfect, with great restaurants within a block, including vegetarian/vegan places. 

The room was clean and well-equipped. Late checkout was no problem, and they held our luggage afterward. Valet is $50, which is about what you would pay at any of the nearby garages. All around good experience.

title: Nice hotel, perfect location
text: Very nice hotel in a great location. Close to Times Square but still away from the hubbub. Close to all Broadway theaters. This is a boutique hotel, so there is no restaurant. But there are tons of nearby options. Our room was nice size for New York. They do offer a Continental breakfast every morning, which is pretty good. Wine and cheese between 4 and 5 in the afternoon is a nice feature. Staff is very friendly and extrememly helpful. We will return the next time we are in NYC.

title: A Wonderful Experience
text:
So full disclosure, my experience of the Pearl was largely second-hand; Ladyfriend stayed here solo when she was in town for a work thing in the winter, and during my most recent stay in NYC both my family and hers stayed here, on her recommendation.  I did, however, sleep here one night, and availed myself of the free wine-and-cheese evening a couple of times.  Suffice it to stay that if you want to be in the Times Square/Broadway area and can afford this hotel, I couldn't recommend it more highly.

The rooms are spacious, and even the ones at the back (or at least the one I saw) avoid the "looking-out-over-an-air-shaft" problem that plagues so many Midtown hotels.  The aforementioned nightly wine-and-cheese event is quaint and pleasant, and the staff are exceedingly amenable.

In terms of the area, I will assume for the purposes of this review that you know what you are getting into.  This is, as I have mentioned in other reviews, my least favorite part of NYC, but if you are in town to see shows there is no better location, and you are also close to a range of great places to eat, from fine dining to the magnificent Times Square Diner, which is just around the corner.  See my recent review of Toloache for great Mexican, and of Da Marino for perfectly passable Italian, which are also just there.  And if you are on a budget, there is a grocery store (a Food Emporium) on the corner, and plenty of less expensive eateries.

The rooms are spacious and lovely, the amenities are notable (I don't know what their deal is with Lay's potato chips, but the fact that they are available for free 24/7 is potentially dangerous), and the staff is welcoming.  If you have to stay in Times Square, stay here.

title: Trapped by reviews!
text: Unfortunately, i booked this hotel based on the positive reviews here, but the reality was different. The only advantage is location; which is applicable to other more than 100 hotels in this area. Reception staff; food and services can't be worse. For me, it was the worst part in my trip to NYC

title: Particolare
text: Albergo fuori dagli standard a cui siamo generalmente abituati. Arredato con gusto, personale alla mano. Colazione servita in camera. Parcheggio gratuito. Raggiungibile dall'hotel, il ristorante Tavan, specialità turche e marocchine. Da provare

title: A great place to stay
text:
We found this hotel through Trip Advisor and we got everything we expected. The location is terrific. Close to Broadway theatres, Times Square, a variety of subways and a good selection of restaurants.

The staff was very friendly and helpful. Very patient with our tourist questions. I would stay there again.

title: Perfect location
text: This hotel is in the perfect location! A half block from Broadway & Times Square in the Theater District. The lobby is nothing special, as is the streetfront of the hotel. Our room was clean and very nice. We had a King Deluxe. The bed was ok, not bad, but not exceptional.  The toiletries in the bathroom were great! I usually don't use them, but I loved them all. The continental breakfast offered a nice array of options, and was well stocked. The coffee was very good. The free wi-fi was a nice bonus.We had a bit of a problem checking in. We arrived at about 11:30am. I had been told the day before, that it was possible that our room could be ready by 10:30 am, although check in was officially at 4pm. Our room was not ready, so we left our bags, with a promise that we'd be texted as soon as our room was ready. We checked back at about 3pm, even tho we had not been texted.  Still not ready, they'd text. We came back about seven, still no text, and were finally able to check in. As we checked in, I heard someone asking about a wine and cheese hour. We had missed it!  I remarked to my husband, that I would have loved a glass of wine after such a hectic day.  The male who checked us in heard me, and asked what kind of wine we liked, and said that he would send some up, on the house! Within minutes, two bottles of wine, on ice and 2 glasses arrived. To be able to relax in our room, with a glass of wine, really made up for our late check in!  The whole staff was very nice and  I would definitely stay there again.

title: Boutique Hotel
text: My daughter and I stayed at The Pearl for one night, while my mother stayed for two nights.  We were in NYC to see a show and shop.  Our rooms were updated and clean and the beds were extremely comfortable.  The hotel has a small workout room and offers an extensive "wine and cheese" each afternoon beginning at 4pm and a continental breakfast each morning.  The staff was kind enough to provide almond milk for my daughter who does not drink cow's milk.  Overall, this hotel enhanced our time in NY and I would highly recommend.

title: Lovely hotel, close to Times Square with excellent service!
text: The is our second stay at the Pearl and it remains as good as we remember. The hotel and rooms are tranquil and quite even though it is so centrally located. The staff are amazingly helpful - from front desk to room attendants and Abu in the breakfast dining area. All are deserving of praise. I fully recommend this hotel for business or pleasure. We hope to be back again soon!  Thank you so much for everything you did for us!!!!!

title: Exceptional
text: Good location, close to Times Square but far away enough so that you are not immersed into the crowds upon leaving the front door. Within a couple of blocks from the theaters we visited. The staff was wonderful and provided great recommendations for restaurants.

title: A Find in Times Square
text: We stayed for a few days during a recent visit. A very pleasant surprise. The Pearl is a small hotel, but it has lots of perks. The location is perfect, directly across from the Eugene O'Neill theater on 49th street. The doormen and the front desk staff are very attentive, considerate and helpful. Check in/check out was seamless and quick. The hotel was very clean, the rooms adequate size and the beds very comfortable. The fitness center was small, but clean and adequate for the size of the hotel. All in all, a very nice stay at the Pearl.

title: Awesome all around.
text:
Great front desk. Great doormen and great housekeeping.

The hotel is located just a few blocks from everything you’d like to do while visiting New York.  

King suite is the way to go. Spend the extra few dollars and enjoy a large room for a great price.

Very clean and modern too !

title: One of the best in NYC!
text: The hotel is one the of best hotel I’ve stayed in in New York City, almost everything is very close, very convenient  to a lot of stores,park and other places.The hotel is nice,doorman is very kind, front desk are professionals housekeepers are nice, breakfast area is also nice  clean and rooms are beautiful.i would definitely come back😊

title: Practical choice
text: I will preface this by saying the room served the purpose we got it for, getting ready and sleeping. Stayed here with a few friends for a girl's weekend. Based on the reviews I was expecting a cute boutique hotel but felt more like I was staying at a standard 3 star hotel.  Rooms were average and a bit dark. Breakfast was nothing spectacular. The staff however was very kind and accommodating.

title: Ubicación
text:
Lo que vas a pagar por este hotel es por la ubicación. 
Un hotel que aspira a ser de lujo pero lejos está de serlo. Estaba tan solo 50 usd o igual de hoteles de lujo y renombre de NYC. Piensan que utilizando amenitis loccitane en el baño u poniendo batas y pantuflas es suficiente para considerarse hotel de lujo. 
Para empezar no tiene restaurant por lo que olvídense de el roomservice. La zona en donde se supone dan desayunos es reducida y muy incómoda. 
Las habitaciones son amplias. 
Eso si la ubicación es excelente.

title: Excellent hotel, great choice for a family - an oasis of calm and quiet just off Times Square.
text: Actually travelled in April 2017 but Tripadvisor won't let me put in a review for that time period. Great service but that's almost a given in any decent US hotel but this location was ideal for the NY tourist and the price was fantastic for what we got. The staff were helpful at every point of our stay. Highly recommended, especially if you are not that familiar with New York.

title: The wonderful staff tops it off!
text:
I escaped from the Stewart Hotel after a horrendous experience (review soon to come) . I quickly booked a room at The Pearl Hotel for my entire trip after spending only 3 hours at the Stewart Hotel.

I was greeted warmly first by William, then the very courteous and professional Ali and Ignacio at the front desk. After learning what had happened to us earlier in the night, they made sure that I enjoy my stay at The Pearl.

The deluxe queen room was tidy, clean and tastefully decorated. Bathroom was clean and equipped with all the necessities. A small TV was mounted for your viewing pleasure. The spacious balcony was an added bonus!

Ali and Ignacio explained everything in detail and never once did they seem to be bothered or showed any signs of impatience. In addition to a wonderful boutique hotel, the staff elevated the experience at The Pearl. 

Bravo The Pearl! I will undoubtedly stay again next time I'm in NYC.

title: Another great stay
text: We stayed at The Pearl Hotel this week on a short but fun filled trip  to New York City.  It is our third visit and everything was first rate  would recommend to all our friends We were very pleased with all the staff and the morning breakfast is a nice option  The location is a big plus. On Broadway and in close  to our favorite restaurant, DaMarino  O

title: Loved this hotel and the location is perfect!
text:
So glad we chose this hotel.  It is impressively nice, modern, upscale.  The location is absolutely perfect, right across the street from Book of Mormon, and Wicked is just one block over.  The North end of Times Square is just half a block away and it is walking distance to Rockefeller Center, Carnegie Hall, Radio City Music Hall, Central Park, MoMA, etc.  Access to most subway lines, with stations just a block or two or three away, depending on which line you want.

The rooms are very modern and stylish just like the photos on the web site show.  Very comfortable.  Continental breakfast is a nice touch and NO RESORT FEE, making this hotel an exceptional value for NYC.

This place is a real gem.  I've already recommended it to my family.

title: Great Boutique Hotel!!!Great location!!!
text: Great Boutique Hotel!!!Great location and  Excellent service from the doorman to the front desk! JULISSA was amazing! we had a long trip to nyc and had a mixup in our hotel reversion, and thats how we ended up in the pearl hotel, and its all for the best we enjoyed it very much and we loved our complimentary bottle of wine! Thank you all! we will come back!

title: Melhor hotel na região da Time Square.
text: Já estive hospedado no Waldorf. Paramount e Édison. Experimentei agora o The Pearl. Experiência incrivel. Hotel novo, limpo, pequeno e atendimento perfeito. Mais caro que os citados acima, exceto o Waldorf. Café da manhã incluso. Lanche da tarde com vinho , queijo e café. Mesmo na Time, não está no agito. Tem também um ótimo mercado a 50 metros do hotel. Um restaurante italiano na frente e um teatro também. Na recepção maçã e batata frita Lays à vontade todos os dias. No quarto microondas, cafeteira e frigobar.

title: Excellent Boutique Hotel
text: It is an excellent boutique hotel in Midtown with an excellent location, just a short walk from Times Square in front of the theater of the Book of Mormon.  Is very quiet and the staff is very attentive,  continental breakfast and afternoon wine included.

title: Great stay
text:
Stayed 1 week here.  Customer service was great.  Friendly and happy.  Lobby has free chippies (lays & Doritos) as well as apples to take whenever you like.  Nice when you’re feeling peckish.
Breakfast was a nice spread.  Continental.  Every flavour of bagels, breads, yoghurt, cereals and a variety of pastries.  Coffee & many flavoured teas.  Apple and orange juices. 
The rooms (we stayed in 2 different rooms) were spacious and clean.  Room was made up everyday - so nice to come back to after a long day out.  No faults but I gave 4 stars instead of 5 because of the room rate.  $540usd per night plus all the taxes on top came to $630usd per night. 5 in the room.  I recommend staying here.  Excellent location.  
***tip: Just around the corner, 9th ave there is a laundromat.  Self service.  Perfect.

title: Terrific Hotel!
text: We just stayed at this hotel for a week and loved it! It is very near a couple of different subway entrances and Broadway is right at the end of the block.  We had one of the suite rooms that had two queen beds and then a small separate room between the bathroom and bedroom with a single pull out sofa. That worked great so our two teens didn’t have to share a bed!  The beds are very comfortable and the bathroom is very nice and roomy! The hotel was clean and quiet and the staff were all extremely helpful and friendly! The breakfast included is very nice and we enjoyed it each day. We would most definitely stay here again!

title: Very Nice hotel
text: The Pearl is an excellent hotel. The location is close to so many things to do and see. The people working at the hotel are very friendly and helpful, making it feel like home away from home. There is a nice continental breakfast and even a wine and cheese hour from 4 to 5 everyday. When we return to New York we will certainly be booking in at The Pearl.

title: Très bien
text: Idéalement situé à 300m de Time Squares donc super pratique après de longues journées en ville, très peu bruyant. Le petit déjeuner est très correct (pour des francais). Les locaux sont nickels et le personnel sympa donc rien à redire, je recommande

title: Almost perfect!
text:
First of all, I wish I could give it 4.5 stars.
The location is great, 5 mins from Times Square, everything is within a few minutes walk yet the street the hotel is on is relatively quiet. Our room overlooked the street and although you can hear city noises they don’t intrude at all, great to be so close but peaceful as well. Our room was a good size with an enormous bed which is the most comfortable bed I think I’ve ever slept in, wish I could have sneaked it into my suitcase! The only possible problem with the room was noisy air con but we solved that by making the room a couple of degrees cooler just before we went to bed and then turning it off overnight. In the morning, it was only a degree or two higher than normal which was fine. We arrived during a heatwave and it worked perfectly for us. Great coffee/tea machine and good toiletries in the bathroom.
The continental breakfast was good and it was nice that the tea and coffee was available 24/7 plus snacks and fruit. A cheese, wine and fruit hour was a nice touch as well.
The deduction of a half star is because 3 days out of four we had to phone housekeeping as we didn’t have any shower towels, or only one, or the tea/coffee capsules hadn’t been replenished or the first morning the fridge wasn’t plugged in. It just seemed slipshod as it let an otherwise great hotel down. 
My other complaint is the reliance on single use plastic - all the plates, cutlery, cups etc for breakfast were plastic and all went into bins and not sorted for recycling. There are notes in the bathrooms about not washing towels unnecessarily yet they are sending so much plastic to landfill without a second thought.
Overall an excellent hotel and highly recommended.

title: Good location, clean rooms & bathrooms
text: If you want to be close to the action, this hotel will work. The staff were friendly, the rooms and bathrooms very clean, and the continental breakfast was decent. The bed however was not comfortable - at least for me. The mattresses were thin. For the price, I’d have hoped for a more relaxing sleep experience.

title: Great little hotel
text: It is a :-clean, cosy, comfy, hotel. Well appointed and maintained. It is close to everything but far enough that you can escape the hustle and bustle. Theaters are on the doorstep and central Park is a few blocks away. The happy hour is decent as is breakfast.

title: Broadway!
text: Location was perfect. Walking distance to theatre, dining and shopping. Staff of the hotel were very nice and helpful. Was given alot of great sugestions. Room was very spacious. Breadfast was just ok.Bagels were the best.

title: Loved this hotel a real gem full of comfort
text: We stayed here as a group of 3 women on a girly few days in nyc. I absolutely loved this hotel. It's so central to times square buto yet not in the hussle of it..like few minutes walater!  The staff are so polite and helpful too. The roimage were so fab!! Beds sooo comfortable in fact if I wasn't so excited to get outo to explore the city I'd happily of stayed on that bed. The bathroom were spaciout and very modern..huge shower head which was great on achy muscles. Breakfast in morning was basic but great set up to the day ahead. Would highly recommend this hotel and will certainly return. This was my 4th visit to NYC  (stayed in diff hotels each time) and this was definitely my favourite

title: Week end visit
text: Staff were pleasant and very helpful. Missed having a dinning room. Lots of places to eat close to hotel.  No one told me ice machine and snacks were in the basement until the last night of my visit. Room was on a quite floor. Easy access theaters. Major sights in walking distance. Would say again.

title: Excelente hotel. Café da manhã péssimo.
text:
Bom, o hotel está dentro das expectativas.
Ocorre que, desde o início, estava procurando hotel com café da manhã. E vi que esse hotel, além do café da manhã, também incluía queijos e vinhos a tarde.
De fato, o café da manhã existe. Mas não é
Mas, são paes e croissant. Queijo tipo cream cheese e ovos cozido. Ponto.
Além disso, o check in apenas ocorreu às 16h em ponto. Tentei há 15 dias antes da reserva, que me oferecessem um check in antecipado. Mas não houve acordo. Entrei no quarto as 16:15. Outro ponto negativo: a cama é pequena.
Mas também há suas qualidades. Está bem no centro de Manhattan, muito próximo a Times Square, Starbucks, etc.
Na esquina há o food empire. La tem tudo.

title: A jem
text:
I can't praise the staff of this hotel enough as every time we stay here they exceed our expectations.
Great location for theatre lovers, spacious rooms with a glimpse of Time Square billboards from the windows.All the rooms we stayed in were great, I particularly loved the suites. The beds are comfortable, the design is quite simple but stylish, everything is exceptionally clean. One more bonus - they serve a light buffet style breakfast (coffee, bagels, fruits) and wine in the afternoon, which is a very nice touch. Overall, I am always satisfied with our stay there. Unfortunately I do not remember the names of the receptionists, but the gentlemen working there always made sure that our stay was pleasant and we were happy with the room. Well done and thank you.

title: Perfect Location for NYC Hotel!
text: My family and I just returned from a trip to New York City and while we were there, we stayed at The Pearl Hotel on West 49th St. between Broadway and 8th Ave directly across from the Eugene O'Neil Theater (where "Book of Mormon" is currently running). For those planning on spending most of your time in Manhattan, the location is perfect! One block from the 50th street Subway station, 3-5 blocks from most of the Broadway theaters and within easy walking distance of Times Square. Half a block from a Food Emporium grocery. The hotel serves a complimentary continental breakfast, serves snacks throughout the day and serves wine and cheese from 4-5pm. The staff was friendly, attentive and accommodating. The beds are the one area that could be improved, but by the time we got home from each day's adventure, they were enough.

title: I am now a big fan of Boutique Hotels.
text: We surprised my daughter for her 13th birthday with a trip to New York with the family.  Typically we stay in one of your chain hotels but we tried something different this time and don't think I would ever go back to a chain.  You get all the amenities of the big hotels but it is so much more personal.  We got to know most of the staff in 5 days.  They new us by name and made us feel special.  Julissa was the first person that we meet and she set the tone for the whole stay.  Always making sure our family was taken care of.  I can honestly say we enjoyed all the staff.  Two other people that really stood out was Joey from behind the counter and Manuel on the bell team.  If you are going to New York you should really look at The Pearl.  From the service to the best location (walking distance from so many things) The Pearl gets an A+ from our family.

title: A pearl of a hotel
text: A fabulous value in midtown/Theater Diatrict. Very good service, spacious rooms that were impeccably clean and parking next door. It’s a 4 star plus property at. Three star price. Well deserving of the Certiicate of Excellence.

title: Una bellissima vacanza nel centro di Manhattan
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato al pearl per 6 notti. L'albergo è un delizioso boutique hotel di 14 piani e poche stanze per piano. Circondato dai teatri di Broadway e a due passi da Time Square. La posizione è sicuramente uno dei suoi punti di forza così come le stanze in perfette condizioni, eleganti e molto pulite. I bagni sono perfettamente puliti e dotati di saponi di qualità elevata. Anche considerando la posizione l'hotel è molto silenzioso. Il personale è stato molto gentile e sempre molto disponibile. Avendo prenotato con largo anticipo ho spuntato un ottimo prezzo per una stanza per 4 Deluxe. Le principali metropolitane sono nel giro di un isolato ed anche hell's kitchen è dietro l'angolo. 
Unico punto di debolezza: la colazione inclusa nella tariffa della camera è adeguata ma non ricca: dimenticate pancake, scamble egg e bacon...non si possono avere neanche a richiesta.

title: Wonderful choice in Times Square
text:
We spent a long weekend in NYC and the Pearl was a perfect home base for us. Not only is it steps from Times Square (and literally across the street from the theater for Book of Mormon) and an easy walk to anywhere in Midtown. It’s also just steps from several subway stations making access to the rest of the city easy. 

The rooms were clean, quiet, and spacious. The staff was friendly and approachable. This is a great choice for anyone visiting NYC for a few days.

title: Fabulous hotel
text:
Had a 4 night stay at the Pearl.
I cannot recommend it highly enough.
The staff were lovely and friendly. Our room (906) was huge for city centre and really quiet for such a central location.
Great location in a quiet street but very near to Times Square and easy walk to most sites.
Loved the breakfast/free snacks/ wine and cheese hour and would definitely return.

title: Un hotel fuori dal comune per gli standard di New York!!
text:
Abbiamo prenotato questa struttura su booking per l'ottimo punteggio..
L'hotel è veramente centralissimo..penso a 50mt a piedi da Time Square..
L'hotel è un 4 stelle con un servizio e delle camere (almeno per quanto riguarda la nostra da 5 stelle).
Le nostre facce stupite nell'entrare in camera e vedere che era grande quasi come appartamento erano da fotografare :)
Siamo stati varie volte a New York e ogni volta gli hotel hanno stanze piccolissime dove non sapete se far entrare voi o le valigie :)
A disposizione wi-fi gratuito per gli ospiti in tutta la struttura.
Nella nostra prenotazione era inclusa anche la colazione per l'intero soggiorno..colazione a buffet abbastanza varia..
Per 3 notti bìnoi abbiamo speso 485$ circa..però vanno ad aggingersi una tassa del 14.75%, 1.5$ di costi di servizio struttura a notte e 2$ tassa soggiorno a notte...comunque lo trovate scritto nelle condizioni dell'hotel (nel caso ad esempio prenotate con booking come noi).
Super Consigliato!!!!

title: Went to New York with my 14 yr old daugher to see Anastasia which was my daughters gift for Christmas/Birthday.
text: The Pearl Hotel and staff made our stay welcoming.  Our initial stay was for the 19th; however, due to a train derailment in VA our trip was not going to happen.  Theresa at the Pearl was very kind and spoke to the manager who approved transferring our hotel reservation to the 26th which apparently wasn’t part of the “rules” in our initial reservation.   A huge thank you for accommodating this request which was out of our control for transportation.   The ticket agency as well for Anastasia don Amtrack were also very gracious and transferring the tickets at no penalty.

title: Best option in New York !
text:
This hotel was everything we would hope for: excellent location, very close to Times Square,Rockefeller  Center, Broadway theaters etc; the reception staff was extra nice - they gave us early check in (2 hours early) and late check out ( until 1 pm) and was always ready to give any information we needed about the city ( including the reservation of a very efficient transfer to JFK, which we strongly recommend - it was about the same price of a street cab but much better service, clean car and responsible driver); the room was very comfortable and nice with a surprisingly big bathroom with L'Occitane toiletries and a tv!
Finally the breakfast on the second floor was good and a great timesaver !  
We had a problem with a clogged toilet and it was resolved very quickly and latter they called to make sure everything was all right. 
The only "negative" point was that our room (507) was in front of a door that gave access to the stairs, so very early in the morning it would start banging with the cleaning staff coming and going... but in reality this is a problem of almost every hotel... we should have asked for another room but we did not - it worked as our alarm clock...  Next time in NY we will definitely stay at The Pearl, but ask for a quieter room.

title: Love
text: Great location, great space. This hotel is expensive but really convenient. Breakfast was okay, though it could have had more options, particularly for those with food allergies. It's a kilometer from Central Park and just around the corner from some great food.

title: Nel cuore di Manhattan...
text:
Abbiamo trovato questo hotel leggendo le recensioni e possiamo confermare che è stata un'ottima scelta.
Posizione strategica a pochi passi da Broadway e Times Square. Per gli sportivi comodo a Central Park per corsa o camminata...lasci la città e ti immergi in questo bellissimo polmone verde frequentato da tantissima altra gente.
Piacevole la colazione del mattino con frutta fresca , yogurt, pane tostato e croissant caldi. Un unico appunto...la pulizia di tavoli e sedie lascia a desiderare.
Piacevole l'idea di offrire agli ospiti l'happy hour delle 16.00 con frutta, formaggi e vino. Comunque la sala era aperta 24 ore per tea e caffè.
Camera recentemente rinnovata e di dimensione adeguata per 2 persone e dotata di ogni comfort...macchine del caffè, prodotti da bagno linea Occitane, accappatoi.
Non da ultimo la vicinanza alla stazione del metrò con la linea che porta direttamente al JFK.
Personale gentile e cordiale.

title: 25th anniversary
text: Can not say enough good things about our stay from the moment we walked through the doors to getting our car from valet parking when we left. We stayed only one night but it was well worth it. Waiting in our room when we arrived was a chilled bottle of Prosecco with 2 champagne glasses and a nice card wishing us Happy Anniversary. We stayed in a King Deluxe overlooking 49th Street which was spacious, clean, and comfortable. Bath robes and slippers were provided( which we did not use) but looked comfy. The staff were friendly and helpful in all aspects. Only con was that the hallways and rooms were dimly lit even with all the lights on which I only mention if you have elderly or sight impaired in your party. Definitely will stay here again. Perfect location and remarkably quiet considering it is in the middle of NYC.

title: Gute Lage, nicht so guter Service
text:
Das Hotel ist klein und fein.
Gesamt gesehen hatten wir einen guten Aufenthalt und das Haus eignet sich optimal für einen Städtetrip.

- Nähe Metro / Subway
- Nähe Times Square
- Nähe Rockefeller Plaza
- Nähe Central Park

Wir hatten ein Zimmer mit 2 Queen-Size Better. Gross genug, aber keine Dusche. Nur Badewanne.

Sauberkeit war nicht optimal.
Ich musste die Putzfrauen spezifisch darauf aufmerksam machen, sie sollen doch bitte den Abfluss reinigen, weil sich das Wasser in der Badewanne staute beim duschen. Nicht zu glauben was im Abfluss war...aber es wurde sofort beseitigt.

Das Frühstücksbuffet war die grösste Enttäuschung. Eines 4-Sterne Hauses nicht würdig. Täglich das gleiche, minimale Buffet. Sehr wenig Auswahl. Und mit sehr wenig meine ich sehr wenig.

title: Tour with the family
text:
Stayed almost a week with my parents. Really cozy, perfect location, very clean and neat.. I would definitely stay there again..
It's not as expensive as one would expect for a hotel in such good location in NYC

title: Chouette hôtel pour une 1ère visite
text:
Pour notre 1ère fois à New York, notre choix s’est porté sur cet hôtel pour son emplacement.
Idéalement situé: à côté de Times Square, il permet de visiter beaucoup de sites touristiques à pieds.
Le métro est accessible rapidement pour les sites plus éloignés.

L’hôtel est joli tout en restant sobre et épuré.

Notre chambre était très propre, jolie et grande.
La literie est top!
Dans la salle d’eau il y a des produits « L’Occitane » d’excellente qualité.
Vue pas terrible sur d’autres immeubles, mais pour le peu passé dans la chambre: pas grave.

Petit déjeuner satisfaisant (bagels, pain de mie, muffins anglais, scones, petites viennoiseries, céréales, yaourts, gelées, salade de fruits frais...) mais peut-être décevant pour les personnes qui aiment le « salé »: rien à part des œufs durs.

Personnel très gentil et poli.

Hôtel très calme bien que tout proche de Times Square.
Nous le recommandons.

title: Short break to New York
text: Just spent 6 nights at this hotel in Times Square. Good clean comfortable accommodation, room had everything you needed. Staff very polite and helpful and location ideal for all the sightseeing. This makes a change from the usual chain hotels and we felt it was excellent value for money.

title: The Pearl Hotel is a “Gem” near the heart of Times Square.
text:
Excellent hotel! The location is perfect being located about six blocks to the heart of Times Square and a few blocks to the 48th and 49th street subway stations. The rooms were very clean and modern and the customer service was superb! 

Finally, the greatest perk for us was the daily wine and cheese hour. What a classy touch that also served a practical purpose in providing a mid- afternoon snack.  Overall, great property!! My husband and I will definitely be back in the future.

title: Great hotel in a perfect location
text:
Just down a couple blocks from Times  Square , you'll never know that as this place is quiet.

Great staff minus the one lady at the  front when we checked in , she must have had a bad day because after that she was much friendlier. Rest of the staff were amazing . Had an issue with our AC in our original room and they moved us to a suite .great location , good breakfast and wine and cheese hour overall happy we booked at the Pearl!

title: Excellent Hotel in Theater District
text: We stayed at The Pearl for 6 nights on an anniversary trip in April, and  our stay was delightful.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The room was clean, comfortable and stocked with upscale towels and toiletries.  The hotel was very quiet, as we rarely heard anyone else, despite there being a lot of folks there.  Breakfast was a good  Continental Breakfast,.  Pastries were fresh and very good, not standard hotel fare.  The location is very good, close enough to Broadway to provide quick access to theaters, but far enough from Times Square to not be overwhelmed with crowds.  Chicago was playing next door and Book of Mormon across the street.  We found good places to eat & drink nearby and a few blocks north.  Access to the Subway is ~ a block away.   Will definitely stay here on future NYC trips

title: Ottimo hotel vicino a Times Square
text: Hotel moderno e molto curato a due minuti a piedi da Times Square. Le stanze sono spaziose, ben arredate, silenziose e dotate di ogni comfort. Il buffet della prima colazione offre una discreta scelta. Il personale è disponibile. Prezzi in linea con un hotel di questo livello in pieno centro a Manhattan.

title: First Class Hotel
text:
From our arrival to our departure we loved being there. First class hotel with great staff who were happy to help plan our visits and give advice on where to eat etc.
The breakfast was a nice buffet and the wine and cheese at 16.00 was very pleasant.
Our room was first class and the bed was so comfortable, overall a great place to stay.

title: Wonderful boutique hotel
text: We booked 2rooms to come in to see a show.  We landed quite early and of course the rooms weren’t ready.  We weren’t expecting them to be.   At 2 we came back to check and one of the rooms was ready and they upgraded the other room so that both would be ready at the same time.  Then after we told the, that we were celebrating our sons engagement, they sent a bottle of champagne to the room with a card addresses to “Mr. and the future Mrs. .....” so darn cute.  Perfect location for shows and the street is not too busy.  Good breakfast and wine in the afternoon. Highly recommend this hotel!

title: Very nice boutique hotel, right in the theater district of NYC
text: It's always nice to stay at a hotel that is exactly where you want it to be - right across the street from the theater where we had tickets, and right next to a parking garage - but what set this hotel apart was the service. The front desk woman was excellent and treated us very well, even upgrading us to a suite when she learned it was our anniversary and birthdays. The room was large and comfortable, and very quiet. The price was a bit high, but for the center of NYC it was no more than other comparable places, and we were very happy with it.

title: Birthday Weekend and Springsteen on Broadway
text: We stayed at The Pearl in March to celebrate my husband's birthday and we had tickets to Springsteen on Broadway.  The Pearl is the perfect location.  Just a few blocks from Times Square, Broadway and many outstanding restaurants.  The hotel is clean, well maintained and the staff is so accomodating.

title: Great location, Great hotel, Great stay
text:
I stayed here in April 18 with my husband and teenage daughter. We were looking for a reasonably priced hotel in a great location with good sized rooms and peace and quiet at night - and that is exactly what this hotel offers - and more !.
The hotel is situated just off Times square (about a 5 min walk) on a quiet side street - which is ideal. The rooms are (we had a classic double) spacious, clean and comfortable and there is plenty of storage for all of your stuff. The room has an iron and ironing board, a free safe, a small cooler fridge a microwave and a coffee maker - everything you could wish for.
The bathroom is quite big with a huge walk in power shower, lots of lovely toiletries provided and a powerful hairdryer (you don't need to bring your own).
The beds are comfy and the hotel is quiet and peaceful at night - we never heard anyone else in their room or any noise in the corridors.
The hotel serves continental breakfast in the mornings (7-10am) and we all thought this was great - toast, boiled eggs, pastries, cereal, fruit, yoghurts,bagels, apple/orange  juice tea and coffee - everything that you need to set you up for the day.
The hotel staff were all kind and attentive and were more than happy to answer any of our queries and told us the best places to visit and gave us direction of how to get there.
In the afternoon between 4 and 5pm the hotel put on complimentary wine, fruit, cheese and biscuits/ crisps etc - and on the occasions we found ourselves near the hotel at this time we popped in for a drink and it was a lovely relaxing time and the complimentary food - kept us going until dinner later on.
If you are visiting New York and want a small, friendly, clean and brilliantly located hotel - with fantastic helpful staff - then this for you, it was absolutely perfect for us and we had an amazing time New York.

title: Good Service and Civility at this great hotel!
text: The Pearl is a real find -- right in the heart of Theater District -- right across the Street from the Book of Morman and right next door to Chicago! We had a room on the 6th floor. It was clean, quiet, well appointed with many amenities and a bath that was luxurious and enviable. The staff could not have been nicer or more helpful -- and we asked for a lot of help! A lovely lounge was the venue for breakfasts and daily wine  receptions at tea time. It made me think I was in Europe. When they discovered it was my birthday, the staff sent up a bottle of wine along with sparkling cider in case we didn't drink alcohol!  I couldn't recommend The Pearl more highly -- we had a wonderful stay.

title: Hotel elegante, pulito e in ottima posizione a Times Square
text: L'hotel si trova in 49 strada, di fianco all'Ambassador Theathre. Un hotel che si presenta molto bene già dalla hall, molto elegante e comoda con divani e poltrone. Il personale è gentilissimo (stanza prenotata con check-in alle 16.00, ma chiavi consegnate già alle 12.00) e disponibile. Ascensori veloci e grandi. I piani non hanno tantissime camere, ma sono molto spaziose e dotate di tutti i comfort. Letto comodo. Bagno piccolino (in proporzione), ma doccia molto grande. Unica pecca (comune a tanti hotel) è il rumore delle altre stanze o dei corridoi, che non viene isolato. Hotel in cui sono capitato "per caso", ma nel quale ritornerò di certo visto la bellissima esperienza.

title: Great Experience
text: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights last week. We had a deluxe king that over looked the theater directly across the street from the hotel entrance on 49th. Our room was very large and very clean. It was nice and quiet in our room even with it being on the third floor. Hotel is very convenient to Times Square, multiple theaters, and just a short walk to 5th Ave. We loved the location. All employees were nice and helpful. They even helped us with the nearby subway and directions. Lastly, the first night we arrived late and the door man directed us to the gastro pub next 2 doors down, Lillie’s. We enjoyed the drinks and appetizers. We returned a few nights for after dinner drinks. Overall, I can’t wait to return and will definitely stay at The Pearl!

title: The Pearl is a gem in the heart of Broadway theatre district
text:
We stayed 15 nights at The Pearl on our third trip to NYC. Ideally located in the theatre district, it is only minutes away from every Broadway show. Rooms are clean, modern and well-maintained. All staff were friendly, helpful and courteous.

The free breakfast was never boring, with a variety of breads, pastries, cereals, fruit, eggs and juices. The free wifi worked flawlessly throughout our stay.There is an all-day guest lounge with fresh coffee and snacks. At 4 pm every day, all guests are welcome to the free wine and cheese.

title: A Gem!
text: Just got back from a weekend trip to celebrate my husband's birthday. I had picked The Pearl after reading multiple reviews online. It's tucked in the middle of the West 49th  block, right in the heart of the theater district and a block from the subway.  Despite this our room was mainly quiet,  and we experienced little noise from either outside or inside the hotel. The decor is sophisticated, and everything felt fresh and clean. They use L'occitane bath products, and the room appointments were luxurious. We had a deluxe king room which was spacious by NYC standards. The staff went above and beyond to make our stay special, and were friendly and knowledgeable. They have snacks and chilled water in the lobby and a wine & cheese hour in the afternoon (which we never took advantage of). It was nice to stay at a smaller place that never felt crowded - a small oasis in the midst of the city.  I would definitely stay here again- it was a treat!.

title: As an unexpected Pearl, very good surprise
text:
Very nice hotel, with room nice kept and good services. Central with Time Square by a few blocks as well as Central park, Guggenheim Museum and so on...... 
50 street subway station direct to JFK. It will ease NYC discovery and save you a few bucks

title: Will return !
text: Clean comfortable stay with great service. Free wifi. Free snacks 24/7 coffee tea etc and free happy hour (wine/ cheese fruit) every evening. Great stay! Also great location right in the theatre district area.

title: Wonderful surprise. Great staff
text: What a wonderful surprise. The location is perfect, the rooms well kept and a bit bigger than the typical NY botique hotel but what made the experience so great was the staff-especially Joey at the front desk. All staff were helpful and considerate but Joey was terrific.

title: Great Hotel
text: The Pearl is perfect for any trip to NYC. Location just steps away from heart of Times Square yet the hotel is tucked away on a relatively quiet street. The service was great and hotel staff was attentive.  We had a great family trip largely due to The Pearl.

title: Perfect all around
text:
Spacious, very clean rooms, courteous staff and a great location. Great free breakfast.
Free WiFi, walking distance to Times Square and to Broadway theatres. Very safe area and less expensive than other hotels.

title: Ótima localização
text: Adoramos ficar nesse hotel, limpo, bem localizado, café da manhã gostoso! Super bom o custo beneficio! Caso voltar pra NY ficaremos denovo nesse hotel! Lugar sempre movimentado, fizemos muitas coisas à pé e tem um restaurante bem em frente italiano que é super bom!

title: Excelente ubicación y servicio
text: El hotel está ubicado a pocos metros de todo. El desayuno está muy bueno y el personal muy servicial. Ideal para la temporada de frío ya que caminando muy poco se llega a todos lados. 3 subtes a una cuadra.

title: Great midtown location.
text:
So nice to have found a reasonably priced hotel in midtown with quiet, spacious and well appointed rooms.  Comfortable bed, nice shower, krup coffee maker and fridge made for a nice stay.

Hotel is in the theater district (Eugene O'Neill theater is across the street, and the Ambassador is steps away) and a short walk to Times Square, though without the hectic noise and commotion.  Heading north, Central Park is a quick jog away as is the fabulous shopping on fifth avenue.

I will definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent Hotel!
text: We spend two nights at the Pearl Hotel based on reviews on tripadvisor.  The Hotel was fantastic!  We enjoyed our stay very much.  From the friendly staff, cleanliness, great location, and comfortable bed, we could not have asked for more.  Bonuses included the continental breakfast which was perfect for us, the wine and cheese hour everyday was a very nice touch when you want a break from the city noise.  We highly recommend this hotel and it will be our go to hotel when we visit the city again.  We could not have picked a better place!

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: Fabulous hotel, beautiful room, and great service.  Nice little restaurant attached to lobby.  Good location near theatre district; walking distance to Central Park, and Times Square.  Would highly recommend.

title: Buon albergo
text:
Posizione super centrale con fermata metro a pochi metri.
L'hotel dall'esterno non dice molto (la via in cui si trova non è particolarmente bella), sicuramente andrebbe valorizzato, stesso discorso per la hall.
La camera (king deluxe) è ampia, buona la pulizia..il bagno abbastanza spazioso e piacevole (anche se non mi è piaciuta la vasca con la tenda).
ho apprezzato la colazione, piuttosto varia e sempre rifornita con bagel, cupcake, macedonia..
nel complesso quindi un buon hotel, anche se x il prezzo abbastanza alto mi sarei forse aspettata qualcosina in piu'.

title: Super hotel
text:
Hotel très bien situé sur la 49ème rue, à 3 min de Time Square. Plusieurs lignes de métro à 3 min. 
Les chambres sont spacieuses, très propres et très calmes. La literie est très bonne et le ménage est fait tous les jours. Il y a un petit coin cuisine avec une machine à café/thé, un évier et un frigo. 
Un petit déjeuner est proposé gratuitement. Il y a l'essentiel et notamment salade de fruits fraiche.
Le personnel est aimable et disponible pour des conseils ou des réservations de taxi ou autre.
Je recommande cet hotel sans hésitation et nous y retournerons si nous devons revenir à New-York

title: Lovely hotel brilliant location
text: Love this hotel. We had a large room which was great. Hotel spotless and comfy. The wine & cheese and breakfast are included and very welcoming. Brilliant location just off time square but very quiet. A brilliant pub a couple of doors away. Would definitely stay here again

title: 1st class visit
text:
Having loved our stay at The Pearl on our last visit, when we knew we were returning to New York, there was only 1 place to stay.
We arrived on the early flight from the UK, getting to the hotel at around 2pm, fully expecting our room not to be ready yet, but the hotel were happy to find us a room that was ready and we were able to check straight in.
The included breakfast each morning is fantastic.  There are a decent number of choices and all we needed to start our day.  Yes there are not any hot options, but the selection of pastries, bagels, toast, cereals, fruit, yoghurts are more than enough for a great continental style breakfast - plus this is included in the room price so an absolute bargain.
We only made it to wine hour once as we were so busy, but this is another great addition.
The hotel's location is perfect for exploring, right in the middle of Times Square, but as soon as you step inside, you feel as though you are miles away.
We loved our stay here and we will definitely stay again next time we are in New York.

title: Supert hotell, sentral beliggenhet
text: Tilbrakte 6 netter på hotellet. Frokost med frukt, bagels og tebrød. Veldig hyggelig personale. Litt smale senger (i hvert fall på vårt rom), men vi reiser jo ikke til NYC for å sove ;) Kan anbefales.

title: Kiva hotelli hyvällä sijainnilla !
text:
Nastalla paikalla lähellä Times Square:a kiva hotelli. Myös metroasemat lähellä ja liikkuminen siksi näppärää.
Aamiainen on ”normiUSAaamiainen” : kahvia, paahtista, muroja, hedelmäsalaattia, keitettyjämunia etc. - päivästä päivään tuntuu olevan identtinen. 
Huone siisti, mutta alkaa olla hieman nuhjaantuneen tuntuinen!
Kaiken kaikkiaan ihan positiivinen kokemus - ystävällinen henkilökunta ansaitsee maininnan !

title: Sophisticated boutique hotel near Times Square
text: We were perfectly satisfied of this very clean and modern hotel situated vis-a-vis the "Book of Mormon"-theater. Its friendly staff make you feel welcome at any time of the day. Only the breakfast could be better.

title: Excellent location
