text: We loved our stay at this hotel. The location is excellent. We saved money because of the complimentary daily breakfast (and it was excellent). The decor is upscale and comfortable. We booked a Superior Queen-Queen Suite. It had a separate sitting area with a sofa. We were disappointed/surprised when we discovered that the sofa was not a bed. Other than that, we thought the hotel was terrific.

title: Definitely a pearl in the middle of Manhattan!
text:
I took my 16-year-old daughter and 2 of her friends to celebrate her bday.  We had a queen suite, so the girls could stay in 2 queens in the main room, and I stayed in the sitting room on the sofa bed.  The arrangement worked out really well - some privacy but we didn't need to get a separate room, which I didn't really want to do in NYC.

The room was spacious, with a refrigerator and microwave.  There are free snacks in the lobby and on the second floor 24 hours a day - what a nice feature.  Basic but nice - chips, apples, water.  The free breakfast is not hot but offers cereal, croissants, yogurt, fruit, bagels, juices, coffee and tea.  Sufficient and a nice perk for NYC.

The location was AMAZING.  Literally less than a minute walk to see Chicago, across the street from another show, and surrounded by the theaters.  And lots of restaurants and stores.  The room was really quiet - you would never know you were in the heart of the theater district.

The gym is small but has the basics.  There was only 1 person there each of the 3 times I went.  

The hotel staff was very nice.  Helpful and courteous.  

I will definitely stay here again.  And I booked my reservation a little later than I had intended (especially for President's Day weekend) and many other places were booked.  I was able to book here, and it was the best choice, and particularly with the room type we had.  Even with just my husband or our whole family with 2 rooms, I'll stay here again.

title: Great hotel in the heart of Times Square
text: Loved The Pearl! This hotel is in the heart of Times Square across the street across from the Eugene O'Neill Theatre. It was surprisingly quiet! We stayed over a Saturday night and there was nothing problem with noise and we were on the street side. The front desk staff were friendly and kind. We (a family of 4) we're upgraded to a Deluxe suite and were able to check in early! The room was well appointed and clean. MOST COMFORTABLE BED EVER! The Deluxe had a small sitting area with a pull out couch. The bathroom had a lovely spa tub and separate shower with rain shower. The complimentary toiletries included l'Occitaine items and bath salts. The Deluxe had a small kitchenette area. The one small drawback is the happy hour and breakfast area is small. The happy hour was wiped out on Saturday by 4:30 but the breakfast club was varied and plentiful. Would most definitely stay here again!

title: Muito aconchegante
text: Boa localização a poucas quadras da Times Square e de grandes teatros. Muitos restaurantes e metro próximo. Equipe atenciosa e educada. Café da amanhã apesar de ser repetido todos os dias era bem gostoso.

title: Amazing hotel!!
text:
The pearl is set in a great location without the noise and hustle of Times Square. It’s close to all major attractions and places to visit, the staff all brilliant and it’s like a big family! With tips on places to visit, fine dining and what or where to avoid (juniors restaurant) horrible! A special mention to the door staff and William in particular who remembered us from our last stay. The pearl can’t do enough for you from ordering transfers, Courtesy umbrellas when the weather was bad, and even a nice bottle of red in the room for my fiancé’s birthday as a surprise when we returned after a day exploring the city! Excellent fresh help yourself breakfast each morning, which sets the day up perfectly. I wouldn’t stay anywhere else in manhattan, and cannot wait to return. 

Danny johnson

title: Fabulous!
text: Lovely hotel, rooms were immaculate, clean and well presented. Staff were helpful and friendly, especially William and Joe? (Can’t remember his name but was on the front desk) gave us complimentary umbrellas, tips on where to visit and eat and booked our taxi transfers to the airport. Food was great! Good selection and all freshly made, wine & cheese hour was also a lovely touch! Would highly recommend to all!

title: A Pearl in the Big Apple
text: This hotel is wonderful!  Accommodating, immaculate and a great location!  Walking distance to everything! Rooms are spacious with nice complimentary breakfast and Happy Hour! The staff is so friendly and helpful! This was my second visit and I will be back again whenever I visit NYC!

title: Hotel similar à casa da gente
text: Estivemos em janeiro passado nesse hotel e nos sentimos acolhidos como família. Apartamento muito confortável, com walk closet, cama confortável e destaque especial para o banheiro com produtos L'Occitane. O café da manhã excelente com diversos tipos de pães, sucos, iogurtes, frutas. Além do café, no final da tarde o hotel oferece um happy hour a seus hóspedes com vinhos de qualidade e diversos salgados para acompanhar. Espetacular. Os hóspedes se sentem em casa e contam Ainda com a delicadeza e competência dos funcionários. Nota dez pro hotel.

title: Great location, great pricing, great rooms, great people
text: This hotel is highly recommended, particularly for downtown NYC which tends to have either low quality / dirty rooms or overpriced for not much... The Pearl soars high above the others. Firstly, its in a fabulous area - directly in between Times Square and Rockefeller Center, so there's plenty to walk to (restaurants, bars, attractions, shows). Great pricing for the weekend and a really nice sized room. Very clean, great breakfast.  Nice work everyone! We'll def be back.

title: Never fails us!
text:
This was our 5th stay at The Pearl, having first stayed there 2 weeks after it opened and then yearly each Feb for a conference nearby.  Each time we return, I hope that we will still be pleased with the shape of the hotel.  I'm pretty sure this place has great management because the place still looks the same as the day it opened.  Modern, clean spaces that look very new.  

Let's start with the location.  Truth be told, I am so done with Times Square.  Do my best to avoid it actually, and it is only a 30 sec walk down the street.  Funny though, this is a very quiet block and you do not feel as if you are so close to the madness of Times Square.  We love this location because of its proximity to the theater district.  It is so nice to be able to quickly walk home from our shows.  Another bonus is how close it is to the endless great restaurant options along 9th Ave/Hell's Kitchen.  This hotel is within a 5 minute walk of nearly every single subway line.  So easy to get all over the city from here.

Now, for the staff.  Every single staff member we interacted with was super friendly and helpful.  Their staff seems to be really happy.  Again- must be good management.  And some of the folks have been working there since our first visit years ago.  From the doorman to the front desk staff, to the nice folks who stock the breakfast and wine reception- all very nice people.

Our room was in great shape.  Clean as it could be.  No spots on the furniture or marks on the carpeting.  It truly still looks brand new.  The bathroom experience is a good one by NY hotel standards.  Great L'Occitane toiletries and super soft, thick, cushy towels.  Great shower as well.  There are only 8 rooms on each Floor, making this a nice, quiet hotel.  About the only thing we heard from our room was the occasional ambulance and the whirrr of the elevator which was nearby.  We got 4 good nights' sleep.
The included breakfast is such a nice feature.  Great bagels, muffins, toast, cereals, yogurt, fresh cut fruit, juices and good coffee- all served in a nice room overlooking the "Book Of Mormon" theater, which is directly across the street from the hotel.

 From 4-5 they offer a complimentary wine and cheese hour which is just a great touch if you happen to be back at the hotel during this time frame.  Good wines and some nice snacks.  Another thing we love about the hotel is the water dispenser and free snacks in the lobby.  The water has orange slices floating in it and is delicious!  So nice not to have to buy bottled water for the room.  The bags of chips are also appreciated.
We are so glad that we found this boutique hotel.  It is an oasis of calm in the midst of a busy city.  See ya next year "The Pearl!"

title: The Pearl Has It All
text: Great location,wonderful accommodating staff, large, comfortable, clean rooms; free continental breakfast and wine and cheese hour. The Pearl is in an excellent location and we loved our stay. The Pearl is a Gem!

title: Très bien
text:
Chambre propre et agréable tout confort. On peut se faire un café ou un thé. Il y a même des peignoirs et un parapluie à disposition. Literie confortable, grand lit.
Petit déjeuner est un peu décevant par rapport aux confitures sans goût et manque du fromage frais et charcuterie,

title: Fantastic place in Times Square
text: This a fantastic place in the centre of it all. According to some lovely American couples that visit it, The Pearl has large rooms, enough breakfast and wine and cheese every afternoon at 4.00 pm. A lot of Hotels in Times Square don't have these so its something to think about when choosing an Hotel. The staff can't do enough for you. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone. If you are a foody, a Theatre goer, the hotel has it all nearby. Thank you the Pearl Hotel.

title: Good value for money
text: The hotel is really well located and it is indeed a good value for your money. The room is not huge but is kind of big for NY. Ours had a microwave, fridge and coffee machine which made the room a little bigger. My mom booked a different kind of room and it was smaller than ours. The bathroom is petite but served the purpose. Really good shower with tub, and the water got very hot (which is important during winter). But don’t worry, it also gets very cold, so it won’t be a problem during summer. They had l’occitane products in the bathroom, which were daily replaced. Staff was very polite. There was this frontman married to a Brazilian that was specially kind to us (we are Brazilians). The breakfast is good, with fruits, breads, croissant, hard boiled eggs, American coffee, yogurt and other things. It was not huge but for NYC pattern I found it very pleasant. Just be aware that the breakfast lounge is not very big, with just 6 tables and depending on the time you get up, you’ll need to sit on one of the couches. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay and recommend the hotel.

title: The Pearl is THE BEST Hotel in Midtown, (and at a great price)!!
text:
My wife and I just returned from a six night stay at the Pearl, and it was the best hotel we've stayed at in all of New York City.  It's a boutique hotel with 14 floors.  They had a free continental breakfast each morning (better than many), free wine and cheese each afternoon, and free coffee/tea/snacks available all day/night.

The location is perfect!  If you want to avoid taxis, Ubers, and the Subway, stay here to see everything in Midtown.  One block off Broadway, three blocks from Times Square, ~four blocks to Rockefeller Plaza, within 1-2 blocks of SO many theaters all of the great restaurants on restaurant row, 5 blocks to 5th Avenue shopping, and ~5 blocks to the SW corner of Central Park.  You can seriously explore DAYS of Manhattan without the need for any type of transportation beyond your own legs.  An added bonus for being so close to everything is that you're in the middle of a quiet side street, so you don't get as much street noise as you would staying directly on Broadway.

The service was unmatched.  Check-in was fast and friendly, and we were given a free upgraded room.  ALL staff were friendly and professional, there's 24 hour security (door man), and when my wife had an unexpected health issue that delayed our return flight, Dan and the front desk staff were understanding, gracious, allowed us to stay the extra nights we needed (in the upgraded room for our original discounted price), and offered to provide assistance in any way needed.  I was seriously blown away by their hospitality throughout our stay. 

In my opinion this is an upscale hotel, but with mid-range pricing.  What we received was amazing for the price we paid.  We will stay at this hotel every time we return to the heart of NYC!!

title: Great Location..Fine Hotel
text:
You can't beat this location if you are in the city to see the city center, attend anything on Broadway or to eat in any of the fine establishments in the Times Square area!
The staff is always helpful and pleasant.  We had a 2 room suite that was modern, clean and roomy.  Three adults shared this space for 3 nights and it worked so well.  We had plenty of storage space, the beds were very comfortable, especially the one in the pull out sofa  (not something you expect)!  Two of us had room service one night and it arrived so quickly we were shocked!!  Oh, our room was very quiet too!  
They provide a light breakfast and a wine and cheese early evening event every day.
Would recommend this hotel to anyone and have!!  Watch for their special rates...would make a nice gift for someone special  This is a small hotel which is why I like it!
While we were all adults, I watched the staff go the extra mile to get a young boy juice so that he had a drink other than flavored water during the wine hour.  They also offered advice on things the young boy might enjoy doing that evening in the city.  This attention is found in small B&B's and in this small hotel.

title: A gem
text:
Nice hotel, near everything and with very nice & helpful people (a special thanks to Julissa - I hope I got the name right).

It really has everything for an enjoyable stay. I would not take the chance to try something else.

title: Hotel central e receptivo
text: O hotel é muito bem localizado, com equipe muito prestativa. Café da manhã justo e petiscos à tarde, com chá, café, vinho, queijos e frutas. É um ótimo por stop antes dos programas noturnos. Quarto amplo e limpo.

title: Lovely hotel in theater district
text: Fantastic little hotel in Theater District/Times Square (across from the Eugene O'Neill Theatre). Our room was clean, roomy, and quiet.  Ahhhh.  Breakfast included, plus mini fridge, microwave and Keurig coffee maker in the room. And a wonderful touch-- snacks in the lobby! The hotel staff went out of their way to welcome us, and make our stay super comfy.  Short walk to our theaters, Central Park, Hell's Kitchen, and subways. I would absolutely recommend the Pearl Hotel, we had a wonderful, restful stay!

title: Wonderful hotel in a great location
text:
We just got back from the US having visited New York and Boston.  For our week in NYC we stayed at The Pearl Hotel. From the minute we arrived it couldn't have been better.  Our room with twin queen beds was equipped with tv & radio but also with a coffee machine and fridge.  We had requested a quiet room and whilst we didn't have much of a view as it overlooked other buildings it was quieter than being on the main street.

Breakfast was a continental style with fresh fruit, pastries, bagels, croissants, assorted yoghurts, cheeses, juices, porridge, cereals, coffee, tea and other hot drinks.  Its a self-service and you can take what you want.  A great range and wide choice.  Every afternoon from 4-5 the hotel serves snacks and wine in the upstairs lobby - a great idea and well supported.  

The staff were attentive, friendly and helpful, arranging tickets or taxis as needed.  Nothing seemed to be too much trouble.  Our room was serviced every day with coffee and towels replaced regularly.  There is a safe in the room which offers the ability for you to keep your valuables safe without the need to deposit in the hotels deposit boxes.  

We were on the 6th floor and were very happy that we had requested a quiet room.  The hotel is virtually on Broadway with a theatre directly opposite and another about 100 yards down the road.  On show nights the street was particularly busy and noisy though the rooms are well sound proofed, you cannot keep the noise of sirens out and in particular the loud sounds made by the fire engines.  New York certainly is a city that never sleeps, but you soon get passed the sounds of the city and we found The Pearl hotel to be in a great location for getting all over the city - Fifth Avenue is 2 city blocks away, Central Park a little further and lower manhattan is just a subway ride away.  There is a subway on 50th street so very nearby.

Can't say anything bad about this Hotel.

title: Ótima surpresa
text: Localizado a 2 quarteirões da Times Square, esse hotel é limpo, organizado, com quartos enormes e café da manhã (simples e honesto) incluído na conta. Preço mais do que justo, e atendentes super educados. Voltaremos sem dúvida.

title: Très bel hôtel à Times Square
text:
Tout est bien
Chambres grandes, silencieuses malgré la proximité de Broadway avenue.
Service parfait
Chambre propre
Petit déjeuner américain en libre service... mais correct
Nous avons passé un très bon séjour

title: Very central hotel
text: The Hotel Pearl was a very nice hotel in the center of Manhattan, opposite a music theatre. Everything in the room was in order. They could charge for the breakfast and serve a bigger choice of food. There was a small problem with the bathroom flooding, but they fixed it immediately,

title: The Pearl Hotel
text:
Very centrally located, lovely rooms. Very quiet,  wine and cheese every afternoon on the 2nd level.  Very nice continental breakfast.
Very caring staff - my first night I had a bout of sickness from eating contaminated food and the staff checked on me frequently.

title: Beautiful boutique hotel right in the heart of Times Square
text: Stay in this hotel every year because it’s right in the heart of Times Square and it’s not a large chain hotel and it’s away from Broadway itself.  The lounge and rooms are extremely clean.  They provide very nice toiletry items that you can actually enjoy and want to take home.  They have complimentary snacks and coffee/tea in the lounge 24 hrs.  They have decent complimentary continental breakfast (~ 6-10am) and wine/cheese hours (4-5pm) as well which is decent.  Didn’t use the restaurant there.

title: What a great find
text: We booked the Pearl for New Year's Weekend having never stayed there before and we're so glad we did. The staff was phenomenal, so attentive and knowledgeable. What a great location, easy to get around. The second floor common area was a great place for breakfast and to watch the street activity with a glass of wine they provided at night.  The room was all you can expect, clean, comfortable and roomy. The restaurant Lillie's was next door and it is a great place to eat and also has great caring staff. These will be my "GoTo" places from now on..

title: Location Location
text: Thank you Pearl Hotel. We enjoyed our stay. The staff were wonderful. Free breakfast. Everything is walking distance. We were there for 3 days to watch Broadway and walking in freezing cold helps that hotel is nearby everything. Center or time square and theater district. The hotel is super clean which is A+ modern and not too busy.

title: New Years 2018
text: Absolutely fantastic hotel and staff, we have stayed in hotels all over the world and the Pearl rates as one of our best. Great location just off time square, big rooms, breakfast included that was fine, and a team that are friendly and efficient. We will be back thanks The Pearl and team.

title: Fabulous New Year
text: From the moment we checked in our experience at the Pearl was faultless. My husband and I travel a lot and usually stay in large 5 star hotels but chose the Pearl for location for Time Square New Year. Room was large and we'll equipped, breakfast was simple but great. Service was exceptional and even though they don't have a concierge, all staff are very helpful. They New us by name and were very personal.  Highly recommended, we'll come back.

title: A hidden gem
text:
My 16 year old daughter and I JUST got back from a four day, three night stay at the Pearl for our annual trip to the city.  This is the FIRST time we strayed from our normal Marriott hotels, my husband travels a good amount and we are silver reward members.  Not really knowing the smaller hotels and the lesser known chains, I have always been reluctant to stray from the tried and true Marriott.  This time, not because I was unhappy with Marriott, but because I wanted something different, I decided to book into the Pearl (literally the day before our trip)...we were not disappointed, in fact, we were so delighted with the customer service, that it is now our go-to hotel choice.  The delights:  The staff.  Out of habit, when we first got there around 3:00, we dropped off our bags and went down to the restaurant for some light snacks and hot chocolate.  While we were there, the doorman came into the restaurant, noticed we didn't have the 10% discount card that we received at check in (I didn't even see it) and then told us to avoid paying for it and just go the second floor lounge.  (thanks for going the extra step to save us money, we didn't pay for hot drinks at the hotel the rest of the trip...unlike Marriott where we would end up with a pretty hefty room charge bill at the end of the stay).  The breakfast was good.  We're not huge breakfast eaters, so we appreciated having our bagels, yogurt, granola and fruit available for free rather than going to Dunkin to get it.  Again, it adds up.  If you're a big breakfast eater, you won't find this free spead adequate...but when we are in the city, we gotta have our NY bagels.  The room was good.  We were on the 8th floor in a deluxe king room (we shared a bed).   It would have been nice to have a chair other than the desk chair, but we really weren't in the room much.  It was quiet.  Let's be real though, you're in NYC, there's traffic noise in NYC.  We found this location to be much quieter than our usual location closer to Times Square.  Noise from other rooms, and inside the hotel was non-existent.  For the first time, my daughter and I both had a very restful sleep our first night, which never happens.  We credit the incredible comfortable beds.  
The bathroom is well appointed.  I appreciated the blow dryer, and the make up mirror.  The shower was a little confusing, but the water pressure was AMAZING.  

Housekeeping:  This was one thing the really delighted me vs. the Marriott.  Our typical schedule has us getting up early, spending several hours outside our room and then coming back for a bit of break around 3.  With the larger hotels, many times we would come back to an unmade room.  For some reason, this bugs me.  When we left, we put out the "please make up room" sign on the door, and every time, without fail, our room was immaculate when we came back.  Ahhh.  Loved it.  

As far as the decor of the hotel, it's not terribly fancy, but it is on par with the chain hotels we are used to.  It was very comfortable in design.  For me, the staff at this place is what puts it over the top.  Seriously.  Every single staff member went out of their way to make us feel welcome and they made us feel like they were happy we were there.  On our first night, after dinner, we came home early after a long day of travel.  Before retiring to our room, we decided to get some tea at the lounge.  We took seats at the window to watch the crowds let out at Book of Mormon across the street.  We were tired, and a bit out of it, and when I looked down to the door below, there was our friendly doorman jumping up and down and waving to us...giving us a good laugh.  I truly appreciate this hotels willingness to allow their staff to be a bit "goofy" to make the experience more fun.  While every team member was impeccably professional, I so enjoyed this experience as well as another door man blowing a whistle and pretending to direct foot traffic outside of the hotel.  

In any city, this place would be a fun place to stay...in New York, this is a hidden gem.  We loved it, and we will most certainly be back again.

title: One Good Pearl is worth more than all the rest!
text: So pleasantly surprised were we with our stay at The Pearl the week before Christmas, that it has become my new favorite hotel in the theater district. We booked just a few days before travel, and i knew I wanted to be in this area - close to the dining in Hell's Kitchen - accessible to Broadway - and not too far from the rest of Midtown. This place is in a perfect location: One block from Broadway, across the street from the Eugene O'Neil Theater, a block and a half to the Metro.  The lobby is small, but the staff is delightful - friendly and always available. Citrus infused water and snacks were constantly available. The included breakfast is adequate, okay nice, okay nicer that I'm not paying an additional $15.95 per person for coffee and danish! (This breakfast is more than that, but you've been to places that charge up to $20 a person for bad pastries and juice. This is perfect: enough to start your day, and everything was fresh.  We never were in the property during the afternoon "wine and cheese" reception.  Our room was a deluxe King (501), and directly overlooked the marquis for Book of Mormon. I was concerned about street noise at this level, but never once heard any traffic or disturbances. Nor did we hear any sounds from inside the hotel - it is soundproofed well.  The room was appointed very well, clean (my wife is a neat freak on hotels), and the bath was lovely. My one special request was very quickly fulfilled.  I have found that the nicest of properties can be spoiled by a poor staff. The Pearl is a gem with a very well trained team of folks. We will be back.

title: We spent a week there for the Christmas Holidays from Austria.
text:
We spent a week there for the Christmas Holidays from Austria. Great hotel and great location. The rooms are spacious, the bed is comfy. 
We especially loved the afternoon snack with some wine.
If there is any possibility to come back in the future, we will definitely choose this hotel again.

title: Great location
text: Hotel is in a fabulous location just off Times Square. Breakfast is included in the price which is varied and plentiful from 7am to 10am. There is complimentary cheese and wine tasting every day from 4pm to 5pm for hotel guests. Staff helpful and friendly.

title: Great location
text: The hotel has great location and the rooms are of decent size. Everything functions perfectly (shower, cleaning, aircon) so nothing to really complain about. With the location comes a price but that is in-line with neighbouring hotels. Breakfast is pretty light (prepare to have another one outside) but also that seems to be a NY hotel thing. Overall good experience - nothing too fancy but very functional.

title: Best Hidden Gem
text:
My husband and I and daughter and boyfriend were here for 5 nights.  The place was wonderful! Right around the corner from Times Square, Radio City Music Hall and Rockefeller Center.  50th street subway is around the corner too.  Rooms were huge with a small refrigerator, microwave, kureig coffeemaker with 4 coffees and even a tv in the bathroom!  Front desk were always friendly, doormen were friendly and booked our ride back to JFK which was only $70.  Breakfast has muffins, bagels, Danish, fruit, oatmeal, toast, cereal, boiled eggs, juices, coffee, tea and hot chocolate. More than plenty to get you going. Coffee, hot chocolate, tea, water, chips and cookies are available 24 hours a day.
This hotel is small, I think only about 90 rooms so we did not have to wait for the elevators at all and we only had 4 rooms on our side when got off the elevator.
I had called the hotel direct to book  and talked to Darrin. He was great. Our kids graduated college this past Saturday and after we checked in on Monday and went out and came back, the hotel had put a bottle of Champagne in the room with a note congratulating the kids!

title: Good hotel but nothing special
text: I did not fall in love with this hotel, and felt that it was overpriced for the experience. Pros: It has a fantastic location in the theater district, right in the heart of things. Check in was quick and easy.  The bedroom was clean and comfortable, the bathroom roomy for New York and up-to-date. L'Occitaine products are nice.  The blackout curtains are great for blocking early morning light. Wi-fi was included, and the room had a mini fridge, a microwave, and a Keurig coffee maker. They let us check out a little late, which we appreciated. Cons: The thermostat was not turned on in our room when we arrived, which we didn't realize until the middle of the night when we were freezing, but it worked fine after that. We were on the 14th floor but the street noise was terrible. This surprised me, as other reviewers tout the quiet of the rooms, which is a big reason I chose the hotel. But I found it hard to sleep with the Times Square street noise coming through the window. The 2nd floor cafe area is bland and small - I have stayed at Holiday Inn Expresses with more character. The included continental breakfast is pretty much all carbs, with some fruit and limited yogurt selection. Again, better at Holiday Inn Express or Hilton Garden Inn. The coffee/hot water comes from a push-button machine. The entry to the hotel is similarly spare, even at holiday season. It just didn't have the feel of an upscale boutique hotel, which is what I was hoping for.

title: Flott hotell
text: Flott hotell med særdeles god service fra alle som jobber der. Sentral beliggenhet i hjertet av New York. Om du vil bo i «gryta» så er dette plassen. Området blir litt for mye turist for min smak. Neste gang vil vi bo i Meatpacking/SoHo. Små rom, men dette er vanlig i NY så kan ikke forvente mer. Hotellet kan anbefales :-)

title: A little bit of Europe
text: Great hotel - helpful, professional staff, free breakfast was "continental plus" with fresh fruit, yogurt, and hard-boiled eggs in addition to breads & cereals. Room was standard (large) American style room, but windows could be opened (slanted in) for outside air to circulate, and thus room was not musty and stale (unlike so many other hotels). Towels and sheets had no strong odor, so almost no bleach/clorox or perfume/fragrance. Overall, solid value for a very nice experience.

title: Reasonable pricing/ Good basic hotel in Theatre District
text: last minute travel and needed reasonable rates ( sky high  NY rates  for my usual go to hotels for my date of travel... so tried the Pearl.  )Theatre District not far from Times Square. Very clean. Simple Decor--room a bit dark--dark walls and decor---bathroom modern updated fixtures.  Very reasonable rate. Easy check in and no noise issues.  So for a good price a good night sleep in a clean hotel.

title: Great location
text: Good hotel close to time square and Central Park. The bathroom was lovely and new and the beds comfy. Our room was on the 4th floor and quite noisy. The breakfast was very basic with limited choice. Staff were all friendly. Would recommend if you are not planning on staying too much in the room.

title: Simply perfect hotel for our NYC stay
text: My daughter and I visited NYC for her 16th birthday. It was a first time trip to the city for both of us. I simply cannot say enough about how fabulous this hotel is; beautiful room, perfect location, wine and cheese hour and breakfast every day. The staff was the BEST part, Juliette at the reception desk was always so very helpful and such a great guide when we had questions about navigating the city. The doorman was so very friendly and helpful. The entire staff was always polite and willing to give advice. Our room was spacious and quiet, we were surprised by how little city noise we heard. The location is perfect, just around the corner from Times Square, right next to and across from fabulous theaters and restaurants. I was nervous about safety during this trip since it was just the two of us and had never been to the city, but we felt safe the whole time we were in the area near our hotel. We plan to return to NYC and will plan to stay w the Pearl every time. I can't imagine a better experience then we had at this fantastic hotel!!

title: Lovely boutique hotel that's close to everything!
text: This is an absolutely lovely boutique hotel!  We stayed for a week during Thanksgiving/Black Friday and the hotel is located next to everything:  shopping, subway, tourist sites, Starbucks and the Eugene O'Neill theatre (that's currently playing the Book of Mormons)!  We stayed in a suite (which was a very large room) and the hotel offers a free continental breakfast every morning from 7:00am - 10:00am (11?) that consists of muffins, danishes, bagels, yogurt, cold cereal, packaged oatmeal, toast, coffee, tea and hot chocolate.  Staff are very friendly.  When we had trouble with the fire alarm in our room (it kept beeping due to a low battery), the attendant came up to our room within 5 minutes to fix it.  I would definitely stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it to others.  What I found slightly odd, was that this hotel doesn't 'celebrate Christmas' (that is, no Christmas tree was in the lobby ... no wreath, no string of garland ... no sign of 'Christmas spirit' at this hotel.  It's not a turnoff, just noticeable).  Guys ... at least put out a poinsettia plant!  Something!

title: Location
text: Ett bra hotell med rena fina och tysta hotellrum. Personalen är bra och läget fantastiskt. Det enda som kunde förbättras är frukosten som är lite fantasilös men den löser starten på dagen. Hotellet ligger p gångavstånd till det mesta och väldigt nära till Times Square men ändå på en tyst och lugn gata. Vi bodde i ett vanligt dubbelrum medans våra vuxna tre söner delade ett rum med två dubbelsängar. Vi var alla nöjda.

title: Wow!
text: Perfect quiet location on 49th between 7th and 8th ave. for theater goers. Accommodating staff,  beautifully appointed rooms. Free continental breakfast.  They even have a nice little workout room with 2 treadmills and an elliptical. We will definitely be back.

title: One night stay
text: Perfect spot to stay in the center of the theater district. Very quiet room was a great surprise. Staff very nice. Uncomplicated stay   Room was clean and everything needed for short stay. Size of room two doubles was small but not tight. Having stayed in many NYC hotels would definitely stay here again.

title: This is the way to do NY!
text: I took my daughter and 3 of her friends to NY for a birthday celebration weekend and stayed in the deluxe queen suite at the Pearl. The location was perfect - 3 minute walk to Times Square; around the block from Gershwin (Wicked), plenty of restaurants; 12 min to Frames Bowling Lounge where we spent one evening, and the MoMA where we spent Sunday.  What prompted this review was how lovely, attentive, and professional the staff are. I travel a lot for work and have stayed at other hotels around Times Square to see shows. They had a complimentary bottle of apple cider and a note wishing my daughter a happy birthday waiting in the room. I had forgotten that I mentioned my daughter's birthday when they called to confirm my reservation and gave the front desk a hard time when they asked for her name...for the note I didn't know was coming. Oops. At check-in, without any prompting, told me to let them know when I wanted the sofa bed made; when I called to ask where the ice machine was they said 'the LL but we'll bring up some ice for you', were pleasant when they found items in the girls dropped items around the hotel, and was very helpful with directions, recommendations, etc. The room was clean and very nice like the rest of hotel, There was snacks in the lobby and second floor at all times, which we raided frequently. I could not have asked for more. Would come back in a heartbeat!

title: Perfect location!
text: Located close to Times' Square and eight minutes from Central Park, this is a very good choice. Desent breakfast was included and the room was spacious and comfortable. The only disappointment was the "fitness room" which wasn't much of that kind. Super small and very bad equipped. As we always look for a good gym when we book our hotels, this was a less good experience.

title: Bon hôtel
text:
L'hôtel est idéalement placé, à une rue de Time Square. Le personnel est correct et répond à nos attentes. En ce qui concerne la chambre, chambre correct et propre. Salle de bain petite avec uniquement une douche. Produit d'accueil limité au strict minimum. La kitchenette inclus dans les chambres est simplement un micro-onde et un frigo. 
Dans le prix de la chambre est inclus le petit déjeuner. Effectivement simple mais très pratique. Bagel, toast, viennoiseries, kellogs et fruits résume le petit déj. Sincèrement je ne comprend pas les critiques qu'on trouve sur TripAdvisor à propos de ce pdj. Si vous connaissez les USA, c'est pratiquement jamais compris dans le prix de la chambre et dans la rue c'est très cher. Donc c'est fort appréciable d avoir un café&bagel avant de partir faire ces visites.

Pour terminer, le rapport qualité prix et bon. Simple mais efficace.

Hôtel que je vous conseil volontiers.

title: Lovely hotel in the best location
text:
My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. The location is excellent and in the centre of shops, restaurants and theaters; opposite Book of Mormon and same street as Chicago.
The staff are friendly and were helpful to when needing suggestions for travel, sights and a laundry. Breakfast was good with a selection of fresh milk, Cereals, breads, bagels and pastries available. Would recommend and stay again.

title: Great hotel in a fab location
text: Just stayed here for 6 nights. Really central located just off Broadway and Times Square. There is a subway stop right at the end of the street - you can get the E train from the airport so really handy. Room was very spacious and very comfortable. We were on the 14th floor - can still hear city noise but not too bad. Air con worked really  well. WiFi was good. Rooms had a safe, ironing board, hairdryer etc. Breakfast was a bonus - good selection each morning of fruit, yoghurts, bagels, toast, cereals and pastries. Tea and coffee and snacks (crisps and fruit) free all day. Staff were very helpful. Can’t complain about anything in this hotel - would definitely use it again!

title: The Pearl is a gem in NYC
text: Great location, just a short walk from Broadway and Times Square. Also other attractions nearby. Helpful and friendly staff, clean and comfortable rooms. Breakfast included, wine & cheese reception every day from 4 - 5pm, coffee/ tea snacks available all day. Enjoyed nearby Broadway shows Chicago & Miss Saigon. Plenty of restaurants around but drinks very expensive. Loved New York on 2nd visit there, but my wife’s purse pickpocketed on 8th Avenue in broad daylight! NYPD very helpful and professional when we reported incident. Would still love to go back some time, and The Pearl Hotel would be our first choice to stay again, a real gem in New York City!

title: nothing bad to say
text: quiet, safe, clean --- my big three - great location for midtown stuff - very welcoming - a little pricey (but all of nyc is a little pricy) - would definitely stay here again and would definitely recommend to others

title: Fantastic stay at a fabulous hotel
text:
I have recently returned from a 5 day NY break, staying at The Pearl Hotel with my husband and our two children.  We had a fantastic time and part of the great experience was The Pearl Hotel.  The location of the hotel is perfect, close to Times Square but away from the chaos.  We walked to Rockefeller and to Intrepid and it is close to good restaurants and coffee shops, as well as two Metro stations. 
We were given a fantastic suite at the rear of the hotel so it was very quiet and it was extremely clean and very comfortable.  The staff were incredibly helpful and friendly and I cannot praise them enough.  Also, as it was my husbands 50th birthday, the staff left a card and complimentary bottle of wine for him, which was a very kind gesture. 
The breakfast was very nice, there was plenty of choice and it was regularly replenished so it was lovely and fresh.  It was a real bonus not to have to go out in search of food to start your day, simply down to a good choice of breakfast then head off to your days adventure.  Another nice touch was the complimentary snacks, fruit and drinks which were also available day and night.
In short, a fabulous hotel, great staff and I cannot recommend it enough.  If we are lucky enough to return to NY, I would definitely stay at The Pearl again.

title: 快適
text:
広い室内でした。
ホスピタリティも最高に良かった。

お水、紅茶、コーヒー、果物、チップスなど提供されていて、いつでも部屋に持ち込めるのが良かった。

朝食はパン、ゆで卵、ヨーグルト、果物ぐらいしかありません。

title: Lovely hotel / very good location
text:
We choose this hotel due to its location and other reviews.
We booked one of the suites for a family of four.
Space was a good size, bedding and room pleasant, staff friendly and were able to assist with our queries 
Only downside was the carpet in the room was disgusting - it dirty a sticky, at first I thought I was imagining it until others in the group mentioned
Look this is a lovely hotel, there are plenty in the area, would I stay again possibly or book somewhere else most likely

title: Wish I'd stayed all week!
text: Amazing service from the moment the doorman opened the door until he waved me off when I left. They've got wine and cheese in the lounge every day for a couple of hours, breakfast is nice - just wish they didn't use plastic plates! The room was fantastic, I booked one with a terrace - it was huge, clean, well laid out and very relaxing.

title: Book of Mormon
text:
Fabulous room, food, and service! Will definitely be back!!
We were comped an upgrade upon arrival. The suite was huge...fabulous bathroom. Staff was friendly. The restaurant had delicious though pricey food. But that's what we expect in Times Square.
Show was directly across the street!!

title: Excellent 6 night stay for family of 3
text:
Stayed here for 6 nights with my husband and teenage daughter.  The location is absolutely excellent, really in the centre of everything, good restaurants nearby too.  Literally opposite Book of Mormon and next door to Chicago. 
The staff are friendly and seemed helpful to guests. Breakfast was adequate, the English breakfast tea was good, a variety of fresh milk available. Breads, bagels and pastries also available - all of which were good.  The cheese and wine hour is really good, although I never ate the cheese they did also have crisps and biscuits available. The wine I had was good, I heard other guests saying they enjoyed the wine too. 
Our room was spacious, with 2 ‘double’ beds. The beds were on the small side, width and length wise, I’m only 5 foot 5 and my feet stuck out the end, so something to be aware of if you’re tall. 
Housekeeping did a good job every day. 
I really enjoyed our stay in the pearl and would definitely recommend to others, as long as they’re not too tall!

title: Great choice for weekend on broadway
text: We had  tickets to Springsteen on Broadway this weekend. After reading  reviews on Trip Advisor we booked The Pearl Hotel. It was the perfect choice. Location, Room, and Staff. (Christian) helped to make it stay to remember. From now on every stay in NYC will be at this property .

title: Great location
text: The Pearl is a very nice hotel located within walking distance of Times Square, The Today Show, a number of broadway shows, & good restaurants. The hotel was nicely maintained. Our room was nice. The staff was great.

title: You can't help but love this hotel
text: By far my most favorite hotel in NYC. Everything is always perfect. The rooms are great and large for NY. For a special treat get one with a balcony. Everything is clean and appears new. Management obviously takes great pride in the hotel. The bed and sheets are amazing, the bathroom is great with very high end fixtures and the staff is so kind and helpful. My flight was very late and they asked me if I wanted a late check out without me even having to bring it up. Nothing to complain about anywhere. Make it your go to hotel in NYC. You will never be disappointed.

title: Always Wonderful
text: An oasis of unpretentious luxury in the heart of hell ..... Times Square.  We love this place.  The rooms, staff and location are perfect for a first time trip to NYC or your 1000th visit.  They are so accommodating ...we had a special needs issue on our last visit and the manager spent 45 minutes trying to help us.

title: Hotel muy bien ubicado
text: Hotel cercado a Time Square y de todos los teatros y de muchas atracciones . El precio algo elevado y sobre todo muy caros los tax etc (verificar antes de contratar) . Por la tarde suelen dar Cata de vinos con quesos etc .

title: Great place in great location
text: We took our family of four to NYC on fall break and had a great experience at The Pearl. The location was ideal being just steps from Times Square and multiple Broadway shows. (The Play that Goes Wrong is fantastic!). This hotel was very clean, had a very helpful staff, and was small enough not to feel like cattle. The doorman William did a great job taking care of luggage and transportation for us. The Pearl is highly recommended!

title: Super Lage, fairer Preis
text: Die Lage ist ein Traum, in wenigen Gehminuten am TimeSquare und umgeben von allen wichtigen U-Bahn-Linien in New York. Die Sauberkeit war tadellos, auch das Personal war ausgesprochen freundlich. Das Bett sah zuerst ein wenig unbequem aus, aber wir haben super darin geschlafen. Die Auswahl beim Frühstück wurde klein gehalten, aber passt für die schnelle Verpflegung am Morgen. Ansonsten gibt's in New York genug Möglichkeiten um ausgiebig frühstücken zu gehen. Alles in allem ein super Hotel.

title: Bien mais ...
text:
L'hôtel est super bien placé et le personnel est charmant (surtout le réceptionniste d'origine algérienne)    ...  MAIS : 

- fort cher pour la qualité offerte
- le petit-déjeuner "offert" est minimaliste, je veux dire quasi nul et la salle est beaucoup trop petite pour accueillir tous les clients
- le parking est horriblement cher

Il y a certainement moyen de trouver mieux et moins cher à Manhattan !!!

Phil

title: Good hotel, great location
text: This hotel is ideally located, there are tube stations nearby and you can easily reach all of the main attractions. The room was small, but it's New York, so I wasn't expecting more. Our room was cleaned to a decent level and the bed was comfortable. We had a problem with the lights in our bathroom, which I had to mention twice to reception before the problem was resolved. The breakfast was very bland and basic.

title: Return Guests
text: This was our second time staying at The Pearl. We had done extensive searching looking for the right boutique hotel to stay in and we found it! The personnel, room, location, and amenities of continental breakfast and afternoon wine opportunity all combine to enhance our NYC visit. We would strongly recommend staying in this hotel.

title: Completamente recomendable
text: El hotel tiene una ubicación inmejorable, a solo tres minutos andando de Times Square. El personal es muy servicial y agradable, y resolvieron inmediatamente nuestras peticiones. Las habitaciones son cómodas y acogedoras, de buen tamaño, y el desayuno, si no sofisticado, muy completo para empezar el día. Ofrecen, además, vino, queso y verduras a media tarde, y, durante todo el día, manzanas y 'snacks'. Absolutamente recomendable para una visita a Nueva York.

title: Hotel perfeito pra família
text:
Procurando um quarto que acomodasse 5 pessoas em Manhattan, encontrei o The Pearl. Possui localização excelente, numa rua tranquila, apesar de ser na esquina da Times Square. Quarto amplo , limpo , com amenidades L”Ocitanne , lençóis de boa qualidade e camas confortáveis. Staff muito prestativos e simpáticos. O café da manhã é mediano, resolve a primeira refeição do dia, mas se  tivesse frios e ovos mexidos seria  perfeito.  
Sempre com água , frutas e salgadinhos à vontade no hall. Indico muito esse hotel!!!

title: Great location, So-So hotel
text:
We chose the Pearl because it was highly rated and was located where we planned to do most of our activities. Coming from Austin, Texas, with its plethora of boutique hotels, the Pearl was quite a let down. But we didn’t come to New York to sit in our room. 
Just be prepared for tiny rooms, teeny baths, hard lumpy beds and moldy shower curtains. BUT, there is a Happy hour from 4-5, with a waiter pouring Merlot or Chardonnay, plus some cheese cubes and crackers. 
You also get bagels, toast, pastries, cereal and fruit for breakfast included in your bill. 
They say you get what you pay for; I don’t know about that.

title: Great location, very helpful staff
text: Right at Time Square! Beautiful rooms, very clean. The staff was extremely helpful withdirections, suggestions for restaurants and things to see, Managers afternoon wine and cheese reception was very nice.

title: Great location. Ok hotel
text:
We were in a one bedroom suite with 2 doubles. There is no separate door for the living area with pull out couch, so this is really just one large room. Pretty pricey for what you get. Decor is looking a bit dark and dated. Location can't be beat. 
Having an included breakfast was fantastic although there are hundreds of restaurants nearby. We did take part in the wine hour our first night. It started right at 4 and finished at 5 on the dot. The snacks were gross. Moldy peppers with dip. There was a girl pouring the wine and when it approached 5 pm we asked for an extra glass of wine each. She poured this reluctantly and did not seem impressed! For the amount I paid for the room she should have given us a few bottles!!! 
We spent next to no time in the room so really the place was fine. Just expected more luxury for the price.

title: LOVELY BOUTIQUE HOTEL
text:
My wife and I spent 2 nights in early September at this delightful boutique hotel.   We very impressed with this relatively small hotel.   It is a couple of minutes walk from Times Square but just far enough from the hectic hustle and bustle that is Times Square.   Continental breakfast is included as are complimentary wine and snacks each afternoon between 4 and 5 p.m.
I would absolutely recommend this little gem of a hotel.

title: Shopping @ nyc
text:
Super Hotel 
Sehr sauber und grosse Zimmer ( Suite) war perfekt 
für 50 $ pro Nacht  haben wir die suite bekommen 
Es ist perfekt gelegen mitten im gewühle und dem times square 
nicht cool ist das frühstück!!!! es gibt plastikgeschirr und die sauberkeit ist nicht wirklich so gross geschrieben,,,, tische nicht geputzt !!! klimagerät war extrem laut in der suite! nach dem wir es gemldet haben an der rezeption wurde nichts unternommen sehr schade!!!

title: A quiet oasis
text: Stayed here on business at short notice. Polite and friendly reception and door staff. Upgraded which was nice - room was spacious, clean and (most importantly) quiet even though it overlooked 49th and the theatre opposite. Gym was small but empty each time I used it, though could be prone to getting rather hot. Breakfast was a simple range, nothing fancy. Recommended.

title: Small hotel, great service and location
text:
This is a rather small hotel located in the center of Hells Kitchen, and in the heart of the theater district of NYC. However the hotel is quiet, located on West 49th street, with Broadway very close on one side, and 8th avenue on the other one. Only 7/8 rooms per floor, which are of decent size. Decor of the room is modern and sober. Bathroom is of decent size also, (however some are small i.e. room 908). Bathroom amenities from L'Occitane en Provence include shower gel, shampoo, conditioner and body cream and soap that have a fresh scent. 
A free breakfast is available until 10am, with cereals, a choice of bagels and pastries, toasts, fruit salad, orange and apple juice (not homemade). 
From 4 to 5 PM, a complimentary wine (red or white) apperitif is served with crackers, raw vegetables with sauce, and cheese , which is a pleasant attention. 
Finally, the staff is very pleasant and helpful.

title: Excelente localização!
text:
Ficamos hospedados eu, meu marido e meu filho de 1 ano e 1 mês, nesse hotel em Junho de 2017.

O hotel é muito bom! A localização é o melhor ponto deste hotel! Fica ao lado da Times Square, do lado do teatro do musical Chicago, perto de tudo!

O café da manhã não é muito bom. Havia alguns pães, iogurtes e sempre havia bananas e maçãs. Café e leite como bebidas. Não tinha nada de frios!

Os funcionários são educados e prestativos. 

Na reserva, eu havia solicitado um berço para meu filho e, quando entramos no quarto, o berço já estava lá montadinho e arrumadinho para meu bebê. Esse foi o único hotel que deixou o berço pronto para uso já na nossa entrada no quarto. Nos outros hotéis sempre tínhamos que solicitar novamente o berço no check in e aguardar a montagem dele no quarto.

Também tivemos outra grata surpresa!Tivemos um upgrade de quarto sem pagarmos nada a mais. 

Os amenities eram da L'occitane, muito bons! 

A limpeza do hotel também era muito boa.

No hall sempre havia frutas, água e batata lays disponíveis para consumo. O hotel também promovia a "wine time" (hora do vinho) das 16h às 17h para os hóspedes degustarem vinhos, porém a gente nunca conseguiu chegar a tempo no hotel.

Enfim, o hotel é muito bom! Entretanto, o preço das diárias não é tão convidativo, mas valeu a experiência e também vale pela localização!

title: Loved it here!
text: From the moment I booked, until the moment the valet brought back my car, the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The rooms were nice and clean. The staff must have overheard me mention that it was husband's birthday, because when we got back to our room there was a complimentary bottle of wine as a gift to him! I would definitely stay here again and recommend to friends and family.

title: 肤色特优生也是
text: fxp形形色色也饿却物色物色特殊同情心肉6句肚饿二十，7组女魔吐我火红色呜呜呜，URL缺月梧桐肉预谋哦婆婆，昨日重现7度鱼死网破秀色田园破色中色，吸取教训听着歌许诺我婆婆预谋做人做事我上自习多委屈，up不想做朋友破苏州热破坡头。

title: Great place, great location.
text: Stayed at The Pearl on a business trip. Very reasonably priced for NYC and particularly for Time Square. Spacious rooms, well set up. Good WiFi. Good service at the front desk and all the staff are friendly. The breakfast was ordinary, but not charged for, so given your in Time Square, there are a million great places to go for breakfast a short walk away.

title: A very pleasant experience
text:
The staff was really friendly and helpful, which is not easy to find in NYC so easily at times.
Personally William, the doorman/bellman is the cat's pajamas, he made you feel welcome every night and he definitely has the personality to deal with customers, he's nice, engaging, funny and bubbly.
The room was small, don't forget this is NYC  and space cost tons, the room was modern, functional  and the AC worked fantastic, which I, being a hot blooded South American, am always hot
I would stay here anytime, and if you meet William say hi from me.

title: Great location. Rooms just OK
text:
Friendly and engaging staff. Fantastic location.. particularly if you are going to see the Book of Mormon! Boutique feel. 
Rooms are a bit of a let down especially for the price. Mine had somewhat dirty and (suspect) stained bedding.
A very NY experience to be honest. I am very rarely impressed by NY hotels... but like NY cares about that..

title: 4 skønne dag i newyork
text: Super centralt beliggende,  lige ved Time square og gå afstand til rigtig mange seværdigheder,  service god. Morgen maden kunne være noget bedre men nok standard for newyork, gode senge og fint rent,,,,,, 😀

title: 立地がよく快適なホテル
text: ブロードウェイの劇場街にあり立地は最高です。地下鉄の駅が近いし、近所にスーパーもあります。朝食付きですし、水やスナックはいつでも無料でした。部屋は広く清潔でとても快適でした。シャワーの使い勝手が悪いですが、慣れれば問題なく使えました。

title: Centrally located
text:
I arrived at the hotel shortly before noon but I was told my pre-booked room type wasn't ready/available, so I would have to wait. I was however offered an upgrade option for $40 extra; I had no choice since I had to settle in and get on a conference call ASAP. In fact, I feel like they were just interested in selling me an upgrade. The view from the balcony of the [upgraded] room was an eye-sore and I immediately asked to change rooms. Except that this room had NO balcony (which is what I had asked and paid for), only difference was that it had a king bed -- there was no view from here since it was also at the back of the building overlooking the roof of other buildings and another high rise building. By the way, I arrived early at a previous hotel, the night before (Library hotel) and was offered free upgrade with no hassles, granted I got there at 8.30 am: I probably should have stayed there but I had already pre booked my hotels without the option to cancel.
Worse still, the WiFi at this hotel sucks -- good luck trying to get on a conference meeting or Facetime with family while you're "home away from home". I spent 30 minutes of valuable time working with their tech support over the phone: turns out, the hotel pays for lower-tier WiFi service. Long story short the tech guy had to make some tweaks to get me on a "fast lane" which ended up being an abysmal 2.5Mbps download speed (my phone is MUCH faster than that): tech support mentions this is the expected average speed one can expect for the internet service level at this hotel. No kidding, perform a speed test after you check-in. I can understand if this is during peak hours (like at night), but this was at noon on a weekday -- when most guests are usually not on premise!
For what it's worth, my room was clean and decent; the hotel is located near the theaters, few blocks from Timesquare, subway stations, a glut of restaurants, landmarks and tourists attractions. Price point was also reasonable for what you get in return. However, I'll definitely consider other options the next time I'm in the city but I think I have already settled for where I'll be staying moving forward. Moreover, there are a ton of nice-looking hotels with great reviews around this part of town.

title: Wonderful location!
text:
The location of this hotel was perfect! Great food and Times Square only 3 min walk away! Free breakfast and wine and cheese daily. Roomy rooms. Separate room with a couch so the little kids can sleep
While others get ready. Across the street from the Book of Mormon. I will return!

title: Great little hotel in an excellent location
text:
Just back from seven great nights at the Pearl Hotel. No cons worth mentioning, but the Pro's are worth mentioning. It's in a brilliant location, you can go up 8th towards Central Park etc (15 min walk), or across and down into Times Square and all it has to offer around it.

Lots of good bars, restaurants and theatres on the Pearls doorstep. But I would recommend if you dont know Manhattan that well or on a first time visit to NY, do yourself a favour and turn right out the hotel, go across 8th towards Hells Kitchen, its just a couple of blocks and it gives a real taste of old New York, and so different to the lights of Times Square.

We found the free breakfast good, simple but enough for us to start the day. Staff excellent and attentive, and a big thanks to the guys on the door, great service, with a special call out to William from the wee Scottish guy

title: Great Time
text: I spent my birthday there, 18-23 August.  have to say whole experience was wonderful.  The hotel is really central, and all the staff (especially Stephanie) were terrific, so helpful and kind - thank you!

title: Eccellente hotel e ottima posizione in Manhattan
text: ottimo boutique hotel in Manhattan situato in posizione strategica rispetto a times square, fifth avenue, central park e metropolitana. Le camere sono belle e pulite anche se non molto spaziose, macchinetta con tè e caffè sempre presente e rifornita, il personale è gentile collaborativo per ogni esigenza. Colazione sempre compresa!!!! Incredibile a New York!!! con muffin, croissant, succhi, caffè, tè e frutta fresca. e poi alle ore 16 di ogni giorno, spuntino di merenda con formaggi e vino italiano ed argentino. comodo anche il fatto che l'hotel è collegato direttamente con ottima steak house che si trova al piano inferiore. In tutte le stanze c' è un frigobar da riempire a vostro piacimento grazie al supermarket che c'è a pochi passi dall'albergo. Vivamente consigliato.

title: Check-in and breakfast
text:
We are in NYC for a week on family vacation 

Good location, nice rooms but limited services

Front desk is going up and down, very bad approach with first check-in contact, the approach improved dramatically with the next front desk person.

Breakfast : small area , limited choice and purely continental 

No minibar (empty) and no complimentary water in rooms

title: Très bon hôtel
text: Personnel agréable. Chambres spacieuses et très confortables. Très bien situé, non loin de Time square. Petit déjeuner inclus très bon. Situé dans une rue calme pour une grande ville comme New York. Je le recommande fortement.

title: Great stay, highly recommended
text: My daughter and I stayed for one night. The location is just perfect. The rooms are well equipped, spacious, super clean and surprisingly quiet. Basic complementary breakfast and complementary cheese and wine hour, another reason to choose this hotel for your stay. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. An amazing stay. We will come back.

title: Such a quiet hotel
text: Love this hotel. Always quiet, doesn't have that chaotic feel that NYC has. Rooms are lovely and well equipped. Location is great with easy access to the subway either on 8th or 6th Avenue. Highly recommend. Some of the check in staff could be a little more upbeat/friendlier but overall the majority of the staff are lovely.

title: Perfect position in New York
text: The hotel is in a perfect position close to Broadway street and all the shows. Rooms are very clean and comfortable. Great service and very friendly staff. They also supply a continental breakfast. Highly recommended

title: Ottima posizione a ny
text: Abbiamo soggiornato  in questo albergo ad aprile per 5 notti. Lo abbiamo  scelto  per la posizione centrale e vicina alla  metropolitana .Siamo stati piacevolmente sorpresi perché l albergo  offriva  la colazione al proprio interno : sempre presente frutta fresca, yogurt  e il classico caffè americano. La nostra camera era discretamente ampia e sempre ben pulita

title: One of the Best NYC Hotels I have ever Stayed at
text:
My wife and I come into NYC about 3 times a year for dinner and theater and we usually stay overnight. We stayed at The Pearl on our last trip for our anniversary.
It was a GREAT choice. We arrived a little early and they upgraded us to a King Size room that is the largest NYC room I have stayed in. The staff was friendly and helpful. 
Since it was our anniversary, they sent us up a bottle of wine with a nice note. 
One of the issues that we usually have in NYC hotels is the wait for the elevator, that was never a concern here.  They have a complimentary wine and cheese hour which was nice. They also have a complimentary breakfast that we did not take advantage of.  
I would highly recommend looking at The Pearl if you are staying in NYC.

title: Bon hôtel très bien situé
text:
Hôtel situé à deux pas de times square donc idéalement placée pour aller balader et faire du shopping. 
Personnel particulièrement sympathique.
Les chambres sont très correctes : une queen size pour 2 adultes et 3 enfants c'est bien adaptée.

title: Ótima localização
text: Muito bem localizado. É possível visitar imensas coisas a pé e o metro é bastante próximo. O quarto não é muito espaçoso, mas é suficiente. Possui microondas  (com bebe deu imenso jeito). O pewueno almoço não é muito variado  (principalmente em fruta) mas serve perfeitamente. Um dos dias chegamoswe a limpeza não tinha sido feita, mas resolveram logo que informámos.

title: Just what we needed in New York!
text: This hotel is great - a great location, friendly and helpful staff, a good (basic) breakfast and comfortable rooms. The staff are probably the best thing about this hotel - really helpful and seemed interested in what guests are up to etc. Location is perfect - a few minutes from Times Square and really close to the C line subway to get around. Perfect base for a trip to NYC!

title: Peaceful oasis in heart of midtown
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights on a couples getaway. Did lots of research beforehand and was very pleased that it lived up to all expectations! The Pearl is a smallish boutique-type hotel in the heart of midtown, with 14 floors and about 8 or 9 rooms on each floor. The staff is lovely and welcoming and went above and beyond to make our stay excellent.

We stayed in a queen with shower on the 11th floor for the first 4 nights, then switched to a queen with soaking tub (on our request) on the 14th floor for our last night. The rooms were very similar in terms of decor, amenities, and layout, although the first one had a more spacious closet and bathroom.

The pros: Very clean, nicely decorated rooms that included the usual amenities like bathrobes and slippers as well as bar fridge, microwave, and Keurig. L'Occitane products in bathroom (and a TV in the bathroom, although we never used it)! Great sheets, black out curtains, very effective air conditioning, and a decent view that reminded us we were in NYC. OUTSTANDING staff, from front desk to doormen to housekeeping, all super helpful and friendly. Breakfast and snacks through the day, nothing fancy but still convenient. Nice lounge, which was very handy when we wanted to relax for a bit after check out. Very good location close to Broadway theatres, restaurants, and subway stations.

The cons: Beds were on the soft side, which wasn't ideal as we prefer a firmer mattress. Only one chair in each of the rooms we were in; not sure if any have two chairs or if we could have gotten another if we asked. Could hear some noise from closing doors in one of our rooms. Also the taller neighboring building meant that it wasn't completely private at night unless we closed the curtains (and closed off the view). Finally, a hot breakfast would have been lovely.

Overall, the positives far outweighed the cons. This is the place we'll happily look to rebook on our next visit to NYC.

title: If you are coming to New York this is the best ever place to stay !!!!!
text: Hey, I am new to trip advisor reviews but I have recently stayed at the worst hotel in the UK at Thorpe Park and have had over 615 hits already for my NEW reviews AND AN EARLY REACTION FROM THE HOTEL BECAUSE THE TRUTH HURTS I GUESS! Because that was the worst hotel I have stayed at, in my 51 yrs of life! It was truly awful! I was a police officer for over 30 years in the uk and my family realise what is completely important for a family visiting new venues in the world! New York I have to assure you is the most amazing city in the world to visit! And if you visit you need to come to the Pearl Hotel Mid Town! No bias, I checked it on trip advisor and it is amazing! It's the best located Just off Times Square with no traffic noise, breakfast and a happy hour! Lovely wines and a chance to meet staff and other guests!The hotel team are lovely, so helpful - it is truly an amazing ! You need to visit! Every member of staff at the hotel are really lovely! I love the team! ( and this is an individual review - I won't accept payment or any other interference for my reviews from the hotel! If it's bad I will say how bad it is so you don't waste your money and it gives the hotel a chance to improve their service!  You need to stay at this hotel for the location, the staff, the breakfast, happy hour and how the staff are ! It's exceptional! Mike Williams  (UK champion of not accepting anything less than a U.K. Family would accept anywhere in the world! ) Take care everybody!  x.

title: Skvělý poměr cena/výkon/poloha
text:
Menší hotel se skvělou polohou přímo u Time square. Vhodný pro rodiny s dětmi. Přátelský personál, prostorné pokoje.
Ideální místo odkud lze poznávat všechny kouty centra New Yorku. Vše v odchozí vzdálenosti. Součástí ceny je jednoduchá snídaně.

title: Great location - loved it
text:
We absolutely loved this hotel.  The staff were so helpful and seemed genuinely friendly.  We sorted theatre tickets within a couple of hours of arriving.  The breakfasts were simple but did he job.  The cheese hour was a great bonus.  Location great - if you want to be near the main sights.  The room was wonderful and had all we could ask for.  We opted for a slightly better room and had a view of Book of Morman!

Stayed for 5 nights.  Did not want to leave

title: great location but a bit inconsistent
text:
We booked two rooms at the Pearl Hotel based on the Trip advisor reviews. Up to today, I'm still on the fence as to how to rate the hotel. That's because there are pluses and minuses. 

For example, the complimentary breakfast had uneven reviews. Some reviewers said it was poor but there were others who said it was ok. I would tend to side with the latter. Sure, there were not hot meals at all - no eggs, no sausages or bacon, etc. - but to be fair, there was enough juices, coffee, bagels, sliced breads, pastries, cream cheeses and jellies, hard-boiled eggs, and fruit slices to give anyone enough energy to last till the endow the morning. 

Service was also uneven. People who were tending the 4:30 to 5:30 cocktail hour  - white and red wine, cheese cuts, cheese biscuits, veggie slices and dips - weren't too friendly. On the second day, the guy in charge started to pack up at 4:55 pm! What?! When I asked if the front desk could give a call to my tour operator to confirm pick -up time the next day, the guy took a look, then gave the booking form back to me and said - don't worry, they'll come tomorrow at 10 am. He never even tried to call. Wow. When I asked the front desk to give my airport transfer a call to confirm, the concierge got it and said - I might as well; Im not doing anything anyway. Having come from hotels in Savannah and Charleston, the difference in how we were bing treated and served was quite glaring. Maybe it was just a NYC culture thing, I'm not sure. The doormen weren't any different. When we arrived, there was no problem in keeping the luggage in storage while we waited for the check in time. But nearing departure, one doorman insisted that the cheapest van transfer I could get to JFK was $160. He was surprised - and disbelieving - when I told him the guy who brought me to the hotel offered $115. Despite a very early booking, they weren't able to give us adjoining rooms, not even two rooms on the same floor. 

The lobby is smallish but functional with their lounge area. The mezzanine which is where we have breakfast had enough seats to accommodate guests. They were unstinting with their plastic plates, drinking glasses, napkins, and plastic cutlery. The two elevators were sufficient for the 80+ rooms. 

Housekeeping was unobtrusive. There was a coffee maker, ref and microwave in the room. the headboard mounted on the wall was padded, a nice touch. I did had a big issue with the bed. The cushion was smaller than the wooden bed base so my wife and I kept hitting our shins on the bed base corners. That needs serious redesign. And on the writing desk, you tend to expect a mirror but they had a picture frame instead. TV was on the small side. there was another TV in the T&B but I couldn't figure it out - it had only a handful of channels unlike the main one. 

But making up for most of the faults is the hotel's location - it's on 49th between Broadway and 8th. We had booked two different plays and both were within 2-3 blocks of the hotel. We were literally a few hundred meters away from the exciting Times Square.

title: Great location
text:
I enjoy staying in this area as it is close to the theatres. The rooms are spacious for NYC standards and good for families. It's not my choice if I was just travelling with my husband, but I think their rates are reasonable and the employees are helpful.  
Tip: The hotel is right across from The Book of Mormon.  Drop off your name in the lottery (I think they do it around 5:00 pm - not sure if it's every night).  My name was called and I got 2 first row centre orchestra seats for $15 each! It was the highlight of my trip!

title: Clean and comfy
text: Overall, I think the hotel was good and very convenient. The room was big for NYC, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was small but had what was needed. The bed was decently comfortable, albeit a little lumpy. The pillows were not the best but fine. Air con worked amazingly. Very good! The staff was friendly and helpful. The wine and cheese hour is nice when you get back to the hotel in the late afternoon and want to relax. It's right across the street from The Book of Mormon. The continental breakfast was mediocre but you could certainly get enough to eat to start your day. They had bread, bagels and English muffins, fruit, yogurt, hard boiled eggs and pastries. My mother said the coffee was good. My only complaint, and it's kind of a big one, they use plastic dishes and cutlery, and they don't recycle. It's 2017. Very disappointed. I think it would be better if they didn't have breakfast rather than put all that plastic into the garbage every day. It was contradictory because in the room, they had a card saying they were devoted to protecting the environment in regards to the washing of sheets and towels. One other thing, if you are scent sensitive, I would ask them to not spray in your room before you arrive. Otherwise, it was all very good and everyone was really nice. Would stay there again without hesitation.

title: Vale pela localização
text:
O ponto ímpar é a localização, como todos comentam. Fomos a dois show da Broadway facilmente alcançados a pé, fomos ao passeio de barco até a estátua da liberdade e fácil acesso aos metrôs. Existe um mercadinho na esquina e vários restaurantes e lojas ao redor. Próximo também à entrada do Top of the Rock.
O quarto é de tamanho bom, não ótimo. Café da manhã bem simples, mas já ajuda.
Recepção atenciosa e educada. Caro para o que oferece além da localização.
Recebem pacotes de compras sem custo adicional.

title: Ótimo custo beneficio
text: Ótima localização, perto de tudo. Ótimo tamanho de apto, banheiro com sistema de cortininha e banheira, o que detesto. Colchões e travesseiros um pouco macios demais, mas a cama tem bom tamanho. Excelentes elevadores, rápidos. Café da manhã repetitivo e com pouca variedade, mas o que tem é bom. Sempre iogurtes, granolas, pães, sucos, café, frutas, o básico para um bom desjejum. Quarto e banheiro muito escuros. Funcionários prestativos. Água aromatizada, maçãs e batatas disponíveis a toda hora. Vinhos e queijos diariamente das quatro as cinco. Ótima limpeza. Geladeira no quarto. Silencioso, ótima acústica. Fiquei no quinto andar. Ficaria nesse hotel novamente e indico. Ótimo custo beneficio.

title: Great Hotel
text: I have just returned from 5 nights at the Pearl hotel. I really liked the hotel. I was with my daughter and we found our room very comfortable - a giant bed each, good facilities such as a fridge, microwave and coffee maker which meant we could buy food in the grocery store a few doors away and heat it up in our room and the room was very quiet. The staff were lovely, super friendly and nothing was too much trouble. A special hi to William, the night door man. The location of the hotel was really good too - a few minutes to Times Square, the subway and surrounded by theatres. The only reason I have given this review 4 stars is because we booked an alarm call for 4.30 am on our last night as we had booked a car to the airport at 5am. Unfortunately we did not receive a call so it was lucky my daughter had set an alarm on her phone as a back up. I forgot to mention there was also a free wine and cheese hour ever day from 4-5 and crisps, fruit and drinks available all day. The breakfast was basic but adequate. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: Great Boutique Hotel
text: I travel to NYC for business 3 or 4 times a year.  I try to stay at this hotel whenever i come up.  Its great.  The free happy hour is a little early for most working people (starts at 4 and runs to 5 each day), but other than that I can't complain.  The restaurant next door is a nice place to grab a cocktail or have dinner at the bar.  You're right across the street from "Book of Mormon" so the restaurant will get busy before the show.  Rooms are great.  Big for NY in my opinion.  If a gym is important to you, this hotel will fall short.  Its very small.  One Elliptical, One rowing machine and one treadmill.  I think there is a universal weight machine as well.  And they won't open it up until 6AM.

title: Just nice.
text:
The best thing: location, especially if you are interested in the theaters.
Check in was quick.
Rooms are small, as most hotels in the area. The beds are not very comfortable, and the pillows have various sizes, most of them very small for an adult.
Breakfast was included: but was very simple, some pastries, cereal, yoghurt, with few seats available.

title: Was not disappointed!
text:
I researched extensively before booking this hotel and made my choice based on guest satisfaction with the staff, location and price. 
Upon arrival our family felt very welcome, staff were friendly and efficient. The size of the Queen/Queen suite exceeded my expectations, as did the breakfast that was very good. As advertised, it really is an oasis just around the corner from time square!

title: La ubicación hace la diferencia
text:
Si vas de visita a Manhattan con plan de recorrer los lugares icónicos de la ciudad este hotel es elegible. A un par de cuadras del corazón de times square te da la chance de visitar varios lugares a distancia de caminata (central park-Moma-museo Madame Tussaud-public library, entre otros) y el resto de los lugares en el downtown a 20' de subte que tomas a cuadras del hotel.
El hotel es simple; habitación linda y confortable. Baño grande y moderno. Todo funcionó a la perfeccion. Tiene heladerita y microondas. Wi-fi funciona correctamente en todo el hotel (en la habitación tambien). 
Desayuno autoservice básico plus, suficiente.
En  resumen: gran ubicacion para los que van a visitar la ciudad y quieren estar en corazón de la ciudad (excelente para ir caminando en verano a la noche a ver gente, luces y negocios).  El hotel acompaña muy bien. Buen balance precio- calidad

title: Excelente opción para familia de 6
text: Estuvimos a mediados de Julio de 2017, excelentes habitaciones, excelente servicio, buen desayuno y snacks disponible durante todo el día. Todo perfecto, gran elección en Manhattan para familia numerosa.

title: Excellent Location but Quiet!
text: We enjoyed our stay at the Pearl. It is very close to theaters and Times Square but on a quiet block. The staff is super friendly and helpful. Our 12th floor room was large and clean. It's a small hotel with fewer than 100 rooms which we liked.
