title: Optimo para Familias
text:
Muy buena Ubicacion, el personal ALTAMENTE AMABLE Y DEDICADO. Las habitaciones un poco antiguas por el tipo de hotel pero muuuy comodas. 
La ubicacion es privilegiada, creo que por eso el costo es un poco elevado respecto a la parte edilicia del hotel.
Volveriamos sin lugar a dudas.

title: Anniversary Trip
text:
Absolutely fascinating experience at The Pearl. Front desk sent us champagne to celebrate our anniversary. 

Room was spacious, bed and pillows were very comfortable, and bathroom was very clean. Close enough to Times Square without the hustle and bustle of the crowds. Centrally located to everything and close to subway. 

Most definitely will return to The Pearl!

title: Muy buen hotel
text:
En el mes de junio nos alojamos dos veces en este hotel. Excelente ubicación, tenés el metro a menos de dos cuadras, lo que hace que puedas llegar desde el aeropuerto, haciendo combinacióncon el air train.
En el hotel todo el personal ha sido muy amable. Cuenta con acceso gratuito a wifi, con buena conexión, desayuno bastante completo (lo básico y un poco más, para nosotros fue más que suficiente) Después del horario del desayuno y durante todo el día, tenés acceso a café, té, agua, manzanas y snacks. En la habitación hay cafetera y microondas. Los amenities del baño, son de L'occitane y cuenta con un muy buen secador de pelo. Hay batas y pantuflas, caja de seguridad y buen espacio para moverse y guardar las cosas dentro de la habitación.
Sin dudas lo recomiendo y volvería a alojarme en este hotel

title: Excellent hôtel au cœur de Manhattan!
text:
Nous avons séjourné a 5 dans la suite Queen Deluxe. La chambre était spacieuse,confortable,propre et bien équipée . 
Le personnel de l'hôtel était très aimable et serviable.
Le petit déjeuner était correct. Un petit plus; un buffet de goûter vers 16h( fromages, vin, fruits crudités ,chips, café ,thé.....).
Le placement de l'hôtel était parfait! A deux pas de Times Square ! Nous étions proche des restos, des magasins branchés, des théâtres de Broadway et plusieurs stations de métro et d'arrêts de bus!
En bref: un séjour parfait!
Nous recommandons vivement cet hôtel!

title: William The Doorman
text: Smiling faces .The staff was very courteous and went over and beyond in providing assistance. But one person who stood out was William the Doorman who made us feel as if we were at home and showed us around the building with a smile and while making us laugh. For this reason we are definitely coming back!

title: The Largest NYC Hotel Room I've Ever Seen
text: 3 of us shared a double room, which included 2 double (full) beds and a large bathroom.  I booked on Hotwire because it was cancellable for $100 more than the non-cancellable hotel web site rate.  Positives included size of room, free breakfasts, wine hour with light snacks, great employees, black-out curtains, comfortable beds, rain shower head, microwave, mini fridge, and in-room coffee maker, t.v. in bathroom, use of an umbrella, and location.  Negatives would be flat pillows, plastic dishes / cups, repetitive breakfast and happy hour items, and the elevators.  For some reason, one elevator kept getting stuck on a floor.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: OTTIMO HOTEL IN MANHATTAN
text:
Ho soggiornato 6 notti in giugno con la mia famiglia e ci siamo trovati molto bene.
Inizio dalla location che e' ottima, a due passi da Times Square e dalla metro in modo da raggiungere qualsiasi punto di Manhattan in modo veloce e sicuro.
Molto bella la camera, spaziosa, silenziosa e con un bel bagno, e anche con un piccolo angolo cottura dotato di microonde, lavello e macchina per il caffe.
Ottima anche la pulizia sia della camera, che dell' intera struttura.
Abbiamo anche trovato un personale di reception molto gentile e disponibile.
La colazione non e' molto varia ma buona e sufficiente per iniziare la giornata.
In definitiva un' ottimo Hotel per visitare New York.
Sicuramente tornerei al The Pearl il prossimo soggiorno nella Grande mela.

title: Bellissimo hotel in nyc
text:
Abbiamo pernottato una settimana presso il The Pearl e siamo stati benissimo. Hotel molto pulito, posizione eccellente (times square), uno dei pochi a Nyc ad offrire la colazione la mattina (abbondante e varia). Il personale dell'hotel è molto molto gentile, abbiamo avuto un problema col bimbo piccolo e loro ci sono stati molto d'aiuto. Ci sono venuti incontro su molte richieste (come per esempio tenere la stanza un'ora in più dell'orario previsto dal check- out) senza farsi pagare. C'è sempre a disposizione acqua fresca, frutta e snack. 

Secondo me il rapporto qualità prezzo é molto buona per essere Manhattan!! 
Consiglio!!

title: Nice and Quiet in Mid Town
text: We stayed in a Queen Suite which was a very nice size and very quiet for the location. This is a smaller hotel. The included breakfast was appreciated ( bagels and pastries , cereal, yoghurt and fruit salad) in a self service room. We didn't try the wine hour as it was a bit early at 4 pm. Very easy to walk to Broadway Shows. The staff were helpful. Only complaint is that our air conditioner rattled !

title: The Pearl of NYC
text:
The Pearl is amazing and made our trip to New York extra special. The staff was beyond gracious and helpful. Our room was impeccable, tastefully decorated, and the bed was COZY!!!!! 

Use this hotel!!!! Best price, perks, and location

We will use this hotel for future trips to NYC!!!

title: Exceeded my expectations
text: Nice find near Times Square. The Pearl is now probably my favorite after staying in other four properties around the same area. Being on the 49th makes it sufficiently away from the Times Square chaos while still near all the transportation network and entertainment. Rooms are nice, clean and big, including special touches such as Loccitane ammenities and plenty of well located power outlets. AC was silent and shades blocked sunlight. My room even included a balcony, although I'm pretty sure that's not the default. Wi-Fi was free and decent, albeit not that fast. Service was attentive and efficient. The only downside for us was the included breakfast: we basically skipped it for one of the several options around.

title: Localização
text: O hotel é um 3 estrelas bem ajeitado com café da manhã bem simples mas que quebra o galho. O grande lance é a localização. Perto de tudo é só andar 10 a 20 minutos que chega em qualquer atração. O quarto é pequeno mas bem aconchegante e novo.

title: Posizione ottima
text: Il principale pregio è la posizione vicino Time Square ed alla fermata della metropolitana . Camere sufficientemente spaziose, personale disponibile. Colazione tipo "self service" senza grande scelta ma con beagle di tutti i tipi !

title: Solid option for decent hotel, but nothing impressive
text:
The bottom line: Good, clean base with an excellent location, else nothing is neither AMAZING nor HORRIBLE.

We stayed in a Deluxe Queen room for 11 nights, average nightly rate incl. tax was $300 (apparently a pretty good deal)

Pros/highlights:

- Location is brilliant
- Room was of good size
- L'occitane bathroom amenities
- Room featured a small kitchenette w/ a fridge
- Vast selection of TV channels
- “Breakfast” (see below) and Wifi included in room rate
- “Wine and cheese” hour (see below) and complimentary snacks (crisps) available each day
- Room request (high floor and tub) was met, parcels sent to me were delivered smoothly
- Bellhops/porters were friendly and helpful

Cons/lowlights:

- The room (1206) was rather dark and felt a bit dated
- Breakfast was the worst I’ve ever seen. Low quality, over-sugary products and highly limited selection, plastic (!) serveware. Out of 11 nights, we tried it after the first night and then never again.
- The wine and cheese hour was equally unimpressive as the breakfast. 
- E-mails were not responded to prior to arrival, despite reminders. Eventually had to call the hotel.
- Reception staff (with the exception of Christian, who was great) and the concierge were pretty nonchalant. Many times you’d walk in, look towards the reception and be ignored by the staff that were either starring into the computer screens, chatting away with an NYPD officer usually hanging out in the lobby or simply just talking to each other.
- The mentioned fridge made quite some noise. No cutlery or bottle opener in kitchenette.
- The tub didn’t feel very inviting, with an old shower curtain and a shallow/old tub
- The view (wasn’t too exciting and also included noise from a fan/ventilation system on the building across the street.

We most likely won’t be returning, but at the same time I do not want to advise against this property. It’s a solid option for a decent midtown hotel – no less, no more.

title: The best location in New York!
text: If you want to feel the buzz of New York but without the constant noise most locations in New York offer, this hotel is for you. Literally a minutes walk from Times Square you wouldn't believe how close this hotel is to many attractions and places of interest! The hotel is immaculate from the lobby up to the rooms and we couldn't fault it in any way. We upgraded to one of their twin rooms which was huge by anyone's standards! Everything you needed was provided and the wine and cheese hour was a lovely touch. Breakfast was perfect to set you up for the day and all staff were friendly and welcoming. The hotel isn't huge compared to many others in New York and so you don't feel rushed during breakfast and the lobby was never overcrowded. We'd never stay anywhere else in New York again!

title: Great for the most part
text: The Pearl has a lot going for it: fantastic location, attentive employees, nice modern rooms and it was very quiet, especially for being around the corner from Times Square. The breakfast was decent- what you'd expect for a continental breakfast. The pillows were pretty bad and the beds weren't super comfortable but both things I think are personal preferences so someone else may have a different view. I would have given it 5 stars except- we had the privacy sign up and the cleaners came in and cleaned anyway- without our permission. I was a little upset by this, as since I had the privacy sign up didn't expect anyone in and had my wallet and credit cards out in the wide open. It's a little concerning when a hotel doesn't respect privacy like that so that gives me pause about going back. However, the accommodations were very nice other than that.

title: 場所はとても便利
text: ミュージカル目的なら最高な立地です。ほとんどの劇場に歩いても15分以内でたどり着けます（シカゴの劇場はほぼ隣）。空港からのACE線、自由の女神への123線、ワシントンスクエア・イーストサイドへのQNRW線へ半ブロック以内です。朝食と４時からのワインは平均以下かなという印象です。もう少しましにできないかな〜。ドアマンは下町ホテルな感じの対応です。

title: Sieben Tage New York
text: Alles an diesem Hotel war top.Die Lage war perfekt neben dem Times Square und viele andere Sehenswürdigkeiten warren gut zu Fuss erreichbar,auch zum Shoppen ein hervorragend gelegenes Hotel.Die Zimmer waren sehr gross und schön.

title: One of the best Hotel in New York
text: Second stay in the Pearl. It was perfect. One of the best Hotel in New York. People were friendly and the room was nice. One inconvenience is the limited number of tables for the breakfast. If you are early, that's not a problem. Even if located in a street with street, that was quiet.

title: Not a pearl. A Diamond!
text:
We stayed there for 3 nights.
The room and the facilities were excellent.  The breakfast buffet  was good and there was an happy hour surprise each afternoon with wine, cheese and vegetables. 
The staff was very helpful, polite and communicative.
The location is great. 2 minutes walking from Times Square  and there are 2 subway stations from each side of the hotel.
No doubt  that I will recommend this hotel to my friends.
We will certainly come back!
Mira

title: Nice Hotel with Excellent Times Square Location
text: The best thing about the Pearl Hotel is the location. It is just off Times Square, slightly away from the bustle, but very handy to walk every where in Midtown. The hotel itself has a fresh, modern style. The rooms have a comfortable atmosphere, although the bathroom in our rooms (we had two rooms for three people) was quite small. My only complaints were that the blanket on the bed was quite thin, and a second one was not provided (and I really didn't want to use the bedspread -- not a good feel at all), the pillows in one of the rooms were oddly small (more like throw pillows), and the television in one room did not have any service. We did request service for the tv, and although they said that they would come up and fix it, they either did not or could not. I might consider staying there again if the rate was right -- it was a solid, if unexciting, place to stay in the Times Square area.

title: Slightly confused by this hotel
text:
We stayed here for seven nights based on positive reviews on Trip Advisor,  The hotel is well located in mid town New York, near Times Square.  I have no complaints with the room, bathroom or the cordiality of the staff.  
I did not like the breakfast and I am not quite sure why.  The dark brown plastic plates and cutlery which one throws out after use were certainly not appealing.  The peeled boiled eggs were rubbery,  Some of the pastries appeared not to be fresh.  Each day, the guy in charge of breakfast abruptly removed everything at 10 am sharp, which was a bit disconcerting.  
We went once to the 4 pm wine and cheese session.  The wine was served in plastic wine cups by a member of staff whose sole function was to pour out the wine and not make small talk.  The cheese was tasteless.  My advice to management would be to scrap this session, if they cannot afford to serve the wine in proper wine glasses (I realize that there is a cost involved in washing the glasses) or to serve better quality cheese.    
Despite all the plastic, which appears to be a cost saving measure and detracts from the quality of the hotel, the hotel employs people to open the front door when someone passes.  I have always found this to be pretentious and unnecessary as is the practice of a porter bringing ones bags to the room;  these measures are fine in a posh hotel frequented by people who like that sort of thing.  The Pearl is not a posh hotel.

title: Mostly great
text: Stayed at the Pearl in a 2 Queen (not 2 double, which they also offer) room for a week in May.  Room was extremely comfortable.  Curtains, totally blackout.  Nice to have little kitchenette area and coffee in the room.  Breakfast and evening snacks very welcome.  Only issues were a light that never quite turned all the way off (though they tried heroically to fix it - must be an issue in the wiring) and one clerk who was quite supercilious in dealing with me (I am an older woman).  Otherwise, super wonderful stay.

title: NIce rooms and excellent service
text:
This is a rather new hotel with large rooms. Our room on the 12th floor was very quiet. The staff in the reception was very kind and helpful. This is in the BRoadway area of NYC so lots of theater visitors etc. Lively street.
Very close to the EE Restaurant.

title: Slight slip in quality, not bad but not as good as it was
text:
We have stayed at this hotel before, and enjoyed it very much. This time, however, we felt it slipped slightly, especially in the housekeeping area. The staff is still very nice, and there is an ok continental breakfast, as well as a wine and cheese hour at 4. Perhaps the housekeeping staff is overworked; we called and asked for extra pillows which never came, and the housekeeping service in general wasn't particularly responsive. The bed was fairly uncomfortable, and the whole place seemed a little worn. 

We very much appreciated the umbrella in our room. Also, although our room was next to the elevator, the noise barely noticeable. The location of the hotel is great if you are going to plays.

title: Quit looking at other hotels and book The Pearl!
text: There is simply nothing less than great about The Pearl Hotel.  The location on 49th is perfect: close to all the action, yet quiet and peaceful as can be.  The free wifi, the free breakfast (fresh fruit, cereals, rolls and pastries, etc. is more than adequate), the wine in the afternoon, plus a decent sized hotel room - don't think there are many hotels that can come close for the price.  However, what makes The Pearl most special are the staff.  Nicer hotel employees do not exist (especially in NYC).  We adored all of them.  Don't want to mention too many names because we'll forget some, but have to throw a bouquet to Christian at the front desk and William at the front door.  We only stayed three nights this time, but already miss those guys.  Do yourself a favor and stay at The Pearl.

title: Still great!
text: I reviewed The Pearl a few years ago  and am happy to report that it is better than ever! They have kept up the high standards and even improved upon them. The quality of the wine at happy hour has improved, as have the pastries at breakfast. The rooms are spacious, the front desk and maids are all very gracious and helpful, everything is clean - and the location has even been improved by virtue of better restaurants opening nearby. A great place to stay - quiet and centrally located to all Broadway shows. A boutique hotel with many foreign visitors - I highly recommend it!

title: Very belated EXCELLENT review.
text:
May I begin with the fact that I don't usually bother with sites like this as frankly I have never been impressed enough with anywhere to write a review... So the story goes, my husband and I stayed at the Fabulous Pearl Hotel in January 2016 for our honeymoon. Whilst there, we experienced the horrendous Nor'easter winters storm that brought New York to a standstill. Although a winter storm sounds romantic and exciting, believe me it wasn't. It was very stressful trying to organise getting home to the UK when all in and outbound flights are cancelled. Nevertheless the staff at the Pearl were SO helpful and accommodating. They contacted Expedia for us. They extended our stay in our upgraded King size room for a further 2 nights. The telephone in the room has a list of FREE phone numbers to all the airlines. This was most helpful as we spent around 11 hours on hold to United airlines trying to get a flight home.  So thank you for this fantastic facility. It would have cost a fortune to pay for those urgent calls if they had charged us for them...As well as the fantastic staff, lovely rooms with great facilities :- tea & coffee making machine, microwave, fridge, kitchen unit with sink and lovely bathroom this hotel far surpassed our expectations of an American hotel. Included in the room rate is breakfast. There is a lounge on the 4th floor? where you help yourself to hot beverages, fruit juice, yogurt,freshly baked bagels, muffins and bread as well as cereals and fruit. What a good morning kickstart. Bed and free breakfast is rare in USA usually just room only.
The staff here are superb. I genuinely couldn't fault them. They go above and beyond to help with anything they can. The management were great and all staff very friendly, and managed to keep our spirits up and have a laugh with us when we were stressing out about the weather and cancelled flights .
The location of this hotel is spot on.
I could not have asked for anything or anywhere better to stay, especially during that dreadful weather phenomenon. Thank you to the Pearl. So highly recommended!We will be back a,s,a,p.

title: Un hotel excelente.
text: Un hotel excelente,muy buena ubicación y muy cerca del metro. El personal muy amable y siempre  dispuesto a ayudar, la habitación muy espaciosa y cama muy cómoda.El café, té y snacks  gratis durante todo el día todo un detalle...

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: This a fabulous place to stay, rooms are a great size, breakfast is included-which is a bonus -cereals, toast, bagels, fruit, yogurt tea, coffee. The staff are very friendly and very helpful, giving us help with the subways and directions. On level 2 - you can get coffee or tea anytime. I highly recommend this hotel. Great spot in New York.

title: Great hotel with friendly helpful staff.
text: We stayed here for 5 nights. We found the room was spacious, clean and comfortable and the staff were helpful and friendly. The hotel is in a great location and is handy for walking to Broadway, Times Square and Central Park with subway stations nearby if you want to venture further away. Between 4pm and 5pm free wine and snacks were served for the hotel guests during 'Happy Hour'. It certainly made us happy after one hour with free wine on tap! Breakfast was a simple selection of cereals, fruit, yogurts, bagels etc which was just enough to keep you going until lunchtime. There is a grocery store round the corner if you need to top up with food and beverages. The hotel has a business centre with a couple of PC's and a printer where you can sort your flight check in and boarding passes out if needed. Overall we enjoyed our stay in this hotel and would recommend staying here.

title: Excelente!
text: Ótima localização para quem vai assistir aos espetáculos da Broadway. Ao lado dos teatros e pertíssimo da Times Square, mas sem estar encima da confusão. Ótimo custo benefício, pois inclui café da manha e os quartos tem um tamanho confortável para 4 pessoas. Ganhamos um vinho pelo aniversário do meu marido. Recebem encomendas da Amazon sem qualquer custo. Usei o transfer de retorno ao aeroporto, o que foi muito cômodo. Não é barato, mas nada em NY é. Voltaria!

title: NYC pratique !
text:
tout le personnel très sympathique, emplacement idéal et vraiment central !
au pied de l'hotel c'est TIME SQUARE ! un portier parle même français !!
pratique le petit déjeuner de l'hotel.
BREF, rapport qualité prix nickel !
Emmanuelle

title: Wonderful week stay in New York
text: Nothing was too much trouble and the reception staff were very helpful. Room spacious and well looked after. The position of the hotel was brilliant for the theatres and Times Square We could not fault anything about this hotel.

title: Glad we tried something different
text:
We usually stay at suites with hot breakfast and mainstream hotels, but based on other reviews,  we tried the Pearl.  So glad we did.  Great r
oom for 5, staff incredibly friendly and helpful,  awesome soaps and shower.  Great location to EVERYTHING!   Subways, restaurants,  just an amazing trip with our 3 tweens.  We would definitely stay here next time in town.

title: Great location
text:
We loved the location of this hotel. Enjoyed sitting out on our balcony and particularly appreciated the complimentary breakfast and cheese and wine. 
Staff always friendly. 
EE Grill next door provides tasty meals with huge potions of chips!!

title: I sort of hate to write a review....because it will be harder to get a room at The Pearl!
text: What a fabulous hotel!  The Pearl has attentive staff, lovely amenities, a great location, huge (and not just by NYC standards) rooms, and is immaculate.  I can't say enough about how nice it is to stay there.  This was my 7th stay and everything has been consistently excellent.

title: Excelente en todo sentido
text:
La ubicación del Hotel es perfecta. A nosotros nos encanta caminar, ya que entendemos que es la mejor manera de conocer, por lo tanto nos movimos la mayoría de los días a pie y en algunos casos en metro. 
Referente a la habitación optamos por la "Deluxe con cama extragrande" y con espacio de cocina. Cuenta con microondas, cafetera, refrigerador pequeño, y algunos artículos básicos como platos y vasos (en la esquina del Hotel hay un mercado que cuenta con todo lo necesario)
La habitación amplia y cómoda, con una ducha increíble!! (aspecto más que importante después de un día de andar sin parar, por lo que el descanso fue 100% placentero).
Referente a la limpieza de la habitación y espacios comunes, muy correcta. 
El desayuno si bien es básico, es suficiente para comenzar el día. Seguramente de camino al salir del Hotel, hagan alguna "parada" en busca de cupcakes, batidos, jugos, etc.
Otro aspecto a destacar es la amabilidad de todo el personal, muy atentos todos en cada punto de contacto.
Un gesto que nos pareció realmente muy lindo, fue la atención que tuvieron con mi esposo. Cumplió años durante nuestra estadía en NY, y al regresar a la noche nos encontramos con una nota saludándolo y una botella de vino con dos copas. Detalles que sin dudas, suman y hacen la diferencia. 
Recomendamos The Pearl sin dudarlo. En caso de volver a NY, elegiría este Hotel nuevamente.

title: Magnificent Hotel
text: This is a rarity in New York, rooms that are normal sized. The hotel itself is immaculate, service is divine and super clean and modern.  All amenities and facilities are first rate. The location is perfect for theatre, shopping and eating. You can walk to all of these.

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text: Had a very good stay at the Pearl Hotel. Very easy to get to from the airport if you're coming via the subway as 50th street station is a two minute walk away. We had room on the 11th floor which was very good, immaculately clean, king sized everything two TV's one in the en-suite, tea and coffee making facilities. Buffet breakfast continental style help yourself with everything you could want. Front of house staff and housekeeping staff excellent and so helpful. From this hotel you can walk to times square, central park, rockafella plaza , Macy's, St.Patrick's cathedral, Lincoln centre, subways on 49th and 50th street to take you downtown to Wall street, statue of Liberty, and Brooklyn bridge. Restaurants to suit every taste and budget here, E&E grill house next door is classy and you get a 10% discount card from reception, out towards 9th avenue and restaurants are very good value for money where locals are eating. Would recommend this hotel and would come here again.

title: Nice rooms, great location
text: Right in the central Broadway area, easy to walk out to 5th Avenue, Times Square etc. Rooms are a good size and very nicely appointed. There is no restaurant as such, but you can walk straight through to the grill house next door, which is excellent. Breakfast is provided as a serve yourself buffet and there is a good choice. Disposable (but high quality) plastic plates and cutlery, but that's ok. Excellent free wine, soft drinks and snacks from 4-5pm. Very friendly staff and great, responsive service.

title: Wonderful Location and Great Ammenities
text: This hotel was the perfect location for us to bounce around to multiple broadway shows during our stay.  The hotel itself is lovely and comfortable and the staff is excellent.  I highly recommend this hotel!

title: Gutes Hotel in perfekter Lage zum fairen Preis!
text: Wir haben das Hotel für unsren New York Trip gebucht und waren absolut zufrieden. Die Lage ist perfekt, nur 5min zum Times Square. Zimmer sind ausreichend groß und sauber. Frühstück ist typisch amerikanisch, aber dennoch ausreichend und lecker. Würden das Hotel höchstwahrscheinlich wieder buchen, da auch der Preis ausgesprochen fair war.

title: Great Space in Theater District Location
text:
Our plans for New York centered around the Theater district and Mid-town Manhattan.  We were also looking for a location that was away from the insane crowd that develops around the Time Square area.  The Pearl was the perfect solution for our needs.  The hotel was spacious, clean and quiet. 

Stephanie at the concierge station was extremely helpful.  We had a general outline of what we wanted to see and do during our visit and Stephanie’s input allowed a specific tailoring that made for a fantastic four-day exploration of New York.  

The hotel offers an expanded continental breakfast that we found quite good and continually attended / replenished during the hours of operation.  The afternoon wine and cheese was very nice and also attended / replenished during operation.  In both cases those whole were first and those that were last all had the same selection.

title: Perfecto
text: Fui por unos días mi sorpresa del hotel es que realmente tiene más de lo que esperaba habitaciones grandes baños limpios productos de calidad en los baños y sobre todo una ubicación privilegiada ya que puedes desplazarte desde ahí a pie a muchos centros turísticos ...un desayuno suficiente para empezar el día y el servicio de taxi que tienen con precios muy accesibles súper recomendable👍🏻

title: Feeling very comfortable in the Pearl
text:
Just returned with my family from a midweek stay at the Pearl, we had room 704, which was perfect. Starting with a big welcome by Manuel, who helped us with our luggage and gave us very usefull tips. 
A nice bottle of apple cider and chocolates where in the room upon our arrival because if the 10th birthday of our daughter.
Breakfast was perfect, always enough, our children loved it, as well as the complementary chips in the hall and the availability of 24/7 small snacks and drinks. Booked also the taxi back to JFK through the hotelservice. Hotel is perfect situated from times square, rockefeller centre, central park, could not be better!
Also a big plus for William, the concierge with always a big smile and more than willing to help. These extra personal touch by Manuel and William  made our stay in NY very comfortable, we definetely will come back to the Pearl.

title: "Perfection"
text:
I stayed there for 7 nights with my family.
I highly recommend this hotel- the location is just perfect, just 2 min from Times Square!
The rooms are really big and clean.
There is a really nice Complementary drinks and snacks between 16-17 every day.
And probably one of the things that made our stay so amazing are the hotel staff! Very helpful, nice and kind.
Definitely will stay there again!!

title: the perfect hotel
text: this is definitely a hotel worth returning to. I stayed for three days before going somewhere else, but the pearl is amazing; starting with the nice facilities and friendly/pleasant staff, plus it's in a very strategic location.

title: Great hotel
text:
First time in New York, so didn't know where to stay.
I had a few boxes I wanted ticked for my hotel and The Pearl ticked them all and more.

Great size room

Tea and coffee facilities in the room

Breakfast in the morning with plenty 
to choose from

Great location 

Friendly staff.

I will be booking here again on my return trip.

title: Outstanding service
text: We could not have been more pleased with the service, quality of the facility and perfect location.   We would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone coming into NY for theatre or business.   During our stay one of our friends had a relative pass away and the hotel could not have been more accommodating.   The staff were willing to easily negotiate to a larger room, the rooms were nice sizes and very quiet.   Just a good choice for a NY hotel that is reasonably priced with excellent service.

title: Great visit
text:
Me and my 18 year old daughter stayed 2 nights at the Pearl.  Location was perfect as we were just in town to catch a couple shows.  
Staff was very pleasant. I appreciated being greeted by the doorman with each entrance and exit,always offering to assist us. 
The bathroom was well equipped with quality bath products

title: Great Location, Friendly Staff, Clean
text:
Here are my pros and cons of the Pearl:

Pros:
- If you like Times Square, this is STEPS away from it all.  This is not my favorite part of the city, but our kids wanted this location and loved it.  
- Our room (707) was very clean and quiet - and fairly BIG for NYC.
- The staff was friendly.
- The breakfast is OK - Not great...but free is good.  
- SUPER easy to get to several subway stops.  
- $45 parking - CHEAP for NYC
- The hotel common spaces are pleasant and modern.  
- The free internet is reasonably fast.  
- Nice toiletries.  

Cons:
- I would have given this hotel 5 stars, but I was very frustrated that when we checked out, they said it would take 30 minutes to get our car as it was parked far away.  They should have told us this when we checked IN as we had not scheduled for this.  Now that I know this, I would stay again and plan ahead. 
- We frequently waited on the elevator and it was usually crowded.  Not a huge draw back, but do plan ahead... 
-The beds, linens, and bath are nothing special - but not bad.  
- Our room was on the back of the hotel - so we had a view of a wall, but it was VERY quiet...

title: Perfect location; Great staff
text: We had to limit ourselves to one night but the staff made the hotel available to us beyond the check in and check out times by getting us into our room, storing our luggage, and allowing us to recoup in the lounge area.  The room has a bedroom and living room which is perfect when travelling with kids.  I slept on the small loveseat and it was still comfortable and gave me some privacy while my son and grandson took the beds.  The bathroom has a great tub and beautiful shower.  Breakfast and wifi were included which was a big reason for taking this room.  The other reason was location.  While this is more than I ever spend on a room, this was perfect for our needs at this time.

title: Bonne adresse à Time square
text:
Hôtel calme, bien entretenu, qui mérite ses quatre étoiles. Chambre de base suffisamment spacieuse et bien équipée. Bonne literie. Seul bémol, salle de bain très exigüe.
Petit déjeuner correct et gratuit. Wine and Cleese buffet sympa tous les soirs.
Proche de tout, Time square au bout de la rue. Personnel d'accueil en général sympa (à l'exception d'une personne).
Éviter la navette proposée pour Newark, limousine plus chère sans doute que taxi. Bon plan pour quelques jours au coeur de manhattan !

title: great friendly hotel
text:
we stayed here to access threatreland, and to allow a good starting point to a variety of other destinations via taxi or subway.  Subway access for North and south is great with 49th Street a minute walk away.

The staff here are all excellent.

The room on the 14th floor (with microwave and fridge) was great, although I would have liked a couple of different pillow options.

I hadn't checked the eating arrangements here other than to acknowledge the existance of a grill, which I assumed would also cater for breakfast.  Sadly not.  The continental breakfast is on level 2.

We prefer a little more so we walked a black and  a half to a deli.

p.s..  don't touch the VOSS water unless you like paying $8 a bottle.

It would have been 5 stars.

title: Good, service
text: We had a pleasant stay,  everything was very good.  Azi at the front desk was able to.get us a very nice room .  service was good location was great.  Staff was wonderful.  I want to thank everyone for our wonderful stay

title: Great hotel in a great location
text:
My boyfriend and I stayed here for 5 nights in April 2017. On arrival our room was not ready (this was expected as we had arrived before 4pm when check in was advertised). We were given the option to upgrade our room which we did - it was a pretty big room with a queen sized bed and over looked the front of the hotel (room 801). The hotel provides continental breakfast between 7-10 every day and we stocked up on this before heading out for the day - it's a great little extra. We did try the wine and cheese one night but we were full from food all the other days we stayed.

The hotel is opposite the theatre for the Book of Mormon, if you are interested in cheaper tickets there is a raffle for remaining tickets everyday at either 5/6pm (depending on the show time). We didn't do it but lots of people did.

Overall the hotel was good, literally minutes away from Times Square and the next corner was the metro.

Staff were helpful - we enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay there again!

title: My nyc visit experience
text:
Great stuff
Great location
Reasonable price
Very clean,
Highly recommended.
Felt like a king. 
Thank you.
Will come back soon.
And tell friends........
.....
Visited many hotels and that was one of the best experience

title: Shopping trip to New York - stayed 2 nights
text:
Went to New York for a quick shopping trip.  Stayed at the Pearl for 2 nights. Pretty small hotel with very personable staff.  I was told my room was upgraded, so not sure what the regular rooms look like.  My room was close to the elevator but did not hear any noise coming from the hallway.  
There is a small Grill restaurant attached to the hotel where you can eat and have a drink.  I had a small appetizer and a drink prior to the show and that was nice.
Good:  Close to shopping,  I liked being close to Broadway, 5th avenue and theatre district.  The Pearl Hotel is just across from the Theater Eugene O'Neill, where The Book of Mormon was playing. I had a free evening and enjoyed a first class seat for a third of the price at the last minute purchase.  I a very nice dinner at Oceans which is about 4 blocks away. If you like seafood, this is a huge restaurant with white tablecloth, very good seafood and nice servers.  The Pearl includes a small breakfast on the second floor, croissant, pastries, eggs predone, toast your own bagels and bread, coffee, juice, milk etc.  It's ok.  In the afternoon, in the same area, they have cheese, fruits, chips, snacks & wine.  They offer apples and chips in the lobby. Bed was comfortable. There's a small microwave and a bar fridge in the room. Nothing in the bar fridge.  

When I left, I was offered a driver to take me to the airport, by the bell boy for $50.00 which was probably just a little more than the cost of Uber. At the airport, I got out of the vehicle quickly while the driver was taking my suitcases out of the trunk.  I had forgotten my cell on the back seat and did not notice until the driver came back to give it to my as I was at the Air Canada desk checking in.  I thought that was an amazing gesture as he already had driven off and had to come back to search for me.
 
Bad:  Dirty bed with sheet were all wrinkled and you could see that someone sat on the side of the bed and leaked!  The sheets had not been changed and only noticed at 11 pm when I went to go to bed.  I called to have my bed changed.
Bathroom area is small and no room to place your personal items.
Carpeting really needs to be vacuumed properly and cleaned.  The was thickness of dust layer on the floor around the walls.  Water bottle in the room available at a high price.

I wish I could give a higher quote for this hotel as the personnel was very pleasant.  For the price of this hotel, I'm sure they can do better with the house cleaning.

title: Great choice for a visit to the city
text: We recently spent a few nights at the Pearl and could not have been more pleased.  5 stars all around for convenience, cleanliness, accommodations and hospitality.  The staff is excellent, rooms are spacious and quiet, breakfast is convenient, and location is ideal for access to theaters, restaurants, subway, Times Square, shopping, Central Park, and everything else the city has to offer.  Don't miss the chance to see the 911 Museum.

title: Confirming excellent choice
text:
We recently spent 6 nights at the Pearl, and wanted to add our comments to those who have mentioned the convenience, quiet rooms, friendly, helpful staff, cleanliness.  What more can we say?  
We booked a Deluxe King room, and were pleasantly surprised by the roominess after hearing of small rooms.  It was nice to have morning coffee in room, and tea in the afternoons, as some of our weather was wet and cold.  
The breakfast was a great start for our day, and for our time, we never found it super busy.  Staff there were very attentive to our requests.  Front desk and door staff also were attentive and were always there to answer all our questions and give suggestions.
We would be happy to return and would recommend the hotel to anyone looking for a quiet, convenient location in Manhattan.

title: Convenient location
text: This hotel is located in the theatre district.  It's a perfect location, easy to walk to everything if you want to stay close to Times Square and the Theatre District.  It is small, the rooms are spacious enough.  The do have a few suites which are very spacious.  They also include a light continental breakfast.  A good value.

title: The Pearl Hotel New York - Excellent
text:
Visited The Pearl Hotel for three days in April 2017 as a family. The position of the hotel is excellent if you want to be on the doorstep of Times Square and theatres whilst still being in a quiet location.

The staff at reception were extremely helpful and provided information on the surrounding area and answered our questions with enthusiasm and positivity.

The family room was large with enough space for us all and was extremely clean.

Would recommend the hotel and given the opportunity again I would definitely return to it.

title: What a gem
text: Stayed here for a 5 day trip to New York. Great location - close to Times Square, Broadway and lots of attractions - but without the manic feel of those areas. Lovely boutique style hotel - great large room, lovely decor and ultra modern bathroom. Staff very friendly and helpful with great advice on places to eat etc. Never had breakfast as we wanted to experience American Diners, but did have room service dinner and the food was great. Free wifi that worked faultlessly. I can't recommend highly enough- thoroughly deserves it's high Trip Advisor rating.

title: My new favorite NY Hotel!
text: I have stayed at many New York Hotels, and this is by far my new favorite! Staff is warm, welcoming and knowledgeable. From the moment I called the front desk months ago to ask questions prior to booking, to the moment we departed, they simply could not do enough to make our 3 night stay absolutely perfect! Housekeeping was meticulous and the bed/room was so cozy/comfortable. Bathroom was modern and quite large for a room in NY City. The continental breakfast/snacks were a lovely plus, as we love to "grab and go" in the morning as there is so much to see and do in NY. Location is perfect, right in the Theater District. Walking distance to so many wonderful sights, and close to the subway (with fabulous directions from staff) for those attractions that you may want to enjoy outside of the Times Square area. It was an absolutely perfect stay....Will definitely be back!

title: Now my favorite hotel!
text:
I travel to NYC almost every month. This hotel is now perfect for me. My office used to be on 39th & 3rd but moved to 51st & 6th. So I needed to find nice nearby hotels, that are not too pricey. I decided to try The Pearl and I am wonderfully pleased. 

It is not super pricey although being in an excellent location. A block away from the subway right in the heart of the theater district.  The rooms are very clean and not too small. The bathroom is nice with modern fixtures. 

The hotel staff were pleasant and professional. They upgraded me to a king room at no charge which was very nice of them. 

This is my first time staying at The Pearl, but it won't be my last!

Very recommended!

title: Overall a positive experience with one glitch
text: Stayed here for three nights and there were many things to like.  The location is excellent.  The staff were friendly and polite.  The second-floor lounge area with free breakfast, afternoon wine and snacks, and 24/7 availability of hot beverages and snacks, was a nice perk.  The Deluxe King room on the 12th floor was quiet, even though it faced the street.  The bathroom was clean and modern with good water pressure.  The bed was comfortable, although there could have been a better variety of pillows.  There was one glitch, however - on the first day I noticed that one of the bedside lamps was not working (its on/off switch seemed to be broken).  I reported this to the front desk, but the issue was never fixed during the 3-day stay.

title: Faultless hotel
text:
I cant recommend this hotel enough. It made our trip to new york just faultless. The location is the main winner, being about 6 or 7 minutes from times square. Walking distance to theatres. rockefellar centre. 5th ave and so much more! Subways also at end of road which was handy.

. We had a nice big room (rare for nyc) with the housekeeping brilliant. L'occtain toiletries. room made up lovely every day. Free tea/coffee throughout day and good breakfast selection in morning  (i was always there early  at 8am so had no problem getting a table! 

The staff were polite but especially one friendly doorman who i fail to remember his name but he gave us great information and always went out of his way and made and effort to talk to us (thank you!) all in all this hotel would be my number one choice when returning to new york city!! 5 stars from me.

title: Great Location, Nice Rooms
text:
Stayed one night on March 11th with another family.  We had the Deluxe Queen Queen suite which housed our family of 5 very comfortably.  Rooms were very well appointed, clean, and beds were comfortable.  Hotel location is great, steps to many theaters and times square.  Short walk to Rockefeller Center and Central Park.  The day we were in town it was cold, but we still managed a fair bit of exploring outside.  Went to the wine and cheese which was nice, but they could stretch a little on the wine with something nicer ($10 more bucks a bottle would get you something decent).  Breakfast in the morning was continental, but gave you enough selection that everyone got enough to kick off the day.

Only complaint was that one of the two elevators was out of service for most of our stay.  This happens, and it was the weekend, but it made moving around the hotel challenging.  I would recommend looking into a complete retrofit of this equipment as the existing was a bit slow and showing it's age.

I would recommend a stay here to friends.

title: Our 30th
text:
Stayed here with family and friends, hotel was lovely clean and staff very helpful. 
Free wine and snacks in afternoon was brilliant, and breakfast was fine for continental.
Staff was there to help, told us some nice places to eat.
Very good location 5mins if that to time square.
Had amazing time can't wait to go back.

title: Great location, nice large room
text: The Pearl Hotel is located in the Theater district very near two subway stops that service the whole city.  It is a boutique hotel with all the benefits you expect, but it offers a good complimentary continental breakfast and wine and cheese hour.  Close enough to Times Square to feel a part of the fun, but far enough away to be quiet.  We stayed in a double room, and the room itself and bathroom were large by NYC standards.  I will stay here again.

title: Great hotel in great location
text: Stayed here for a week. Great customer service by desk and door staff.  Concierge also assisted in booking trips and advising where to go. Location is right by times square. Rooms are clean and spacious.  Continental breakfast included.  Also the added bonus of a wine and cheese hour every day and a nice lounge all day with complimentary tea and snacks.  Would stay there again if I visited New York.

title: au milieu de  the big apple et près de tout pour un premier voyage
text:
rien à dire sinon un bémol pour le PDJ qui pour nous français était vraiment trop rapide .

La chambre était bien . Cet hotel permet d'avoir les bus hop and hop aux pieds,ainsi que les comédies musicales,l'agitation,les restos et commerces. Je le recommande vivement pour se plonger dans New York de la 1ière fois.

title: Average
text: Clean room and friendly staff.  Don't expect too much for the complimentary happy hour, though.  Small veggie tray and cheese - the celery and carrots were old and I'm surprised they were put out.  Not crazy about the 2 wine choices.  Otherwise, I would recommend.

title: Excellent in all ways..
text: Just came from a visit to New York.. booked it at the last moment would definitely want to go back to this place anytime I visit in the future. Very friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are great and most important is that it is just a few minutes walk away from Times Square and Rockefeller. Just perfect! Parked my car there and used the hop in hop off tour to see the city. The continental breakfast gave us a great start top day filled with activities .

title: Solid, basic hotel
text:
Front desk staff are very helpful (especially Azi) and doormen are friendly. We have a room with 2 double beds - beds are a little lumpy and they creak and crack everytime you move. Pillows are small and one has seen better days. Bedding isn't luxurious - sheet, waffle-weave blanket and bedspread. It's a so-so room: a little worn but adequate with the usual things you'd expect, but nothing special. I would have rated it 3 stars. Breakfast included - bagels, small pastries, yogurt, 4 cereals, dubious-tasting coffee.  Boring but it's fuel.
There are no bad surprises here but nothing is amazing either.

title: Pearl Hotel
text: Very nice hotel in the heart of theatre district. We moved out of the Sheraton because it was dirty and not good value to be welcomed by the Pearl. Small hotel with great location, nice sized rooms with a decent bathroom and amenities.

title: Well appointed place, good size rooms, good price
text:
I don't normally stay in the Theater District (after having lived in the city, I tend to avoid tourist areas), but this deal was too good to resist - highly ranked hotel under $200 / night! You don't often get a hotel at that price point that has a doorman and such an attentive staff.

Will definitely stay again.  

Pros:
easy to get to from Penn Station & Port Authority (1, C/E, N/R all stop nearby)
decent size room (for NYC), nice design and good, flexible lighting
bathtub
free breakfast and all-day snacks in the lobby; free hot beverages all day
free wine / cheese reception in the afternoon
small enough size that you don't have to wait forever for an elevator
convenient to Broadway theater district
complimentary bottle of wine for birthday

(Minor) Cons:
breakfast area got busy and seats seemed limited for the number of people there
check in time isn't very flexible (4:00), which could be a problem for long-distance travelers
our 14th floor room got pretty hot (heat rising from the rest of the building, I guess) and we had to open window / turn on A/C

title: Lovely NYC stay
text: A great place to stay when going to the city to see a Broadway show.  Very clean and comfortable. Wine get together before the show, Continental Breakfast daily and snacks to be found 24/7. The staff is on top of the game!!  Had a bit of a problem with a stranger but staff was totally on top of it and made me feel very safe.

title: Eine Perle in Midtown
text:
Nun schon zum dritten Mal war ich für 5 Nächte mit meinem Freund Gast im The Pearl und musste erneut feststellen, wie gerne ich jedes Mal in dieses 4 Sterne Haus zurückkehre. Die unschlagbare Lage in Midtown, der zuvorkommende, stets freundliche und sehr bemühte Service sowie die tadellose Sauberkeit in den Zimmern sind nur drei von vielen Gründen, die uns immer wieder in das The Pearl in der West 49th St. zurückkommen lassen. Es gibt zahlreiche kostenlose Snacks (Chips, Kekse etc.), ein kontinentales Frühstück, Tee- und Kaffeeautomaten sowie eine gemütliche Winehour mit Kräckern, Käse und Obst jeden Tag zwischen 4 und 5pm.
Mehrere U-Bahn-Stationen, der Times Square sowie das Rockefeller Center und die 5th Avenue sind fussläufig erreichbar. Einen besseren Ausgangspunkt zum Erkunden der Stadt kann ich mir nicht vorstellen.
In den extrem sauberen Zimmern gibt es Slipper, Bademäntel, hochwertige, französische Beautyprodukte und Regenschirme für den Gast.
Wir können dieses Hotel uneingeschränkt empfehlen und werden definitiv auch bei unserem nächsten Besuch in der Stadt wieder hier einchecken - vielleicht ja mal in der Vorweihnachtszeit. :)

title: Great Hotel
text: Stayed in room 202 which has it own outside patio. Since we were there during the bitter cold did not get to lay out on the lounger. Room and hotel was very nice but expensive. Plenty of room for the 4 of us, husband and 2 teenagers.

title: Good location and breakfast included
text:
Hotel was clean and tidy ,Staff very friendly,
very good location 2 mins from Times Square
my only complaint hot drinks facilities in the room were free but the bottled water was $8
same water was $3 in Walgreens at times square

title: Second stay
text: I really like this hotel.  The location is great.  The decor is attractive and my room was very comfortable.  I  appreciated being able to grab a quick breakfast on the way to my convention each morning.  The snacks were a nice bonus as wall.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  I will recommend the Pearl to my friends.

title: Great hotel
text: The Pearl Hotel is in the perfect location!  There are 2 Broadway theaters on the same block, close to Times Square and Hell's Kitchen.  The staff is friendly and accommodating, the rooms are spacious (but the closet was tiny!) and they have complimentary breakfast and wine/cheese every afternoon.  The breakfast did not have a huge selection, but it was nice to have something to grab in the morning.  I would definitely stay there again!

title: Hôtel parfait et très bien situé
text:
Réservation sur booking et belle découverte à la clé. Chambre très spacieuse avec lit King size, personnel charmant toujours prêt à aider et dégustation de vins tous les soirs à 16h même le week end. De plus, aucun bruit et parfaite isolation avec vue sur la Rue.
Petit déjeuner copieux incluant bagels, viennoiseries, pâtisseries et cakes, fruit frais, céréales et yaourts. Aucun souci pour trouver des places tous les matins.
À 5mn de Times Square et 1mn du Crowne Plazza qui lui pratique une taxe journalière de 30 dollars au lieu de 4 pour le Pearl.

title: Little Gem in Midtown
text:
Located a couple blocks from
Times Square, in the heart of the theater district make it a super convenient location. Great service, the doormen are always there to help!  Amazing free breakfast which is almost unheard of in NYC!!!  A small gym too!  Larger than normal rooms and suites available too. 
Really loves my stay & would return.

title: Great location for good price
text: Glad we choose this hotel after reading reviews here. Location is perfect to visit NYC major landmarks. Very good restaurants around. Valet parking is 45 min from the hotel so make sure you ask for your car in advance. Not much to add except book now!

title: Hotel muy céntrico y muy buen servicio
text: Hotel situado en un lugar ideal para disfrutar de la ciudad en pleno Broadway. Habitación amplia, silenciosa y muy buen servicio. El desayuno estaba incluido y me pareció muy correcto. Abierta permanentemente la sala en la primera planta para poder tomar cafe, infusiones. Fruta disponible gratis.

title: Excellent location, value and service.
text:
This hotel is ideally located in the theatre district with times square only a minutes walk away and all the other attractions were walk able too, however if your not a walker there were many close metro stations.

Our room was very clean, relatively large with a lovely shower. The breakfast provided all you needed for the day. It is served on plastic plates which may bother some people however for the choice is great and for the price you can't complain at that.

Snacks, water, tea and coffee are available all day in the breakfast room and by the exit to grab and go.

I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Sentralt og svært hyggelig hotell
text: Her følte vi oss svært velkomne fra vi satt i taxien på utsiden av hotellet ved ankomst til vi dro derfra 6 dager senere. Vi var en familie på 4 på ferie i New York og hadde et supert opphold på dette hotellet. De ansattes imøtekommenhet, svært hyggelige og hjelpsomme var med på å sette ekstra spiss på oppholdet. Rommene var store og fine (mot bakgård), hvor det da var stille og rolig i forhold til all nattestøyen i New York.  Gratis Wifi som funket meget bra. Inkludert frokost - denne var helt grei. Skulle man kunne ønske seg noe mer kanskje litt mer variert pålegg - men som sagt helt greit for oss. Skal vi tilbake til New York kommer vi garantert til å sjekke opp dette hotellet igjen. - Anbefales

title: So great, I'm coming back!
text: The Pearl was the perfect fit for our need to find a quiet, boutique hotel in the theater district.  The staff was welcoming and helpful and the parking valet made for a smooth entrance.  We arrived early, but our room was ready.  We were upgraded to a king room, which was very nice.  The room was clean and comfortable, with a large window overlooking the Eugene O'Neill Theater where The Book of Mormon was currently playing.  We grabbed some lunch at The Grill next door.  It was quiet and the food was very good and it gave my sister and I a chance to catch up on things and still go back to the room for a short nap before getting ready to go see Natasha, Pierre and The Great Comet of 1812.  Highly recommend everyone sees/experiences this immersive musical based on 70 pages of Tolstoy's War and Peace.  We also enjoyed the wine and cheese hour and it was nice to be able to have the continental breakfast offerings in the morning.  We never heard any noise and slept well.  Our stay was so pleasant that I've booked a room for May 30th (have to see The Great Comet again!). Big thank you to the staff for making our stay so pleasant!

title: Très bon emplacement
text:
À quelques pas de la 5th avenue et time square l'endroit idéal pour un quick passage à New York pour faire un tour dans les magasins etc..l'hôtel est propre la literie est plus qu'agréable, le petit déjeuner est pas mal. Je vous recommande un petit passage au resto grill de l'hôtel pour les arrivées tardives du soir.
Hôtel recommandable, cela dit faut penser aux adaptateurs pour les clients hors Amérique :-)

title: Excellent
text:
Hôtel très bien situé. La chambre et la salle de bain sont très bien équipées et propres, avec le wifi, des rangements, un petit frigo et une cafetière.La salle de sport ouvre tôt et est bien équipée.
Le petit déjeuner, gratuit, offre un large éventail de produits. Le personnel est disponible et il y a un employé qui parle français qui est toujours prêt à nous conseiller. 
Nous y retournerons sans hésiter.

title: Near Perfect
text: There is a lot to like about this hotel property. The location is in close proximity to times square and hell's kitchen and the myriad of restaurants in that area. Directly across the street is the Book of Mormon sell-out broadway play. The staff is very helpful and friendly throughout and the housekeeping spot on. Continental breakfast is very well stocked with everything; a nice option to an otherwise expensive breakfast dining elsewhere. The wine and cheese happy hour, however, could use a better presentation of appetizers instead of just Ritz crackers. The rooms themselves nicely appointed, to include expensive guest amenities and fabulous shower. If I am to be honest for those reading this review and to the owners of this lovely hotel; my recommendation to make this an excellent choice of hotel to stay is to upgrade the beds and add a duvet cover. With everything that is wonderful about this hotel; the owners can take a page out of the Westin brand hotels regarding their bedding.

title: Excellent stay all around
text:
We traveled with our toddler and requested a room not facing 49th street, highest floor and away from the elevator banks for a quieter stay since our daughter naps and goes to bed early. Upon arrival, the front desk let us know they were able to accommodate all of this and continued to check in throughout our stay on whether we needed anything else. Valet was easy and convenient. Front door were helpful and kind, especially when it came to helping us get a stroller in and out of Ubers. The snacks, happy hour and breakfast were added bonuses; even though we ate out in the morning, it was nice to grab some fruit or coffee on our way out for the day. 

Kids or not, this is an excellent hotel and we would not hesitate to stay here again on our next visit.

title: Great Room, Great Location - Only Knock is room was not available until 3:45
text:
Nice room. Great location. Helpful staff.

Only knock - the hotel called the day before to confirm our reservation (very nice touch by their customer service department) and asked when we would be arriving. We said we would be there by 3:00. No mention was made that the room might not be available before 4:00. We arrived at 3:15 and with nowhere else to go, we had to wait in their 2nd floor lounge area for 30 minutes for our room to be ready. Since we were traveling in from Long Island, we could have come in 30 minutes later - rather than waiting in the lounge for our room.

One other nice touch was that they sent up a bottle of wine to our room as birthday surprise from the hotel.

We would stay there again - we would just arrive later next time.

title: Great hotel and staff
text: Stayed here for a long weekend with my teenage daughter.  Location is perfect near Times Sq and the subway is at the end of the block.  Staff were very attentive and helpful.  Appreciated the breakfast as we had a full schedule and could grab something quick and easy. Will definitely be back.

title: Wonderful! Best staff.
text: Great location. Lovely rooms. Central Park, Time Square and great restaurants all within walking distance. The staff is amazing, especially Azi at the front desk, he couldn't have been more helpful or friendly. Thank you for making it a great trip. We will be back.

title: Very good stay at the Pearl
text:
We stayed at the Pearl for 5 nights in December and very much enjoyed our stay.  Location-wise the hotel is brilliant, just north of Times Square, and the service can't be faulted either.  We were given a complimentary upgrade due to it being my girlfriend's 30th birthday which was a really nice touch, and I really liked the idea of the happy hour in the afternoon at 4pm with free cheese and wine.  Breakfast is also included - it's nothing spectacular, just a selection of cereals, pastries and bagels etc but makes a difference in an expensive city!

The room itself was very nice with a big comfortable bed, wi-fi and large screen TV, and unlike some NYC rooms, was actually pretty big.

The only reason I haven't given it 5 stars is because despite the breakfast and wine hour included, it is still pretty expensive, but I recognise that this is New York so everything's expensive!  That said, I'd definitely return here the next time I'm in New York.

title: Muy recomendable
text: El personal es muy amable, las camas son muy cómodas y el baño es bastante amplio. A la oferta del desayuno le faltan frutas y alguna otra cosa. Sin embargo, lo que tienen bastante rico. Además, el hotel está ubicado en un lugar fantástico en Manhattan, cerca de las calles más famosas y perfecto para salir a dar una vuelta por la noche. Además, está al lado de Hell's Kitchen, una zona de 9th Avenue llena de restaurantes con comida deliciosa. Muy recomendable.

title: Fantastic
text: We stayed For 5 days, and we were not disappointed. The style looks great and services are even better ! The staff alone, made it worthwhile. When you ask a question, 3 people are on it !!! Fantastic. Clean, quiet, and professional, I will definitely be back. Congrats to The Pearl

title: Holiday to NYC
text:
This hotel has been amazing, I would strongly recommend it to everyone.  The staff have been very helpful and friendly, nothing too much trouble.  I have never stayed in such a friendly place.  We have had an an amazing time!! Thank you so much!! 

Slight problem with the first room located at the back of the hotel, as we had a leaky shower. However they offered to move us straight away and even upgraded our room free of charge. We were moved to the front of the hotel this time to a superior king (absolutely massive room and bed - more than you would expect from a New York hotel). The rooms were lovely in both overall, no one can help something not being in correct working order at that moment!! Would recommend a superior room or the deluxe both were fab!!

title: Pe(a)r(l)fect!
text: It has one year since I stayed at the Pearl Hotel and I still miss it.  Every member of staff we met was fantastic; the gym was great; the breakfast was great; there was free wine and snacks in the afternoon; the room was great; there was free orangey water in the lobby; the location was pefect.

title: Hotel nota 10
text: Localização incrível. Partindo do aeroporto JFK pegue a linha de metrô azul E, e desça na parada 50 st com 8 avenue. Muito perto. Tudo que fizer em NYC sera fácil de acessar nesta localização. Fácil de comer nas redondezas. 80 metros da Times. Recepção incrível. Gente muito educada. Tudo de uma limpeza impecável. Guardam suas compras na Amazon ! Não cobram. Café da manhã para o estilo EUA é muito bom. Quarto, calefação, banho, controle de tudo é perfeito. Preço sensacional pois paguei 216 dólares por dia com todas taxas inclusas.

title: Holiday trip
text: Very well located, 3min walk from Times Square at good price. One of few hotels in New York which includes breakfast. Very friendly staff who helped us out with restaurant recommendations, printing passes and more.

title: Best kept secret!!!
text: It was our families first time to NYC and but just a little research I came across this amazing boutique hotel. The staff is amazing...the location was perfect...the room size and amenities was just what we needed. When we come back we know where we are staying!

title: Manhattan on your door step.
text: We chose the Pearl Hotel due to the previous excellent reviews it had received and we were not disappointed. The Pearl is well placed for those new visitors to New York and those who have numerous visits under their belt. The staff are excellent and cater to all your needs without fuss and complaint. The rooms are of a good size and are of an excellent standard. The Breakfast is good and as long as your not looking for a cooked breakfast there is enough choice to keep your fuellled until lunchtime. We will be visiting again as it's exactly what we wanted! Well done Pearl and we will be seeing you again.

title: Por encima de su ubicacion, el  personal
text:
En un viaje de 10 dias que dividimos en dos hoteles novotel times square y  the pearl, el segundo lo escogimos por sus puntuaciones en tripadvisor y booking.com  yun acierto total.

El punto fuerte es sin duda su personal (en general) salientar el personal femenino de recepción de habla hispana y el persoanl de puerta sobre todo  Francisco (un chico moreno fuerte) no megustaria engañarme de nombre pues se ofrece a ayudar en todo momento y siempre con una sonrisa.
Las habitaciones super amplias (ademas viniendo de novotel que con el mismo coste son la mitad de grandes y no tienen ningun servicio) television de gran tamaño, mini-kitchen con nevera microondas,cafereta capsulas , baño con bañera y ducha y tv en el mismo, camas supercomodas.
En lo referente a servicios teniendo niños se agradece tener aperitivos disponibles las 24 horas asi como limonada. Lo que no se ajusta es el horario del brunch de la tarde pues en el momento que se acaba  el vino que la gerencia tiene a bien disponer no se sirve mas da igual que llegues a las 17:30 que a las17:50 si se acabo no reponen  durante toda la hora.
Si bien el desayuno es suficiente no se ajusta a la categoria del hotel y el personal masculino que nos encontramos  fechas entrada 21 diciembre y salida 27 no es en sus formas nada correcto hubo dias que silbaban por medio delagente desayunando o sacudian manteles al suelo en presencia de comensales.
No estaria mal un bufe un poco mas amplio, repito por la categoria del hotel.
Si vas sin transfer tienen unos contactos con muy buenos precios.

title: Great Service and Great Location
text: I stayed overnight at The Pearl Hotel for work purposes. I have to start off by saying that the front desk concierge Julissa is A+, she  checked me in promptly went over dinner options and described the amenities such as wifi/breakfast/snack area. I stayed in the Superior Queen - Queen Suite which was spacious, comfortable and the bathroom had a nice sized walkin shower. I didn't utilize the kitchen area but I can imagine it would be great for longer stays. Just a side note - the pillows are extremely soft, I didn't mind.

title: Great hotel!!
text: We came here to see some shows, a this is the perfect place, right in the middle of theater district. We were able to walk to all of our plays. Very clean, nice people working here. Breakfast snacks, and afternoon wine and cheese. Will definitely stay here next time

title: Once again-A+
text:
We stay at The Pearl every Feb while attending a conference in the city.  This past weekend was our 4th stay, and I can tell you the place is still completely on its game.  Friendly staff who greets you each time you come back to the hotel.  So convenient to walk in off the street and be in your room in less than 2 minutes.  That's the beauty of a boutique hotel.  No grand lobby to walk through, no huge banks of elevators to wait on.  Only around 15 floors and each floor only has roughly 8 rooms.  This makes for a nice, quiet hotel experience!
The bed was super comfy and the sheets were crisp and clean.  The towels were huge, fluffy, and very soft.  Love the L'Occitane toiletries.  They smell wonderful and are of great quality.  Love the Keurig coffee maker in the room.  The blackout curtains are 100% effective.  This room is dark with a capitol D.  Makes for a great night's sleep!
We also love the free breakfast, which consists of bagels, yogurt, fresh fruit, and pastries.  Nothing fancy, but good quality items.  The coffee machine in the breakfast area is available all the time and the coffee is excellent!  The manager's reception each afternoon is also very nice with wine, cheese, veggies, snacks, etc....  
A simple, but much appreciated touch is the water/snack station in the lobby.  Wonderful to get a glass of "orange" water and a bag of chips as you head up to the room.
All in all, I can't imagine a better place to stay while in NYC.  The location is so convenient to all of the theaters and great restaurants.  An easy walk up to the park.  Several subway stations within a block or two will take you to any place you want to go in Manhattan and beyond.  This place gets an A+

title: Great Get-Away
text: Great voutique hotel located in the middle of everything!  The hotel was beautiful and breakfast and happy hour are included.  The rooms were expertly decorated.   The complimentary toiletries were great.  And the staff was VERY welcoming.   Would not hesitate to recommend The Pearl to anyone.

title: Just Right
text:
We stayed here for 5 nights in January/February. To celebrate my birthday.  This hotel provides a simple continental breakfast which turned out to be very handy as we didn't realise just how expensive NY was going to be. A small hotel VERY well located. The room was clean. The towels were changed every day even though we didn't 'signal' that we wanted them to be changed. There isn't really a view to speak of from the windows but as we were exploring NY and just using the hotel as a base this wasn't really a problem. All the hotel staff were very polite and friendly, nothing was too much trouble. I received a complimentary bottle of wine in our room, which was a nice touch.
One tiny little niggle, I was a little disappointed at, the fact that they use throw away plates, cutlery etc at breakfast! Even if it's all recyclable, it seems daft. That said, I would stay here again. :)

title: Great hotel, across from book of mormon
text:
Wonderful location! Excellent price. Our room was very spacious; when we first walked into the room, I was worried that I had made a mistake with the reservation, because the room was so big!
Our luggage arrived at a separate airport from my husband and me. The front desk staff was very helpful and understanding; they even sent up a complimentary bottle of wine. 
The location of this hotel is perfect; we walked to a matinee of the Lion King, we walked to a comedy show at Caroline's on Broadway. Cute bar called Lilly's next door.
We used our 10% discount at the adjoining restaurant one day for lunch; we did the prix fixe menu. It was delicious and lots of food, with great service.
I would recommend staying at the Pearl, if looking for a hotel in Midtown / Theater District.

title: Great .
text:
Can to city for our anniversary. It's our second stay at the hotel 
They gave us a low-cost upgrade to suite 
Beatiful room  bathroom etc 
Great location right across from theater 
Close to everything  
Breakfast coffee all day and wine and cheese great touch 
Our new favorite Nyc hotel

title: Great hotel.....Great location
text: This was our second visit to the Pearl Hotel but this time without children.  From pulling up at the door on arrival, to leaving the hotel after five nights stay, we had a lovely time.  The doorman on our arrival (didn't get his name  but we share the same wedding date) was so helpful and gave us advice and tips on where to go that night for supper.  We had booked a standard double room but were upgraded to a deluxe queen which was so spacious and the bed really comfy I could have spent all my time there!  I wasn't too sure about the continental breakfast but there was so much choice we managed to fill ourselves up which saw us through until way past lunchtime.  Unfortunately we missed the cheese/wine due to being out all day but having experienced it on our first visit, it is  worth going.  All the staff were friendly and helpful.  This review would have received a five star rating but my only complaint was the size of the bathroom - it was tiny and with a husband who is 6'5" it was a tight squeeze if both of us wanted to use it.  Overall this is the perfect hotel for Times Square, the theatres are right on your doorstep (The Book of Mormons opposite and Chicago a one minute walk) and we will certainly stay here again on our next visit.

title: Great hotel in the mid-town theater section of Manhattan.
text: Staff extremely friendly. Was upgraded to a Queen Deluxe Suite. Enjoyed the complimentary wine and cheese from 4-5 pm.  Plenty of room considering many hotels in the city have small rooms. Very clean rooms. Right in the heart of mid-town. They offer free continental breakfast but we opted to eat out of the hotel.

title: Great stay
text:
Stayed 1 night with my granddaughter while we took in 2 shows. Our deluxe double bedded room was very spacious and comfortable. Easy check-in. Reception staff was very gracious and welcoming. 
Turns out, we mistakenly left something in the room and I got a phone call from the hotel and they are Fed-exing it back. We didn't know it was missing until they called.
That's what I call good PR.

title: One of the best hotels in the heart of Manhatten
text: Very nice and clean. Cooperative staff. Checked in first time after arrival from overseas and second time after internal trip in US. I am sure that my stay during next year's trip will be in this hotel. Rooms are very spacious. Continental breakfast is served daily and it is included in the room charges. The hotel is 6 minutes walk from Times Square.

title: Great mid-town Theater location
text: Needed to book at the last minute and fount this great little hotel. Friendly staff with comfortable and well maintained rooms. The theater district is literally right outside the front door. Juts a few minute walk to all the time square attractions. Would definitely come back with the family for a future visit.

title: Love the Pearl
text: I stayed at the Pearl hotel from January 24th to the 26th 2017. I loved this hotel....the staff are amazing special shout out to Juan who is always smiling and is just a great person. The location is amazing walking distance to Times Square. The room was big by New York standards and so clean. The bathtub I lived in it. The Continental breakfast was well stocked and I would say far exceeds any Continental breakfast I have ever had. In the early evening they had wine and cheese which is lovely. I have nothing but praise for the Pearl.

title: Nice hotel but the service had slipped greatly.
text:
I have stayed at the Pearl on previous trips to Broadway and enjoyed the hotel-the location is perfect for Broadway, having a room with a balcony is always nice. The bathrooms are only average at best. Since my last stay I must mention the service (or lack thereof). 
We arrived on a Saturday afternoon and was surprised that there was no doorman-we exited our taxi and waited expectantly for someone to appear to either open the door or appear with a luggage cart-neither of which happened. Once inside the lobby there were two women at the front desk, with only one client in front of us, but the check in process took and exceptionally long time-especially since booked and paid for the hotel online and was a repeat visitor. Once that was completed I turned expecting by now certainly a bellhop would have appeared but again nothing, and we carried our bags to our room. As we had a dinner reservation to make we dropped out bags and returned to the lobby, where I asked the now present but very less than enthusiastic doorman (Ramon) for a taxi. After waiting several minutes I actually was able to use my phone to request a limo and have it arrive before the doorman was able to hail a cab-which I think he put zero effort into doing. 
I prefer to try the small boutique luxury hotels when visiting NYC, but with many to choose from, I will not be returning to the Pearl.

title: Great location and clean!!
text:
Top place to stay last week. 2 minute walk to Times Square, friendly and helpful team both the desk and concierge. 
Rooms are large, clean, modern and always made up nicely. Thank you housekeeping!!
Breakfast was included which was a basic continental toast, fruit,cereal and yoghurt etc... or if you prefer.. Times Square diner is a 1 minute walk for a ny style cooked breakfast. 
Tea, coffee, and fruit and water are also available all the time complimentary. 
Thanks team!!

title: Amazing!!!!
text:
I usually stay closer to Time Square but this hotel was fantastic from the staff to the location. We arrived mid afternoon to very pleasant hotel staff they were extremely welcoming and kind they understood we had a long trip and they couldn't be more helpful from taking our bags to the room to topping up the tea and coffee. I was up very early every day for breakfast with was offered fresh fruit, bagels toast to cereal perfect! 

I can't fault this hotel as I found nothing wrong with it, they arranged a car to take us to the airport it was comfy and clean. I am going back to New York again for Christmas shopping 100% I will book a room booking at the pearl hotel .

title: A great experience in a prime location
text: The entire stay was 100%. From the doorman to the location it was perfect for what we needed that weekend. Right off broadway, it is walking distance to most of what times square and the theatre district have to offer. The room was clean, the front desk was helpful and more importantly they were friendly. Will definitely stay here in the future when I get to NYC.

title: Best service
text:
We stayed with friends at this hotel. The booking process was simple. The staff here is very friendly. We loved the complimentary tea/coffee which is always available. The location is the best part. The rooms are well lit and very clean.
The services and facilities and class apart.

title: Excelente
