text: El hotel es excelente.  Todo es como lo publicitan. El desayuno es adecuado para enfrentar el frío de diciembre.  A las 16 hay degustación de quesos, verduras y vinos. El personal es muy amable. Todo el tiempo hay personal que habla español y te dan todas las indicaciones acerca de subtes y transporte.  A la hora que llegues al hotel siempre hay café y snacks. La ubicación es única. Para la noche del 31de diciembre nos obsequiaron champagne y copas para el brindis.  A 30 mts hay un lugar de venta de alimentos  y el hotel te provee platos y cubiertos descartables.Muy recomendable !!

title: A Marvelous Hotel
text:
For the past four years my girlfriend and I have stayed at the Pearl Hotel for a ladies weekend of theatre, museums and restaurants. This hotel is in a class by itself. The hotel staff -- bellman (Manual and Morad) and front desk staff (Vanie and Christian) -- immediately recognized us when we entered the hotel and thanked us for our continued patronage. As Morad said, "It's like a family here."

The hotel's location, excellent customer service, free continental breakfast, wine offerings at 4 pm, bathroom amenities, and wonderful bed make The Pearl my hotel of choice in NYC!  I would highly recommend this boutique hotel.

title: "Au top "
text:
Hôtel très bien situé sur Times Square pour découvrir New York 
Accueil et personnel Parfaitement efficace merci à  Mourad pour nous  les français qui ne metrisons pas l'américain 
Petit déjeuner très copieux 
Reviendrai sûrement pour un prochain séjour

title: A Pearl in the heart of NYC
text:
The short story, will stay again.

The long story -

Positives:

* huge room! It's NYC, you expect shoebox rooms even in the most luxurious of hotels, but not this one! We had a double room with two double beds for 2 people.

* clean

* 24 hour acceas to complimentary tea and coffee facilities

* location location location- if you love musicals, this is where you want to stay

* friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable staff

Negatives:

* breakfast buffet is lacking severely. For all it's positives, the hotel needs to make more of an effort with breakfast. Only healthy thing available is fruit and boiled eggs.. the rest are bagels and pastries and jams and flavoured yogurts. Not so great if you're trying to maintain a semblance of a healthy diet while on holiday.

That's all folks!

title: Rise up...
text: This hotel rises above the rest! I reserved our room by phone with Christian. He was very pleasant and made the process very easy. He's very personable on the phone and it was a pleasure booking through him.  The hotel called (Charlotte) the day prior to confirm our reservation and arrival information. We were to arrive by Amtrak to Penn Station at 12:35 and we're going to check in early by 1 and have the hotel store our luggage; as normal check in is at 4 pm.  Storing luggage is one of many services they provide for guests of the hotel.  Upon check in, they had our room ready! I was shocked and very pleased; especially with an 8 hr train ride. We had a double deluxe room on the ninth floor. It was amazing! Two comfortable beds, lots of pillows, a shower with not only an adjustable water flow, but a wand too, and a television in the bathroom were only some of the features of our room. We had a fridge that was able to store wine and a sink. Each room is equipped with a safe, robes, slippers, ironing board, and hair dryer. Room service is provided by E&E Grill. You can see my review for them. We ate there twice-once in the restaurant and once in our room. Why else should you stay here? Well, because of the other amenities! A cardio fitness room, free wifi, a cocktail hour at 4 daily for guests, free breakfast with danishes, bagels, fruit, cereal, and yogurt. 24 hr coffee, tea, and hot cocoa on the 2nd floor and snacks in the lobby.  One night, my daughter wanted something to drink and I was already in my pajamas.  I asked the staff if there was anywhere close to get a drink for her and they went to get me apple juice and brought a bucket of ice to our room because it wasn't cold. I was shocked! What service!!!!  Speaking of service...While we didn't have our room cleaned the first day because I left the do not disturb sign on the door, room service called and left is a message. If we needed anything in our room all we had to do was call anytime before 7. I thought that was very considerate as you never know when you'll run out of toilet paper. Back to info on the hotel, the doormen are courteous and always willing to help you get to where you need to be, call a cab to the airport, or help you load the car. The Pearl is centrally located between 8th and Broadway in the heart of the theatre district and all that is Times Square. The hotel is directly across the street from the production The Book of Mormon!  This is honestly the best hotel I've stayed in while in NYC to date!  Great effort to the staff and crew at The Pearl and remember to like my review!

title: Perfectly located for theater, quiet and comfortable
text:
In the mid-theater district, the Pearl Hotel has a friendly staff, quiet rooms, comfortable beds, and more!  There is an ample free continental breakfast, free NY Times, and a complimentary wine-and-cheese hour.  The bathroom is well lit and the shower easy to use.
When I left a book in the room after checkout, the hotel called me in Dallas to offer to return it.
My wife and I enjoyed our stay, felt it was a good value, and would return.
My only criticism is that there were no mirrors in the elevators or in the elevator waiting area.

title: Nice experience in the heart of the theater district
text:
My partner and I stayed there for 5 days and we were very impressed with the hotel
Great location 
Spacious room with an awesome bathroom 
Very attentive and professional staff 
Continental BF aceptable 
They even sent a bottle of wine to the room for my partner's birthday 
For sure we would stay here again

title: Broadway Overnight
text:
We came in from the suburbs for a nice dinner and theater experience, so stayed at the Pearl. It was very convenient--literally directly across from the Eugene O'Neill Theater. We arrived Saturday afternoon, in time for the wine and cheese reception on the 2d floor common area, which was very nice. The welcome was efficient, the room well-appointed (don't expect a view, tho!), temperature was good and could adjust it easily, got a sound sleep. There was a microwave and coffee in the room, no minibar.

Complementary breakfast next day was a continental buffet: fresh fruit, pastries, cereals, bagels/muffins, choice of juices, coffee/tea. Got a little hot/stuffy on that 2nd floor, probably to compensate for the very cold day outside.

I wasn't there long enough to use the fitness center, but I peeked inside. It had the usual few machines with monitors and some free weights as well. Equipment looked in good shape and clean.

Given the location, I thought the price was fair and service and amenities great.

title: Great location and nice spacious room
text: Our family of 4 (including 2 tween girls) spent a single night at the Pearl.  Our room (2 queen beds) was spacious for NY and had high-end bathroom with shower and tub.  Fantastic location and surprising quiet.  The staff was friend and helpful.   Nice continental breakfast was included

title: Hotel em NY
text: Adorei o hotel...quartos grandes e limpos.Café da manhã decente...banheiro de bom tamanho.Hotel silencioso...no quarto você tem frigobar,pia e microondas.Eu fiquei bem satisfeita.Perto da Broadway,com a 7av.

title: Return Visit!
text: I've reviewed this hotel a few times.  Had not been here for a few years and I'm happy to report that the hotel is better than ever...clean, comfortable, great location with all the amenities. This time, we not only enjoyed the wine happy hour after our matinee, but also found they had sent us a bottle of wine when I mentioned we were celebrating my husband's birthday. I also discovered a beautiful Catholic search next door for a very traditional service. We visited with our adult children and they also enjoyed the hotel immensely.

title: A little gem in a sparkling location
text:
Forget the pretense (and price) of New York City's grand palace hotels and stay in this small gem of a place. Here are 4 reasons why:
1. Location - Only blocks from all Broadway theaters (a few are mere steps away.) Times Square, Rockefeller Center and Central Park are easy, casual strolls from the front door. Walking in NYC is half the fun, and this location encourages it. And if you want to venture further in the City (and you should) subway stations are less than a block away in either direction, while taxis or Ubers are literally swarming the place.
2. Quality Rooms - if you've ever stayed at a NYC hotel where the room is the size of your closet back home, then you'll appreciate The Pearl. By Manhattan standards, the standard room is generous in size, clean, comfortable and well maintained.
3. Staff and Service - No waiting in line to check in at this boutique hotel! We had our key within a minute, and the front desk staff was always friendly and attentive. Our housekeeper greeting us in the hall every day with a smile, and the doormen were down to earth and friendly. Although we didn't take much advantage of it, a continental breakfast and an afternoon wine and cheese hour is included in the room rate.
4. Price - Staying in a quality hotel at a prime Manhattan location is never going to feel like a bargain if you're the type who always compares rates to what you once paid for a motel room along the interstate in Iowa. Consider the context, people! Sometimes, you really do get what you pay for, and if you can book The Pearl for under $300 a night, you should. Rooms at nearby "name hotels" go for much more, and you compromise little and gain much by choosing The Pearl.

We will return to this terrific find. It's attributes made our New York trip memorable.

title: Fantastic size room and shower - great location
text:
The pearl hotel has great customer service. The rooms are large and the bathrooms and showers some of the biggest I've seen for a boutique hotel in the city. Very comfortable beds and quiet considering how close it is to Times Square and the Theater district. This hotel is directly across from The Book of Mormon. There was a TV in the bathroom which is rare, great showers, and extremely great value for the money. They also offer complimentary breakfast and water and snacks 24/7.  I will definitely be back! 

If you are looking to be close to theater and Times Square this is a fabulous choice. I've stayed all over the city and I love how convenient it is.

title: Comfortable, clean, modern hotel in central location
text: The pearl hotel is great, I would highly recommend, especially for families. Excellent location, times square just around the corner, just out of the major hustle and bustle but still so close (1 block away). Next door is a great food store/supermarket with ready made meals and supplies. Plenty of restaurants/cafes/starbucks within 2 minute walk.  The hotel itself is very, very clean, modern, warm and friendly. The decor is simple, yet nice. The front desk staff are professional, efficient and help with enquiries when asked. The rooms were very comfortable, beds,pillows, towels and amenities all excellent.Our queen suite had a separate living area with small kitchenette, microwave, fridge, tea/coffee making facilities.  The complimentary breakfast served is served on level 2 in a designated breakfasted lounge area it consisted of tea, coffee, juices, cereals, bakery items, croissants, bagels etc. boiled eggs, fresh fruit and condiments were plentiful. The food was fresh and very convenient.  During the day they offer coffee/tea and little snacks/chips/cookies; complimentary wine and cheese in the evenings. The restaurant downstairs was good for a bottle of wine or cocktail, didn't eat there. Over all I would definitely recommend The Pearl hotel as a great all rounder and good value for money comparable to its competitors. We stayed at the "Marriot Marquis" in Times Square a week later and were horrified: it didn't  compare to The Pearl at all!

title: NYC First visit
text:
Me and my daughters took a trip to NYC in early December to enjoy the beautiful sights of Christmas. I found the Pearl on Trip Advisor and am so happy I did. A few days before my arrival to NYC, someone from the Pearl called to confirm my stay and wanted to know if I needed any help with anything. The concierge helped me to book a tour and get car service from the airport. 
They had a nice continental breakfast that was just enough to get your day started. 
The room was quite large and made it nice for 3 adult women to share 1 room. 
The hotel was clean and quiet.
The staff was very helpful, warm, kind and accommodating. 
This hotel is in a great location. Easy walk to Times Square and very close to several subway stations. 
When I return to NYC, I will only stay at the Pearl.  
I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Quick and terrific stay!!!
text: Our family of 5 stayed for one night in mid December.  The room was neat and clean, the staff was very friendly and we loved the snacks and breakfast that was included.  Great location near Times Square.  We would definitely stay there again!

title: Affordable luxury
text: My wife & I stay (2 nights) at The Pearl was amazing! Large room (Rm 1103) with a great sitting area all for a great price. A block away from the action allows for the serenity hardly found in Manhattan. Great food options around (including room service) makes The Pearl a great destination. Give them a try...👏🏼

title: Little Gem
text: The location of this hotel could not be better; centrally located on a relatively quiet street given it is downtown Manhattan. The service, snacks, and rooms are all wonderful.  Love the second floor mezzanine for reading, people watching the street, or grabbing a cup of coffee.

title: Nothing but PRAISE for the PEARL!
text: I read nearly 200 hotel reviews before settling on The Pearl for our New Year's Eve trip to New York City. Review after review gave the Pearl 5 stars. I was skeptical at first, that there could be a hotel that was consistently reviewed so well. From the moment we arrived, I knew we had made the right choice. Despite it being busy (NYE "eve") and lots of people checking in, we were checked in and oriented right away. Our bags were delivered within 5 minutes of arrival to he room. The room we had (Executive King) was perfect in size and decor. The concierge was helpful with directions and dining recommendations. We were so impressed with everyone we interacted with. So, suffice it to say, the five star reviews are 100% accurate. The location, the decor, the wonderful staff, the cleanliness, the breakfast, the wine and cheese hour, the water and fruit available throughout the day, the hotel restaurant (EE Grill), the well-appointed rooms....everything was excellent. Stop looking, just book here! You will not regret one aspect of choosing this lovely hotel. We will surely return to the Pearl for any and every stay to NYC in the future. Thank you Pearl staff for a wonderful New Year's Eve experience!

title: Great hotel and perfect location
text: We stayed 5 nights at this hotel, chosen due to good reviews and location. We were very happy here. Very clean and comfortable, housekeeping staff went above expectations doing a wonderful job of our room each day. We were on the 2nd floor beside the complimentary breakfast room which also provided snacks throughout the day and pre dinner wine and nibbles. Our room had a lovely private outdoor area which we would have loved, if it wasn't quite so cold. We were walking distance to everywhere from the Empire state building (arrived at opening time and no queues). Also walked to central park, theatres, Rockefeller centre and to great nearby restaurants and Macys. The subway was also very close. The staff particularly the gentlemen on the door were able to give us directions to everywhere. We went ice skating in a wonderful nearby park they recommended. Horse and carriage through central park was a highlight. Would stay here again and highly recommend.

title: So happy to run across this awesome find...
text:
After an abysmal experience at another 'large chain hotel' in the Times Square, I found The Pearl after a quick scan of H.com.  After reading the reviews and viewing the pictures, my family and I (which we had 6 more nights planned in NYC), decided to move to the this lovely boutique hotel. It's situated directly across the street from the theater now showing The Book of Mormons (which we had already seen in SF), but just far away from the busy-ness/lights/noise of Times Square.  Our room was listed as a 'Deluxe Double', and compared to the previous hotel's room, this room was significantly larger.  The bathroom was very well kept, and even had toiletries from L'Occitane (and a TV in front of the 'seat').  The staff was super friendly, and check-in was very pleasant.  We were well early of the usual check-in time, but they had our room ready to roll into even before lunch!  Over the course of the next 6 nights, we got have breakfast down in their lounge (while it was included with the hotel fee, it was a basic American Continental breakfast).  The room was super clean and felt very homey/comfortable.

For the location, the nightly price was average, but overall, the experience was superior.  I will definitely book again when I come back to NY next month!

title: A Great Stay
text:
We recently returned from a four night stay at the Pearl Hotel.  Our expectations were rather high based upon the reviews posted; our experience was in line with the exceptional reviews and we enjoyed a wonderful four night stay.

We were greeted very warmly upon arrival, and as we had an early flight, our room was not yet ready upon our arrival at the hotel.  We anticipated this, and they were very prompt to tag and store our luggage.  They took my cell phone number so as to call me when our room would be available, and we left to have some lunch.  A brief time later, we received a call that our room was now available, so we returned to the hotel to freshen up and unpack ... this was a very seamless process and we were happy to be in our room so quickly.

We booked a deluxe two-queen-bed room, and it was quite spacious with a small but very nice bathroom.  There was a desk, and an additional small sitting area within the room, and storage was plentiful.  There was also a very nice area with a refrigerator, sink and coffee maker for our use.  We were very pleased with our room, and it was a very clean and comfortable stay; housekeeping did a consistently good job during our stay.  There was surprisingly little street noise at nighttime, and the heating system was efficient,quiet and kept the room very comfortable during our stay.

The free continental breakfast was convenient and quite good for our needs, consisting of bagels, english muffins, toast, pastries, croissants, cereals, yogurt, fruit and drinks.  The seating area on the second floor was kept clean and was quite comfortable; we were able to find seating each day of our stay.

The location could not be any better; we were within close proximity of so many things and could not have asked for a better location.

The physical attributes and location of this hotel are great unto themselves; however, the friendly and helpful staff is what makes this hotel so special in my opinion.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, and will definitely stay at the Pearl Hotel upon returning.

title: Simply fabulous!
text: My mom, sister and I just stayed at the Pearl for 5 nights. Words are not enough for this amazing hotel.  This was my second time to stay at the Pearl and I was not disappointed in the least.  Our Queen suite was huge by New York standards with wonderful amenities.  This would be enough but the amazing staff and service were well above par. William the fabulous doorman was there for much of our stay and always made us feel like we were queens of the universe.  We love you William! The rest of the staff were also wonderful.  The grill house next door is a fabulous place to get drinks (Cocktails and cappuccinos) and has great food too! You won't be disappointed at the Pearl...wonderfully situated to walk to almost everything in Midtown.  I can't wait to come back! I LOVE the Pearl and NYC!

title: Expected More
text: Recently traveled to NYC to take in some shows with the family and see Christmas decorations. Pearl has received positive reviews thus decided to try it as close to theaters/Broadway and Times Square. Given price, even though we were in NYC, I expected more. Reserved King Deluxe Suite so had 2 rooms. One with King Bed. One with Queen Sleeper. Check in was very late due to traffic. Greeted nicely. Hotel staff were the best part of the entire stay. Although telling visitors that walk to Radio City Music Hall is only a couple of blocks when it has snowed and pouring out, was bad advice. It is much more than a couple of blocks.  Went to suite. First glance nice with the 2 rooms, amazing bathroom and small kitchenette with Keurig/Microwave/Refrigerator. Only temp control in "parlor" where queen couch located thus rooms either cold or hot. Hotel knew we had 4 people but had to call at 2AM to get couch made up. One bottle of water on counter which was never replaced. 4 keurig coffee with only one package of sugar/powdered creamer. There were chips/fruit snacks in "breakfast room" along with a coffee/hot water/decaf machine and supplies including tea and hot chocolate. Half and half available but type that doesn't require refrigeration. Jug of water with small cups.  Continental breakfast was disappointing. Cereal, bagels, toast, small pastries, yogurt, juice. Have had better continental breakfast at chain hotels. Only room service for lunch and dinner. Comes from restaurant next to hotel so have to pay at time of delivery. Check out at noon. On final day of 3 night stay, asked for late check out at 1:30. Told could only have until 1PM without a charge. After spending what we did, this did not feel like this represented decent customer service at all.

title: Spacious room, super clean, nice extras
text:
We took our two boys, ages 4 and 6, to NYC and stayed here. The staff are very attentive and helpful. The room is spacious for this location and great for us all. We loved the free breakfast from 7-8 am every morning and the free wine and cheese from 4-5pm every afternoon!
And...the best toiletries from L'Occitane de Provence!

title: Excellent service
text: I have just come back from staying at this hotel with my Sisters. There were 6 girls on a shopping trip. The hotel was excellent in every way, they helped one of my sisters buy some toys that we could not buy here, the breakfast is very good, staff are very helpful, the room was clean. I would highly recommend if staying in New York.

title: Отличный отель в самом центре Нью-Йорка!
text:
Расположение очень удачное. Множество ключевых достопримечательностей в шаговой доступности. Поблизости несколько станций метро. От аэропорта добрались на air train (минут 20) и метро (35 минут) за 7$ на человека. В соседнем здании - театр Амбассадор, где идет мюзикл Чикаго.
Завтрак скромный, континентальный. 
Каждый день с 16 до 17 бесплатно для всех гостей отеля сервируют вино (вполне приличное) с закусками: 2 вида сыра, нарезка овощей (перец, сельдерей), фрукты (клубника, виноград) и крекеры. Кофе/чай с печеньем и чипсами доступны на 2-м этаже 24 часа в сутки. Из лобби отеля вход в ресторан Е&Е, где гостям отеля предоставляется скидка 10% на еду. Открыт и на обед, и на ужин. В номерах кофемашина, микроволновка, холодильник.
Из необходимого в номерах также: утюг и гладильная доска, фен, халаты и тапочки, косметические принадлежности L'occitane.
Персонал очень вежливый и профессиональный. За проживание мы попросили сразу снять с карты, чтобы не блокировалась сумма на 30 дней. Депозит (200$ за двоих за 5 ночей) взяли наличными и при выезде вернули.
Понравилось все. Рекомендую.

title: Отличное расположение, хорошее состояние
text:
Провели здесь две ночи. В целом остались довольны, хотя не все безупречно. В первую очередь хочется отметить очень удачное расположение, рядом несколько станций метро на выбор, до многих знаковых мест очень удобно добраться пешком. Дизайн отеля приятный, аккуратный, понравилась спокойная цветовая гамма. Номер был достаточно просторный для своей ценовой категории. Все необходимое для безмятежного отдыха есть, включая кофемашину и микроволновку. Интернет входит в стоимость, работает сносно в любое время суток. Не очень понравился слишком мягкий матрас. Моя проблемная спина обиделась и потом весь день напоминала о себе. Ванная комната, чистая, косметические средства неплохого качества. Из плюсов еще отмечу отлично оборудованный спортивный зал и "счастливый час", когда бесплатно угощают вином с закусками. У лобби всегда можно поживиться фруктами и печением. 
Завтраки среднего уровня, ничего особенного. Удивила одноразовая посуда, хотя знакомые сказали, что это нормально. 
Персонал вышколенный, очень вежливые и обходительные девушки с удовольствием помогали в любых мелочах. 
В сумме: неплохой вариант для короткой остановки, хотя не назову его идеальным.

title: Nyc outra vez!
text:
Fiquei hospedada neste hotel, e a primeira impressão não foi a melhor, paguei cerca de 60000 euros noite e na altura não tive opção de escolha no tipo de quarto , e sabia que era um quarto com cama Queen , que quando se viaja com um filho não dá jeito pensei que ao chegar teria a oportunidade de alterar, qual foi o espanto de me pedirem mais 20 dolares noite, não paguei! na terceira noite ao falar com o responsável de balção e mostrando que não estava nada satisfeita fez um up-grade e trocou o quarto.
Não compreendo o bloquei de dinheiro no cartão de credito visto o quarto ter o frigobar vazio!? o chão tem alcatifa , o ar condicionado um pouco barulhento mas aquece bem.
falta um cobertor extra no roupeiro, e os colchões estão um pouco velhos.
Tem máquina de café e microndas.
Produtos L'Occitane.na casa de banho.
Pequeno almoço muito fraco , é continental completamente basico e desagradávelmente com mesas baixas onde as pessoas colocam os pés em cima da mesa! tem outro lado com mesas normais mas é um espçaco muito pequeno.
Em relação ao atendimento muito bom, gente muito simpática , lamentávelmente no balção só falam inglês.ajudam com o transporte da bagagem.
Fica em frente ao teatro onde está a ser exibido Chicago , ao pé de tudo, caso precisem de alugar carro, tem a Budjet mesmo em frente.
Wi-fi gratuito nos quartos.

Poderei vir a ficar novamente neste hotel caso consigo uma tarifa um pouco melhor, acho que o valor que paguei muito excessivo para o serviço que oferece.

title: BEST hotel I've been to!
text: I literally do not have one bad thing to say about this place. From the moment we got there, we were in awe. The valet was quick and easy. The receptionist was super polite and friendly. We were upgraded to a king size bedroom with a balcony which was absolutely beautiful! The location is perfect! It is right in the middle of Times Square, walking distance to shows, restaurants and shopping. The room is impeccable. I have stayed at the W Hoboken, Gansevoort Park and Yotel and none of them compare to this hotel. The bed was so comfortable, the balcony was huge. There was a microwave in the room as well as a coffee machine. The best part of the room though was the bathroom! It was beautiful and there was a even a television hanging from the bathroom wall. My boyfriend was watching the football game while taking a shower lol. There is a complimentary wine hour which includes delicious wine, fruit, and some snacks. This is great considering Manhattan is very expensive so it was nice to get something for free haha. Serafina is directly across the street, I suggest going there to grab a drink or some food because it is incredible. Because of the great experience I had here, I will be back to The Pearl. This will be my new go to hotel when in the city!

title: Great Location
text: This is a good value hotel in Times Square. The facility is well maintained with a very engaging, helpful and friendly staff. Although our room was very comfortable and spacious, we could have done without the elevator/air conditioning noise.  Check-in could have been more efficient. We dropped off our luggage in the early morning but did not get the call we requested when the room was ready.  Came back late in the afternoon and still had to wait for our room. The rest of our two day stay was very nice. We will probably stay here next time if we need to be close to Times Square.

title: Gorgeous rooms, friendly staff and fab location
text:
My husband and I checked in on thanksgiving for one night at the end of our honeymoon before heading back home to the UK. We took three flights to get to New York from the Galapagos Islands overnight and the taxi from JFK took a lot longer than we expected due to a lot of the roads being closed off for the parade. We were extremely tired to say the least. We arrived at 7am, far too early for check in but were hoping the hotel manager could help us out. Although our room was taken he said we could upgrade and then be able to check in early. This is usually $120 but he gave us a discount to $80 so we took up his offer sharpish! He then said they usually charge a half day rate but he could see how in need we were of sleep so he wavered that. The other receptionist was really friendly, asking about where we had come from and how we liked Argentina and the Galapagos.
When we got the the room I was very happy. Best features were the black out curtains, the complimentary tea/coffee machine, the very large and comfortable bed, l'occitaine toiletries, free wifi. In fact, there wasn't anything I didn't like. Included in the room price was a wine and cheese hour at 5pm and snacks in reception and on level two. Unfortunately we were too tired for wine and cheese but we would most definitely had gone along if not.
On check out the next morning the hotel was more than happy to hold our cases whilst we explored the city some more. No extra charge and they got them out for us to repack our shopping and took them back again whilst we went for food and a walk. They didn't appear put out in the slightest. 
I would definitely recommend this hotel in New York.

title: Family trip
text: Great hotel in a great location ! All employees were very helpful. Room was clean and bed was comfortable. The only negative thing I would have to say is that there is no breakfast room service . The restaurant only does lunch and dinner and brunch on sat and Sunday, However, the hotel does offer a free continental breakfast which was a very nice touch .

title: Believe the hype and book this hotel fast, before it sells out!
text:
We stayed for 5 nights with two adults and two small kids. 

ROOM: a very spacious  "Deluxe Queen Queen" room: 
•	 Two comfortable queen beds with very large pillows.  
•	Huge bathroom, with large tub and separate large rain shower, with a gorgeous marble counter-top big enough for three sinks (although it had only one). Lots of room for four people’s toiletries. Kohler faucets. (And Toto toilets in the lobby bathroom.) Lots of nice big soft towels.
•	A pantry area (between the beds and the bathroom) which looked nice and elegant (not like those ugly kitchenettes in efficiency hotel rooms). It had an (empty) mini-fridge, microwave, sink, coffee machine, cupboards, etc.  (No freezer: but an ice pack that we jammed into the back of the fridge stayed frozen, more or less.) Perfect for travelling with kids, if you need to wash bottles or keep milk in the room.
•	A sort of "walk-in closet".  Have you ever seen that for a reasonable price in a NY hotel room?? Lots of storage space in this hotel room! 
•	Desk & chair, huge dresser, ledge for suitcases, full-length standing mirror.
•	We had a double stroller (never had to fold it) and a playpen in the room, and it never felt cramped.  I would have loved a suite, but we had enough space.
•	We could hear doors closing in the hallway, & voices in the halls when people walked to the elevator, but not often. No risk of the usual loud NYC street noise, since we were not facing the street.
•	Dimmers on all the light switches. A very nice touch! With the lights out and the shades drawn, the room was so dark that it was impossible to guess when morning arrived – perfect for kids to sleep in. 
•	The room was renovated recently to high luxury standards: they obviously put a lot of money into it, and it shows. The whole room and bathroom was crisp and clean, with high-end furnishings, and nothing looks worn out or shabby.    
•	Free wifi too. Plus a TV in the room and in the bathroom. 
•	This hotel room reminded me of the Encore or Palazzo on the Strip in Las Vegas: that sense of a newly renovated, fully appointed, large, roomy space. It’s so rare to have that feeling in midtown NYC for a mid-range price. 
•	Note: there are different types of rooms in this hotel, so ask specifically for what you want. If travelling with kids, or if you might be stuck in your room feeling sick, or if you need to spend time working at a desk, this room was great because of its spaciousness. 

SERVICE: wow.
•	It was almost like a funny TV show: the housekeepers and bellhops were arriving so quickly that they were tripping over each other in the doorway of our room. 
•	The staff member noticed we had a small child, and asked if we wanted "a crib". Five minutes later he was back with a playpen and thick mattress and sheet; he set it all up within seconds. (We used a nice big soft hotel towel as a blanket for the baby.)
•	The staff was nice, extremely friendly, and (dare I say) they even looked happy - a very nice change from some hotels where you get dirty looks or creepy stares from the staff. They smiled and laughed and chatted with us in a genuine way. 
•	You can bring the breakfast back to your room, or take it with you as a snack during the day. This was great for our kids. Same for the apples and chips in the lobby (I never saw my kids eat so many apples!). We didn’t have to stop for breakfast or snacks during the day. You can also make yourself a Keurig coffee in the room, there are take-away disposable cups with lids in the pantry area of the room.  

LOCATION: 
•	Midtown/Times Square, very central.  It's a tourist area, not a quiet residential area, but the hotel itself is quiet and peaceful.
•	Lots of 24 hour drug stores within a block or two that also sell grocery staples like milk for kids. Lots of inexpensive kid-friendly dining options nearby (and expensive options too of course).
•	Our car was whisked away to a garage upon check-in, and returned to us with no problems or delays upon checkout.  

For us, this hotel stood out from its competition in NYC due to the large room & huge bathroom size, the high-end renovations inside the room, the nice multi-lingual staff, and having wifi/breakfast/snacks provided free of charge. (Don’t hesitate because you're wondering why you never heard of this hotel. I’m sure there’s lots of amazing things in NYC that you’ve never heard of!) Just try it, you’ll be happy you did.

title: Melhor custo x Benefício
text: Estava hospedada no Renaissance Midtown e resolvi ficar mais dois dias em NY. Quando fui ver, a tarifa do hotel tinha dobrado. O Pearl foi uma grande surpresa!!! Localização muito melhor que a do Renaissance Midtown, hotel e atendimento Mais aconchegante, quartos ótimos ( bem maiores), facilities L"Occitane. Para mim este hotel deveria ser 4, quase 5 estrelas. Recomendo e quando for a NY me hospedarei neste hotel novamente.

title: Excelente!!!!
text: La mejor opción para estar en New York, excelente servicio al cliente de TODOS, cómodo, céntrico, desayuno delicioso incluido,las habitaciones limpias, excelente toda mi experiencia muy recomendado!!!!

title: Muy recomendable!!
text: Todo fue excelente!! Desde la ubicación del hotel; la atención del personal en especial del Sr. Enrique encargado en la recepción; la habitación amplia, moderna y silenciosa. Buena la limpieza. El desayuno muy suficiente. Hablan español. No dudaría en volver. Es muy justa la relación del servicio-ubicación-precio.

title: Helt fantastisk hotel på Manhatten
text: Vi  boede en uge på dette hotel og det var fantastisk. Super service minded personale - lækket rummeligt værelse (nr 907) vendt mod gården så der var stille og roligt. Lækker kontinental morgenmad og 'Wine and cheese' mellem 16 og 17 - perfekt beliggenhed for udflugter på Manhatten. Dørmænd på dette hotel er et kapitel for sig og skal simpelthen opleves, de er bare toppen - tak for et fantastisk ophold.

title: The perfect location for a boutique hotel
text:
We stayed for four nights at this lovely little hotel and could not have been happier. The rooms are clean and well appointed, the staff are friendly and helpful and it was in the perfect location. 

You walk out the front door, cross the street and directly into the door for Book of Mormon or take about 20 steps to your left and you're at Chicago. It takes about three minutes to walk to the heart of Times Square and it's only half a mile to Central Park. We strolled back to the hotel from the Empire State Building and it's less than a five minute walk to Rockefeller Centre. 

I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else in Midtown.

title: Super bem localizado
text: Fui super bem atendida por todos os funcionários. O hotel é bem limpo, quarto confortável e espaçoso. Adorei as amenidades da Louccitane. O café da manhã é típico americano, sem muita variedade mas tinha opções saudáveis e gostosas. O queijo e vinho oferecido das 4h às 5h, é uma delícia e uma ótima opção para voce relaxar. Super recomendo esse hotel. Voltarei a ficar nele com certeza.

title: A cozy and comfortable hotel in the theater district of NYC.
text: We spent several nights at the Pearl hotel and were quite satisfied with the helpful and accommodating staff.  The rooms were modern and most adequate for our stay.  The hotel's location was centrally located to all the places we wanted to visit by just walking.

title: Good location - Larger than normal rooms
text: Stayed for two nights, smallish hotel, good location, clean, decent size room, but needs some sprucing up. Majority of staff is friendly. Asked for an upgrade to a terrace room, but didn't get one. Only saw one terrace occupied during our stay.

title: Buena ubicación y servicios complementarios
text: Estuve unos días en el invierno de Nueva York en invierno y con nieve. La ubicación del hotel es muy buena cuando son pocos días de visita a esta hermosa ciudad; está muy próximo a los teatros y a sitios de interés turístico, a muchos de ellos se puede ir caminando a toda hora. Además ofrecen 24 hs servicios de café, te y snacks lo que resulta muy práctico. También recibieron unas compras que había realizado por internet hasta mui llegada. Muy grata experiencia.

title: Bello hotel
text: Realmente es para ponerle excelente pero por lo que cobran deberían ofrecer un desayuno mas completo, por ejemplo café expresso y no ese café aguachento al que están acostumbrados los americanos. Es una opinión.

title: Viagem a new york
text: Hotel pequeno, um pouco escuro , bem localizado na times square. O cafe que está incluído na diaria é muito pobre com poucas opções.Os quartos são grandes e bem equipados, porém o barulho da rua incomoda o sono .

title: I couldn't fault it!!!!
text: Stayed for 5 nights in October. Fantastic boutique hotel which I couldn't fault. Beautifully decorated rooms, bathroom was immaculate (with a TV!). Brilliant location, close to everything. Staff were lovely and helpful, even organised a luxurious chauffeur driven car for our journey back to the airport. This only cost the price of a yellow cab and it was so more comfortable, will book it both ways next time I stay, and I will stay again. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation to anyone. Enjoy!!!

title: very pleased with one-night stay at The Pearl
text: I was very happy with my last-minute booking of this hotel for 1-night.  I found the tripadvisor reviews to be accurate.  It is clean.  The service is very good.  The hotel is the kind of place I want to stay when traveling.  While we were only there for 1-night and did little other than walk around the area, if you are traveling to NYC as a tourist and want to be in the middle of things, this is a great pick.  Thank you, Pearl staff and owner, for doing things right.

title: Very good
text: This hotel is situated just by Times Square wich makes it perfect for visitors wanting to be in the center of Manhattan. There are however many hotels in this area so this is not exclusive. But the hotel in itself is somewhat exclusive. I went with the family, two adults and two children. The room was à double-double and was perfect. It was big enough, the beds were comfortable, the ventilation could be adjusted and it was nice and clean (even cleaner and with that extra touch if you tip the maid 2-3 dollars a day!). Overall all the staff is very friendly and helpfull. The only thing my be that the breakfast is smaller than usual, but good. And they do have free wine every day from 4-5!

title: Amazing Hotel!
text: The Pearl is such a wonderful hotel! The rooms are lovely, spacious and spotless! They offer breakfast in the morning as well as a cheese and wine hour (4-5) and there is a variety of snacks and hot drinks available 24/7 in addition to each room having a coffee machine. The location is perfect as it's a couple minutes walk to Times Square and all the broadway theatres. The hotel staff were so helpful during our trip and were recommending places to eat and helping us to navigate the subway! Thoroughly recommend!!

title: Bem Localizado No Midtown, ótimo em tudo
text:
Hotel Localizado na 49w entre a 7 e 8 avenidas , fica bem no meio do fervo mas em uma rua mais tranquila ao lado do teatro do show Chigado e em frente ao  show Book Of Morman . 
Possui estações de metrô bem próximas o que facilita muito a locomoção em NY .
O hotel tem tudo novo , cama boa , banho bom , lençóis e travesseiros muito bons bem como as toalhas . Isolamento acústico e de luz excelentes . Limpeza excelente .
Neste hotel tem um grande diferencial que é o café da manhã incluído, é simples mas ajuda muito para não perder tempo . Tem liberado no salão snaks , chá e café no quarto .Ás 16 horas tem vinhos e queijos também liberados para os hospedes com bons vinhos 
Na esquina com a 8 av . tem um mercado que tem de tudo para quebrar um galho ou abastecer o frigo bar .
Atendimento excelente , free wifi e recebe encomendas sem cobrar . 
Super recomendo , é claro que vc paga pela localização mas vale a pena .

title: Súper recomendado para familias de 4
text:
Nos encantó por qué es un hotel con cuartos muy amplios para lo que se acostumbra en NY. Somos una familia de 4 y tomamos la Deluxe Suite king w/sofa bed y mis hijos durmieron súper bien allí. Tiene una kitchenette con cafetera, mini refri, lava vasos y microondas. 
Lo que más me impresionó fueron los closets. Tiene dos mini walking closets y uno coat closet en la entrada. 
El baño es suuuper amplio y con rain shower. 
El personal muy atento 
Definitivamente lo recomiendo

title: Excellent
text: Super hotel-situated within walking distance of so many places you'll want to visit, clean, large rooms, great staff (including the really helpful doorman with the moustache), decent free breakfast, very nice wine, cheese & crackers 4-5pm (again for free), good wifi (also free). Try the pizza at Gotham Pizza around the corner (special deal: 2 large slices of plain pizza and a drink for only $5).

title: Buen servicio , habitaciones confortables, personal amable.. sin dudas una buena elección
text: Muy buen hotel . Excelente ubicación a dos cuadras de Times Square . La  habitación (suite deluxe), excelentemente decorada, moderna, espaciosa y confortable (vestidor, microondas y pileta formando una especie de ktichinette; cafetera con cápsulas de café y té; el baño contaba con bañera y ducha apartada cerrada con blindex, y hasta un pequeño televisor; las camas grandes y con cómodos colchones). La limpieza excelente. El personal muy amable, hablan español y atendieron todas nuestras inquietudes y pedidos.  Café, te, agua y snacks a toda hora y momento. El desayuno podrían mejorarlo (no hay platos calientes, ni fiambres), pero es abundante (yogurth, panes, cereales, pastelería bàsica) . Como soy celiaca me proveyeron pan sin gluten sin ningun inconveniente . Muy servicial la camarera que atendía en el desayuno.  Wi fi perfecta. Si bien se debe pagar por el uso de las computadoras que están en la planta baja, no cobran por la impresión de los boarding pass. Nos alojamos por cinco días con mi esposo y mi hija de nueve años .La excelente atención hizo muy  placentera nuestra estadia. Hotel muy recomendable!!!!

title: Great hotel - definitely recommended!!
text: We stayed at The Pearl Hotel in October 2016 (for 6 nights). Our room was nice, clean, spacious and comfortable. The breakfast was good with a rather wide range of choice including bagels, bred, pastries, fruit, coffee and tea. Last but not least, the staff is friendly and professional, and the location is simply perfect (5 minutes from Times Square). We would definitely stay there again and recommend this hotel!!

title: My favorite NYC Hotel
text: The room was huge by NYC standards, and very clean, comfortable, quiet and modern. The breakfast was delicious and the wine hour was relaxing. I felt safe there, traveling alone with my teenage daughter. We stayed four nights and felt pampered and protected. The location is perfect for Broadway shows, without getting mauled walking out the door.

title: Great hotel
text: We stayed at the Pearl hotel to celebrate our anniversary last weekend. Hotel was clean and staffs were friendly. We got two queen beds and it was roomy for our family of four. Location was great as well. I would recommend to request upper level rooms. The hotel is very close to the time square and it gets noisy. Beds were making noises and no hot breakfasts were served. But overall it was great and we would definitely stay again.

title: מלון מצויין, מיקום מעולה
text: מלון חדש יחסית, חדר מרווח (Deluxe) עם מכונת קפה, מיקרו ומיני-בר. מקלחת גדולה. נקי, מסודר ונעים. ארוחת בוקר קונטיננטלית, שתיה חמה, מים קרים ונשנושים חינם לאורך כך היום. שירות מסביר פנים, אדיב ונעים מצד כל אנשי הצוות. דקה הליכה מתחנת הסאבווי הקרובה. שלוש דקות הליכה מהטיימסקוור. מחיר סביר עבור התמורה.

title: Location location location
text:
The location of this hotel is ideal for a base if you are sightseeing and perfectly located if you want to see a show in the theatre district. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The room we had was clean, tidy and spacious for us two with a personal room safe, iron, ironing board, hairdryer, dressing gown, slippers and a pod style coffee machine. The bathroom was great with complementary toiletries and the power shower was awesome.
The continental breakfast was much better than expected with a wide range of choice including cereals, toast, pastries, bagels, eggs and fruit to name but a few.  A bonus was the free cheese and wine between 4 and 5pm although I can't recommend American cheese being an avid Cathedral City Cheddar lover.
I would recommend this hotel highly after a very enjoyable stay we had at the Pearl.

title: great location-friendly staff
text:
great spot that wasnt as expensive as a lot of hotels in the area
Its across the road from the Eugene o'neill theatre, many other theatres nearby
times square less than 5 mins walk, also maybe a 15 min walk to central park

title: Awesome!!!!!
text: Excellent location, super helpful staff, lovely clean rooms, wine & cheese hour from 4 until 5 is all you can eat & drink. 5 minutes from Times Square & bus tours all over NYC. Lovely restaurant next door. Nice friendly bar over the road, part of Mayfair Hotel, staff really friendly & lovely shrimps!! Hotel really helped us out when we had to stay an extra 2 days. Definitely would stay there again. Great stay in a beautiful city!! Applebee's is just around the corner for the best breakfasts ever!

title: NY 2016
text:
Location is great.  Walking distance to Restaurant Row, Time Square.  

Hotel is a bit out dated.  Carpet in our room looked a bit worn but we were able to look beyond that due to the Staff.  They were very professional and friendly.  I would recommend this hotel.

title: A Gem
text: Attentive, professional service in this well-appointed Hotel in a top location were to be expected in this highly regarded  establishment, but the extras -  more than decent continental breakfast, wine/snacks 4-5pm, bottle of Prosecco for our Anniversary, all complimentary - placed The Pearl as a 'cut above'. Highly recommended!

title: visita a New York
text:
pase una semana en Nueva York este pasado 4 de Julio y nos quedamos en este hotel mi esposa, suegros y yo.
nos agrado mucho el Hotel, personal muy amable, siempre habia alquien que hablara espanol, esta a apenas una cuadra de Time Square pero a la vez tranquilo, habitaciones de buen tamano, el desayuno un poco ligero para mi gusto pero lugares de mas cerca para desayunar, acceso a estaciones de tren en todas las esquinas, en general super bien ubicado y cerca de todo, para personas que no conocen mucho a Nueva York este es el hotel perfecto.

title: Mr
text: Top class hidden gem in the midst of a bustling new York city! Not a bad word could be said about this hotel, staff exceptional, location couldn't be better I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Honestly perfect I'll never stay anywhere else in NY again

title: New York visit
text: 5 day break hotel in midtown. Close to time square but didn't get the noise so good sleep. Continental breakfast included with good selection. Staff friendly and good clean rooms.little bit expensive but it's in the middle of new York.

title: Great hotel
text: This was our second stay at The Pearl Hotel. It's in a great location just off Times Square which is handy for the theatres and the TKTS booth! The staff are very welcoming and friendly. The rooms are clean and spacious (although a little more space in the bedroom would have been great) and have everything you could need. The free breakfast is definitely a bonus. It's basic buffet style but enough to set you up for a morning's sightseeing. The 4.00-5.00 wine and nibbles hour is definitely worth a visit. Would highly recommend.

title: Loved it!
text: The location was awesome. The hotel top class.  Was dissapointed in the breakfast selection.  Very limited. Used to a much bigger variety at similar hotels in other countries.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.

title: A bit of a treat
text:
Our flight to New York from Port Elizabeth (South Africa) via Johannesburg and Dubai was always going to be a long one and we decided to treat ourselves to a "better" hotel in an excellent location, and The Pearl Hotel did both of these things.

The rooms were a real treat and we could not have made a better choice.

Breakfast selection could maybe have been a little better

title: Staff so friendly and helpful
text: The rooms with coffee maker, microwave and fridge were lovely and spacious, complimentary breakfast was nice and efficient(you can take it up to your room, too), and staff were friendly and even offered to call my airport driver I had booked myself when he was 10 minutes late. Times Square is steps away. Also enjoyed the musical Chicago right next door.

title: Fantastic !
text:
Just back from a week in New York with husband and 2 teenage kids. 
Stayed at the Pearl and couldn't have been better! 
Room for family huge and had microwave , fridge , coffee etc . 
Staff were soooo helpful and cheerful.
The concierges were falling over themselves to help too and explain anything you didn't understand. 
Breakfast great for what we needed and on tap coffee...fab.
Didn't get time to make use of wine and cheese but that was because we were out ..
Area great as though off Times Square was quiet.....wouldn't have wanted to be right in Times Square
Great for uptown and downtown
In fact can't praise enough! Thanks for a really wonderful stay .

title: Great hotel
text: This hotel is a gem. Have visited New York several times but this is without doubt the best hotel we have ever stayed in. The staff are amazing, could not do enough. We arrived late and needed something to eat and doorman gave us a bar 2 doors down and it could not have been better. Room was large by New York standards and very quiet considering where the hotel is situated. Doormen knew the answers to anything we asked. Even recommend a great laundry near the hotel as we had been traveling for 2 weeks, go to M&M laundry, it's amazing and not at all expensive. When back in New York will definitely stay here and will recommend to all our friends. Thank you.

title: Love this hotel!!
text:
Okay, I really liked the hotel. The only complaint I have is the water pressure was weak. They have a body wand so the sort of made up for it but using that the water seemed to go everywhere. 

I would NOT recommend the restaurant next door. My husband and I went in, the hostess seated us. No one addressed us or took a drink order or even took 2 seconds to say "we'll be right with you". After 20 minutes or waiting we left. The prices were very steep as well. 

I gave the hotel 4 out of 5 because everyone in the hotel itself was great. Just thought you'd like to know about the restaurant. ;)

title: The Santiago's @ The Pearl!
text: My wife and I stayed at The Pearl Hotel the day before and the night of our wedding, it was memorable! Management was super helpful making sure we had everything we needed and every single person from the very moment we stepped out of the taxi until check out were extremely helpful and polite!  We were greeted by name every time we walked through the lobby, our room was Very clean and the rooms were just like the online pictures, Beautiful!! Our family gathered on the second floor the morning of our wedding and enjoyed complimentary breakfast, great food and beautiful atmosphere.  We recommend the Pearl for any occasion! Hope this was helpful! -The Santiago's 😊

title: Unassuming and Friendly - A Great Hotel in Great Location; Highly Recommended
text:
We used this hotel as the base for our recent 8-day stay exploring New York. At something like 14 floors and maybe 80 rooms this hotel is a tiddler compared to the multi-storey giants that surround it. So even on the top floor you are not going to get the high level views that you might get from the likes of the Crowne Plaza which is just along the street.

However, what you get instead is a nice, easy-going, intimate and friendly atmosphere where you never feel like you are just a cog winding its way through the giant corporate hospitality machine. In terms of location you can't get much better - just around the corner from the tourist madness that is Times Square but far enough away to not be right in the middle of the mayhem. There is a subway 2 mins walk away and a supermarket at the end of the block for stocking up on snacks and drinks.

The front desk was always well-manned with an extremely helpful and knowledgeable concierge service and the complimentary crisps (chips if you are American) and iced water in the lobby are perfect after you have been pounding the miles around NYC in the late summer heat (as we were most days). Our room was a deluxe queen-queen suite which had two very comfortable double queen beds and a separate sitting area with TV, fridge and Microwave; the bathroom was modern, well-fitted. Despite the hotel's central location, our room was always quiet too.

This is also one of the first hotel rooms I have stayed in where the air-conditioning kept the room at a nice temperature without being intrusively noisy or turning me into a dehydrated husk every night, so bonus points for that.

I think what sets this hotel apart from the crowd however (and the hotel market in NYC is especially crowded) are the extra little touches that they provide - and these make a huge difference to your overall experience.

When we were researching this trip this was one of the only hotels we could find that included a breakfast. Last time we stayed in NYC the novelty of paying $20 per head extra or heading out to find a diner early in the morning soon wore off. I have seen a few complaints on here about the nature of the breakfast but I really don't know what people are expecting. We found the selection of pastries, toast, cereals, fruit, yoghurt etc perfect for a quick sustaining bite before we headed out for the day. The quality is great and there is no need to mess about going anywhere else. Yes, it was served on plastic plates but who cares? This is a functional (but enjoyable) no-frills breakfast that you don;t get in many other NYC hotels.

The room price also included a fast, efficient and consistent wi-fi connection - better in fact than many other paces we have stayed. To put this in context, the Crowne Plaza on the same street wanted to charge us about $30 a day for a package that includes wi-fi and a couple of other things you probably won't use (gym use anyone? I was walking 10 miles a day around the city... who needs a gym?! And if I did, The Pearl has one included anyway).

During the time we stayed there was also a complimentary cheese and wine hour in the afternoon and we managed to find the time on a few days to sit and relax with a decent glass of red or white. Again, no frills but a really nice touch.

Room service was reasonably priced although out of hours it seems to be outsourced to a local deli that delivers. No problem - good quality, fast delivery and decent price. We also found a traditional deli-sandwich shop a couple of blocks down that was excellent too.

Finally, the complimentary toiletries are L'Occitane. My wife LOVES L'Occitane cosmetics and would have stayed here just for that, but it is a great touch that gives an extra luxury feel to your stay.

In short, this was the perfect hotel for our NYC holiday. Great location, quiet, comfortable, friendly and with lots of nice touches - we would have no hesitation in staying again. It actually felt like good value - and that is saying something for a hotel just off Times Square.

title: Recomendable, muy bueno
text: Estuvimos solo un dia por un evento; tienen excelente atencion, habitaciones modernas, muy bien equipadas, han pensado en todos los detalles para que uno se sienta comodo y a gusto en el hotel. Otro detalle es que al ser un hotel mas pequeño se valora la atencion personalizada, la sala en el primer piso para tomar algo en el dia es muy util.

title: Great Hotel in fantastic location
text: We picked this hotel off the great reviews and we were not disappointed. From the moment we arrived tired from out trip from the UK, we were greeted by the lovely doorman, and then reception. Everyone is so friendly and willing to help. Begot upgraded to a King room as it was our anniversary and the bed was huge and one of the most comfortable we have stayed in. Surprisingly for where it is located just off a busy Times Square, we found our room quiet and we slept amazingly! Would stay again and highly recommend.

title: Just like its name
text: Just like its name, this hotel is a real pearl. 10 out of 10 in every area. Cleanliness, concierge service, fabulous location. It was always great to return to the hotel after a great day in NYC. Most definitely will stay there again and will highly recommend to everyone .

title: plastic plastic, really? paper cups in room, all plastic in breakfast room
text:
Sheets not ironed
table cloths not ironed in breakfast room, soiled and had to ask to be replaced.
happy hour, cubed cheddar and a white, carrots from bag, going white, celery with brown ends, 
everything plastic, room paper cups for coffee, all plastic in breakfast room and happy hour. what a waste!

title: Ticks all the boxes!!
text:
I searched for a long time for the right hotel and the Pearl Hotel was the perfect place. 

Comfortable room, dark and soooo quiet at night, right in the heart of the theatre district and very close to transport, Time Square, 5th avenue and the start point of all our tours. The breakfast bar is adequate, but the hot water takes a while to come through at night for our showers. The kitchenette was fine. 

I couldn't have asked for more for our NYC holiday. Highly recommended and hope you love it too.

title: Holiday stay
text:
Pearl was a great hotel to stay in and an excellent location to get to the various sites to see in New York 
Staff were extremely helpful and rooms were comfortable 
Metro is close by and centrally located hotel 
Nice size room and not noisy 
Breakfast is not the best as served on plastic plates and paper cups - not to my liking

title: Above average
text:
Quick Summary: Clean rooms. Small but average by NYC standards. 
Perfect location for Times Square and Theatre district. 
Family friendly. 
Breakfast was the reason we booked this hotel versus comparable hotels in the area. 
I would stay here again.

title: Good hotel at a great location
text:
Not a big hotel, but greatly located in midtown New York. Almost all subway stations are less than 5 minutes walk, and there are a lot of restaurants and shops nearby. Rooms are pretty specious relatively to other hotels in NY.

The breakfast buffet is not what you'd expect for a decent hotel breakfast, but enough to start the day with a cup of coffee & bagel or croissant. 

WiFi is free, but it's not very fast. Great A/C. The staff is very friendly and helpful.

Of course, the only problem, like most of the hotels in NYC is the price, but from my experience it is still worth it compared to other hotels that are just slightly cheaper.

title: GREAT HOTEL
text:
Stayed 2 adults and 3 children's in a suite and there was anough room for everyone. Great Breakfast (but no vegetables). Quite street and close to everything. Big supermarket just near by. 
GREAT STUFF!

title: Fabulous hotel...great location!
text: Wow what a find! Fabulous central location, just 2 mins from Broadway and Times square and 10 mins walk to Central Park. Surrounded by a mix of restaurants and cafes but bizarrely quiet location, certainly for the centre of NYC. The staff couldn't do  enough to help us with extended check out, breakfast, taxi hailing and general advice. Room was enormous, and not what i had been lead to expect as the norm in the city, with amazing power shower, robes, slippers, safe and fridge too. Hot drinks machine and hairdryer provided too. The continental breakfast was included and they kindly provided me with gluten free bread and almond milk on request. Breakfast area runs from 7-10 but gets busy towards the end and shuts promptly. Wasn't a fan of the disposable plastic plates, bowls, cups and cutlery. There is a room service provided by the hotel in core hours but they have a very efficient ordering arrangement with a nearby cafe who can fulfil the same menu outside of the hotel hours and you order from your room in the same way. Delivery took 15 mins. I will definitely stay there next time I visit and recommend to all!!

title: Great Location
text: We were in the City for just two days for a meeting and have got chance to stay in this hotel. If you want to stay in somewhere in the heart of NYC then this is your place This is a very good small hotel located in a few minute walk from Times Square. Room was clean and spacious, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom had a huge shower. Room included a continental breakfast which was not that big but was sufficient and there was complimentary cheese and wine offer also from 4-5pm. We had free wi fi in our rooms. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

title: The name of the hotel says it all
text: This hotel is simply a gem. A true find in NYC. I travel to NY frequently and have been staying at the same hotel for years. Unfortunately this was a last minute trip and they could not accommodate me. Or I guess I should say fortunately, instead. Because I now have a new home in NY. I travel a lot  (about 250 nights a year on the road) so I'm not frequently blown away by a hotel, but this one did it. The staff is friendly and helpful. Upon check in they upgraded me without me even asking. The room was beautiful, spotless, well appointed and really large - much larger than you would expect in NYC. There was a gorgeous balcony with tasteful furniture on it. A real nice touch. The bed is comfortable and the amenities are top notch. Electrical outlets are everywhere, as they should be. The only negative thing I could say if I had to find something is that the refrigerator is not stocked. But that's minor given you can get anything you want within a block. This hotel is simply a gem and I'd recommend it to anyone without any hesitation. Thanks for a great stay and for a new home while I'm in NYC.

title: ..super lokatie en toch rustig
text:
Bij binnenkomst in de lobby valt de ontvangst wat tegen maar de kamers zij ok en heerlijk rustig en schoon. Dit ondanks dat je in het hart van de Big Appel zit.
Het ontbijt wat bij de prijs inbegrepen en bestaat uit bagels en verschillende soorten gebak croissants en verder hard gekookte eieren en jam ect.
Om bij te komen van al het shoppen krijg je om 4 Pm wijn, kaas ect.
Alles bij elkaar voor NY niet slecht.

title: Special Attention in a Great Location
text: The Pearl has that New York boutique hotel feel in a location that is easy walking to Time Square, Broadway plays, restaurant row and 3 subway stations. Checkin was smooth and easy.  We had a large room with a nice bathroom with a large window overlooking two theaters.  Even robes and slippers and small fridge. Room was very quiet for New York.  The Pearl treated us with champagne when they learned we were celebrating our birthdays.  Concierge helped us with reservations and touring advice and remembered our names when we walked in.  Every evening there was open wine tasting with light snacks and a continental breakfast every morning.  I will definitely stay here next time!

title: Will never stay anywhere else while visiting NYC
text:
Just returned from my fourth stay at the Pearl Hotel. The rooms, the staff, the service and the location are exceptional. Close to Times Square , Hells Kitchen, Rockefeller Center , Columbus Circle,Central Park ....
The rooms are modern and spacious and very clean. The continental breakfast is a real plus. They offer snacks all day long as well as a wine and cheese in the early evening. Free wifi in the rooms as well as coffee machines,microwaves , safes etc 
An absolute gem boutique hotel on a very quiet street a stone throw from Times Square. 
If your looking for an unforgettable vacation ... Stay at the Pearl.

title: Sentralt og fint hotell på Manhatten
text: Hotellet har en nydelig beliggenhet i en av de mange sidegatene til Time Square. Hotellet lå sentralt, det var svært enkelt å finne frem, personalet var meget hyggelige og rommet var stort og fint. Vi hadde 4 netter på hotellet og rakk og gjøre alt man kan, det er gangavstand til (nesten) alt man ønsker å oppleve. Betjeningen er svært hjelpsomme med det man skulle måtte lure på. Det eneste som trekker litt ned er frokosten, den er svært enkel og består for det meste av ulike kaker. Prisen var kanskje noe stiv, men man må betale for en slik beliggenhet. Kan absolutt anbefales videre!

title: Excelente!!!! Lo recomiendo sin dudarlo!!
text:
En principio quiero destacar la excelente atención del personal!!! Sumamente amables, educados atentos, los muchachos que están en la puerta, que en general hablan español, son FORMIDABLES!!!! Al igual que los de la recepción y los que se encargan del servicio de desayuno y  vinos por la tarde
La ubicación es perfecta!!! La calle es bastante tranquila pero estas en una de las mejores zonas, muuuuy centrica,  caminas unas poquitas cuadras y tenes el Time Square, el Central Park, en fin para regresar tranquila a cualquier hora de dia y noche. En la esquina tenes un The Emporium Food para comprar comestibles
Las habitaciones son grandes, cama espectacular, tal vez el único defecto es  que el mobiliario es sobrio, algo anticuado pero en perfecto estado
El desayuno es bastante completo, sin platos calientes ni fiambres, pero con algunas frutas panes, pasteleria, cereales. Abundante.
Por la tarde, de 16 a 17 sirven vinos de buena calidad, quesos snak y algunas verduras. Para aprovechar.
Solo nos alojamos dos noches antes de regresar a Buenos Aires, pero fueron suficientes como para recomendarlo sin dudar
En resumen, la mejor ubicación, la mejor atención, limpio, y el plus de que incluye desayuno y tentenpie por la tarde
Suerte!!

title: Great location and great features!
text:
I was there for 4 days on a girl trip. 
Check in with quick and smooth. We even got our rooms early. They informed us that we were right on time for the wine and cheese that is from four till five. They had both the red and a white wine as well as a nice selection of cheeses vegetables and fruit available. In addition in the lobby at all times is water chips and apples.
We had the double queen suite. It was quite spacious by New York standards. It is very close to the heart of times square and a lot of different theaters and restaurants. 
The concierge was very knowledgable navigate to Subway even on the days that there was construction.
Finally, a continental breakfast was served till 10 o'clock. It had toast, bagels, eggs, cerea, fruit and coffee. So nice not have to get room service or to try and find somethibg to eat in the morning before you were off. 
Overall a really great hotel and I would definitely return!!

title: Near everything and on a quiet street
text: We stayed at The Pearl Hotel for 3 nights in Sept 2016.  Thur, Fri and Sat.  It is a very clean and modern boutique hotel.  The bathroom is exceptionally nice!  We were pleasantly surprised with the superb daily continental breakfast.  This location is perfect.  Close to everything. The shows, Macy's, Times Square, Fifth Ave, Diamond District and Central Park.  The doormen and front desk staff are all friendly!  Also, as a bonus on Sunday mornings there is a street fair on Broadway.  Great shopping!

title: simplemente espectacular
text: perfecto hotel para visitar Nueva York, cerca de Times Square ,Broadway, Rockefeller Center. Mejor ubicación imposible. el Staff muy amable, las habitaciones limpias,buen tamaño con frigobar, cafetera Keurig,te reemplazan el cafe todos los días, agua, la cama divina y para estar tan cerca de todo son muy silenciosas las habitaciones. en el bano encuentras productos de L Occitane. Hacen un Happy Hour todos los días de 4 a 5 de la tarde donde sirven vino tinto y vino blanco y sirven una tabla de quesos con uvas y un dip con vegetales que me parece un toque muy lindo por parte del Hotel. el desayuno variado, cereales cafe te chocolate caliente leche,hasta leche de almendras frutas ensalada de frutas bagel pastelería croissant mantequilla miel mantequilla de mani queso philadelphia y mermelada, lo único que le faltaría para ser perfecto es que para el desayuno pusieran jamón y queso de resto o recomiendo 100 % simplemente espectacular

title: Excelente custo benefício
text:
Para quem quer ficar hospedado próximo a Times Square, esta é uma ótima opção. O hotel não é muito grande, tem café da manhã incluído (coisa rara em NY) e uma degustação de vinhos à tarde.
O quarto era bastante espaçoso e muito silencioso. Ammenities da L'Occitane. Chuveiro ótimo.
Não foi possível um early check in, mas nos permitiram ficar até às 14h no check out. Voltaria a me hospedar.

title: Pearl - the right name!
text: What a fab hotel! An oasis in the midst of NYC chaos. Small boutique hotel. Excellently positioned only 2-3 mins walk from the start of Times Square. Very near to 'restaurant mile' and theatre district. Hotel is small and charming. Lots of attentive staff. Very nice rooms with coffee maker, fridge, microwave, TV, hairdryer and safe. Very comfortable beds and so little noise from street below. Breakfast is 6-10 am, get and go approach, continental range which is more than sufficient. Tea, coffee and snacks available 24/7. Free wine and cheese hour daily 4-5pm. Secure building and rooms.  Would recommend.

title: Fab Hotel
text:
The Pearl is a lovely stylish hotel ideally situated just off Times Sq.We stayed 4 nights 12 - 16 Sept. Hotel is spotlessly clean and well maintained.The rooms are spacious,nicely decorated and comfortable.The continental breakfast was great. 
The staff were extremely welcoming and friendly whilst remaining professional. A big thankyou to everyone at The Pearl.Extra special thankyou to William the doorman,a great guy,warm and friendly and super helpful.

title: New York City at it's best!
text: I spent months looking at hotel reviews and looking for a boutique type hotel in the city.  The Pearl checked every box and it was one of the best hotel experiences!  The rooms are huge, and we did do an upgrade when we checked in which was worth it for the small fee.  I absolutely loved the wine hour with all the cheese, crackers and veggies.  We didn't miss it one day!  I loved having all the snacks and iced coffee available at any time during the day and we took advantage of this.  The breakfast was also more than enough for us.  The location of the hotel is awesome just a few minutes from Times Square.  I dream about this hotel and would love to go back!  This made our New York City trip spectacular!

title: Clean and close
text: The Pearl is a small and quiet hotel. The rooms are well maintained, clean, and decorated. The hotel is just a couple of blocks away from Times Square, so it's definitely within walking distance. There were plenty of shopping and food options nearby. We enjoyed our visit!

title: Gem of a hotel
text:
I love this hotel!!! I have stayed here already 4 times in the last two years, and I simply adore this hotel. The location is perfect - on a quiet street, yet right next to Times Square. The service is terrific; everyone is friendly, helpful and everyone is always smiling. It's not a huge chain hotel, and thus although modern it has a unique charm to it. The lobby is small but inviting, and it's also great that you can always get a glass of water and a snack (fruit, or a bag of chips) when you enter the hotel. The rooms are spacious, clean, modern and lots of room for everything. I also love the L'Occitane bath products. Another cute little perk, are the Hershey kisses by your bed everyday.
Other great perks are the free wifi, the nice breakfast, coffee all day long, and a 4pm wine and cheese hour!!! 
Now that my daughter is at university in New York, The Pearl Hotel will be my home away from home.

title: A Fantastic Hotel In A Perfect Place
text:
We stayed 5 nights near Times Square in this hotel. The service there was Amazing,they offered you drinks, snacks and even carried you bags to your room. Our room was great, it was decorated perfectly and had stylish furniture all around. It had an AC in the room so it was nice and cool to. I liked our room because my bed was closest to the AC, although my mum and dad were closer to the TV. Our bathroom was rather big it had a reasonably large shower with two sinks a clean toilet and a bidet. There was an outdoor patio where we had evening drinks with the family.  Every morning we had a buffet with all kind of things cereal, oat meal, hot chocolate, croissant, juice and all kind of other nice foods ( My mum loved the bagels).
 The hotel was well located, it was near Times Square and Broadway. This meant that we had access to lots of shops and restaurants. My favourite part off my trip to New York was visiting all the interesting places like the Statue Of Liberty, Grand Central Station, Central Park, Empire State Building and the Central Library where part of Ghost Busters was filmed.
The Pearl Hotel is in an ideal location for access to the underground metro and within easy walking distance of the major sights. 

Hope You Enjoy Your Stay In New York.

Written By: Oliver B

title: Friendly service makes this already upscale, well-located hotel even better
text: Of course, the Pearl's location is very convenient, with multiple metro stops nearby, Times Square just around the corner, and many theaters in the neighborhood. But in addition to that, the rooms are amazingly clean, well-appointed, and extremely comfortable. Our room had a refrigerator and microwave, coffee maker, nice-sized desk, a safe, plenty of counter space in the bathroom, and a very comfortable bed. And the staff can't be beat!  They give you top-notch service with a smile. We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. In fact, we can't wait to return.

title: Gerne wieder !
text: Ich war zum fünften Mal in NYC, entsprechend war dies meine fünfte Hotel-Erfahrung. Kurzum: Ich bin ziemlich sicher, dass ich beim nächsten Besuch wieder hier einchecken werde, da einfach alles passt (Lage, Größe und Qualität der Zimmer, vergleichsweise wenig Straßenlärm, Freundlichkeit des Personals, Zusatzleistungen wie WiFi usw.). Lediglich an der Qualität des Automaten-Kaffees im Frühstücksraum müsste noch gearbeitet werden, der schmeckt in jedem Hampton Inn wirklich besser !

title: Fantastic location
text:
Stayed here for 6 nights while in New York for the first time to do the whole touristy thing. Really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. 

Arrived very early in the morning, but was fortunate to have a room ready, so could check-in straight into my room. This was nice after having not slept that much in the red eye flight from LA. The rest of the service was very nice, with friendly doormen and front desk staff. Nothing was too much trouble, including an embarrassing blocked toilet!

The rooms were nicely appointed, and larger than I expected for New York. The bathroom was very nice also, with lovely bathroom amenities and a TV in the bathroom (not that I used it).

The breakfast was nice. I see people whining about the options, but for a free continental breakfast, it was pretty good, and was one way to save some money in New York! It was also nice to have snacks in the foyer. I took a packet of chips and fruit everyday in my bag to have during the day while out and about. I didn't manage to get to the wine and cheese in the evening, as I was too busy exploring New York.

The really good point was the location. Right in the heart of Broadway (I went and saw The Book of Mormon which was literally across the road) and block away from Times Square, and half a block from the closest subway station. Doesn't get better than that. Was also able to easily walk to 5th avenue and up to Central Park. Despite its location, being just off Times Square meant it was that little bit quieter, so was not disturbed through the night with street noise.

Overall, really enjoyed my stay and would recommend it to others coming to New York. If I return to this amazing city, I would hopefully come back to the Pearl Hotel

title: Excellent hotel and location
text: The hotel is spotlessly clean, spacious room with comfortable beds.
