Staff were very friendly and helpful with room maid service daily,  great location just off Times Square but far enough away from the noise if you want a bit of peace and quiet.  Lovely continental breakfast too.  Would definitely stay again if visiting the area.

title: Hotell sentralt på Manhattan
text: Koselig hotellel med kort gangavstand til det meste.  Hotellet lå like ved Broadway. Store og fine rom. Tv både på rommet og badet.  Rent og fint.  Gratis vin kjeks og frukt hver dag klokken 16. Kaffe, vann og snacks var tilgjengelig hele tiden. Blid og trivelig betjening.  Frokosten var enkel, men helt ok.  Det som dro ned var at alt service og bestikk var av plast og for dermed rett i bosset.

title: Gem of a hotel in Tiems Square
text: We stayed 2 nights to have a girlfriend weekend and see some Broadway shows.  This was the perfect hotel for that.  They have a really nice wine tasting from 4-5PM and a nice continental breakfast.  The staff is very pleasant and helpful.

title: a due passi da Times square
text:
L'hotel è sulla 49th strada , tra la 7th e 8th a due passi da Times Square oltre ad avere la metropolitana. Le stanze sono pulite e spaziose. Il personale dell'hotel è gentile e disponibile. Il ristorante dispone di un ristornate dove poter cenare e pranzare, ma io non ho avuto modo di provarlo. Al secondo piano la mattina dalle ore 6 è pronta la colazione, un pò scomoda la presenza dei tavolini da salotto al posto dei tavoli. 
consigliato.

title: Nice hotel
text:
Nice modern hotel very central for all shows etc, from the minute we arrived we where greeted with the doorman and all staff from front desk to the housekeeping lady 
Would recommend this hotel to anyone but don't ask for a late checkout $150 for three hours!!!! Nae danger

title: Great stay at The Pearl!  Highly recommend a closer look.
text: Great experience at The Pearl.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  We were placed in a king suite with sitting area and nice outdoor patio.  The room was extremely comfortable and clean with a contemporary feel.  The location made it really easy to get around the Times Square area and the Theater District. Two major theaters are just steps away.  Easy access to the subway system made getting around the city simple to navigate.  The Pearl had a very good complimentary breakfast to start the day and a nightly wine service to start your evening. I would highly recommend this hotel for your New York stay.

title: Wonderful Surprise in Times Square
text: Loved, loved, loved this place.I am a native New Yorker who now lives in Chicago, but came to New York for a weekend to celebrate my daughter's 13th birthday and see some shows. I stumbled upon the Pearl in an internet search and reviews looked good and rates were among the better out there. The Pearl exceeded my expectations. Now if you're looking for a big fancy lobby and tons of restaurants, etc. that's not what you will find here, but of you are looking for a great location, great service, a clean updated room, then this is the place for you. We arrived early, but were allowed to check in. We were given a handicapped accessible room, which was amazing since it was large and had an amazing walk-in shower. Our room didn't have much of a view because we were overlooking a courtyard, but that was a blessing. It was so quiet we both had great nights sleep. Beds were comfy.  I can't say enough about the staff. Everyone was friendly and kind, especially the doorman. When they found out it was my daughter's birthday we were sent a bottle of sparkling cider with champagne glasses filled with chocolates and a calligraphy note with her name wishing her a happy birthday. We loved that snacks were available for free all day and that continental breakfast was provided daily. I would go back in a minute, and thank you to the Pearl for making our weekend everything we hoped it would be.

title: Fantastic New York hotel
text: Wonderful hotel located near Times Square, convenient for major attractions.  Beautifully presented and well furnished rooms, considerably larger than usually found in New York. With the excellent buffet continental breakfast,  wine and delicious nibbles served between 4 and 5 pm, guests are so well catered for. The staff are very polite and accommodating. This hotel is perfect.

title: Great hotel in the heart of it...
text:
Not heard of this hotel until we started investigating potential accommodation, but very glad we found it! It is conveniently located just off of Times Square, with plenty of bars and restaurants nearby. The staff are very pleasant and helpful, and when they found out our trip was a 30th wedding anniversary celebration, they very kindly left a complimentary bottle of Prosecco in an ice bucket in our room! Thanks guys!
The very nice large room was clean, with a good bathroom with walk in shower, a very comfortable Queen bed and a flat screen TV.
They also provide free 24 hr coffee, tea and light snacks in the restaurant and foyer area. Also, a nice touch is the complimentary wine and cheese between 4-5 pm.
All in all a very nice hotel in a good location, and I would thoroughly recommend for your visit to NYC!

title: Faultless all round . .
text:
We had never visited New York before and so we're not sure what to expect, but found everything at The Pearl superb. The hotel is a smaller hotel in a spot on location, with friendly and helpful staff. Our room was a twin double with a fridge, microwave and coffee machine. There was a TV in the room and another in the generous bathroom which had a large and powerful shower. Beds were very comfortable and the room was spotless, the only negative was the view from the window out to the back, which quickly became a positive when we realised how noisy it was at the front of the hotel ! 
We had a considerably quieter room because it faced the rear and as we spent no time in the room in daylight,  it didn't bother us at all. 
The location is superb, a block from the Metro,  5 minutes from Times Square and within a few minutes of loads of Broadway musicals. It is astonishing how near a lot of attractions are with loads within easy walking distance. 
There have been some negative comments on the breakfast here, but we loved it. Help yourself to whatever you like and as much as you want, cereal, fruit, yoghurt, toast, bagels, egg, pastries,  juice and coffee. If you want a cooked, that is not included, but you are surrounded by all manner of breakfast options at a reasonable price. 
And don't waste money booking a transfer to the airport before you leave the UK, for €70 all inclusive, the hotel offer a private car to JFK, that picks you up from the door. I could find nothing except the Metro cheaper.
I would highly recommend The Pearl, it has a great location, helpful, friendly staff and is a smashing hotel.

title: Expected better
text: My partner and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. We expected it to be better for a 4*  hotel. Breakfast was disappointing as they only had limitid choices without any hot food selection. But it was in a great location just walking distance to the time square and for the public transports.

title: Excelente servicio y ubicación
text: La atención en el hotel fue maravillosa. La habitación era amplia, cómoda y limpia. Tenía una buena heladerita donde podíamos poner algunos productos. De todos modos, el hotel ofrece en su tarifa servicio de desayuno y snacks y algunas bebidas sin cargo durante todo el día. La ubicación es inmejorable, a metros de Times Square.

title: Estupendo hotel
text:
La situación es ideal. Las habitaciones también, y el personal amabilísimo. Quizá el precio es algo elevado, pero resulta agradable hospedarse allí. Lo peor, el salón para desayunos, que es muy pequeño para el volumen del hotel.
Aun así, lo recomendaria

title: Perfect location for the theater and popular tourist spots
text: We chose The Pearl for a mother-daughter weekend in NYC due to it's location.  It is close to everything without being in the middle of the madness of Times Square.  It ended up being the perfect hotel for us.  We were in a very nice 2 queen room which was a really good size for NY.  Coffee/tea, microwave and mini fridge in the room.  Breakfast in the morning was quite extensive and wine and snacks every afternoon.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  Highly recommend The Pearl for anyone who wants to be in the middle of action but not in Times Square.

title: Fantastic hotel in great location
text: The Pearl Hotel is a hidden gem in the hustle and bustle of NYC. It is small and friendly and located within walking distance of many of the top sights. The staff are helpful and friendly. The rooms are very spacious and the bathrooms are luxurious. Complimentary breakfast is served daily and there is plenty of choice. The wine and cheese hour is also a great benefit of this hotel.

title: Hotel Magníifico!!!!!!!
text: Recomendo demais o The Pearl Hotel!!!! Como o próprio nome diz, ele é uma pérola no coração de Nova York!!!! Amei me hospedar aqui!!!! Serviço fantástico, staff a ducado e atencioso, muito acima dos padrões americanos! Pra mim o classifico como excelente!!!! Não tenho nenhuma reclamação à fazer!!!! Voltarei várias vezes mais!!!!?

title: Fantastic hotel for exploring NYC
text: Our family of 5 visited NYC for the first time at the end of July. We have 3 teenage boys and were therefore on the lookout for a hotel that could accommodate us comfortably in one room and be well located. The Pearl met all our needs, in a great location off Times Sq, within walking distance of Central Park, 5th Ave, Rockefeller Centre and close to subway to take us to Downtown Manhattan. The room was a good size with 2 doubles and a sofa bed in separate area. The breakfast was a good quality and fuelled us for the day. the 4pm wine and cheese was also a welcome treat particularly on the day we landed from the UK! Staff all helpful and couldn't recommend high enough.

title: Great time had by all
text: The hotel staff were completely helpful with every request made of them, the room was comfortable and well maintained each day whilst we were out.  It was perfectly situated for all of the tourist areas in the city and I would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city

title: SUPER
text:
Très bel hôtel très bien situé sur Times square
Chambres confortables, calmes avec vue sur une piscine du club de sport d'en face et un petit dej succinct mais très bien pour démarrer la journée.
Personnel gentil et efficace.
À recommander !!!!

title: New York City Vacation
text:
I took my mother on vacation for a week to see Broadway shows and sight-see New York.  The check-in process was quick and easy.  We arrived a few hours before the room was ready, but they allowed us to store our bags at the hotel until it was time to check-in.  They carried our bags to our rooms before we even got out of our Shuttle Van.  

When we finally got to our room, it was crisp and clean and very spacious.  There was even a television in the bathroom!  The shower was large with lots of pressure.  Words can not even describe how pleased I am with my experience.  The staff was friendly and accommodating when we needed directions.

Breakfast is included, not a huge selection, but nice and peaceful.  This hotel even includes a complementary cheese and wine hour 4-5pm, a fitness center, and a gourmet restaurant next door.  Also, the maids leave Hershey kisses on the bed every evening, a nice touch.

The hotel in the heart of Time Square.  It is next door to Chicago, the musical and within walking distance to  other great restaurants and theaters.  Moreover, the subway station is only a block away.  

When it was time to check out, the staff informed us when our shuttle bus arrived and carried our bags to the van.  

I have absolutely NO complaints about this hotel!  Fantastic place.  I highly recommend!

title: Great Hotel
text:
This is a great hotel, the room was clean and comfortable and surprisingly large for NY. The staff were friendly and helpful, the hotel surprised my partner with a complimentary bottle of wine to celebrate his birthday nice touch. 
Close to time square but not in time square (1 block away) walking distance to 5th avenue.Closer to Broadway shows, than 911 memorial and Empire state building worked great for us. 
Had an excellent time, would stay here again.
Fitness centre and free wifi

title: Hotel recomendable!
text:
Solo estuvimos dos días antes de ir a Canadá, pero la estancia fue buena. Llegamos antes de la hora de check- in y nos dieron la habitación enseguida. Elegimos el Pearl por su ubicación, cerca de Times Square ( para tener las mismas referencias que el año pasado que también estuvimos en NY), pero la calle del hotel es tranquila.
 La habitación era espaciosa y limpia, daba a la parte posterior (veíamos la terraza de un gimnasio), aunque era ruidosa a causa de los aires acondicionados.
Bonito baño, con bañera y ducha separadas y buena ventilación. Los productos de baño eran de la marca l’Occitane, y teníamos champú, acondicionador, body milk, gel de ducha líquido, jabón de manos, y jabón de ducha.
Tanto en el hall de la entrada, como en la sala de desayunos, estaban disponible todo el día agua fresca perfumada con frutas y bolsas de patatas chips.
El desayuno es lo que menos nos gustó, con poca fruta y los productos no nos parecieron de muy buena calidad.

title: Quietud entre el bullicio / Quiet amongst the noise
text:
El hotel es muy lindo y cómodo. Las habitaciones que no dan hacia la calle son las mejores, no son ruidosas a pesar de estar a unas cuadras de Times Square. El pequeño desayuno, incluido, es suficiente para iniciar la mañana. El personal es increíblemente amable, sin excepción. Volvería a The Pearl sin pensarlo dos veces!
We had an excellent stay at The Pearl, the staff is very kind and attentive without being pushy. The rooms are a very good size and comfortable. 
The bathroom was clean and spacious. We went to he second floor for breakfast to start the day, there are always apples, the, chips and water .
We would stay here again.

title: The Pearl is exactly that!
text:
MY DW and I travelled to NY end of July. Weather was hot.  The Pearl is perfectly situated, right off Times Square and so near to Hell's Kitchen for great restaurants. 5 mniute walk to any of the shows we went to. We were on the 14th floor with a Deluxe King room with a fridge and microwave.  The room faced West 49th St. and we had an okay view.  The room itself was very large and comfortable.  The windows didn't seal quit properly and some of the road noise came in, but nothing too annoying.  The hotel was full but we didn't see anyone else on our floor the whole week we were there.  Maid service was good - room kept clean with ever increasing amounts of Hershey's kisses left each day :).  The free breakfast was fine for us - we don't eat anything heavy in the morning  but if you like a big breakfast this might not be it for you. Front desk staff was superb - always willing to provide as much information as you needed and always greeted us with a smile.  Doormen were quick to please and a wealth of information. Liked the chips/apples/lemon water in the lobby.
Absolutely recommend the Pearl.

title: Great location
text:
We expected great things having seen the many positive reviews on TripAdvisor. We weren't disappointed. 

Positives :

* Very comfy beds. 
* Great location - only a few minutes walk from Times Square and a subway station. 
* Clean, modern and good sized rooms. 
* Free WiFi. 
* Good breakfast - reasonable choice for a quick breakfast before heading put for the day. 
* Friendly and helpful staff. 

Negatives:

* View from the room wasn't the best. But it didn't really bother us. 

We'd highly recommend this hotel to anybody visiting New York. We'd definitely look to stay here again on a future visit to New York.

title: Super hotel, great location
text: The hotel was in the theater district, one block from Broadway, but far enough away from Times Square. There are subway stations within a block, a really good grocery store right on the corner, and a very good steak house attached to the hotel.  The rooms are extremely comfortable, the bed was great. Loved having the microwave and mini-fridge available, very nice toiletries for the bathroom, interesting and good shower. I was on the 14th floor, and my only complaint is that I was right next to the elevator.  However, with all the action during the day, I slept through the elevator movements at night, and I would stay in that room again. Staff was very friendly, wonderful to stop back at the hotel for nice wine in the afternoon from 4-5, plenty to choose from at the free breakfast.  Highly recommend this hotel and I will book it the next time I go to NYC,

title: Hotel ótimo!!
text:
O Hotel The Pearl está localizado na 49th Street, na Times Square. Tem uma ótima localização! 
O apartamento que escolhemos, com cama de casal Queen, tinha um bom tamanho, frigobar, banheiro bem equipado, tudo novo e limpo. 
O café da manhã era bom, se  comparado aos padrões americanos.
Recepcionistas e porteiros gentis e prestativos.
Um Hotel que entrega o que promete.
O preço não é dos melhores, mas eu voltaria. 
Recomendo.

title: Gem of a hotel!!!
text: Beautiful boutique hotel near Broadway shows and Times Square. Superb staff, spotlessly clean, great amenities with quiet rooms and modern decor. It even has queen beds, free Wifi and free breakfast! Not to mention free snacks, and a free wine and cheese hour! This was a wonderful experience. The Pearl definitely contributed to making our NYC family trip an unforgettable memory! Thank you all at The Pearl.

title: Fantastic hotel
text:
Great hotel with super friendly and efficient staff.
Good location in heart of theatre district but quiet in the hotel.
Free continental breakfast was great with lots of choices and cheese and wine event at 4pm for an hour every day was good too.
Room was sufficient in size for 2 people and very clean.
Highly recommended

title: Loved this hotel!
text: We stayed here for 4 nights and loved every one of them! We felt like we found a little gem in the theatre district!  Azi at the front desk was so nice and helpful...we got there prior to check-in time but he gave us an early check-in and we had a beautiful room which was very clean! The bed was comfortable and the street noise was minimal. We had no problem getting a good nights sleep. There was a free continental breakfast on the second floor that had a great variety and we ate there every morning. We absolutely LOVED this HOTEL and it's STAFF!!   We couldn't have asked for more!

title: Carino e ospitale
text: Mi sono trovata bene tutto sommato , peccato che non potessi tenere con me il mio cagnolino perché non lo accettavano ma non importa perché il soggiorno è stato fantastico e la pulizia era eccellente. Colazione ricca e ben curata , reception degna di un bel hotel.

title: Excelente opção em Nova Iorque
Really nice hotel
text: Very clean hotel, customer service was always friendly and willing to help. Continental breakfast was really good too. Bed, pillows and blankets were clean and very comfortable. Location is impeccable too! This hotel has it all. You can't go wrong with this hotel.

title: Loved our 5 day stay!
text:
Very clean hotel!  The people who worked there were so kind and helpful.  We ate the free cheese and wine and it was very nice.  The breakfast was mostly breads and pastries, but they did offer cereals and hard boiled eggs too!  There was fresh bananas, apples, chips, and infused water throughout the day.
The beds were nice and the shower was great!  The Pearl uses very nice shampoos, conditioners, soap, and lotion.  We absolutely loved our stay.  We were just blocks away from Times Square and the subway.
We cannot wait to return to The Pearl!

title: What a surprise!
text: This hotel is such a nice surprise.  The staff are friendly, the rooms are beautifully decorated, the beds are comfy and the location is awesome!  A short walking distance to shops, restaurants, theatres and Times Square yet the hotel itself is located on a quiet street.  There's a little grocery store around the corner which is very convenient and you feel safe walking in the area.

title: いいホテルです
text:
7泊しました。立地はすごくいいです。50thの駅が一番近く、アッパーウエストやブルックリン方面にも一本で行けるので便利でした。タイムズスクエアへもロックフェラーセンターへも徒歩10分ほどなのも便利でした。そんな立地にも関わらず、窓の防音性が高いのか、外の騒音は気になりませんでした。むしろ廊下や隣室の音の方が結構響いていました。数軒先には大型スーパーがあり重宝しました。
部屋は広く、内装もシックで落ち着けます。少しがっかりだったのは、「簡易キッチン付き」の部屋を予約していたのに、電子レンジがあるだけだったこと。湯沸かしポットもなく、フロントに頼んで持ってきてもらいました。ただ、高級ホテルでも冷蔵庫さえないことが多いというニューヨークのホテル事情を考えると、空の冷蔵庫と電子レンジがあるというだけでも恵まれていたのかも。ちなみにスリッパはありません。あらかじめ持参しておいてよかった！
かなり嬉しかったのは、2階の朝食ラウンジで、24時間コーヒー&スナックがフリーなうえ、夕方4時〜5時はワインとおつまみ（チーズやクラッカーなど）のサービスがあったこと。朝ホテルを出て、疲れ果てて一旦もどるのがちょうどそれくらいの時間なので、何度も利用しました。
ホテルスタッフは総じて愛想がよく親切でした。チェックイン、チェックアウト時の説明も明快でわかりやすく、レスポンスが早いのも良かったです。
当初は某大型ホテルに泊まる予定でしたが、部屋数2000室近くと知って、手が回らないのでは？と不安になり、こちらに変更しました。こちらは90室ほど、こじんまりした雰囲気でロビーもいつも静かで和めました。
ニューヨーク再訪の際には必ずリピートすると思います。

title: Excellent Hotel! Amazing Staff!!!
text: My fiance and I stayed at the Pearl Hotel and were greeted by their wonderful staff. The front agent Melissa Guzman was an absolute doll, she upgraded our room with a beautiful balcony, and made sure we had everything we needed or desired during our stay. The hotel is very clean, beautiful decor, nice gym and is in an excellent location. We loved the Pearl hotel and staff and will definitely visit again!! Thank you!

title: 朝食はしょぼいが、全てにおいてNYを感じれるホテル
text:
NYの定宿として使わせていただいています。
まず立地が良い、近くにスーパー、飲食店、ドラッグストア、全てが揃っています。8Aveを使えば42stまでで特に事足ります。
特に隣のリリーズバーはゴシックで、よく現地の仕事先の方との打ち合わせでも、一人ででも、かなり使わせていただいます。NY全てですが、下手に日系のホテルに泊まるよりは、自分はこのホテルのような雰囲気が好きです。

title: Parfait
text: Hôtel idéalement situé en plein coeur de Time Square mais dans une rue calme, personnel très sympathique, petit déjeuner continental très correct et gratuit avec fruits frais, viennoiseries, plusieurs types de pains, wifi gratuit, notre chambre était parfaite également pour notre court séjour de 4 nuits.

title: Tolles Hotel in zentraler Lage
text: Das Hotel liegt sehr zentral direkt neben dem Time Square. Trotzdem ist es ruhig. Die Zimmer sind sauber & eher klein, aber für einen kurzen Aufenthalt top. Das Frühstück ist gut & das Personal freundlich und hilfsbereit. Wir können das Hotel sehr empfehlen!

title: RECOMENDO COM LOUVOR !
text:
Fiquei num quarto com 2 camas queen ( para mim, meu marido, filha e neta). 
O quarto era amplo com anti-sala e um banheiro enorme.  Na anti sala havia, sofá, frigobar,microondas e também tv. Foi maravilhoso, principalmente pela quantidade de pessoas no mesmo quarto. ( Ninguém sentiu falta de espaço) Para mim foi uma experiencia inédita e muita agradável .Sempre viajo para NY (estive em abril de 2016) e nunca havia me hospedado no The Pearl - RECOMENDO COM LOUVOR

title: Great location to Broadway shows and clean hotel
text: I would not normally stay down near Times Square because it is chaos and loud.  This hotel is a charming little hidden gem near all the Broadway shows and Times Square if that is what you are going to see/do.  The hotel is clean and has a tiny gym w/ a few cardio machines.  They offer continental breakfast in the morning.  The front desk staff was very helpful overall.   There is a little grocery store around the corner so you can go stock up on snacks and waters for your room if you are there a few days. I chose a room with a small balcony even though I hardly ever used it!  If you want fresh air and want to hear the noise of the city at its best-you can get the balcony rooms.

title: Excellent hotel in the city.
text: Very surprised by this spacious hotel in the city. We were met by friendly staff and got an upgrade upon arrival. The other thing that was surprising for the city was the quietness of the room. The hotel is in the theater district close to everything. The only thing not impressive was the breakfast. I suppose if you like the continental breakfast foods it's ok, but we like a hearty breakfast. They should have the breakfast as an option.

title: Great Hotel!!!  Great staff!!
text: Unforeseen circumstances, resulted in having to take the kids to New York, not realizing that a New York fire code restricted us from being in the original room reserved.  The staff and in particular Darren, the Hotel Manager, went out of their way to accommodate us and provided a different room.  Great staff!  Great hotel!  Will definitely stay there again!

title: Very welcoming
text: Our trip to New York has been amazing to say the least. Everyone at The Pearl has been very friendly and helpful with directions. Rooms are spacious and clean and the continental breakfast is also top notch. William the doorman is wonderfully funny and friendly. When we visit the Big Apple again we will definitely be staying here again.

title: Great Hotel!
text: This hotel has good location in the heart of NYC. The staff is friendly. We were there during Christmas time and the hotel was decorated very tastefully. We love the included breakfast. We would give this hotel 5 stars rating but they need to improve the stinginess of wine that they serve during 4 o'clock wine and cheese. Whoever pour the wine really didn't want to give the wine, our glass was filled only 1/8 of the glass (almost thought we were only allowed to smell the wine).

title: Honeympon
text:
We thoroughly enjoyed staying at the pearl hotel for our honeymoon. On arrival we were greeted pleasantly and warmly welcomed by the staff. Nothing was too much trouble and they were always happy to help. We mentioned before the trip we were coming on honeymoon and they unexpectedly ungraded up to a larger room and gave us a bottle of chilled prosecco on arrival. On the final evening we ate in the hotel restaurant (directly next door) and had a lovely meal - the food was very tasty indeed and would highly recommend. 

The door staff were very pleasant and friendly. Everything is run very efficiently and the location is excellent - only a stones throw away from Times Square and other attractions. 

We wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel and if we returned to New York we would certainly be staying here.

5 star indeed. 

Mr and Mrs Richardson - UK

title: Clean, Quiet, and Spacious room in NYC
text: We did a mini-trip July 2016 with a 12 year old child. At The Pearl Hotel you are steps away from Times Square but you would never know it.  The standard rates maybe higher but well worth the extra dollars. This property is clean, quiet and has spacious rooms for NYC. Breakfast includes typical continental breakfast fare. While coffee, tea and lemon water is available all day.  For the wine social in the evening they offer both red and white wines with a cheese, fruit and veggie tray.

title: מלון בוטיק איכותי בטיימס סקוור
text: איזה כיף של מלון. מלון חדיש, נקי, מסודר ואיכותי. נמצא מרחק של 20 מטר מהטיימס סקוור, בפינה שקטה. מדובר במלון בוטיק של ממש. אני מגיע למלון הזה בפעם השנייה ולא מתאכזב. הפעם הגענו משפחה כולל שלושה ילדים. החדר מרווח, נעים, נקי ומתוחזק. הצוות מוכן לעזור בכל פניה ובעייה. ממליץ בחום על המלון הזה. ארוחת בוקר נעימה. ממוקם על הטיימס סקוור ובקרבה של דקה מתחנת התחתית. שווה כל דולר!!!!

title: Nice, but a little disappointing
text: The hotel staff. to a person, were the friendliest I've ever encountered.  Facility was very nice, but a drop disappointing.  We were unable to use the TV, and it took multiple visits by a number of staff to finally fix the problem.  In addition, we received complimentary breakfasts, but, for a hotel of this esteem, the breakfast offering was, at best, mediocre in terms of the quality and variety of food.  Also, the beds were very uncomfortable.

title: Only location.
text:
Hotel is on a great location if you like to be in the middle of a lot of people and very close to Times square. Times square is just around the corner. But if you want to see real New York go to Greenwich village or maybe upper east or west side.
Considering hotel, rooms are ok in size but very dark, there is no daylight in the room. Air conditioner was very loud. Room was clean, housekeeping cleaned every day,clean towels. Bathroom was small. Breakfast was terrible, this was the worst breakfast ever in any hotel I've ever been in. Lack of choice!They serve bagels, tost, cereals, coffe machine, milk (and if you come after 9am there is no milk, no refills),sweet croissants, boiled eggs which don't taste good. No cheese, nothing.Very disappointing!! Overall not worth the money. Too expensive for that kind of service. For the last 3-4 days we even didn't go to breakfast because you just can't eat that every morning. And the place were breakfast is served is definitely not adequate for breakfast. 
P.S. don't take the room on the second floor.
one more thing, our room was on 9th floor and next door was room of housekeeping, omg, constant door banging. You can here everything in rooms. Poor value for money!

title: Excelente atención, servicio y ubicación
text:
Muy serviciales siempre, fuimos en familia con 3 niños y me facilitaron pedidos especiales para desayunar y por la tarde ofrecen un happy hour de wine, cheese and fruit muy conveniente sobre todo en verano. Siempre que uno llega al hotel lo espera una jarra de agua fresca con snacks y fruta. 
En el primer nivel los huéspedes tienen servicio de cafe/te permanente. 
Las habitaciones muy cómodas, limpias y bien equipadas
El personal muy amable y según tu inquietud te asesoran para ahorrar en tus visitas. 
En cuanto a la ubicación es fantastica en medio de todo y a pocos metros de Broadway donde siempre hay gente a cualquier hora del dia. 
Volveriamos sin dudarlo

title: Perfect stay at The Pearl Hotel.
text: Excellent stay at The Pearl Hotel. Room was nice and the staff very friendly and helpful. Having breakfast included was great with plenty to choose from. Perfect location in the heart of Broadway but was nice and quiet too. Easy walking to Times Square and Central Park. Also able to walk into Hell Kitchen where there are lots of nice restaurants to choose from.

title: Ottimo hotel a New York
text:
Consiglio vivamente questo Hotel!!!
Personale gentilissimo, camere grandi con ogni tipo di comfort. Al secondo piano la mattina viene offerta la colazione con cornetti, paste di vario tipo, frutta e pane con marmellata. Scordatevi un caffè all'italiana ma è nello standard di New York. 
Ci tornerò sicuramente anche perché a due passi due da Times Square.

title: Hotel tres bien en plein coeur de NYC
text:
Nous sommes déjà allé plusieurs fois à NYC et le Pearl Hotel est de loin le meilleur qu'on ait jamais eu. Situé à proximité de time square, avec métro à la 49th et 50th : idéal au niveau des accés. 

Chambres parfaites, propreté parfaite, petit dej parfait. 

Et pour les français ne maitrisant pas bien la langue, il y a Mourad , portier de l'hôtel qui parle tres bien français, et qui est trés gentil et aidant. 

Bref : une adresse indispensable.

title: Good Hotel , Great Location.
text:
This is a very good small hotel in the heart of theatre land a few minutes walk from Times Square. It is not cheap but we were upgraded to a larger suite on arrival. This was an excellent room on the 12th floor well away from any noise below with effective air conditioning which we needed in the sweltering heat of New York.
Room included a continental breakfast which was generally very good and we never had any problems finding a seat. There was complimentary cheese and wine on offer from 4-5pm and we took advantage of this also.
Staff were great, very helpful and accommodating and we would certainly recommend The pearl for its position and overall very good service.

title: Location!!!
text:
If you want to stay in somewhere in the heart of NYC then this is your place. The rooms are a great size and the continental breakfast was not huge, but certainly sufficient. 
I found this place by literally walking around NYC on google maps, and I'm so glad I stumbled upon it not one travel agent in Australia knew about it or recommended it, despite great reviews on all forums. 
It is opposite the theatre and around the corner from Times Square. 
It was a great place to stay in our first time to the big apple.
We loved it!!!

title: Great service, but gaps remain
text:
We stayed at the Pearl recently during a New York heat wave.  We chose the Pearl from its rave reviews, but were aware from some of the comments about it failings.  From our point of view, what worked without question was the service - from the moment we arrived at the hotel to checkout.  The team were a delight to communicate with.  What did not work though were as follows:
- the breakfast, while adequate, was always crowded, tough to find a seat, and frankly everything being on disposable plastic plates was not up to standard.  The availability of certain food (muffins) and beverages (earl grey tea) was hit and miss
- the noise - yes, it is a noisy hotel, and we were not staying by the lift.  Our room did overlook another buildings a/c unit which we could hear (windows need better sound proofing) but even our own a/c unit was noisy and intermittent and the fridge had a high pitched squeal when it turned itself on
- room service was patchy. On our last day the room was not serviced until late, and then no towels were left for us.
In summary, great location, great service, but needs work

title: Fabulous hotel in the heart of the city
text: I stayed at this hotel with my mom over a long weekend in May. It was amazing! The room was clean and spacious even, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom had a huge shower and even a tv in it. Impeccable. We had free wifi in our rooms. Breakfast was free and pretty decent, as well as afternoon cheese and wine. Very cool! It's located in the center of things - right at Times Square so everything was super close and easy to walk to. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

title: Beautiful
text:
Stayed at the Pearl New York Times Square from 17 - 22December 2015. 
Beautiful hotel, lovely hotel staff and immaculately kept. 
Read all previous reviews on here and I must say this hotel is perfect and well worth the premium. 
Bed was comfy and had a perfect nights sleep. 
I proposed to my partner whilst in New York and the hotel staff gave us complimentary prosecco and flowers. 
Highly recommended this hotel and can't wait till our next stay. 
Thanks again, Paul.

title: חויית שהייה נהדרת.
text:
מיקום מצוין. שרות מעולה. יחס חם וסבלנות מצד אנשי הצוות.
חדרים מרווחים ונקיים.כל אמצעי התחבורה במרחק הליכה של 5 דקות.קפה ותה חופשי כל היום. ארוחת בוקר קונטיננטלית,מיותר לשלם על ארוחת הבוקר.
בסך הכל תמורה מלאה לכסף.

title: nice one
text: it was a short stay, and we really enjoined it. everything is clean and luxury. If you like wine, i think you can have it free on happy hours time. went with two babies, and felt comfortable. we will definitely come back.

title: The Pearl shines as Advertised
text:
After extensive research, we settled on staying at the Pearl during a recent trip to NYC and we were not disappointed.  To start, the location is perfect!  You're a 1/2 block off Broadway Ave with theaters on 2 of 3 sides.  So, short walk to Times Square, hundreds of restaurants, Broadway shows, the Rockefeller Center and even Central Park.  This is a boutique hotel, so there's only about 10-12 rooms per floor, but 14 floors provide plenty of room options.  So, while overall a small boutique hotel, this property is not short on amenities.  Along with the location, the other attraction for us was all the perks and the Pearl delivered.  Just try to find another Times Square hotel with great location, plus free breakfast, free Wi-Fi, fitness center, concierge, door man, valet or self parking next door, free fruit/water in lobby 24/7, free wine hour every night, robes, name brand toiletries and the list goes on.  While you pay a decent price to stay here, you do at least get treated well and get something in return.  Although very small, also note that there is a restaurant (steakhouse) right next door that serves lunch/ dinner and also provides room service to the hotel.  

The rooms themselves were fairly spacious for a downtown hotel.  The bathrooms were very nicely appointed with dark wood and granite/  marble.  The beds were comfortable with in-room irons and safe.  Flat screen TVs in the room and bathroom.  The only thing missing was a mini-fridge/ bar.  I'm very, very particular about cleanness and the room and whole hotel were near spotless.  Very impressive and very clean.  Kudos to the cleaning staff.  I was also impressed at how quiet the room was and the overall hotel.  We slept very peacefully every night.  

Last, but not least, the service was also excellent from the entire staff, from front desk, to in-room services to doorman.  Everyone was very friendly and helpful.  You can't go wrong staying at the Pearl.

title: Great hotel in great location!
text: My husband and I have stayed at The Pearl Hotel on several occasions. We can always count on clean rooms, a comfortable stay and great service. The complimentary breakfast is pretty simple (yogurt, pastries, cereal, juice, etc.) The location is perfect for walking to Broadway and Times Square.

title: Great Place To Stay In Midtown
text: The Pearl has already received great ratings from guests - in fact, that is why I decided to give the hotel a try.  The location on 49th Street between 7th and 8th Avenue, is perfect - near the theaters and the many activities in and around Time Square.  The hotel is modern and clean - with helpful, friendly staff.  I highly recommend the Pearl as a great place to stay in New York.  It won my future business!

title: Great, peaceful, comfortable stay
text: What a great place to stay. From the moment we walked through the door, everyone was very nice. Great location to the theater district and Times Square but on a quite section of street. Beds were comfortable, room was spacious as was the bathroom. We were told the hotel was completely gone through 6 years so everything is nice and new. Complementary wine and cheese hour and breakfast. Highly recommended by us. Thanks GW

title: Honey moon nella città che non dorme mai
text: Io e mia moglie abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel dal 30 maggio al 5 giugno (pernottamaneto + colazione) per il nostro viaggio di nozze. La posizione è centralissima, a due passi da Times Square; non c'è una vista interessante dalle finestre, ma a parte questo la struttura è elegante, la stanza è molto confortevole ed ampia, dotata di tutti i comfort; il bagno è pulito e la doccia fantastica. Buona la colazione con ampia scelta di dolci. Il personale si è dimostrato sempre molto gentile ed attento ad ogni esigenza.

title: One of the best hotels I have ever stayed
text:
The Pearl went out of its way to take care of ever need. When we booked they said we could only get a king bed. I called ahead and requested 2 beds. When we got there we got 2 beds. We asked about restaurants we could walk to, they suggested several with in 1 block. They advised us if you should take a cab or uber. 
They had a wonderful continental breakfast and 4-5 they had wine and snacks.  It was 1 block from Time Square. I would go back.

title: Excelente ubicacion de un muy buen hotel
text: En nuestras vacaciones en NY nos alojamos en este hotel del centro de Manhattan. Lo primero decir que la ubicacion es excelente, al lado de Times Square, de los teatros de Broadway y de la mayoria de atracciones turisticas del Midtown. Hotel elegante, con muy buena y cordial atencion. Habitaciones amplias y muy bonita, aunque nuestras vistas no fueron las mejores. El alojamiento incluye un desayuno, bastante basico eso si y un happy hour de 4 a 5.Dispone de un pequeño gimnasio. En fin, hotel muy recomendable para disfrutar de esta gran ciudad

title: Excellent location, Easy to get to via subway. Clean.
text:
This hotel is in midtown manhattan within 5 mins of times square, 10 mins to central park and near to enough subway lines that you can get to any part of manhattan or JFK airport very easily. Our room was quite large and clean with a comfy bed with full ironing board, decent hair dryer, nice bathroom and plenty of storage. There was a free wine and cheese hour between 4-5pm which is nice in a city that is pretty expensive. The breakfast was only ok. There were only 4 cereals; three of which were sugar based, the other bran and raisan cereal was poor. Bagels and pastries were fine, fruit cocktail wasn't great and the juices were not freshly squeezed.

How to get here from JFK airport.
Take skytrain from JFK to Jamaica (red line)(20 mins). Then take E subway to Wall street and get off at 50th St station (30-45 mins). When you come out of the subway, look for 8 avenue, go left on 8 ave then another left and pearl hotel on your left. If you end up on broadway, take a right and another right and the hotel will be on your right. Once you figure it out it is very easy to find your hotel. Midtown manhattan is the easiest part of the city to find your way around.

title: Très bien!
text: Nous avons passé une semaine dans cet hôtel en famille. Idéalement placé au centre de Time square, silencieux, propre, accueillant! L'équipe est absolument adorable, jusqu'aux portiers qui sont vraiment géniaux!! Très bon rapport qualité prix, petit dej compris! Nous avons adoré!!

title: Great hotel
text: Stayed at The Pearl for 4 nights and had the best time. The hotel could not be in a better location as it is near most of the popular tourist sites such as Times Square, central park, Rockefeller Centre etc. There is also a subway/underground station nearby. The staff were really helpful and so friendly. The breakfast was good and the rooms were clean and well equipped. I will be recommending this hotel to my friends and family in the future! They even gave us a free bottle of wine as they knew it was my birthday!

title: I love it it should be a 5 star hotel !!
text:
We came here for a short break with my family. It was a great location just off Times Square so no noise. Nice rooms it just fitted our 4 member family with a convenient sofa bed. And the staff are very helpful. Great that we got a free breakfast! 

I love this hotel and it is the best in New York !

title: Pleasantly Surprised
text: I booked this hotel 2 days before our travel. Though it wasn't as reasonably priced as I would have wanted, I still felt like it was a good price for the location. So once we pulled up to the hotel and we were greeted by a gentlemen who took our bags and offered to valet our car. We walked to the front desk and was promptlychecked in by Christian, Why being checked in, the other staff talked and joked with us. Within 5 mins we were done. We headed to our room to find a modernly decorated room. It was clean and very spacious for a hotel in the city. The location was AWESOME!!! we were 5 blocks from Time Square and we were surrounded by tons of restaurants and shops.

title: There are so many to choose from - You've got to pick one
text: We were looking for a midrange priced hotel and the NY choices are infinite, but we think we got what we expected. This 49th street location between 7th and 8th is ideally located for walking distance to most shows and Times Square and just half a block to both the red and blue subway line for up or downtown. It's has reasonable proximity to Central Park South for that all important walk or ride in the park so we were very happy with our decision for the weeks stay in the big apple. Rooms are spacious, clean and well serviced, while the front deck is very helpful and friendly. We ate out, walking to the many local restaurants so we didn't experience dinning in, thank you "The Pearl".

title: Great location.
text: Small boutique hotel, stones throw from time square and two minute walk to subway. Quiet oasis from the noise and crowds. Double room was fine, well appointed and clean , may be a little on small side compared to normal US double rooms. Shower over bath. Continental breakfast included , adequate but very limited and served with disposable plates.  Staff ok , some friendly some surly ( in typical New Yorker fashion ) .

title: Excellent service!!  Lovely hotel!
text:
My husband and I stayed at The Pearl Hotel from July 11th through July 16th.  We initially booked a queen room and requested a high floor.  We were placed in room 1401.  Unfortunately the elevator is located right against the room.  We listened to the elevator rise and descend all night long (even with ear plugs in).  We asked for a different room first thing in the morning.  They immediately took care of the situation and upgraded us to a King Suite - room 1204.  They also supplied us with a bottle of champagne and a lovely card as we were celebrating our anniversary.  

The room and bathroom was very spacious considering this is a NYC hotel.  The hotel is near Times Square and can be a bit noisy.  We recommend ear plugs which are supplied upon request.  The bathroom was a decent size and the shower was amazing! The room had a Keurig which was a nice touch as well.  The hotel provides a bottle of water in the room however they charge $8.00.  I chose to get a bottle of water from the vending machine instead.

The continental breakfast was just ok.  We were expecting a hot breakfast however they supplied a large variety of bagels, pastries and cereals - and more.  The coffee was good.  Plenty of seating.  We never had an opportunity to attend the happy hour as it was only 4 to 5 p.m.  I am sure it would have been nice.

The staff was very nice and accommodating.  Upon arrival, (7:00 pm) we asked about local restaurants for a nice steak.  They recommended Gallagher's which was only a few blocks away and made reservations for us immediately.  Anything we needed, they were there to accommodate.  Housekeeping did a fabulous job daily.  They do not supply many towels however if you request additional, they will attend to every need.

The prices were very reasonable and the location is perfect!  We would highly recommend and plan on staying here again during our next visit.

title: Superb hotel.
text: Fantastic location to base your holiday from. Staff very accommodating and friendly. Excellent breakfast and wine hour from 4-5 with snacks. Very clean and good size rooms. Close to subway and Times Square. The staff at the hotel went over and above to make our stay special. Many thanks.

title: We loved the pearl!
text: We booked this stay last minute and I was nervous about knowing little to nothing about the hotel but I was not disappointed. The gentleman at the front desk, Christian I think was his name, was wonderful. We were a little early checking in and he offered to store the bags while we walked around and grabbed some food. He upgraded us as well, the room was immaculate and spacious. The restaurant downstairs is good as well perfect for some apps and a few drinks. We will be back again.

title: Comfortable Hotel steps away from the lights of Times Square
text: We enjoyed our stay at The Pearl for our daughter's 16th birthday. The room was standard size for NYC. There was a long hallway before entering the main part of the room with a nice sized closet. The room had a mini fridge (not stocked), coffee station and an in-room safe. The beds were comfortable and we were not bothered by much street noise even though our room looked directly upon the Eugene O'Neill Theater where the Book of Mormon is playing. It did offer some good people watching. The theater that is playing Chicago is only a couple of doors away so the location of this hotel is the biggest draw. There is a nightly snack/wine hour as well as a daily breakfast. We found both to be very basic and after the first time, not so appealing. We did, however, enjoy the bowl of fruit and the carafe of water that was kept in the lobby. The front desk staff and doorman were always pleasant and helpful with anything we requested. I thought it was a bit pricey for the quality of food that was served but I suppose, as I said before, the location is perfect to catch many shows and the buzz of Times Square.

title: Excelente hotel y experiencia
text:
Un hotel muy bien ubicado y muy buen servicio.  Relajado total. 
Piezas limpias comodas,  buenos baños
Proveen desayuno,  liviano pero suficiente.  Frutas,  cereales,  pan,  facturas,  yogurt,  plátanos y manzanas
Las 24hrs, cafe y té.  De 4 a 5 cheese and wine.  El personal ayuda en todo. 
Recomendable 100%. espero volver algún día

title: Schitterende lokatie, acceptabel ontbijt
text:
Het Pearl Hotel ligt op (5 minuten) wandelafstand van Time Square en het Rockefeller Center. Wij huurden twee kamers (een suite voor 4 personen, een kamer voor twee personen) aan de voorkant op de vierde verdieping. We hadden geen last van lawaaihinder van buiten. De kamers waren ruim en netjes onderhouden, met een safe en een goed badkamer (goed werkende en goed afgesloten douche), de WC was in de badkamer. Het personeel aan de receptie was heel vriendelijk en behulpzaam.

Het ontbijt 's morgens was onder de buffetvorm met zelfbediening (ook zelf afruimen). Het aanbod was OK (lekker verse fruitsalade). Het bestek was wel van plastiek (toch wat minnetjes voor dergelijk hotel) en het duurde wel even voor bepaalde items (vb. toastbrood, confituur) opnieuw werden aangevuld. Hier is wat ruimte voor beterschap.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text:
People this is a fantastic hotel....Location...location...location so so close to Time Square, the hotel looked as though it had recently been refurbished. The rooms are fresh and of a good size (which is rare in NY). The beds were super comfy....
The staff are wonderful, ALWAYS so helpful and pleasant . It was really nice that no matter what time of the day or night you came into the hotel you were always greeted....That is rare let me tell you.
The breakfast was continental but thee was plenty to choose from, yogurt, pastries, toast, cereal, tea, coffee. Thank you The Pearl Hotel, I will be back and I'll be sending my clients.....

title: Stellar experience!
text: Booked the Pearl due to location and the other reviews on TripAdvisor and I was not disappointed. Super clean, super QUIET even though it's right in the thick of things. Times Square and Broadway were just a quick walk, as was Rockefeller Center. Breakfast was great, I never made it to the wine/cheese reception. Nice folks at the desk, door, and management. Did have some trouble with the cable a few times but they tried to get it up and running quickly (it's the cable company, not them). They even surprised me with a bottle of wine, two glasses, and a nice card on my birthday -- and I didn't even tell them it was my birthday! Beds were super comfy, the room is huge, the bathroom is huge and even has a TV in it -- what??! If I ever have the chance to visit NYC again I will absolutely stay here! Thank you for a great week's stay.

title: Great location, fantastic customer service
text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel just last week for our 10th year anniversary and from the moment we stepped into the hotel, we were greeted with such warm welcome (after a long flight and were exhausted). The bellmen were all friendly and helpful, hotel staffs were attentive and when they heard it was our anniversary, they upgraded our bedroom and also sent someone to bring us a bottle of champagne that afternoon we arrived. Everyday when we came back from sightseeing, we found chocolates on our bed, on my side, and the husband's side. This hotel is amazing and we can't thank them enough for having made us feel very special and that our stay in the city was a wonderful one. Our flight home was not until late afternoon so even though we still had to check out at noon, they had no problem in storing our luggages until it was time for us to leave for the airport. The location was great, the room was big and clean, we definitely will stay here again if we get the opportunity to visit New York in the future. Thank you The Pearl for your hospitality. If only all places provide that spectacular customer service like yours.

title: A Great Hotel in The Theater District!
text: My wife and I needed a NYC hotel for an event in the city that we were attending this past weekend. We love boutique hotels, and after reading other reviews, took a chance on the Pearl. We were completely taken by this hotel's charm. The room we had was large and very comfortable, you would never know you were in the middle of Manhattan because it was so quiet, and the continental breakfast they served was perfect. The room rate was astonishingly reasonable for the location. We would not hesitate to book here again if we need a mid-town hotel room. It was perfect for us!

title: Brilliant location and quiet
text: Stayed 6 nights and have nothing bad to say about the hotel.  Location is next to Chicago and opposite House of Mormons shows  literally minutes from the main stretch of Times Square.   The breakfast plentiful with fresh fruit, bagels, cakes, cereals etc enough to start the day off.  The hotel is modern and very comfortable.  Room had a microwave and fridge although beware of the 8Euros for the water! The bed was very comfortable and the room spotlessly clean. A good choice. Check out Lillie's a few doors.

title: Great hotel in a good location.
text:
We recently spent 5 nights at The Pearl Hotel, New York and am very pleased to report that it is every bit as good as previous reviews have stated. We were initially assigned a room at the rear on the 12th floor, which was lovely but unfortunately suffered from noise at night from an adjacent roof top air conditioning fan. The next morning we were immediately changed to another room, which was equally as nice and a lot quieter. The hotel staff were all very nice and attentive and nothing was too much trouble. 
The continental breakfast offered on the second floor was also very nice with cereal, pastries and fruit etc on offer and set one up for the day ahead. The hotel location is excellent for central Manhattan, just a few blocks from Times Square and Central Park. I can thoroughly recommend this as a very good hotel for anyone visiting NY. You will not be disappointed. Well done to everyone at The Pearl Hotel.

title: Little Gem in a middle of buzzling NYC
text: Well maintained small (ish ) hotel in the walking distance from the Time square. Very clean and excellent, friendly staff always ready to answer any enquiries. We stayed king room which was looking over the street. It was very comfortable and the bed fab briliant. Higher floor recommended if you are lighter sleeper (like me) however the area is failry quiet if you compare The time square. The hotel offers a continental breakfast that is included during your stay. It was lovely. I can't fault it as I would not eat greasy breakfast anyway. All restaurants and little grocery stores nearby. Also its middle of Broadway so handly if you ar interested in any shows. Also very near 5th ave and the Rock. Enjoyed every minute of our stay.

title: Good hotel central location
text:
Me and my husband stayed here for 3nights in June. The room was a good size and was equipped with a microwave and a fridge. The bathroom was also a good size. The room also had a free safe.
Location is one of the big selling points for the hotel one block away from Times square. Personally I didn't like Times square as was far too touristy and busy if I returned I would pick another area to stay.
The breakfast was lovely and got us off to a good start for busy days sightseeing. 
The staff on reception were always friendly to us. 
We were never in the hotel to try the cheese and wine hour but again little touches like this go a long way.
We didn't have any complaints about this hotel during our stay.If you want a good location then this is a good choice with many sights within walking distance.

title: Perle
text:
Dieses Hotel kann ich nur empfehlen!
Perfekte Lage, mitten im Zentrum. Zwei Minuten zu Fuss zum Times Square! Unzählige andere Sehenswürdigkeiten zu Fuss ereichbar. Enorm nettes und zuvorkommendes Personal. Wir hatten ein sehr geräumiges Zimmer auf dem 14. Stock und somit kaum Strassenlärm. Das Frühstücksbuffet ist für europäische Verhältnisse eher mager, aber in NY ist es so üblich. Es hat verschiedene Bagels, Süssgebäck, Cerealien, frische Früchte, Yoghurt, Kaffee und Tee. Also alles was man braucht. Zwischendurch kann man sich immer mit kleinen Snaks und Getränken verpflegen. HAMMER!!!

title: The best stay I've ever had in ANY hotel by far!!!!
text:
I've never been so blown away by the service, cleanliness, size, and functionality  of a hotel before. The Pearl was beyond words INCREDIBLE.
Upon arriving Azi welcomed us and asked us the nature of our trip. Saying it was our anniversary he immediately upgraded us to a deluxe King suite and sent up wine and sparkling cider (I'm 7 months pregnant) as a surprise. They accommodated an early check in no problem. Our room was HUGE. It was modern and beautiful. We had a lovely view of the theatre across playing jersey boys. Keurig machine in the room, TV in the bathroom, gorgeous huge stand up shower, L'occitane products, robes, slippers, umbrella, fridge and microwave. The bed was huge and incredibly comfortable. 
The lobby has fruit, snacks and fruit infused water 24hrs a day. Wine, fruit and cheese from 4-5 and an incredible continental breakfast from 7-10 everyday. The hotel was around the corner from times square but remarkably quiet. It was the PERFECT location. A walk from everything! The staff was always smiling, always greeted us, and was so very attentive. 
I'm the manager of one of downtown Toronto's busiest restaurants/bars and usually am quite aware of service in any form of hospitality and I have never been so impressed. We've already recommended it to several friends and will only stay here when in nyc. 
If I could I'd give it 10/5. Thank you for such a wonderful time!!!

title: Great place to stay
text: Great hotel, the rooms were nice and clean and they are reasonably pricd for NYC. Great location, it was right around the corner from times square. The staff was really helpful and polite. My girlfriend and I enjoyed our stay here and will definitely stay here again.

title: Boa localização
text:
O hotel e pequeno, agradável, tem uma sala de musculação , um café da manha muito simples e para quem adora comer quando acorda chega a perder o apetite.
Tem também um happy Hour no fim da tarde. E mediano

title: A very enjoyable stay at the Pearl New York
text: We recently enjoyed a 6 night break at The Pearl New York. How pleased we were that we found this gem of a hotel. The location is perfect if you want to be in the centre of Manhattan, near to Times Square and the Theatre District. However, the hotel is situated on a side street which gives you the impression that you are on the outskirts of the action without the frenzy and constant noise found in Times Square. The rooms are soundproofed which is wonderful for a peaceful night's sleep. Housekeeping is excellent and all the hotel staff were very helpful throughout our stay. A light buffet breakfast is available free of charge and, although some guests have complained about the quality and amount in their reviews, I think they are expecting far too much! Breakfast consists of a selection of cereals, fruit, croissants, pastries, bagels, spreads, juices, tea, coffee. All are help yourself so what is there to complain about???? It was fine. There is a luggage storage room available and the deposit and collection service was very professional. I can thoroughly recommend The Pearl and would definitely stay there again.

title: Makes visiting New York so much easier...
text:
The location of the hotel is good, given that it's close to Times Square and Central Park, but this does mean that sometimes your sleep is disrupted. Our room was on the fourth floor and I often got kept awake and woken up by horns beeping on the street below, however my sister who I shared a room with and my parents who had a room on the eight floor found no issue, so maybe if you're a light sleeper request a room on a higher floor!

My favourite thing about this hotel was level two. Here you could make tea, coffee, hot chocolate and all kinds of herbal tea. There were also crisps and biscuits available to just take, and apples and fruit flavoured water for the healthier people. All this provided such a nice welcome back to the hotel after a long day out sightseeing - we used to stop off in the lift at level two and get ourselves goodies to take back to our room and refill before heading out for the evening! This is also where breakfast is served, which was included in the room, a great selection of pastries, bagels, toast, cereal and fruit - plenty to fill you up and it was never massively busy so there was always somewhere to sit.

The beds were super comfy, and Hershey's chocolates were left on our pillows each night. We were lucky to be upgraded to a suite due to a mix up with the rooms when we arrived, this was very spacious, with two double beds and a separate area with a sofa and tv. The bathroom had a bath and a shower and was very clean and modern, and all the toiletries provided were good quality.

I did make use of the gym one day. It's quite small and doesn't have very much equipment, but I can't see it ever getting that busy. 

Overall I'd really recommend this hotel, it has a warm and welcoming feeling and the location is good.

title: A Pearl indeed
text: The Pearl is choice small hotel in the heart of the Theatre District.  In a quiet way it gets just about everything right.  Vaguely modern and stylish, the Pearl is handsome in a relaxed way, not aggressively cool.  No glitter, no brass, nothing shiny, not much color.  The short halls are agreeably dim.  Terrazzo floors lend dignity to the lobby and elevator.  Amenities include an extra pillow and umbrella in the closet, free snacks in the lobby, and a free bottle of water in the room (not needed, NYC tap water is delicious).  Our room had a microwave and an extra sink by the fridge.  The room was quiet and the a/c controls were intuitive.  There's no card urging you minimize the hotel's laundry expenses on the pretext of environmental sensitivity.  Our room was relatively spacious--a bit tight by American standards, ample compared to London or Paris.  Hearing foreign languages in the elevator I felt good about America.  Although the Pearl is not a "luxury" hotel, what greater luxuries are there than modesty, dignity, discretion, and good taste?  If you like the Pearl you'll probably want to leave the neighborhood at least once for dinner.  Try Boulud Sud or the Atlantic Grill, both near Lincoln Center, 2 subway stops away (there's a station on the corner) or a 20 minute stroll.  Not cheap but very good. Reservations advisable.

title: What a Gem in the middle of Theatre District
text:
We were recommended this hotel for our first visit to NY. We did have some reservations but they were very quickly removed. Nothing but praise for the staff and they are happy to answer all your questions as well as offer assistance when required. It is excellently located to the theatres in Broadway but more importantly the location to the metro stations gives you multiple options to travel up and downtown. The rooms are spacious and well equipped and super clean. The free breakfast which comprises of toast , pastries , cereals, bagels, coffee and tea plus fruit it a great asset in that you don't need to leave and search for breakfast in the mornings before you start you daily travels around the city.
Being a small establishment makes it more beneficial to you as a guest and this does differentiate it from the larger chain hotels.
I can highly recommend this hotel for any length of stay and I am sure that you will find it charming, comfortable and accommodating as we did. 
Highly recommended.

title: great location very disappointing breakfast
text: very well situated for sightseeing around midtown and in heart of broadway theatre district. We were upgraded to twin queen bed rooms which were comfortable and quiet. The major disappointment was the continental breakfast. The selection was very limited, largely just bagels, muffins and pastries. But it was served on plastic disposable plates and bowls a la budget motel standard. That said the free snacks and cheese and wine hour were nice touches. The reception staff were very friendly & helpful but the overall decor was drab and brown tinged. The other reviews had raised our expectations.

title: Very nice hotel in a convenient spot in Times Square area
text: This was a spur of the moment move from another hotel where we were.  It cost double what it usually did, but oh well.  The property is well cared for.  It's only about 5 years old. The lobby is very small, but functional.  We had a noisy air conditioner problem when we checked in, so they moved us.  If you try to check in early, even if the room is ready, there is a $80 fee.  I thought that was ridiculous. But, hey, it's NYC. There were little things in our room that needed attention, throughout our stay, one light bulb in a desk lamp and one over the vanity. The evening wine/cheese hour is average at best. The breakfast is also what you would expect. No waffle machine, only bagels, pastries, cereal, hard boiled eggs, juice and coffee. the rooms were very quiet and there were black out curtains.  The staff were very friendly. I would stay here again, but only if I could get a good deal.  They do have transportation to the airport for a reasonable fee. There was a small kitchenette area with a microwave and fridge and Keurig coffee maker. Only a block from the subway and Times Square.

title: What a Great Find!
text: A great hotel in a fantastic location. The staff is friendly and helpful, the afternoon snacks much appreciated and the rooms quite large by New York standards. Being right in the heart of Times Square, it's also surprisingly quiet. Highly recommend.

title: The best hotel in NYC
text:
The Pearl hotel is a luxury boutique hotel.
Its location is great, it's staff is superb.
The manager- Georgia will do above and byond to keep you smiling.
Finally a hotel with spacious rooms, modern design, fully equipped, you may reserve a room with a balcony as well!
Breakfast is good, you always have a supply of drinking water and snacks at the lobby. You also have a cheese and wine hour at the afternoon.
Enjoy,
E.

title: Perfect place to stay
text:
Stayed here with my wife in May and cannot fault the hotel at all.  Very centrally situated just off Times Square.  Was pleasantly surprised to be upgraded on arrival to a deluxe room after emailing the hotel beforehand to let them know the stay was for a special occasion.  The room was large, comfortable with coffee machine, fridge and television.  The shower was fantastic with nice complimentary toiletries, bathrobe & slippers.  Wifi free throughout our stay
Breakfast served each day was ample, enough to gear you up for a busy day sightseeing and the complimentary wine, crackers, cheese & fruit at 4pm was a nice touch.  This was all served on plastic plates - this did not bother us at all, but did notice some other people leaving reviews did not like this.
All staff were very friendly and helpful.  
Would certainly stay here again and recommend this hotel to anyone coming to New York

title: Fantastic Hotel
text:
I am so pleased I booked the Pearl Hotel, the staff were very friendly & happy to help in any way they could. We also got up-graded when we checked in to a room with a kitchenette & fridge as well as 2 queen size beds. 
The hotel also offers free Wifi which you get the code for on your arrival, this made it easier for us to stay in contact with our family at home in the UK. 
This hotel offered continental breakfast every morning with no extra cost, there was a good choice of pastry's, bagels, toast & cereals available as well as juices & hot drinks.  Also available every day at 4pm was a complementary wine & cheese hour in the hotel dinning area which was lovely on the one occasion we managed to make it back in time to enjoy it. 
I would most defiantly book this hotel for future visits to New York, it as very close to Times Square & the theatre district with 2 theaters being in very close proximity to the hotel. Great Location to explore & enjoy New York, we mostly walked every where but also used the Subway on a few occasions to get us to places if attraction times booked in advance.

title: Superb Hotel, just a few minutes from Times Square
text:
Checked into the hotel for 3 nights as our first stop on 2016 holiday to the states. 

Was offered an upgrade at check in to a King Balcony room instead of Queen. $20 a night, and worth the extra. They allowed us to see both rooms before deciding. 

Rooms are very nice, comfortable and a reasonable size for NYC hotel. Well decorated, with clean and pleasant bathroom as well. 

Breakfast is a simple continental but is very very good. 

Staff were polite and attentive

title: Suverän vistelse
text:
Jättetrevlig personal, rent och fräscht, jättebra läge! God frukost. Rymliga och tysta rum.
Nära till teatrar, times square och central park. Hotellets transportservice var jättebra ut till flygplatsen. Litet men fräscht gym (löpband, lite vikter, trainer).

title: Anniversary
text: Loved everything about this hotel. The location was the best...walking distance to everything and a food emporium just a few steps away for access to bottled water, soft drinks etc.  The staff was friendly and always aiming to please. The beds were comfy and the rooms were clean. Continental breakfast and wine and cheese hour were a nice added bonus. Will definitely come back again. BTW, I picked hotel based on reviews and was worried my husband wouldn't like it; but he loved it too!

title: Loved staying at The Pearl
text: Wife and I stayed here for our 15th anniversary. Everything about the hotel was excellent. Outstanding service, very nice interior, great amenities and fabulous location. We were able to use Chase Ultimate Reward points to book which was a nice bonus. We stayed on the 11th floor and on the 10th floor there are some rooms with walk out terraces. We will definitely look to stay at The Pearl again and when we do we'll request one of the terrace rooms. Great experience!

title: Amazing stay in New York
text:
Arrived at the hotel to be greeted by happy, smiley faces at the front door & Reception. They offered us a room upgrade for free & waiting for me when we walked into our room was a Birthday card & bottle of wine! 

Room was perfect. Really good size. Clean. Comfortable. Quiet. Included a kitchenette with a fridge, sink, microwave & coffee maker. Lovely products in the bathroom too. And soft towels! 

Breakfast was good. Plenty of choice. Only went to the free wine & cheese hour once but glad we did as it was lovely. Nice to sit & chat with other couples & rest our feet for a bit! 

All the staff were very attentive, friendly & helpful. Doormen/Porters were stars. Always took the time to chat to them. Saw a few people completely ignore them, not even thanking them for opening the door. Rude!! 

The hotel is perfectly situated with Times Square, subway, theatres, restaurants, shops all literally just around the corner or down the street! Found our way around really easily. So much to do & see in Midtown. I'd done an itinerary before we went which was a life-saver. Not having to stress about what we were doing & how to get there etc each day enabled us to make the absolute most out of our 4 night stay. 

Did all the typical touristy stuff. We bought the New York City Pass & definitely got our money's worth. Would definitely recommend buying it. My personal favourites were "Top of the Rock" & watching "Les Miserables". Would recommend doing the "Landmark" boat trip with Circle Line Cruises & also walking the "High Line". So many amazing memories. 

Oh & comfy shoes are a must!! 

If you're looking for a small, modern, clean, friendly, boutique hotel - I would thoroughly recommend booking the Pearl. Enjoy!!

title: Fantastic hotel , great location .
text: Returned today from 5 days in NY , my first time there , went with a friend for our 40th birthdays . Extremely friendly , helpful staff nothing was too much trouble . Location is superb just round the corner from Time Sq but not affected by any noise what so ever . Comfortable room and spotlessly clean . We only had the breakfast once when we went out early , as we preferred to go out for breakfast . It was perfectly adequate though . The only negative thing I could say ( very very minor ) is that the shower was not as powerful as it looked . I think it depends on the floor your on as other reviews have said extremely powerful . It was fine and that is me nit picking !!! My friend and I would both stay here again and would definitely recommend. Thank you for making our stay so enjoyable and the complimentary birthday wine !!! I will be back : ))

title: Building work in reception was annoying
text:
This was our third visit to the Pearl.mwe were surprised on arrival to find that reception was a building site. Not what we expected at all. The receptionist apologised, but the work went on all weekend. Very disappointing.

Alongside that one lift seemed to be permanently out of action or being used to shift materials.

Overall not what we would expect from a 5* location.

title: Modern hotel, great location, great staff
text: First time staying in this hotel, and was not disappointed. Nice and central to Times Square. Staff were very friendly and more than happy to help.Breakfast is a basic continental style, cereals, bread products, yogurts and fruit, which more than sets you up for the day. We loved the complimentary snacks that were available, and we had the cheese and wine one afternoon, which was also great. Rooms are comfortable, air conditioning can be a bit noisy, which we have found in all NYC hotels. The room maid left us a chocolate on the bed every morning, which was a nice touch very typical of this hotel. We will definitely return for a visit.

title: Excellent
text:
Stayed here for 5 days with my Wife and 2 children (8 & 9).

Our Deluxe King suite was very comfortable and superbly furnished and fitted.  Bathroom also was quite luxurious with high quality soaps and shampoos provided every day.

Perfect location around the corner from Times Square, excellent breakfast and superb friendly staff - Christian at the front desk was exceptional.

Would highly recommend and would definitely stay here again.

title: Don't stay anywhere other than The Pearl
text:
We have just stayed for 8 nights for the first time at The Pearl. We have been to New York on many trips and this is our best experience ever. There is no disputing the fact that the room size is very good for New York and to get a very very good Continental breakfast included is again a rarity to put it mildly. A roof safe is another unusual treat for New York.
I loved the TV in the bathroom which had nice toiletries again something lots of Hotels have cut back on. The free wifi was excellent and also the free newspapers.
The breakfast was plentiful and most enjoyable

title: Fantastic hotel and fantastic location
text: We are just home from a 4 day break to New York. I can't recommend this hotel enough. We stayed in a queen suite. The room was stunning and absolutely immaculate. The staff were extremely courteous and helpful.

title: Great stay, and great location
text: I don't usually leave reviews, but this hotel has really done a good job impressing me. I stayed for five days, my king bedroom is really nice and cleaned with care. The housekeeping staffs are so professional and detail minded (they noticed me drinking more frequent on the English breakfast tea and next day they put two of them for me.) Even though it is near time square, the neighborhood is never too loud.

title: Chuveiro é o melhor!
text:
A primeira impressão o hotel tem cara de antigo, meio fora de moda, mas logo vc esquece dessa impressão. Fomos super bem recepcionados apesar de ter feito o check inn por volta de 19:00. Tivemos um upgrade de quarto. O quarto era ótimo, como descrito, mas a decoração é escura e pesa um pouco aos olhos, tem até um pequeno closet, mas o banheiro é recém reformado e bem moderno e foi o que mais nos impressionou. Era grande e tinha box de chuveiro e banheira separados. A água do chuveiro é muito abundante, o que para mim é um grande diferencial em conforto em um hotel. A cama é daquelas bem macia, padrão nos EUAs, mas os travesseiros não eram tão bons. O café da manhã tem o básico necessário. Croissants, bolinhos, bagel, sucos, frutas picadas, ovos, geleias, cream cheese, manteiga, café, e agua quente da máquina. Leite desnatado, integral e chocolate em pó. Não é glamouroso, mas com certeza atende bem. De uma forma geral, fiquei muito satisfeita com o hotel e ficaria de novo pelo custo benefício, de localização, preço e conforto.
Um pequeno senão, foi que esqueci uma bota no closet, e ao contatar o hotel, me informaram que ela não foi encontrada... :(

title: Great hotel!
text:
We stayed at The Pearl for a week and all in all it was great. 

The breakfast is really handy and the wine/cheese hour well received after a day on your feet. The location is fab with everything on your doorstep and Central Park a 5 min jog away.

The room, a deluxe queen queen, was a good size and always cleaned during the day.

So many local restaurants. Our favourites were Patzeria Friends and Family, Bare Burger and Cosmic Diner (for a quick bite).

Our only gripe was the refurb taking place which was the majority of our stay which limited lift access and also stairs at times! It didn't feel the welcome we'd paid for and was a shame. The front desk was ok but local knowledge did seem a little limited. The door guys were really welcoming.

We would stay here again and had a great time!

title: Great Hotel
text: We stayed at The Pearl for three nights on our first trip to NYC, we will be back to stay here. I can't fault the Hotel at all. The free breakfast was excellent, the rooms well equipped, lovely and clean, and the staff were very helpful and friendly. The location was as close to Times square, without being on Times square, so very central location. Fantastic!

title: Best stay in new york
text: The pearl was one of the best hotels I've stayed in in New York if not the best. There is a continental breakfast available and as much tea or coffee available all day and night from the lobby area, also there are snacks with free wine between four and five o'clock every evening free of charge you don't get this at many hotels in America. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful as are most staff in other hotels we've been to in New York but I would recommend this hotel and it's not far from Times Square.

title: Fantastic !
text: Amazing hotel. Perfect central location. Rooms are small but clean and of a high standard. A free help yourself breakfast has everything you need...bagels, cereals, muffins , hot drinks, fruit. You can eat there or take to your room. Snacks and hot drinks are available all day just help yourself. Fantastic cheese and wine each afternoon....free wine , snacks, salad, dips , cheese and biscuits.staff are really helpful. The doorman will literally whistle you a cab!!
