Easy to get to places from here. The hotel is surrounded by theatres. We went to the theatre across the road and nipped back in the interval to use the bathroom and get a drink! Would highly recommend this hotel , the included breakfast , snacks and drinks is such a bonus.

title: Excellent location for a first visit
text: Visiting New York for the first time? Then this hotel is perfect. Rooms are modern and clean and the beds very comfortable. The staff are extremely helpful & kind. It's a cool calm retreat in the middle of the excitement and buzz of the city. Continental breakfast is adequate (take your own tea bags) but the plastic plates & cutlery are the one negative. The ice water, apples & crisps in the foyer are a brilliant family refresher at the end of a hot day. Good Italian restaurant opposite & Lillie's bar, a little further along 49th, is expensive but well worth a visit. It's easy to hail cabs right outside the hotel or there is a subway station just a short walk away.

title: Great Central Location
text: My daughter and I stayed here for three nights. If you want a hotel close to Broadway and Times Square then this is a good one to choose. The staff were friendly and helpful, our room was clean though a little dark as we were at the back of the hotel on the 8th floor overlooking other buildings but that is a minor criticism as we were out most of the time. Personally, if visiting NYC again, I would opt to stay in a different, quieter area of the city - nothing to do with the hotel but my dislike of the crowds and bustle around Times Square.

title: 1 semaine géniale à NY
text:
Très bien situé sur Times Square, un peu plus au calme que dans d'autres rues, tout est vraiment à proximité.
Proche du métro, des bus, des musées, boutiques.... de tout.
accueil sympathique. 
Suite King size de luxe très bien. 
Petit déjà basique mais bon.
Steak House excellent (burger et frites maison au top !!!!)

title: Tolle Lage!
text: Ein schönes Hotel mit unheimlich freundlichem Personal, Das Hotel liegt  in toller Lage, 2 Minuten zu Fuss zum Times Square. Viele Brodway Shows in unmittelbarer Nähe. 2 Minuten zu Fuss zu einer Subwaystation

title: Absolutely amazing!
text:
Everything about this hotel made our trip amazing, we just got home this morning and already can't wait to come back! The staff were amazing especially Christian on the front desk and William the doorman, everyone here can't do enough to help, Christian recommended and booked a restaurant for us for my birthday and a few other recommendations for breakfast and lunch in the area which were all lovely, I get the feeling you are better asking Christian than the concierge for this as he recommended from his own experiences and really grasped what we wanted (no offence to the concierge they were lovely too and very helpful if you knew what you wanted) the room was lovely and very spacious, as a woman the shower heads are a little annoying to wash your hair with but this is something that bugs me everywhere I go so not really an issue, free continental breakfast is perfect setup that meant we could have a quick bite early morning before getting out and having a few hours exploring before a proper breakfast
The food at the grill is gorgeous and the lady behind the bar here was amazing and made us feel like regulars after our first drink! 
Free wine and cheese hour? Can't go wrong with that! 4-5pm so good to set you on before you get ready to go out especially if you're going to a show and not eating till after 

They left us a bottle of wine and birthday card in the room (although this was wrote to my fiancé and it was my birthday!) not their fault though as it was how it all pulled through from Expedia when we booked this 

Overall an amazing hotel made perfect by the amazing people here 

Can't wait to come back!!

title: Wonderful Hotel
text:
The Pearl Hotel could not have been better.  The staff was so helpful, the rooms were clean and spacious and best of all was the great breakfast to start the day.  The wine hour was also an added benefit at the end of a day of touring.  Snacks and drinks were available all day.

The hotel was located directly across the street from the theatre where we saw the "Book of  Morman".  In the midst of the theatre district and around the corner from Times Square, I will be staying there the next time we visit New York.

title: Wonderful experience; really good hotel
text: Deceptive when you first arrive and wait for the 4pm check in; we were not sure what was to come. The room was lovely, fortunately at the side so not noisy. Good beds, apart from having tucked in sheets and blankets and small pillows. The hotel staff were generally v good and friendly. The continental breakfast was great with: fruit salad, yoghurts, bagels, muffins etc. Non stop access to coffee, tea, cold water. Wine and cheese at tea time if you wanted it. Great bathroom, microwave and fridge in room. Great mid town location and near transport, theatres and restaurants. We liked it a lot! Thanks

title: Only thing excellent is the location
text:
Great location close to Broadway,Times Square,sub way stations and lots of restaurants in the vicinity.
We stayed for 5 nights on the 14th floor at the back, nice and quiet,the room not as big as  i expected but spotlessly clean,the outside corridor was very dingy though.
The breakfast was a self service continental which included stale pastries and was eaten off grotty brown plastic plates with matching brown plastic cutlery,hence we only ate there once.
The cheese and wine is over hyped,and could be improved by serving the wine in glasses instead of plastic ones for starters and how about some social interaction from members of staff .
It would have been nice to have a bar at the hotel as well, the staff in general were more business like than friendly,did i also mention how painfully slow the lifts were? It was faster going up to the top of the rock.
The only thing excellent about this hotel is the location,i cant give a hotel that serves up a mediocre breakfast with plastic plates etc  and wine in plastic  glasses and charges you 250 pounds (370 dollars) a night for the privilege any more than an average rating,sorry.Its not that the hotel did anything really wrong,it just didnt do enough to merit the price.

title: Great location!
text: The Pearl is clean, quiet and comfortable.  It is perfectly located near the Broadway shows that I was in the city to see, and the Continental breakfast was a great bonus.  The staff at the front desk were super helpful- gave us directions and advice.  We will definitely stay at the Pearl again.

title: A solid Four stars
text: Our family of four stayed at The Pearl for a three night vacation in May.  We had a double Queen suite, which was clean and spacious.  The staff was all very friendly and helpful.  The hotel location is great for Midtown attractions, but you pay a premium for the convenience of staying in the Theatre district.  A continental breakfast is included in the room rate, and it serves as a great way to fuel up before leaving the hotel for a day of sightseeing.  The hotel has narrow, dimly lit hallways which gives it a bit of a sad feel, but the lobby is bright and welcoming.  The Pearl's boutique atmosphere adds value to the stay and differentiates this hotel from the surrounding chain hotels.

title: Super locatie heerlijke hotel!
text: Mooie kamers en super schoon. Geen geluidsoverlast en hotel met goed ontbijt. Om de hoek ligt Times square. Vriendelijk personeel. Goede en gratis wifi.Familiekamer met 2 Queensize bedden keukentje met magnetron koffiemachine en koelkastje.

title: Can't believe it still looks so great after five years!
text:
I enjoyed my stay at The Pearl Tre!endlessly. The Deluxe king on 12th floor was wonderful. The bathroom shower had the greatest showerhead I've ever used in any hotel or on any cruise ship. The ambiance was amazing and you can't beat having a continental breakfast and wine, cheese and other tidbits during cocktail hour both in the second floor lounge.

The staff was very friendly and helpful. There are not only tons of restaurants nearby but there is a fabulous  restaurant adjacent to the lobby: E & E Grill which is open for lunch and dinner serves steaks and seafood at fairly reasonable prices. There is also a huge supermarket on the corner of 8th Ave & 49th Street where you can purchase other kinds of snacks to keep in your mini fridge. You are in the heart of the theater district with it's hustle-bustle atmosphere but the hotel is a tranquil Oasis amidst it.

Would highly recommend this hotel. It's worth the price you pay considering all you get!

title: 5star +!!!
text: Have stayed at The Pearl in the past and have been to NYC on a number of occasions and I can honestly say that I love this hotel, the location is amazing as are all the staff who work here, everyone is so friendly and you feel totally at home, if you are considering visiting NYC don't bother looking at any other hotel, stay here!

title: Love this place
text: The perfect place to stay in New York Times Square area. Great staff, very helpful. I won't stay anywhere else. You can't go wrong here. Take advantage of the breakfast in the morning. Also the snacks provided.

title: Meget bra hotell
text:
Hotellet lå like ved Broadway men likevel i en rolig gate. Ingen støy overhodet. Rommet var bra. Vi var 2 voksne og 2 barn, sengene kunne vært litt bredere. Servicen meget bra og min kone fikk en oppmerksomhet når hun fylte 50😀👍.
Meget enkel frokost inkludert i prisen. Den dugte for oss. 
Vi kommer gjerne tilbake!

title: Modern and quiet among the hustle and bustle
text: We just stayed here for 5 nights. Location is outstanding. The hotel rooms were nice size plus they were clean and modern. A/C works very well.  The continental breakfast was disappointing and was not befitting a hotel of this high caliber. Bottled orange juice, tasteless baked goods(Danish and bagels), fresh fruit salad that was not really fresh, but the type that has been marinated, like you get at a lower quality grocery stores. Coffee was very good. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Great doorman(William). Definitely would stay here again.

title: Really Nice Hotel, Great Value
text:
I'm normally not a fan of cookie-cutter Midtown hotels, but this place was great. 

Things we liked: 
--Fantastic location. Only a block from all the action. 
--Room was modern, clean and spacious
--All the doormen were very helpful and courteous
--Price was a lot cheaper than major hotel brands

Things that could be improved: 
--The shower head was way too powerful. It actually hurt to use it. We had to do half-head and half-wand to make it bearable, and the wand sprayed all over the place. 
--Breakfast is about the same as a Hampton Inn (nothing special). 

I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel. Next time we're in NYC for shows/shopping, we'll most certainly stay here.

title: Fabulous
text: This hotel is perfectly located in the heart of the Theatre District; it is steps away from Time Square and a few blocks from Central Park and loads of great restaurants. The hotel has a modern look and wonderful customer service. We had a concern and the manager quickly addressed it; the staff goes the extra mile to ensure its patrons are content. The continental breakfast is perfect before heading out, and the wine & cheese at happy hour is just perfect before dinner. There is no doubt that we would stay here when we return to Manhattan.

title: Extraordinary, personal attention and value
text:
My wife and I touched down for a whirlwind Broadway weekend—three shows in two days. We're accustomed to staying in a chain hotel and setting our expectations fairly low in Midtown Manhattan, but our stay at The Pearl just made us rip up the rule book. 

I have gold status with two national brands, but Christian and the rest of the team at the front desk made us feel more welcome and cared for during our visit than anyone at any hotel we've visited over the past year. They remembered our names, anticipated our needs, made sure we had a safe place to store our luggage before our room was ready, and ensured we knew about the complimentary wine/cheese hour and the continental breakfast.

Our room was modern, comfortable, clean, actually had room to move (a rarity in Midtown), and quiet. There's no extra charge for Wi-Fi that was speedy enough for Netflix during our downtime (another rarity in Midtown). All of this at a rate that was $100 less expensive and significantly more stylish than either of our usual go-to chains. We no longer have to tolerate a shabby hotel for the benefit of walking just a few blocks to a show. We'll be back again—and probably more frequently—knowing that we can rely on The Pearl.

title: A nice hotel, away from the crowded streets
text:
This is a nice hotel, centrally and conveniently located, yet away from the crowds. Very clean and modern. 
Close to key points of interest. Staff is friendly. Breakfast is not bad. Room was nice and clean and bed was comfortable. 
Only reason for a 4 star from me is for lack of variety on the breakfast, but I guess that is normal for a continental breakfast. 
Otherwise a very nice place.

title: Unique find.
text: We were visiting friends in New York and wanted a quiet hotel, hard to find near Times Square, but this gem was a delightful find. Just near the Broadway district behind Times Square, but a very short walk to all the shops and lights. The room was very large with a king size bed, large bathroom, very surprised for a New York hotel. We did not have breakfast as we went out to get bagels so I can not comment. Staff were very helpful and the hotel was beautiful. When my wife and I return to New York we will definitely be staying here again, no doubt.

title: What a find
text: It was a great find if you want to stay in the Times Sq area. I reserved a room with a terrace. Although at the time it was cold in NY it was still nice to step out above the city and see the surrounding area (although you can see limited stuff). The prices were very fare for the nice room.

title: Séjour parfait
text: J'ai adoré cet hôtel. La chambre était spacieuse et équipée d'un four à micro-onde, d'une cafetière à dosettes, d'un réfrigérateur et d'une télévision avec un grand nombre de chaines.Le seul petit inconvénient est que la télé située dans la salle de bain ne fonctionnait pas. Les espaces de rangements étaient suffisant, la chambre était très propre et le lit était très confortable. C'est la chambre standard que j'ai préféré jusqu'à aujourd'hui dans le monde. Le petit déjeuner contenait les éléments essentiels, mais on peut regretter l'absence de charcuterie et de "salé" en général mise à part les œufs durs. The pearl est bien situé, c'est l'hôtel idéal.

title: No complaints!
text: Enjoyed a weekend stay and can't complain about a thing! The location is very very good if you're into the manhattan/broadway attractions, close to everything. The front service service was great, super helpful and very friendly. The room was very nice, and was as advertised, spacious, comfortable, modern, and bathroom was very nice. Not much of a view, but you're not there for the view. Did not find it noisy at all, but we had late nights. Hallways and elevators are small, but that's normal in small new york hotels. The breakfast in the morning was good, but nothing special. Nice to have the option! Free Wine in the afternoon? Very nice!  Would definitely return!

title: The Best
text: Excellent locationin Times Square, friendly staff and high quality services. Rooms are spacious and have good facilities and appliances. I went to New York many times and this is the best hotel i have stayed in so far.

title: Fantastic location
text:
Good value hotel in fantastic location, seconds away from Time Square and directly opposite theatre showing The book of Morman and next door to Chicago.
Front desk staff very helpful, our room was clean and spacious.
Air conditioning was very noisy but we turned it off but could have been very annoying in summer months.
Breakfast was very good but EVERYTHING served on cheap plastic disposable plates, with plastic cutlery and cups.
Complimentary wine and cheese served every afternoon but cheese had no flavour but hey - you don't expect classy cheese in the USA!
Convenient supermarket 30 seconds away on the corner (just turn right outside the hotel entrance.
Would stay here again - just for the location.

title: Wonderful hotel in the heart of Times Square
text: Our room was a comfortable size with two chairs, robes, slippers and refrigerator. All the Staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is perfect...on 49th between Broadway and 8th. There are many restaurants, Starbucks, Coffee Shops closely located and it's a short walk to Central Park and great shopping.  I would definitely stay here again!

title: Great location, great staff highly recommend
text: Love this hotel, great location not far from Times Square and yet it's quiet :) Super friendly staff who were very helpful. I would recommend this hotel and would be happy to stay here again. Room was clean, spacious with everything we needed

title: Simple elegance, great service and location
text: I have nothing but wonderful things to say about The Pearl. I checked in early and they upgraded me to a suite at no extra charge- very nice and unexpected! The front desk was well run and helpful and the bellhop was also- showed me all the amenities in the room. The room was comfortable and fairly large- microwave, fridge, separate seating are with 2nd TV, slippers and robes, huge shower with waterfall type head, separate tub, fancy toiletries (L'occitane)- quite welcoming. The wine and cheese happy hour was convenient- I was trying to save some money on meals so that was pretty much my dinner (I was traveling alone)- good wines and pretty basic snacks but pretty nice for free! The location was perfect- close toTimes Square but far away enough from the craziness- I was on the 3rd floor looking on to the street and it was quiet and the black out curtains worked- let me sleep in! Breakfast the next morning was perfect- continental but lots of choices including fresh fruit. Check out was easy and fast, I left my bags and came back later and had no wait at all- I was running to catch a train so that was great- also got directions to closest subway station to get me to Penn Station. I will definitely come here again on my next trip to NYC- hopefully soon!

title: Good hotel
text: Good hotel, excellent location, excellent service, recommended to ask for a quiet room, simple breakfast, coffee and snacks all day, and free wifi , Jaime Mendieta did everything to please our stay at the hotel-Thx.

title: This truly is a "Pearl"
text:
On our frequent visits to Manhattan we try to stay in different hotels each time, to experience the incredible variety of neighborhoods and amenities of the world's greatest city.  The Pearl might warrant a return engagement.

It's clean. The theatre district location is perfect.  Subway access is close. There is a nice morning continental breakfast.  A small but functional fitness center.  A courteous, professional and effective staff.  Walking distance to great food and drink.

There may be more famous addresses in NYC, but the Pearl offers incredible value.  Put it on your list of preferred places to stay.

title: Great location
text: I won a trip to NYC and this was the hotel they picked. I couldn't fault it. Great location, friendly and helpful staff, lovely continental breakfast which has something for everyone. Close to 2 subway stations and right near Times Square and Broadway. Only negatives were that the view was of other buildings, to be expected in a concrete jungle, and the plug didn't fit in the hole in the bath so wouldn't fill. The room was spacious and the beds were huge and comfortable. Would happily return.

title: Great Boutique Hotel in Theatre District
text: Nice hotel, convenient location in Theatre District a few minutes walk from the show we saw (Wicked). Grocery store, cafes, restaurants, bars, Times Square, subway - everything is close. Service is excellent. When we checked in I told them it was my partners birthday and they upgraded our room and then later sent us a bottle of wine! How great is that! And it was a good bottle! Our room was huge and had a street view. So I cant complain.

title: Will visit again
text:
Midtown location, cross from Eugene Onniel(?) theater. Also, property right next to
parking garage!  Staff very pleasant and helpful. NYC still noisy on 14th floor, but that's
NYC.  Rooms comfortable, amenities fine. Location about 1/2 way down 49th St., west of Broadway. Continental breakfast certainly adequate.  All in all, a pleasant visit.

title: Nice place to stay
text: It's so relaxed to stay. Very near to the Times Square , but not noisy at all. Just by the "Chicago" musical theater! The hotel provides continental breakfast( it's better than what I thought!) There is always lemonade, snacks and fruit at the first floor for anyone to get for free. I think it's just the right place to stay when you want to have a short break in Manhattan!

title: Great Stay
text: Small, boutique hotel right by Times Square. Check in was super smooth. The rooms were very clean with modern furnishing. Very comfortable. The staff was top notch, special mention to William, the doorman. He went above and beyond. Loved our stay, we'll be back

title: Amazing hotel
text: Just returned from a 4 night break at the Pearl.  Everything about the hotel was lovely, from the comfortable beds, the le'octaine toiletries to the complimentary continental breakfast.  Staff were very friendly too.  The hotel is in a perfect location, easy access to theatre land, the metro and Time Square.  We traveled as a party of 3 ladies and felt very safe.  Would definitely recommend the hotel and hope to return again.

title: 5 Jours à NY !!
text:
Points positifs : Personnel très agréable et serviable ! Chambre spacieuse, calme, propre et literie confortable. Emplacement idéal pour visiter NY puisque central. Metro juste à côté de l'hôtel. 
Points négatifs : pas de frigo dans la chambre. Bouteille d'eau à 8$, Chambre sombre. Le petit déjeuner sans plus, avec couverts en plastique. 
Cependant je garde une très bonne impression quant à mon séjour dans cet hôtel à NY

title: Haven amongst the busyness
text: Hotel is the perfect base to be busy in NYC. Bang in the middle of theatres, easy walking to Times Square, the main avenues, Central Park and subway at the end of the street. Despite this the hotel was quiet. We loved the fact this was not a large hotel so not  over run by guests and the staff were really friendly  and helpful. The rooms were clean, well equipped  and had lovely beds.

title: Large modern rooms in good location
text:
We visited the hotel as a couple for 3 nights in April. 

We were given an upgrade to a room with a large balcony on the 10th floor. We've stayed in a few hotels in New York and this was by far the largest room I've ever had in the city. It was modern and clean and the l'occitane toiletries were really nice. 

If you want to be near Times Square then this hotel is ideal. It's a 2 minute walk but still manages to be quiet at night and out of the madness! You're also right next to a subway station. I think there are nicer parts of New York, but if you're a first time visitor then this is ideal. Also if you're going to Broadway (do, it's a fantastic experience), then this hotel works really well.

title: Great hotel for theater lovers
text: My wife and I just spent our 20th Anniversary at The Pearl which is located in the heart of the theater district. We saw a number of Broadway productions and each time could be back in our hotel room in five minutes. Wonderful accommodations and amenities. And judging from all the languages we heard spoken from other guests, the hotel is a favorite among international visitors to NYC.

title: Great small hotel
text: This small hotel offers a lot.  In the theater district but not right on Times Square makes for a great location.  Superb staff--very attentive and friendly, although the restaurant recommendations from the concierge were not helpful.  We got a decent rate (given NYC prices), and the small suite worked out well--only a slight upcharge, which was quite reasonable.  Would definitely recommend this place if you don't need a Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton, Parc Hyatt, etc., but want something better than an Embassy Suites, Hilton or Sheraton.

title: Spacious for NYC and a lovely property
text: We stayed two nights at the Pearl and enjoyed the clean room that by NYC standards was quite spacious. Lots of amenities from wine-and-cheese happy hour on the 2nd floor to a small TV in the bathroom and a full-size bathtub. Only complaint: one doorman was incredibly rude, but all the rest of the staff was super nice. Convenient to the theater district. Would stay here again.

title: Good location, staff excellent lacked few finishing touches
text: Travelled to NY at the end of April as a party of six. The Pearl is in a great location not far from Times Square and short walk to Central Park. Check in was efficient and friendly, throughout our stay all staff were extremely courteous and welcoming. We had paid a little extra to upgrade our room and were on the 7 th floor. To be honest the room our friends had which was a standard on floor 5 was equally nice and spacious so probably not worth paying the extra. The corridors and rooms are quite dark, whatever we did with the lighting was dim in our room. Generally looked a little worn but no complaints re the size of the room, large king bed, kept very clean and plenty of complementary bathroom products. Breakfast is served on the second floor. Decent range of light breakfast buffet, fruit, yoghurt, cereal and toaster for bagels. Generally busy and "self service" plastic plates, cutlery etc. The afternoon drinks/snacks were disappointing compared to others I have had in NY. Very restricted range of wine and snacks - we didn't really bother after the first day. Out and about we watched the football in Carraghers bar on W 39 St, good atmosphere and decent bar food. Tried Bourbon Street on 46th Street, between 8th and 9th decent food and range of drinks and the Tir Na Nog on w 39th St between 8 and 9 st Decent menu and 80's disco on Friday night. Disappointed by the Rainbow Lounge at the Rockerfeller building, had been here around 10 years ago great cocktail bar with outstanding views particularly if you get in around dusk. Made effort to go but seems they let too many people in there now was very crowded and noisy and didn't have a single drink we asked for. Maybe we just timed it wrong. So in summary would recommend the Pearl for its great location and friendly team of staff, could do with a little refurb in places and sort out the drinks reception.

title: Earnest guest focus and great rooms
text: I recommend The Pearl and felt grateful for discovering this hotel after other accommodation fell through the night before travelling to the US. I booked through Wotif. The receptionist on check-in accommodated my request for a bath with an evident striving to satisfy if possible. Staff were friendly. A 2nd floor lounge had evening drinks and breakfast included, a nice touch. There was always fruit around to supplement healthy eating on the go. The room was tastefully decorated, spacious and had thoughtful provisions (e.g., nice toiletries and fast free wifi), and a marble bathroom. I found it easy to dart around New York with two subway stations nearby. Thanks for a great stay!

title: You will NOT be Disappointed!!! Trust Me
text: This Hotel & Staff are Perfection!!!! We stayed here back in Nov2014 after my Cancer treatments. The Morning Buffet Breakfast has hot items not just your typical cold items...It is within minutes to Times Square!!Coffee& theatres...So clean, so big Our room had the sink in the counter where you make your coffee...I Loved that,We were there for a week ....My honey loved the Flat screen in the Bathroom!! go figure :-) He wants one at home now Ha! Ha! Enjoy!!!

title: Beautiful hotel in the heart of NYC
text: Stayed here with my mum for my birthday what an amazing place right in the centre of New York next to the famous Broadway show Chicago! Staff were so lovely and breakfast was amazing! In the hotel a bottle of wine was waiting for my birthday and in the afternoon wine and cheese! Next time I go to New York I will be coming back! Eeeeek! 💕💕💕💕💕💕💕

title: Everything you need...
text:
Stayed here for 2-3 nights before our flight to San Francisco, then again on our return before coming home.  Friendly reception staff, modern reception area with sofas, snacks, fruit and fresh water available in the lobby.  
The first room we stayed in was large, comfy, with a microwave and a fridge.  Bathroom was big with a great walk in shower.  Loved the magnified mirror attached to the wall!  
Bed seemed very small but we have a super king at home so anything smaller than that, we are going to feel it.  We were facing the back of the building so the view was grim and very noisy generators going 24 hours.  Having said that, when you come to New York, you dont spend much time in your hotel room and if you expect peace & quiet, you're in the wrong city!  Take earplugs!!  Room very clean and cleaning staff excellent.  If we forgot to take off our Do Not Disturb sign, we always had an answerphone message saying they hadn't been able to clean and to contact them to arrange if wanted.
Breakfast area was small and on occasions, not enough seating.  Food and drink was plentiful with cereals, fresh fruit, pastries, bagels, bread, eggs etc. Plenty of tea, coffee and juice.
Our second visit, we had a smaller room still with the same noisy grim view.  This had more impact as we were in a room with smaller windows, which felt claustrophobic.  
We didnt use the restaurant so cannot comment but the deli/supermarket, closeby was very handy!  Great base to walk everywhere and we only took the subway once to see the 9/11 memorial.

title: Amazing hotel
text: Just returned from 5 night's at this hotel, staff so helpful and friendly, continental breakfast set us up for the day, excellent location as the big bus tour is round the corner excellent for exploring uptown and downtown, brillant restaurants all nearby. If we have the chance to come back would book this hotel again, thank you to all the staff at the pearl

title: Delightful Weekend in the City
text: Splendid girls weekend in NYC was made even better by this hotel! The location is smack in the middle of the theater district and easily walkable to several metro stations and Times Square.  The establishment is smaller so you don't feel like a faceless body wandering thru the lobby, and a little bit off the more heavily touristy areas.  Christian at the front desk was especially helpful; checking us in and storing our luggage before our room was ready so we could head out & explore the city.  Free wifi!  Such a rarity in hotels of this class.  The continental breakfast was varied and filling, preparing us for our daily adventures.  The room (507) was well appointed and quiet, and the bathroom luxurious.  I like a bit of comfort when I travel and the Pearl absolutely meet that!

title: Simply the best.
text:
The Pearl is simply everything you would wish for in a hotel. Close to the bustle and excitement of Times Square, close to subway, wonderful, friendly staff, excellent clean rooms. One of the best aspects is the wonderful grocery/food store literally steps away.
They are happy to keep parcels for you at no charge [great for us overseas visitors taking advantage of Amazon or similar].
Being NY, you will also be pleasantly surprised at the charges, though of course, like any hotel, rates vary during the year.
There is no other hotel I would consider staying at. It's simply the best.

title: Bien ubicado, bien decorado, bien atendido
text: Nos encantó, queda al lado de times square, con estaciones de metro en todas las esquinas, ahora les cuento del hotel, este está recien arreglado con una muy bonita decoración, ojalá pidan piso alto, la vista no es de lo mejor, el tamaño de la habitacion es muy bueno, todo los articulos del baño son Occitane, batas, cafetera que cada día reponen con cafe, muy limpio siempre, un pequeño desayuno y todos los días en la tarde durante 1 hora hacen una degustacion de vinos como amabilidad del hotel. El precio esta bien. Nosotros volveríamos a este hotel en un proximo viaje.

title: Da ricordare
text:
Ottimo albergo in posizione strategica per time square,quinta e settima avenues.Camera ampia, servizio ottimo, colazione europea compresa.Molto silenzioso, letto comodo.
Personale gentile e preparato per prenotazione spettacoli.
Servizio taxi disponibile con frequenza elevata e metropolitana nelle vicinanze.

title: Amazing stay at the Pearl Hotel!
text:
We stayed at the Pearl Hotel for 3 nights. The hotel is beautiful, clean, location is great 3 minutes walk from times square but also very quiet. we asked for our room to be on a high floor and we were on the 8th floor which was super quite. The beds were comfy and we even had chocolates on the pillows! :-) 
The staff is friendly and helpful. I don't have anything bad to say and that's a first for me!

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text:
We had great 5 nights, during April 2016, took 2 rooms - 1 double bed room + 1 with 2 qeens beds room, total of 2 adults + 3 girls (ages 10,12,18).
The Pearl has a super super location !!! close to Brodway showes and Times Square, close to Subway station. Still in a queit street and the rooms are queit.
Friendly and helpful team ! Opening doors for you....Great and tasty breakfast, which is very difficult to find in NYC.  They also have time for wine, cheese and snacks in the afternoon.  All day long you can find in the lobby cold water, apples & snacks.  The rooms are big and clean.  Good bath shower gel/shampoo/body lotion - "La O'ccient" excelent products. Everything looks new and clean.  Comfortable and big beds.  We had a great time at the hotel and enjoy every moment.  It is defiantly the best hotel to stay in NYC, if you are a couple, single and also for families.  I hight recommend it :-)

title: Perfect
text: Great location for all the main attractions. Easy walking distance to Rockerfella centre, central park, empire state, 5th ave. Times square just down the road. Room was great, large corner shower cubical, plenty of storage space. Breakfast was ideal to start the day without fuss. Plenty of choice. Wine and snack hour at 4pm a welcome treat after a long day sight seeing. Would definately return.

title: Escapade NY
text:
Hôtel bien placé car au centre névralgique de Manhattan, pas loin des musées au nord, tres proche ligne Metro et l on peut irradier en étoile.
En plein centre de Times square donc ambiance tres agitee mais bonne insonorisation.
Petit déjeuner inclus ce qui est rarement le cas à NY mais il s agit d un self service avec viennoiseries seulement et verres en cartons jetables..donc ils ont choisi cette alternative mais cela surprend pour un quatre étoiles.

title: GREAT HOTEL !
text:
Four of us stayed at this hotel for one week and all i can say is WOW!
Everyone, from the Front desk to the Room maids were really pleasant and friendly. They were attentive to our every needs. From booking taxis to restaurant reservations and general " how to find " places they were great.
The E.E Restaurant and Grill which is part of the hotel served us some of the best steaks we have ever eaten and Lillies Victorian bar which is just up the street is well worth a visit too!
We will certainly be back !

title: Birthday Weekend Stay
text: Stayed at the Pearl Hotel NYC this weekend for my daughter's birthday and it was TOP NOTCH!!! First the hotel is in Times Square, right in the heart of Broadway!! Beautiful & modern!! All of the amenities you would expect. Kurig, refridge, microwave, refridge, and hair dryer. Comfy beds. Quiet rooms even with all of the hustle & bustle right outside all night. Staff is beyond friendly & helpful!!! The icing on our cake was the birthday note, sparkling cider & champagne glasses waiting in our room for my daughter. If we ever come back to NYC, we will stay at The Pearl for sure. I highly recommend it.

title: The Pearl is a pearl!
text:
A Pearl is a gem... The pearl is a gem too. We heard a lot about the Pearl before going to New York. And we can certified that all the good you can hear about is true : rooms are spacious clean and really pleasant to live. The staff is helpful and very kind. The hotel is located near a lot of subway lines and even though it is in the central part of Times Square we appreciated the peaceful calm of the hotel.
Breakfast and wifi are free and both excellent.

Premier voyage pour les enfants, un anniversaire pour un des deux parents et des retrouvailles avec New York après 20 ans : ce voyage était très important pour nous... New York est toujours aussi magnifique et envoûtante... Concernant le Pearl, c'est un hôtel qui a largement contribué à la réussite de notre voyage : chambre spacieuse, propre, déco très agréable fonctionnelle avec son frigo, son micro ondes et sa machine à café. Le staff est très sympa, prévenant et toujours disponible.

Hotel idéalement placé dans l'hypercentre, à proximité de nombres lignes de métro et de sites de visite à pied.

Petit havre de paix au milieu du foisonnant Times Square.

Nous y retournerons sûrement et avec plaisir.

Thank you Pearl Hotel : we enjoyed and appreciated a lot our stay!

title: Elegance in the Theater District
text: Relatively new (5 years), the Pearl sits in the middle of all the theater action.  It is located between two different subway stations, and almost all theaters are in walking distance.  Perhaps more importantly, the rooms are not NY closets, but large and graciously appointed, including a fridge, microwave and wet bar.  It is clean, friendly and very comfortable.  it might seem pricey until you count in the continental breakfast and cheese and wine each evening--both free. That brings lots of families there.  I found it to be quiet, clean, comfortable and very friendly.

title: Absolutely Brilliant Hotel
text: This is a really great small ( for New York ) hotel. It is spotlessly clean and well maintained with well equipped rooms. We were fortunate enough to be allocated a superior room which had a small outdoor terrace .The Pearl  is in a good location just off Times Square and Broadway. The staff were all very friendly and knowledgeable. Nothing was too much trouble for them. On our arrival at 3pm and we were invited to take refreshments in the small lounge area where tea, coffee and snacks - all complimentary-are available 24 hours a day.and where between 4 and 5 pm complimentary wine and cheese are also served .The complimentary breakfast was very good with a good choice available. The adjacent Bar/Restaurant , which is accessed via the reception area served excellent food.  On our last day we booked a private transfer car through the Concierge for our return journey to the airport . it cost $70 - about $10 more than a Taxi - and was well worth it . We vacated our room after breakfast and the they stored our luggage free of charge so that we could enjoy a full day out before our night flight home . When we returned to pick up our luggage we were invited to partake of the free wine and cheese that was being served in the lounge . Having stayed in larger . more well known establishments in New York the Pearl outstrips them on all counts.

title: Excellent hotel
text: This is our second time staying here this year, and we could not be happier. We received a complimentary upgrade upon check-in this time which was a treat. But it's the staff that makes this place special. Everyone is smiling, helpful, and friendly. All restaurant and transportation recommendations are spot-on. And the wine and cheese reception each afternoon is an appreciated touch. The beds are comfortable, and the rooms are good size for NYC. Will stay here again!

title: A real gem
text: This is a great hotel and very well situated just off Times Square and Broadway. This was our fourth trip to NYC and our third at the Pearl. The staff were very helpful, rooms were clean and of a good size and there is free WiFi. Within short walking distances you have access to several Subway lines and loads of great places to see. We found a great diner nearby on 8th Ave - Times Square Diner - which does great breakfasts, although the hotel supplies croissants, coffee, juice, etc. We're going back for our fourth stay soon

title: First class
text:
Pros: The hotel was lovely and close to all the attractions. We received a room upgrade on arrival. The free continental breakfast and the cheese and wine between 4 and 5pm are a bonus.The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable. We booked two broadway shows through the concierge and seats were excellent and we recieved a complementary dinner with the second show.
Cons: Nothing.
Location: All the time square and broadway attractions are within walking distance and there are subway stops in several nearby locations.

title: Great stay at a fantastic hotel!
text: The location could not be better placed. Ideal for all New York attractions. Modern hotel which catered for all our needs. Comfortable beds with a large very clean bathroom containing rain shower and also a bath.  Luxury L'Occitane toiletries provided in addition to bathrobes/slippers. Great benefits of staying at this hotel also had to be the complimentary continental style breakfast and also snacks/coffee available 24/7, and the wine hour.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent hotel highly recommend
text:
Fantastic hotel just returned after spending 4 nights at The Pearl thoroughly enjoyed it. Beautiful and clean, rooms are fabulous, we were on the 14th floor.
We saw the musical Chicago which was straight outside the hotel.
Really close to Times Square, and a fantastic location for all sightseeing.

title: Only one niggle with this hotel
text:
Just returned from a week stay in the Pearl. Great location very close to times square was actually surprised how long we were. Close to metro station and close to many good restaurants. We had friends that were also staying in NY at the same time and they said their room was very small compared to what we had, our room was on the second floor was a queen size room with an outdoor seating area. Not that we used the seating area as the weather was a little cold but if they weather was nicer i am sure we would have sat out there. 

Our only niggle with the hotel which may sound very petty to some people but we put the "do not disturb"  sign on the door as we didnt feel the room needed to be cleaned and to be honest all we had done is shower and sleep there one night BUT the cleansers still entered our room as i know it sounds petty they then left a message on our answer phone to say that they needed to come into the room as it needed to be done every two days which to me is crazy, i'm sure a towel can be used more than twice just seemed very wasteful to me. 

Apart from this niggle i could not fault the Pearl hotel, if we were to return to NY i would not hesitate to book here again.

title: No se puede pedir mas
text: Todo lo que debe tener un hotel, habitacion confortable aunque deberían modernizarlas un poco, servicio excelente, atención y ubicación inmejorables, servicio de desayuno que pocos hoteles de NY tienen y snacks a toda hora que nos hicieron sentir como en casa. Precio razonable. Que mas se puede pedir?

title: Fantastic Hotel by Times Square
text:
This hotel is fantastic! Located right by Times Square, really accessible to use as a base whilst exploring New York.
Room was first class (me, the Mrs and 2 kids), very big, clean and had an upmarket feel about it.
All the staff, especially door staff were knowledgeable, helpful, & friendly. 
Would highly recommend and will be going back at some point

title: Ideal spot in NYC
text: Great location close to Times Square and many theatres. Ideal for sightseeing and shopping. Great hotel with professional, polite and helpful staff. Free wifi. Excellent room. Continental breakfast to start the day off. Buses and metro service close by.

title: Amazing Hotel right off Times Square
text:
This hotel is the Best ! I have been to NYC a couple of times but this hotel wins hands down yes it may be smaller than some but dont you know the best things come in small packages ! The staff from us checking in to checking out were just fantastic nothing too much trouble always very polite , well dressed even the doormen had a warn welcome for guests. 
The free breakfast and wine and cheese in the afternoon was a bonus , I know people  have previously said  the breakfast should have more choice but we were more than happy with what was on offer . It was fresh and constantly being replenished . 
The bedroom was lovely very clean , lots of space which is unusual for NYC , large bathroom with bath and large shower . Premium toiletries and hairdryer. Bed were comfy and room is air conditioned . Walk in closet and safe.
The hotel is just off Times Square but not noisy and is very close to the subway station. 
To sum it up would I return Yes and would I recommend it Yes without a doubt , this hotel is a Gem right in the heart of NYC .

title: Lovely weeks stay in great location hotel
text: We have just returned from a weeks stay at The Pearl with our two young children aged 5 and 10.   We would definitely stay here again.  The room was very clean and a good size for all four of us.  The staff were all excellent and the concierge staff were really helpful.   We had a continental breakfast each morning which was good quality.   The main thing we liked was that although it is central (minutes from Times Square) it is fairly small compared to larger hotels nearby which gives it a lovely friendly feel.  We all loved it.

title: Tolles Hotel, absolut empfehlenswert
text:
Wir waren 6 Nächte mit der Familie im "The Pearl" und können das Hotel definitiv empfehlen:

- Tolle Lage, unmittelbar in einer Querstraße zum Times Square.

- Freundliche Atmosphäre. Das Hotel ist für New Yorker Verhältnisse nicht allzu groß. Dementsprechend wirkt alles ein wenig familiärer, im besten Sinne. Wünsche werden von der Rezeption freundlich erfüllt.

- Einrichtung: Das Hotel ist modern eingerichtet, alles wirkt noch gepflegt und gut in Schuss

- Das Frühstück ist inklusive. Die Basics (Bagel, Gebäck, Obst, Getränke etc.) sind umfangreich und appetitlich vorhanden. Das tut dem Reise-Budget, besonders in NY, sehr gut.

- Jeden Tag bietet das Hotel seinen Gästen von 16-17 Uhr Wein & Snacks kostenlos an. 
Äpfel, Chips und Kekse sind jederzeit complimentary zu haben.

Negativ:
Das kostenlose wifi funktioniert im Hotel grundsätzlich sehr gut. Leider hatten wir aber im Zimmer immer wieder Probleme mit dem Netz.

Die Zimmer sind ziemlich klein, wie es in New York nun mal so ist. 

Taxi ist eher nervig. Uber ist die definitiv bessere Alternative.

Transfer mit Uber zum Hotel:
Newark: ca. 70$
JFK: ca. 85$

Das Hotel ist sicher nicht günstig, aber es wird auch entsprechend viel angeboten. Von uns eine klare Empfehlung!

title: Great hotel
text:
We are visiting New York for our honeymoon and we are so pleased with the pearl hotel
Room size is so good, heaps of room, we are just in a std queen room.
Staff are really friendly and helpful
Location is amazing, close to times square but location is not too noisy which makes it easy to sleep. Subway stations are very very close.
We still have 2 out of our 6 nights to go but a very enjoyable stay here at the pearl, would highly recommend it.

title: Excellent location, friendly staff
text: We booked two suites here over Easter for a family of six. The first thing you notice when checking in is the friendliness of the staff, it was always lovely coming home to their welcoming smiles after trekking the city all day (and dealing with tourist loathing New Yorkers, lol). The hotel has a Westin vibe, although maybe not quite as polished. Rooms are a good size and price for New York. The hotel is in an unbeatable location, right on Times Square. There is a million things to do, all the theaters are here, museums, tons of restaurants ranging from high end to $2 pizza slices, loads of shopping. There is a free continental breakfast which is okay. One suggested improvement would be the addition of a couple of waffle makers - most hotels offer them now and there's nothing better for breakfast when you're on vacation. They do free wine and nibbles from 4pm-5pm every day. If you get there early you can sit in one of the armchairs and look down on the street below, it's fascinating to watch the world walk by. Our room (402) faced on to 49th street (which is a fairly quiet street compared to others nearby). There was some minor noise from traffic - we used the supplied earplugs by the hotel and white noise on our phones and slept fine. My parents had a room (909) which faced over the church next door which was quieter. If noise is an issue (eg. if you have kids who can't use earplugs), request a room on a higher floor, not facing 49th street. Another tip, if you're looking for last minute tickets, google "Last minute New York Theater Tickets" or similar - you will save money over using the concierge. Overall, a great stay and would definitely return.

title: Best kept secrete in Times Square
text: Our family visited NY for the very first time New Years 2016. We had been told about how overwhelming it can be in NY and because of the location of the hotel and the helpful tips from the staff, Julissa, our trip was amazing. We loved the hotel and we cant say enough about Julissa and her positive and very helpful attitude.

title: Great Mid Manhattan Hotel
text: Beautiful hotel close to theaters, Times Square and everything mid Manhattan has to offer.  Hotel staff was friendly and helpful and was eager to answer our questions.  The room was fantastic!  Loved the layout (long hall with closets, cupboards and a coffee area) spacious room and great bathroom with a television in it.  Loved the Philosophy shampoo and soap and I would definitely come back again.

title: Non male!
text:
Ci siamo goduti i servizi di questo ottimo Hotel di recente ristrutturato e molto ben posizionato. Non c'è una vista interessante dalle finestre, ma a parte questo la struttura è elegante, pulita, generoso il ricambio degli asciugamani, abbondanza di saponi, oli profumati, balsami, creme e sciampo. I letti sono molto confortevoli. La colazione a buffet ricca e gratuita. 
Ottimo il rapporto qualità/prezzo.

title: Ubicación inmejorable
text:
Excelente ubicación para familias
Si fuera solo no utilizaría este hotel, su valor es excesivo por su categoría, se paga claramente la ubicación inmejorable que tiene
Es limpio, muy buena atención 
El wifi es lento y no adecuado si van a trabajar
El desayuno es bueno, él área destinada podría mejorar. El espacio para desayunar en sillones resulta algo incomodo si van con chicos, nada grave igual va bien
Hay un estacionamiento pegado aunque no necesitan auto. Las líneas de metro están a pasos de su excelente ubicación
Hay un súper justo en la esquina que vende lo que necesiten
Es caro, pero Manhattan es caro

title: excellent service
text: Very convenient to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, theatres, Central Park, museums, and Hell's Kitchen. The service was friendly and helpful, especially the front desk. Surprisingly quiet room, very clean.

title: Your hotel is a gem!
text:
Awesome staff:  from the warm and friendly greeting we received curbside (after a 4 hour drive!), to the quick and easy check in at the desk, to the genuine inquiries about how are stay was going from the maids, doormen and bell captain!
Lovely, comfortable, and clean room.
Nice and convenient Continental breakfast.
Ideal location!!
Stay at this hotel, folks; great prices that are worth it:)

title: Great hotel!
text: Loved it here! I rarely write reviews but felt The Pearl was definitely worthy of praise. EVERY time you walk past the front desk they say hello and the doormen are wonderful! One even stood outside with me, in the snow, and helped me hail a taxi as I had a train to catch and was worried I might miss it. It's clean and the rooms are a nice size compared to other hotels near by. It's in Time Square but right off 49th so you don't feel like you're in the middle of the craziness. I traveled here solo on business and felt very safe during my entire trip. This will definitely be my go-to hotel when I'm in the city!

title: Next to the Time Sq
text:
Reasonable price for everything what you get in this hotel. Rooms are spacious, especially those with two beds. The view from the room is less important if you came to discover NYC and spending all day out. Breakfast is good, they offer different varieties of fruits, bakery and musli and cornflakes. Only thing I missed is they do not offer meat (salami, sausages etc.)
Staff is very polite and very welcome. Every part of hotel from lobby, restaurant and roommate very clean. 
WiFi connection is excellent.
One thing I didn't like was on arrival when you check in you have to leave deposit via your credit card. I have been stayed at more luxurious hotels in the world and have never been ask to do something like that. Hope they'll change that policy.

title: Great location and surprisingly quiet
text:
I was travelling with my niece who is 11 years old so the security and location of the hotel was important.  The room was nice and quiet, despite the location being only 5 minutes from Times Square we didn't hear any traffic.  The hotel felt safe and secure, the rooms comfortable and the complimentary wifi worked well.  Breakfast, also complimentary, was OK but a bit of a bun-fight as it was busy with not many seats.  Would benefit from an improved toaster (or more than one!) and perhaps an ice machine.
Beware the bottled water in the rooms - they charge $8 for it.
Beds comfortable, room temperature easy to control, nice towels, could do with more hangers in the wardrobe, but lots of drawer space.
Overall recommended, and especially for women travelling with children.

title: Peace and quite in the crazy city
text:
Just got back from a long weekend in New York with my family.
Staying at the The Pearl was very peaceful and quite in the very noisy Times Square area.
Just off Times Square it's a great place to stay for all the theatres and sites.
Rooms were very clean and have very comfortable beds and had great shower room.
The breakfast was the only disappointment only a continental breakfast on offer with limited choice.
The Wifi was fast and reliable.
All the staff were very friendly and very helpful.
I would defiantly recommend this hotel for a New York stay.

title: the Hotel which truly works for it's customers
text: I would like to thank the hotel stuff which were incredible helpful! I made a reservation through booking.com and when I arrived to hotel I found out that the reservation did not go through (i think it was my mistake to provide incorrect credit card and unfortunately I did not see the cancellation, I think). So I actually I did not what to do and I had my family with me. The front desk and the manager provided me with the room and what was great they did not charge me any extra fee- they took only the amount which I had during my reservation (you can imagine how the price for the room can increase if you want to book it the same night). So I really felt that the personnel was truly intended to help me and how they value each customer! They also provided us with a cotbed without any additional fee! The staff was really helpful!. the hotel itself is located in excellent place- close to hop on hop ff bus station, Macy's mall. The hotel was very clean with complimentary breakfast & free internet! the bathroom was great and they provided the customer with premium soaps shampoos, etc! I really recommend this hotel!

title: Amazing hotel!
text: Stayed at the Pearl for a week with my family of 8 in 2 rooms. The hotel was able to accommodate my request to have the rooms on the same floor which I appreciated. The rooms were spacious and clean and the beds were comfortable. Location was fantastic- around the corner from Times Square and close to the subway and Broadway theatres. A great feature of this hotel is that they offer 24 hour complimentary snacks as well as tea and coffee beverages which was lovely (and rare these days) to keep us warm in the cold weather. There is also a complimentary snack hour in the afternoon with cheese, crackers, dip, carrots etc which was an added bonus. The staff at the front desk and the door were very friendly and helped us with all our enquires. The only downfall was that the breakfast was repetitive and there were no new additions to the buffet during the week stay (this has happened in other hotels we've stayed at in the past). Nevertheless, would love to stay here again!

title: New York Easter 2016, Excellent
text: Great hotel, located just off Times square. The hotel staff were all very friendly and courteous. The room was well equipped with fridge and microwave & coffee machine, The complementary wine and cheese hour in the afternoon is a lovely touch and a day sightseeing or prior to seeing a show. Breakfast was great with a good continental selection. Recommended for a great stay in New York.

title: Mother/Daughters Weekend
text: Location was fantastic and we were lucky enough to be accommodated with an earlier check-in when we arrived. Room was comfortable, spotless and by NY standards - spacious. Complimentary Continental breakfast was pretty good and complimentary wifi a real treat.

title: Great Hotel
text: The check in was excellent; the location of this hotel so close to  mid town & the avenues  with subway close at hand we really enjoyed our stay. The staff were so helpful & pleasant including Ari Lindsay & Melissa. We had a king room  clean ; well appointed & the bathroom was fine. The complimentary breakfast was good - juices tea coffee toast bagels fruit etc  and every day a happy hour at the end of the afternoon with free wine & nibbles & we met so many people from different parts of the world & USA. This was our 4th visit to NYC & we would stay at this hotel again

title: Spring Break 2016
text: The Pearl is located in the heart of the Theater District and walking distance to everything. The subway (which is extremely convenient) can be accessed within a block walk. Our family stayed 5 days in a double queen... it was clean, stylishly decorated and roomy. The hotel offers breakfast daily for guests and a cheese/wine hour in the afternoon. Coffee and snacks are available 24 hrs. Staff at The Pearl was very professional and friendly. Our only compliant was that housekeeping overlooked our room but the management responded immediately. We will book The Pearl when we return to NYC.

title: Best-Better Hotel
text: A very nice , clean, sweet, courteous, awesome hotel in NYC.  I was not disappointed..at all. Theater District. My doubl. queen was assigned, in the back of the building . That was ok. Biggest room in NYC I've had. Bed's a little soft for my back, but very good hotel. BTW Shower directions may be a help, Not used to up/side splash/ cold!!!

title: Spring Break
text: We were very happy with our stay. The staff was friendly and attentive. The doormen were always willing to help, offer advice, hail a cab or call for a car. We came in late one night and needed forks to eat our cheesecake and Manuel took care of us. The location is awesome.  Right around the corner from Times Square, a short walk to Rockefeller Center and 5th Ave. The only  recommendation we would make is regarding lighting in the rooms.  Even with the dimmer switch turned up to max it was difficult to get enough lighting for 3 girls to put on make-up. The magnified mirror in the bathroom was a plus, however better lighting near the awesome full length mirror would have been fantastic.  Small detail I know but feedback is always good. We were pleased with our stay and will stay again.

title: NYC en invierno
text:
La ubicación es buenísima, más todavía si tenés en tus planes recorrer Midtown, ir a ver obras de teatro y disfrutar del central park. Además, está cerca de varias líneas de metro, por lo que hace muy conveniente utilizarlo par volver luego de largos días de recorrida.
La atención es muy buena, muy cordial y servicial, diría lo mejor junto con la ubicación. Las habitaciones, a mi gusto un poco quedadas en el tiempo, y la cama me pareció menos cómoda que muchos otros lugares.

Excelente y para destacar el wine tasting (con vino argentino como debe ser) a las 17. El desayuno podrían agregarle fiambre, si no está perfecto. Buenísima la idea de tener té, café y snacks gratis y a disposición las 24hs.

Sin embargo, volvería y lo recomiendo para parar por esta zona, ya que es el mejor en el que me he hospedado en Midtown!

title: Excellent!
text: Stayed at The Pearl for a NYC getaway. This hotel had it all. Great location, great staff and a nice environment. Hotel was neat and clean, even the stairwells! Decor was modern and very tasteful. Very nice continental breakfast as well as an afternoon wine hour with snacks! Water, fruit and bagged snacks available in the lobby as well as coffee on the second floor. Room was spacious, nicely decorated and the bathroom area had a great shower. Staff were super friendly and very helpful with recommendations for dining and other helpful hints.  Top notch!

title: Great location, great place to stay
text: We recently returned to NYC and our hotel decision was the easiest one of all, We returned to the Pearl. It is located just enough off of Times Square to be out of the crush and noise. We were able to walk to most of the things we wanted to see. The metro or cab are both readily accessible from the hotel. I would classify The Pearl as a boutique hotel, relatively small, very quite, quick and ready elevators, very clean and very friendly. Perhaps there are cheaper places to stay but we clearly got our money's worth at this hotel.

title: Excellent stay at The Pearl
text: I booked this hotel based on other reviews on this site and wasn't disappointed.  My husband and I spent two nights at this hotel with my teenage daughter and pre teen son for a college/spring break trip and this hotel worked out wonderfully.  The staff was very friendly and helpful at check in and upgraded us to suite which was perfect for my son to have a little privacy.  The gym had everything we needed and the continental breakfast included pastries, yogurt, coffee etc. and was nice especially when we were late one day for a college tour.  The location was quiet but very close to Times Square and was central to all the things we wanted to do.  I especially appreciated the cleaning staff leaving extra toiletries.  Little things like that make a hotel stand out.  The beds were very comfortable.  Our only issue was with the tiny pillows but it didn't detract from our wonderful stay at The Pearl.

title: Fab hotel
text:
Just spent a week at this hotel. Fab room and staff were excellent. 
Had bagel breakfast every morning that set me up for the day. 
Very peaceful despite the fab location. Just off Times Square. Also very safe location.
Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC.

title: Superb hotel!
text: Just returned from a three night stay at the Pearl Hotel for my first ever trip  to New York and I must say it did not disappoint in any way. The hotel has an amazing location just off Times square surrounded by theatres, cafes and shops. The hotel staff were absolutely flawless, nothing was too much trouble and the room was extremely well presented and had all the amenities you could need, (the walk in shower was especially good!). Big shout out to the night doorman William especially who arranged my car back to the airport at short notice, really nice guy and a credit to the hotel. Along with his service and the rest of the staff is the reason why when I next visit the city i will defiantly be returning!

title: True Pearl
text:
Оказался в этом отеле волею случая, т.к. обычно ищу в Нью-Йорке более дешевые места. Но в итоге не пожалел ни об одном потраченном центе и нашел настоящую жемчужину на Манхэттене!
Отель расположен очень удачно, вблизи от Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, MOMA, множества ресторанов и магазинов. Это место почти идеальное для туриста в Нью-Йорке.
Отель небольшой и выглядит, как новый. Может, действительно новый. Номера достаточно просторные по нью-йоркским меркам, также прекрасно оформленные. Чистота везде идеальная. В номере есть микроволновка, холодильник и кофеварка. Кровати супер-удобные. Сантехника новая и исправная. Качественная косметика. 
Континентальный завтрак, к сожалению, скромный, но Нью-Йорке невозможно умереть с голоду )
Если бы не прайс, останавливался бы в этом отеле и в дальнейшем. Рекомендую с чистой совестью.

title: Great service - awesome rooms - great loaction
text: One of the best boutiques in New York. It is very conveniently located. Breakfast is pretty good and the gym is also awesome. Every request was attended to pretty fat. Comfortable bed. Cant say if I wanted anything more.

title: Amazing
text: Just returned from a 4 night stay here can't fault this hotel in any way all facilities excellent location fabulous everything top class looking forward to going again as soon as possible. Wine hour is added bonus so generous

title: Perfekt läge!
text:
Bra, stort rum. Helt OK frukost för att vara USA. Trevligt med vin och ost på eftermiddagarna. WiFi funkade också hela tiden.Lugnt läge mitt i teaterdistriktet.  
Rekommenderar detta hotell till familj och vänner och kommer försöka bo där nästa gång i NY.

title: Outstanding Accommodations!
text: My sister and I weren't happy with the hotel we had reserved for our first trip to New York, so we walked around the corner hoping to find a hotel that would provide cleanliness and space. Well we received so much more than we were looking for. From the time we entered the lobby we were made to feel welcome. The front desk clerk and manager were so kind. We were shown a room that was simply perfect and was so clean. We had a wonderful stay and highly recommend The Pearl of New York to all who are looking for awesome customer service and a lovely clean environment.

title: Excellent location. Great hotel
text: Just off time square, this hotel was in a perfect location. A walk away from Central Park, just round the corner from the hop on hop off bus that takes you everywhere you need to go. Lovely hotel room, cleaned daily, free wifi, free safe in the room and tv. Breakfast was ok. Cakes, coffee, cereal, fruit and bagels and muffins to toast. A restaurant is attached to the hotel than you get 10% off if you are a guest. Really helpful staff at the desk, they organised transfers back to the airport.

title: Really nice hotel
text: Really nice hotel, great location, close to Times Square and metro-stations. Friendly straff, nice, spacious and clean room. Loved the complementary wine and cheese hour every day. Simple, but good breakfast, really good coffie! Will absolutly come back!

title: Fantastic hotel and can't beat location!
text: Great location for a quick overnight or multiple-day trip! Convenient to just about any theatre you'd want as well as Rockefeller Center and Times Square. Only a block away from the subway too. The late afternoon wine reception & snacks were lovely and made it possible to make it through a show without being starving until a 9:30 p.m. dinner. I also accidently left a sweater in the closet and housekeeping was great about shipping it to me the very next day. Will definitely stay here again!

title: A Gem in the Heart of the City
text:
I have stayed many times in New York and without a doubt for the money The Pearl is a real find! Perfect location for both someone on a first trip or a seasoned New York visitor.  5 minutes stroll to Times Square, 10 mins and you are in the heart of Hells Kitchen with its great restaurants and bars.
The hotel staff are friendly without being in your face. We were in room 801 - a very good size (no really!) with coffee machine, microwave and fridge. The staff had noticed it was my birthday and had left me a gift of a nice bottle of wine and a hand written card - nice touch. 
The bed was comfy, large bathroom with walk in shower (and TV!) - and lots of space for shopping bags.
If you are going to New York I would highly recommend this hotel

title: Fabulous!
text: Lovely hotel central location, rooms were clean and well made up, really helpful staff and close to all the sights in NYC, breakfast was really good too, free tea n coffee 24/7, even got 20% off at the steakhouse next door for being a hotel guest, concierge helpful too for booking theatre tickets and airport taxis, would highly recommend!

title: Perfect hotel direct bij Time Square
text:
Modern boutique hotel met zeer goede kamers.
Bedden zeer comfortabel, badkamers modern.
Continental breakfast included en van goede kwaliteit.
Fijne lounge en overal gratis wifi.
Liging is top direct aan Time Square en Broad Way.

title: Familje hotell
text: Rent och fräscht, perfekt läge vid Times square, rymliga rum för familjen med barn. Gratis Wifi, frukost. Trevlig personal som var mycket hjälpsamma. Deluxrummen har både dusch och badkar! I närområdet finns tunnelbana, mataffär, restauranger.

title: Emplacement idéal
text: De par son emplacement cet hôtel est vraiment intéressant, le métro est proche de même que la gare routière. Concernant l'hôtel, le personnel, lui, est vraiment à l'écoute et réactif. Enfin sur la mezzanine vous pourrez profitez 24/7 gratuitement d'une machine à café, d'eau de fruits et autre petits encas. Cela paraît peu mais croyez moi un jour de froid passé dehors donnera une saveur à votre petit café dans le fauteuil. Le petit dej n'est pas exceptionnel mais suffit largement pour débuter la journée. Enfin l'hôtel a un partenariat avec le resto attenant qui à l'air sympa.

title: Amazing
text: Everything from start to finish was fab. Nothing was too much trouble. Staff were very polite and helpful. Great location. Room was very well equipped . Breakfast /complimentary cheese and wine were a bonus. Very clean and white linen, towels . I would without question stay here again . Thank you so much Fir our lovely stay St your hotel.

title: Esperava mais
text: Já fui várias vezes a NY e cada vez procuro me hospedar em algo diferente para ir conhecendo um pouco mais dos hotéis e regiões e dessa vez acabei optando pelo Pearl Hotel. Pela classificação desse hotel no tripadvisor e pelas inúmeras avaliações "excelentes" eu esperava mais. Chegamos no hotel bem cedo (estávamos em dois casais) e, claro, só tinha quarto disponível mediante pagamento de early check in, até aí tudo bem. O outro casal pegou um quarto pelo early check in, deixamos as malas e fomos andar. O problema é que quando voltamos ao hotel no horário do check in normal a moça nos informou que continuava não tendo quarto disponível. Isso foi um desrespeito, afinal se tinh quarto pro early check in como que não tinha quarto disponível na hora normal do check in?! Depois disso meu marido foi reclamar com o gerente que explicou que é porque os quartos disponíveis eram em uma categoria superior, mas acabaram "deixando" a gente ficar num quarto de categoria um pouco superior sem pagar a mais, por não ter outro quarto disponível na hora. Só esse descaso inicial já foi o suficiente para não gostar do hotel. A localização realmente é excelente e o hotel é bem novo. O café da manhã é incluído mas bem fraquinho. Quando voltar a NY provavelmente não me hospedarei mais nesse hotel.

title: Perfetto a parte la vista
text: Molto tranquillo, pulito, centralissimo cortesia e ospitalità....ottimo. Le camere sono grandi ed accoglienti, i letti morbidi ma comodi. Purtroppo manca il bidet. Peccato per la vista dalla camera.....molto poco interessante come si vede dalla foto

title: Location location location
text: The Pearl is in an amazing location - literally a block from Time Square and so many theatres. Easy walk to Central Park, the piers for the Circle Line cruise and Empire State Building too! We walked and walked! Supermarket on the corner. Great diners on 8th Ave. Complimentary wine hour every afternoon. Front desk staff and concierge were so helpful and always friendly when you arrived or left the hotel! Would stay again.

title: Wonderful hotel.
text: Spent two nights with our sons in a double queen room. We saw a play, ate at nice restaurants and just enjoyed the city. This hotel is in an excellent location and the staff couldn't be more polite or helpful. The hotel and room were very clean. We will definitely be returning and recommending to friends and family.

title: Lovely hotel in the heart of the theater district
text: We chose this hotel because of its location close to theaters, and the positive reviews on Trip Advisor.  We were very pleased with this choice.  We felt relaxed and safe staying at the Pearl.  The room was clean and fresh.  Everything seemed new.  I will definitely stay here again.

title: Couldn't have asked for more...
text: We have just returned from a six-day stay and it was a faultless experience. From the moment we checked in to the moment we left it was smooth sailing all the way. The location is ideal, close to the park, theatres and all the sights but away from the full on hustle of Times Square. We had a queen size deluxe suite for a family of four which was spacious clean made us feel as if nothing was too much trouble and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Don't miss the cheese and wine hour at 4 o'clock the wine was delicious .

title: Fantastic Hotel!
text: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon; it was our first trip to New York so we had no idea what to expect from the hotel or the area. We booked the hotel based on very positive reviews on here and they were absolutely spot on. From our check in to when we left the hotel a few days later, we felt valued and comfortable during our stay. The hotel was close to a number of top NY locations but still very quiet at night - you would never know that you were so close to Times Square! We thoroughly enjoyed our time at the Pearl and it was the perfect place to stay for our honeymoon. The rooms are huge and the bathrooms very luxury. There are a number of complimentary extras such as toiletries, high speed Wi-Fi, a delicious breakfast and daily cheese and wine hour, and many more! We would thoroughly recommend the hotel to anyone considering it. It is a hotel that errs on the side of slightly expensive, but if you can book early or go during non-peak times you can get an excellent deal that make it so worth the money.

title: Good rooms and location
text: The rooms were more spacious than rooms in the area.  Having a microwave and fridge was nice as there is a very nice grocery store on the corner block. The bedding is a little old and it would be nice to have some USB plug-in ports; but other than that, the room was clean. There is a great on demand system with tons of free TV shows.

title: Great location
text: Stayed for just 3 nights in a suite with kids. Really nice staff, lovely hotel, clean and modern. Breakfast is nice for some reason they do not give out proper cutlery and crockery and just have plastic which is a bit random. They also have a nice restaurant called E&E Grill which was very good.

title: Lovely Hotel!
text:
This hotel is in a fantastic location for access to anywhere you want to go. The hotel itself is lovely. it's very clean and the staff are very attentive. Hershey's kisses were left on our bed every night and as we were celebrating our anniversary they provided us with a bottle of prosecco. Beds are very comfy but the pillows are a bit lumpy for my liking.We were in room 1202 and it was lovely but unfortunately it was very noisy due to the elevator going up and down all night. Take some ear plugs and you will sleep soundly. 
Would stay here again but next time I would request a room away from the elevator.

title: Clean, well appointed room
text: The Pearl lobby is very nice with a bowl of apples, chips and fresh lemon water.  The staff was very friendly and the concierge was helpful in setting up a carriage ride for us.  The hallways are quiet and elegant.  Our room was so nice, bigger than I expected in the city.  Beautiful bathroom with a flatscreen on the wall.  Bed was very comfortable as was the bedding.  We easily stored our luggage as we spent the day in the city before catching our train at 3pm.

title: The splurge is worth it!
text: The Pearl is a boutique hotel that is in the heart of the theatre district.  We were in walking distant to Rockefeller Center, Central Park, the subway, Grand Central Station, Bryant Park, Times Square, etc.  The rooms are clean and relaxing.  You can start your day with the very nice continental breakfast, then hit the sites for the rest of the day.  Later, don't miss the late afternoon cheese and wine happy hour to relax and recharge before your evening activities.  The location is also close to many food choices and coffee spots.  My husband and I had a wonderful time in NYC and our accommodations and experiences at The Pearl contributed a lot to our enjoyment.

title: Fabulous oasis in the theatre district
text: I've stayed at The Pearl three times and have loved it each time, for its outstanding location, wonderful service, quiet cool ambiance and great rooms. This time we had two rooms for our group of friends, and each room and bathroom was excellent. We also enjoyed the quality continental breakfast and generous wine hour.

title: Great Place To Stay!!
text:
As a frequent visitor to the city, I find this hotel a great value and a wonderful location!
You are close to anything you might wish to do in the day including the sub-way and you could not be better located for theater going at night.  There are also fine places to eat or grab a coffee within minutes of your door.  The folks at the front desk are always pleasant and helpful. You can partake in the light breakfast and the evening wine and snacks if you choose..this is an added benefit of your stay and helpful if you are trying to save on your daily costs!! The rooms - various sizes - are all lovely and clean!  It seems the Brits have the skinny on this hotel because they seem to out number Americans during my stays!!

title: Unexpected extras in the city of NO EXTRAS
text:
This hotel is wonderful! I am used to 4.5*/5* New York hotels looking very stylish and pretty with nice facilities for a fee. The pearl is different.

Free WiFi, free room upgrade (the king room was astonishingly huge), free continental breakfast and 24/7 refreshments in the 2nd floor lounge really make a difference. The evening wine and cheese was really delightful and a good time of the day to relax a while before deciding what to do about dinner and the evening etc.

The hotel itself feels like a nice 4.5* resort hotel in somewhere like Aruba. Immaculately clean and well presented. Modern chic style.
