Lots of extra things to make the stay nicer and more convenient without charging. I have been to many high-end NYC hotels but this is the one I will try and book next time, I absolutely loved it!

The location is great for Times Square / Broadway / Hells Kitchen. We walked down to midtown no problem as well (15-20 mins to Penn station).

title: A Great Option for staying in NYC
text:
This is a nice hotel situated in the heart of the Theater District.  The hotel is well kept and the decor is pleasing.  They offer packages including wifi and continental breakfast.  It is very convenient for the customers.  

Staff is friendly and efficient.  Housekeeping messed up our stuff on the night stand and a couple of items fell on the floor.  This happened only once. For the most part, they are good.

title: Awesome
text: Couldn't have asked for a better stay. We were able to check in early due to early arrival. Everyone was extremely helpful and we will be back. The hotel was just steps away from the theater we were visiting to see a performance of Chicago. While we didn't get to use it this time we're glad there's a fitness center and will definitely use it next time we are in town. Close to Rockefeller Center Broadway and Time Square. Rooms were very clean and the beds are very comfortable.

title: Gem hidden in plain sight
text: If you are looking for a Midtown/Times Square hotel and can get the Pearl for less than $200 a night, there's absolutely no reason not to book it. Attentive doorman, 24/7 snacks in the lobby, complimentary wine & cheese hour every day, free wi-fi. The rooms are big for New York, and the bathrooms are *enormous* for New York. Good lighting with dimmers. Located across the street from the O'Neill Theater, and one block from three subway lines. The TVs could be bigger, but that's probably not why you came to visit.

title: Great location just off Broadway
text:
We have stayed here twice and have had 2 excellent stays. The rooms are clean and well furnished. The staff are friendly and very helpful. Contrary to other reviewers, I think the breakfast is fine; cereals, breads, yoghurts, and fruit. 
The hotel is 5 minutes from Time Square but once inside things are quite.

title: Amazing stay brilliant hotel
text: This hotel was fantastic and couldn't fault anything about it! We visited NY for 4 nights, this hotel is prime location for all areas....Times Square Broadway Central Park Empire State, the list goes on and we're all in easy walking distance. From check in to leaving the staff couldn't of done enough for me and my partner from ordering taxis helping with bags. And obtaining show tickets! Very modern clean hotel with good breakfast every morning to set the day up (included in the price) and even a tv in the bathroom. The door staff were so attentive and polite with a special mention to William who made me feel welcome and gave me inside tips about the city. Would recommend to all family and friends and would totally stay here again when we return 😃 10/10 ....by Danny johnson and Leona Roberts uk

title: Perhaps an Appropriate Name
text:
Given that a pearl is a semi-precious stone, perhaps that's an appropriate name for this property.  It's certainly nothing to get excited about, but it's worth having around. 

A number of prior reviews had mentioned warm welcomes and upgrades at reception.  There certainly was nothing wrong with the check-in experience, but there wasn't anything out of the ordinary either.  Just a standard "welcome to The Pearl " and no mention of an upgrade.  We stayed in a deluxe double Thursday - Sunday of the weekend preceding MLK Day 2016, at an average nightly cost of around $350, booked through the hotel's website.

The heat in our first room wasn't working properly when we checked in.  The front desk said maintenance would fix it, and we left for meetings and then dinner.  When we returned several hours later, it was still 63 degrees in the room.  We were told that maintenance had left for the day, so we were moved to another room, a floor below.  Nothing major; just annoying.

The heat in the second room worked; however, it made a clicking or popping noise (it sounded like the plastic casing around the vent) in about one second increments every time it turned on.  The noise would continue for several minutes, then slow, and finally stop.  Until the heat kicked back in when it started all over.  Needless to say, those three nights were not among my most restful.  

Otherwise, The Pearl is perfectly acceptable if you need to stay in West Midtown.  The room was a decent size, and the water pressure in the shower was excellent.  The continental breakfast was convenient, if uninspired.  The room was clean.  The price was moderate.

The Pearl did manage to score on two pet peeves of mine:  first, the bedside clock radio was glued to the nightstand; second, the "hangers" in the closet were those ridiculous contraptions that are attached to the rod.  Sorry, but free potato chips in the lobby don't make up for such highway chain motel touches.

title: Great hotel,great location
text: We stayed at the Pearl Hotel as our honeymoon in New York.It was really worth every penny.we thoroughly enjoyed our stay there.the location is fantastic..time square,Rockefeller centre,Central Park,Broadway are only 5minutes walk away,and there are numerous subway stations close by.the hotel Rooms itself are very comfortable and clean.the staff are very helpful and friendly.i could not fault the Pearl

title: Great Hotel in Awesome location
text: After initially booking the Waldorf Astoria we decided to change to The Pearl and we are so pleased we did. Complimentary breakfast was a nice touch for NYC and complimentary cheese and wine between 4pm-5pm was really welcoming after a busy day and a very nice touch. Complimentary coffee and snacks available all day on floor 2. Our room was very spacious with good coffee machine microwave and fridge. We also had a free bottle of fizz given for our anniversary. Reading this back sounds like we were here for the freebies but seriously a great hotel with comfy beds and good room and bathroom amenities. Location is amazing 2 mins walk from Times Square and 5 mins walk from our Broadway shows. Ask at the front desk for directions to 5th Avenue, you will amazed at how close this hotel is. Friendly staff without being annoying. Cannot fault anything about this hotel. Try Lillie's pub next door which is really nice and friendly. Recommend to all and can't wait to return.

title: Wonderful place to stay in New York City!
text: We did a lot of research on non-chain hotels in NYC for our first trip there and The Pearl always seemed to come up with top reviews. We agree! From the minute we arrived, we were treated very well by everyone there. We loved the intimate feel of the hotel and the fact that it was set off of Times Square, yet close to everything. The rooms were very nice and modern and it was so quiet at all times. We slept very well! The breakfast was light and just enough after indulging so much in the city. We have nothing negative to say about this hotel. We will definitely return and recommend to friends.

title: Fantastic
text: Fabulous hotel which I would highly recommend for a stay in NYC. Very close to Times Square yet it's very quiet in the rooms, which are spotlessly clean and tastefully decorated. Buffet breakfast was a welcome addition with a good selection of food including fresh fruit and boiled eggs. The wine and snacks hour 4-5pm daily was great if you happened to be about during that time. Fresh fruit and crudités with dips, cheeses and crisps, along with choice of wines was lovely. Tea, coffee and snacks available 24/7. In all it was perfect for our first trip to an amazing city

title: Amazing stay at this wonderful hotel
text: This is a very good hotel in the midtown area of Manhantan. We stayed here for 5 nights in January. The staff were very attentive to our every needs. The room itself was spacious with a microwave and loccitane products. Breakfast was simple but more than adequate, consisting of bagels, cereals, pastries and hot drinks. There is also a wine and cheese hour between 4-5 pm which we went to once and it was brilliant. There is a 24 hour facility for hot drinks and snacks and also access to microwave. In terms of location, we could not ask for a better one. It's just off Times Square and walkable to the majority of tourist attractions eg 5th avenue, Rockefeller building, Empire State Building and Central Park etc. There are also subway stations in less than 5 min walk. Overall, amazing stay at the hotel, would definitely come again and recommend to friends!

title: The Pearl is a Gem in the heart of the NYC Theater District
text: My spouse and I were extremely please with our stay at the Pearl Hotel.  The location is ideal as we were in town for a play weekend and all theaters are well within walking distance.  Plenty of good restaurants near by.  We stayed in a King Suite which was so very comfortable.  Large bedroom, Living room, Kitchenette area, Large bathroom with great soaking tub and a great large shower.  Three TVs and three closets.  Exceptionally clean and nicely furnished.  Staff were friendly.  Especially nice was a complimentary breakfast each morning and wine and cheese in the afternoon.  For the price, location, and amenities it can't be beat.  We will definitely be back.

title: Bem localizado e tem café da manhã!
text:
A localização é muito boa,sem dúvidas,porém em Ny o melhor dele é oferecer café da manhã!
Quarto confortável, atendimento prático do check in e cordial na saída.
Fica perto de bons restaurante, de atrações e de metro.
Recomendo para casais e viagens rápidas!

title: Great Stay at The Pearl
text: Booked the Deluxe King Room - happy to have a refrigerator, microwave and coffee pot.  Nice size room with comfortable bed.  Glad to have a desk and chair along with another chair to sit on instead of the bed.  Bathroom was also a nice size, it had a TV in there along with two shower heads in the large tiled shower.

title: Incredible attention to detail
text: I am absolutely thrilled with The Pearl Hotel. The amenities are incredible and the room is beautiful. I have a wet bar, a Keurig, and a refrigerator. My room came with robes, L'Occitane toiletries and there is even an umbrella should it rain. There is free wi fi, free breakfast and no charge for the gym!  There is even almond milk in the breakfast room for the Paleo friendly. The service at the front desk could not have been better. And the prices for New York City can't  be beat. I would highly recommend The Pearl Hotel for your New York City getaway.

title: My snow Angels
text: I personally have not been to this hotel but, my daughter and son-in-law were here during the snow storm and have told me of the excellent caring service of all the staff at the Pearl.Thank you for looking after them in such difficult circumstances, after 2 cancelled flights' and a return via Germany they are safely home now.Thank you, so very much from Mom to Alison and Peter Bower in the Honeymoon Suite ...Sheffield UK

title: Great Hotel
text: Great hotel in a fantastic location. Close to everything in midtown. Rooms are really comfortable and modern. The staff was fantastic. Lindsey the concierge was awesome. Our plans had to majorly change due to the big storm and she made it easy!

title: Birthday Boost!
text: The Pearl was ideally situated near Time Square we expected it to be noisy, but far from it, we enjoyed sleeping soundly! The free cheese and wine every day with nibbles was much appreciated at 4pm and kept us going till dinner. There isn't a restaurant as such, but the self-service buffet was more than adequate with everything you could wish for! We were given an upgrade on our room plus a free bottle of wine to celebrate my 60th Birthday, which was a lovely surprise and a very kind gesture. All the staff were very helpful and couldn't do enough for you. We found the E/E grill over rated and expensive and enjoyed much better meals elsewhere. Should we visit again we would certainly use this hotel again.

title: Billed as five star. Not in my book
text:
Location wise this place is excellent. Nest to subway stops and within easy walking distance of Times Square, Hells Kitchen. Reception and check in were warm, friendly and polite. The room, billed as a Queen delux, was just OK. I have found that all hotel rooms I have stayed in in America have one thing in common. They are all small compared to similar rooms elsewhere in the world. The bed was a standard double and comfy enough. There was a fridge, empty of course, which we kept our shop purchased water in. They do supply water but you have to pay for it. I found it quite amazing that there is no complimentary water in what is supposed to be a five star hotel. Coffee machine was good but could only serve one coffee at a time. The creamer was awful - so we got our own milk. As we walked in a full length mirror was leaning against the wall. I thought it must be a temporary measure but no it was screwed in in that position - I have never seen anything like it and cannot begin to understand the reason for it. Bathroom and toilet were fine. There was a TV in the bathroom to but it just flashed a message saying it was not working. 
Breakfast is served on the second floor. Billed as Continental style. I don't know which continent they are referring to. Juices, a hot drinks machine, bread and bagels to toast, cereal, boiled eggs and spreadable cheese. It was crying out for some sliced meats to make it a bit more moist and easy to swallow. Towards the end of our stay we had our breakfast out. We took advantage of the hotels car back to JFK which was 70 dollars. The taxi here was just over 50 with extras and tips and the never ending ads on the screen in the back.  The ride back was extremely comfortably. Well worth the extra money. 
E/E grill attached is well worth a visit. 
In summary the location and service make this place worth it. But if they had a better breakfast, supplied water, it would have been excellent.

title: Julissa!!
text: We are currently staying at the Pearl and love it for its location and atmosphere right around the corner from the Times Square hustle and bustle. Complimentary wine, cheese, and fruit every day from 4-5. But the people are what make this place what it is and Julissa at the front desk is he best in the business. She takes care of everything and makes your visit as seamless as possible. We'll come back just for her. Amazing!! Not to mention Azi who treats you like family. Thoroughly impressed.

title: Pearl Hotel
text: We stayed at the Pearl Hotel when we were in NY seeing Book of Mormon.  This hotel is directly across the street. It is a lovely boutique hotel with amazingly spacious rooms, a friendly / helpful / knowledgable staff, a wine and cheese hour from 4-5 pm, and a continental breakfast in the morning.  The beds were comfy and the rooms were very clean. The staff held our bags when we arrived before check in and gave us directions to the MOMA. Upon our return we checked in and they gave us a complimentary upgrade to a suite!  We enjoyed chatting with other guests at the wine and cheese hour sharing restaurant suggestions. Valet parking made driving into the city easy. We loved our tour of the MOMA, our dinner at Pigalli around the corner, Book of Morman, and jazz night at the Rum House a few blocks away.  Great weekend! Great place to stay!

title: Nice rooms great location
text: Really nice hotel just off Times Square.  Deluxe rooms are a good size nice comfy bed and good shower.  Free continental breakfast and snacks.  It just lacked something but couldn't put my finger on it maybe it was just a little bit impersonal.  I would stay here again and totally recommend it.

title: Loved this place!
text:
My 13 year old daughter and I came to NYC for a long weekend and had several Broadway shows planned. This hotel was the ideal location for seeing shows! It's just a few blocks from all of the theaters (Chicago and Book of Morman are actually on the same street). It's a boutique hotel which means it doesn't have the hoards of people and the noise that some of the other large chain hotels nearby have. 

Things we loved in addition to the location and size: the room was huge, the bathroom large and modern, the room had a mini fridge, microwave and sink, the complimentary breakfast and evening wine & cheese, the quietness of our room (especially being so close to the craziness of Times Square), the helpful front desk staff, the "fancy" water and snacks in the lobby at all times, the subway to Soho for shopping one block away and the price of the room for everything I just mentioned! This place is awesome and we will absolutely come back again the next time we visit NYC!

title: What a wonderful hotel!
text:
First of all, the location is terrific: it's across the street from the theatre showing The Book of Mormon. It's just over two short blocks from a very good Italian restaurant, Trattoria Trecolori, and within walking distance of one of Zagat's two top-rated New York restaurants, Le Bernardin (but I prefer the other one, Bouley, in Tribeca.)
The rooms are large and well appointed. The hotel is quiet - no street noise to speak of. The elevators are amazingly fast. The staff are super helpful. The continental breakfast buffet had lots of good choices. I loved everything about the hotel.

title: Fantastic location
text: Hotel staff were really friendly and helpful. The location just off Times Square in the heart of theatre land was perfect as a base to explore NYC. Rooms were large, clean and luxurious. Bed comfy but needed another pillow after first night. Breakfast was basic continental but more than adequate. Only gripe was you had a bit of a wait for the lift at busy times.

title: A Hidden Gem
text: I stayed here for one night on January 8th after seeing Matilda on Broadway. The show was great and The Pearl Hotel was the cherry on top. Checking in and out was both fast and painless. The receptionist explained everything and I especially liked the extra little perks that the hotel provides like the free breakfast,snacks and Wi-Fi, what a great deal. My room was on the 4th floor and was spacious,very clean and cozy.The bed was nice and comfortable.The bathroom was a nice size,and the television in the bathroom was a nice touch. Overall I really enjoyed my stay here, and I will definitely book this hotel again.

title: Fantastic hotel in NYC
text:
We'e visited New York several times before and can honestly say the Pearl Hotel is the best we've found - a real gem, close to Times Square and in close proximity to the main attractions, theatres and the subway.

My husband, myself and our daughter stayed in a deluxe room with 2 queen beds, and couldn't believe the size of the room - it was huge! There were so many extras included, the best of which were the daily continental breakfast, the free wifi, the wine and cheese in the afternoons - and a total surprise, the complimentary champagne and souvenir glasses that appeared in our room on New Year's Eve (with a non-alcoholic version for our daughter)! 

The staff were amazingly helpful, the beds were spacious and comfy, we had a fridge, microwave, coffee machine, iPod dock - and even an extra TV in the bathroom... they've really thought of everything to make your stay special and we will be recommending this hotel to all our friends. It was also fantastic value for money when compared to other hotels of this calibre.

We'll definitely be back to the Pearl Hotel - thanks to all who made us so welcome!

title: 100% confortable
text: Excelente locación, cerca a Times square y la atención del personal excelente, siempre atentos tanto en la puerta como en recepción y en la cafetería. El desayuno es gratuito, si bien no contiene carnes, te ofrecen lo básico como para empezar el día, harinas, jugos y frutas todo en platos descartables, lo bueno es que uno puede llevarse el café y empezar su día con pie derecho. Snacks  y agua a todas horas, por la tarde ofrecen hora del té, una degustación de quesos y vino. La habitación es mediana, cuenta con cafetera y microondas, el baño muy parecido al baño de un spa con ducha española, tina y televisor. Kit completo en la habitación que incluye batas, pantuflas, plancha y elementos de spa como sales de baño. Lo único malo que encontré fue el sarro en la ducha, por ese motivo no la utilicé y parece que olvidaron limpiar el cajón de la mesa de noche. Es un hotel pequeño pero muy personalizado y cuenta con lo necesario para hacerte sentir como en casa.

title: Great Location
text: The Pearl has a great location in NYC.  From the hotel it's convenient for shopping, the theatre, and some of the attractions.  Walking is the best way to get around and this location is central enough to get around easily.  The hotel itself is very nice.  The rooms are a good size and everything was clean.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  They are pretty strict about check-out times but otherwise no issues.  All in all we were very happy with our stay.

title: Excellent location and service
text:
Booked a Queen Deluxe suite for 4 nights over New year. Rooms are very well equipped and clean. Location is perfect for theatre and shopping.
Staff are very helpful and friendly. Free Wi Fi and breakfast included in price. I booked this hotel 0n 30 December one day prior to arrival and telephoned hotel to book. I found the booking agent very helpful in trying to find a suitable room for us. The only draw back is for those of us living in Europe and have a usual evening flight back and need a late checkout. The Hotel is not flexible like other hotels with regards to checkout time. Needed to check out at 4 PM instead of 12 Noon. Despite the room not being booked for the day of my departure the Hotel took from me $140 for the late checkout. I think that after spending 4 nights in the hotel and with the room not being booked that same night , the hotel took advantage of the situation and could have extended the checkout to 4 PM without charge. For tis reason I did not give the hotel 5 stars on value and instead gave it only 4 stars.

title: Fantastic hotel!
text:
We visited from the 21st to 28th December with our 3 children and stayed in a deluxe queen suite, which was clean and spacious for a family of 5.  It was handy having a kitchenette with fridge, coffee machine etc.  The bedroom had an ironing board, iron, safe and brolly (which was handy as we had a rather wet stay!)  The bathroom was spacious, with a good selection of toiletries, dryer, fluffy towels.  Free wifi on as many devices as necessary was fab too, meant we could stay in touch with family over xmas and we could have chill out time after a day on our feet, my kids were thrilled that they could still use the interest. The Pearl really have thought of everything.

The hotel staff are fantastic; friendly, helpful, nothing is too much trouble.  Breakfast is fantastic, yes, I've seen complaints re the plastic plates, forks etc, but it really does work, it gives people the flexibility to take-out a coffee or bagel or take food back to bed etc.  There were ample snacks, refreshments throughout the day should you get peckish or need a coffee fix.  Water in the lobby is a great way to ensure guests are kept refreshed as you head out or head back in.....again, fab idea!  Its the little touches here that really do make me want to return and recommend this hotel.

The hotel is perfectly located; Times Square, Rockafella etc on your doorstep, but a pleasant walk to Central Park, and various other hot spots.  We bought a 4 day Big Bus pass which was great for sightseeing and getting to the places we had on our list of 'must sees'.  The tour guides were fantastic.  Once the pass expired we did a lot of walking, which helped burn off those calories from overindulging.  

I would most definitely return to The Pearl.  I much preferred a small boutique hotel where the staff would recognise you, chat with you about your day and offer advice or make reservations for dinner.  This is an excellent find!!!!

title: Amazing!
text:
This is one fantastic location, It is extremely handy if you intend to go to Times Square, as it extremely handy.

The hotel! WOW, it is incredible! the staff are fantastic and extremely amazing. it was my partner and I, 1yr relationship anniversary, and we where greeted with a bottle to congratulate us, this was very beautiful,

i stayed here for New Year, and we where given a bottle and complimentary glasses to take home. this was extremely unexpected and very appreciated. it makes the day even better.

Everyday, they do like 24/7 drinks/snacks. on one of there floors, again, i didn't know this upon booking.

I didn't use the gym, so i can't comment... Breakfast was nice, basic but it fills the hole!

Overall, i would highly recommend this and it is worth what we paid!

For those that love the internet and can't escape it, they have free wifi which is FREE! we all love freebies! 

the beds! WOW! incredible and soon comfy! 

For any info anyone needs....
coffee machine - (not a kettle), paper cups, hairdryer, iron/board, then mini wash things.... you can request for fridges, but they come in the more expensive rooms with microwaves. 

hw ever there is microwave on the 2nd floor! 
any questions ask

title: Great Stay in theTheater District
text: Nicely situated in the Theater District. Close enough toTimes Square but on a quieter street. you can even see the river from the balcony! Warm greeting from the front desk employees. Good information to our questions.Nice bedrooms with a balcony. Great spot if you want to go to a  Broadway show or explore the city

title: Gran posizione, comfort medio
text: Posizione straordinaria a due passi da Times Square e nel distretto dei teatri di broadway. Molto semplice, ben pulito, ma colazione spartana fino allo scarso. Letti con materassi finiti e sfondati. Ci aspettavamo qualcosa in più e veramente costerebbe poco dare qualche servizio in più.

title: Great hotel and amazing stay
text:
We booked this hotel based on the great reviews on this site and I'm pleased to say that the hotel not only lived up to the high expectations we had but surpassed them easily.
The hotel is located a very short walk from Broadway and Times Square and is opposite the Theatre showing Book of Mormon. Despite being located in the middle of the chaos during New Year, you step into an oasis of serenity. The staff are also helpful.
We booked a queen suite to give our children some room and the room was huge, not just for New York, but anywhere. It was beautifully appointed. We had booked this trip as an early anniversary treat and mentioned this when booking. Upon arrival the hotel had left a bottle of champagne in the room for us.
The hotel provides a free breakfast every morning. There is a wide choice if pastries, bagels, cereal fruit and yoghurt - everything you need for a quick but filling breakfast before a day of sightseeing.
At 4pm every day there is a cheese and wine reception, again provided for free by the hotel. A decent selection of cheese, crackers, vegetables and dips as well as as much white or red wine that you want. A lovely pre-dinner snack.
We stayed over New Year and on NYE there was a champagne reception from 4-8pm which replaced the wine reception.
There is coffee, water and snacks provided 24hrs a day.
The hotel is fabulous and we will be recommending it to anyone we know who is planning a visit to New York. We will always stay at The Pearl whenever we return to New York

title: Believe the great reviews! Awesome!
text: Booked in April 2015 for New Years and made a great choice! Nicer than the bigger hotels right on Time Square (we've stayed there and they're nice) and just two blocks away. The staff was delightful and bent over backwards to make our two night stay memorable. Rooms are big and new and clean and beautifully appointed. Nice continental breakfast, great restaurant, great value. Stayed in room 1203 and loved it. We will return.

title: Fantastic hotel
text: Stayed here for four nights in December. Lovely hotel - good size of room especially for New York. Great location, very close to Times Square. Breakfast was included which was great as saved us time in the morning. I wouldn't say this hotel has a wow factor as some of the other New York hotels do, however we had a very enjoyable stay.

title: A true gem amidst all the glitz of Times Square
text: I will start with the only downside for us.  We were hoping that it would be a little bit further from Times Square as my wife is not a fan of that area.  That being said, we had a wonderful time there.  Times Square for us is a bit like Wal-Mart - we can't stand going there but it is almost unavoidable!  We had no issues with noise and the room was nice and quiet.  The included amenities of free wifi (shouldn't that be the case at every hotel these days??  seriously) and an evening reception were appreciated.  The staff was courteous and helpful 100% of the time.  I left a few items in the room and when we returned for our bags they were neatly bagged awaiting my inspection.  The room was well laid out, clean and spacious as far as New York hotels go.  The bathroom was larger than we expected as well.  All of these helps keep the stress level down when you have two kids (9 and 11) rooming with you!  Move it a few more blocks away from Times Square and it would be perfect for us.  If you enjoy the convenience and need access to the sights and sounds of Times Square it is probably already perfect for you.

title: The best!
text: Really this hotel is the best for eveything,it's smaller,so better attention  given.Its remarkably quiet.The location is prime,theater district and a couple blocks from time square, or rokefellar plaza,subway at corner.continental breakfast, wine and cheese hour,unheard of in this area.here at Christmas and they made it special,definitely no other place to stay next time in ny

title: Christmas Surprise for My Son
text: Beautiful boutique hotel on W 49th Street.  Booked because if proximity to Book of Mormon.  Great location close enough to Times Square but far enough to not be caught up in the crazy.  Convenient to a lot of shopping and food.

title: Wonderful Find
text: The staff were very helpful and kind.  Breakfast every morning along with wine in the evening.  Rooms furnishings were splendid. The location was directly across from the Book of Mormon show and very close to Times Square.

title: December 17-21
text:
Did a girls trip with my daughter.  Picked this hotel and we loved it.  Had a Deluxe King Room with a balcony!!!
The room was huge and immaculate.  The only downfall was the closet size and counter space in the bathroom.  Both were very tight.  Great location for theatre, shopping, dining and Times Square.  The front desk were accommodating.  Requested turn down service and it was done every night with chocolates and two bottles of water.  Doormen were friendly and helpful and the housekeeping was outstanding!!! Breakfast was fine, I don't know what the complaints are about but would of liked to order room service for breakfast but its not an option.  My new go to hotel for NYC.  You won't be disappointed!!

title: Top hotel
text: Great staff , great location.No problem recommending the Pearl.Rooms are a good size well appointed.The continental style breakfast is just what's needed prior to exploring the city, not sure why other reviewers complain about the disposable utensils and plates etc ,it's just for a quick bite not a full blown restaraunt.

title: Great hotel, great location, great staff
text: My sister and I stayed at this hotel in December 2015. We were very happy with this hotel. The room was extremely nice and very clean. The room had a hotel safe, comfortable bed, blackout curtains, coffee maker and it was just the right size for two people. The bathroom was very clean, it had a makeup mirror, hair dryer, and enough counter space to actually use your items. There is a small workout room with two treadmills, an exercise bike and elliptical and I used this everyday. It is very clean and has water and towels. There is a free breakfast everyday and it is better than you would expect for a free breakfast in NY. You can make instant oatmeal, cereal, fresh fruit, and there is a lot of small bakery items. The coffee and tea set up is available 24x7 and this was really great when we came in late and it was chilly outside. The staff was friendly and helpful. They do have valet parking. They are close to Times Square but not in the middle of the bright lights. The location was great to walk almost anywhere. I would stay here again.

title: Strategically-located in Times Square
text: Rooms were clean, cozy and beds were huge...4 can easily fit into 2 beds. Staff very pleasant and helpful. Theatres located to the front and left of the hotel. Shopping area within walking distance. Tickets for city bus tours readily available at every corner, Muslim halal food also available from vendors located a few streets down. Would certainly stay here again and recommend to friends.

title: Amazing experience!
text:
The staff at the Pearl are so accommodating and really go above and beyond for their guests.
To start, my boyfriend and I were looking to spend our anniversary and I was calling different hotels to see if they would do anything special for the occasion. While other places were trying to rush me off the phone, or emphasize that I had to pay for additional services, I was pleasantly surprised that the Pearl were much easier to talk to. I spoke to Joseph at the time and though he wasn't able to give me much information on what he could offer, he simply said that "we like to surprise our guests for the occasion." I was sold at this place just from that statement alone; mind you, i hadn't paid for the reservations yet and i was really just looking around. But Joseph was able to answer a lot of my questions about their hotel without sounding annoyed or rushing me off the phone.
When we got to our hotel we were greeted by Azi and he checked us in. As soon as we gave our information, he was already informed about our anniversary and greeted us on the occasion! Talk about a staff that is well informed! He was happy to inform us that our room had been upgraded to make our anniversary that much more special. I really wasn't expecting much to be honest, at most flowers in the room but a whole suite upgrade was incredible. The rest of our stay was great- the fact that the hotel was walking distance to everything NYC had to offer was a bonus. If you ask me, this was a luxurious hotel for an awesome price! Definitely looking forward to this hotel the next time we're in the city.
